tay: biro na Soto Chay ing-wen 'miwan Sexo' tmatok tonox sa Genzyominzok
english: President Tsai Ing-wen's Apology to the Indigenous Peoples on Behalf of the Government.

tay: nano' sqo ryax na mposal sazing kawas wayal qasa ga,wal sbahon kya nqo Horit na Thaylow maha "Genzyomin" qo knosa ta' naha' maha "Sanpaw" sraral la. nano' qo ginrhow naha' smbalay lalo' qani ga, iyat nanak maha wayal naha' laxan lqo niwan sinllwan na cinsqiri' naha' nanak,niwan nyox naha' sbbaq maha Genzyominzok hya' ga "spzyang balay cinrhzyal Taywan qani" qo lalo' naha'. skahol ta' sqo knita' balay qani mita' ga, kira' qani ga, sikiy pkkrawn ta' qo knita' qani la. kin'wanay mako' sexo' tmatok tonox sa kwara' simo ka Genzyominzok. ta ryax spayat kbhol kawas wayal qani ga, wayal simo balay mqzinot ro ini' simo naha' 'nblayqiy mlahang, anay mako' 'miwan sexo' tmatok tonox sa kwara' simo ka Genzyominzok.
english: On this day 22 years ago, the term "shanbao" (mountain people) in the Additional Articles of our Constitution was replaced with the proper name: "indigenous people". This correction not only did away with a discriminatory term, but also highlighted the status of indigenous peoples as Taiwan's "original owners". From this basis, today, we are taking another step forward. To all indigenous peoples of Taiwan: On behalf of the government, I express to you our deepest apology. For the four centuries of pain and mistreatment you have endured, I apologize to you on behalf of the government.

tay: baqon mako' maha, tehok sawni' qnai ga, maki' na' sqoliq moci swa' lxon tmatok tonox. ga nano' ya qani qo, nyox mako' s'iwan sexo' tmatok tonox qani. nano' kwara' ka gaga' niya' qo sawn maha knita' naha' sa ini' naha' ptnaqiy mita' simo qani, ini' ga, kwara' ka kinmxyalan glow na bbzinah ka yan simo qani ga, gaga' nqo songos niwan mosa' Hatteng na ita' sqoliq maha ga, yani qo nyox myan s'rox sqani ssawni' qani, aki' msbah cikay qo knita' sami sa minqso' balay maha sako'.
english: I know that even now, there are some around us who see no need to apologize. But that is the most important reason why I am representing the government to issue this apology today. To see what was unfair in the past as a matter of course, or to treat the pain of other ethnic peoples as an unavoidable part of human development, this is the first mindset that we, standing here today, resolve to change and overturn.

tay: anay mako' kmal na mosa' 'llaw na kay', kmayal sqo nano' qo nyox myan s'owah tmatok tonox sqo simo ka Genzyomin qani ? rhzyal Taywan qani hya' ga, maki' sa spayat kbhol kawas wayal lga rima' kya sqoliq maki' sa rhzyal qani la, kwara' sqoliq qani ga, yasa minblaq mqyanox sa qnxan naha' nanak, maki' nanak ke' naha, Gaga' naha', Gaga' na qqyanox naha' ro qzyonam naha'. sawn kasa lga, iyat snwalan nqo cinrhzyal ro nyox wahan na sqoliq kahol bzinah qo rhzyal qani la.
english: Let me put in simple terms why we are apologizing to the indigenous peoples. Four hundred years ago, there were already people living in Taiwan. These first inhabitants lived their lives and had their own languages, cultures, customs, and domains. But then, without their consent, another group of people arrived on these shores, and in the course of history, took everything from the first inhabitants who, on the land they have known most intimately, became displaced, foreign, non-mainstream, and marginalized.

tay: sawn maha pins'olah na rikisi' qani hya' ga, nano' yaqo mnhlhil mwah na sqoliq mwah zmingat sa ana nano'nasqoliqminqso'. maymawmtzyowazyowaw sqo rhzyal naha' nanak, yan nqo laha' qo tmnwang, ro iyat laha qo spzyang cinrhzyal la, ro niwan nyox naha' sqtqot tay syaw ka ini' kt'aniy ana cikoy na sqoliq. thozyay mrayraya' qo lalo' na sqoliq ga, hazi' ana skahol naha' sa kmxyalan na sqoliq ps'rox sqo ttman lalo' naha'. baqaw ta' i siki ini' ta' kayal maha sami qo spzyang balay maki' Kogi' na qalang maha ga! mosa' naha' psiy balay maha balay balay qo Rikisi' qnai mita' la, nano' yasa qo si ki skayal ta' qo zyowaw balay qani. ro spzyang balay ga, si kiy inblayqon naha' minbzinah lmnglong balay kwara' qo zyoaw wayal, nano' ya qani qo nyox mako' ss'rox sqani ssawni' qani.
english: The success of one ethnic people can be built on the suffering of another. Unless we deny that we are a country of justice, we must face up to this history. We must tell the truth. And then, most importantly, the government must genuinely reflect on this past. This is why I stand here today.

tay: kya qotox biro' ka sawn maha "Taywan tongso'". cyox niya' pglaingon balay kmayal hya' ga "iyat pinqmahan qo Taywan qani. Oranta' qo mwah mnazyang, Cncngkong qo mtzyoaw, Plmokan qo minlahang. ". qani hya' ga pzyang balay knita' nanak na Plmokan qani hya'. Genzyominzok hya' ga, ki'a rima' sqaniy sa pira' syan msyaw kawas kinki'an naha' sqani laha' la, cingay balay Gaga' naha' ro snyan naha' kinbleqan na tonox sa rhzyal qani, ro nyox naha' ini' lxaniy 'molah tehok miso qaniy. aw' ga, nyox ta' siy khlaniy sqo inlongan na kya qo lmaqox na glow miro' sqo Rikisi', nano' ya qani qo mosa' mako' s'iwan Sexo' tmatok tonox sa Genzyominzok qani.
english: There is a book called "The General History of Taiwan" published in 1920. In its foreword are these words: "Taiwan had no history. The Dutch pioneered it, the Koxinga Kingdom built it, and the Qing Empire managed it." This is a typical Han view of history. The truth is that indigenous peoples have been here for thousands of years, with rich culture and wisdom that have been passed down through generations. But we only know to write history from the perspective of the dominant. For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.

tay: nano' qo wayal pktnoxon na Oranta' ro Cncngkong, ro wayal naha' qawlon aki' qqblaq mqyanox na Pingpoco', ro wayal phqilon na Plmokan sqo mtciriq sa Genzyomin, ro wal si kzyawpi qsahoy rgyax na Gipon mwah mlahang, ro mocing sa tmasoq mtciriq ka mwah lqo Cyokaminkok, mwah psbaq sa qqyanox na Plmokan lqo Genzyomin qani. ta ryax spayat kbhol kawas qani ga, kwara' qo mnwah Taywan ka Sexo' ppklahang qani ga, spwah naha' sqo mwah qmalop smbo' sa Genzyomin, mwah zmingat rhzyal, yasa si naha' pcqihiy kwara' qo inllongan kwara' na Genzyomin qani. nano' ya qani qo mosa' mako' s'iwan Sexo' tmatok tonox sqo Genzyominzok qani.
english: The Dutch and the Koxinga Kingdom massacred and exploited the Pingpu ethnic group. The Qing Empire presided over bloody confrontations and suppression. Colonial Japan put in place comprehensive savage policies. And the post- war ROC government undertook assimilation policies. For 400 years, every regime that has come to Taiwan has brutally violated the rights of indigenous peoples through armed invasion and land seizure. For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.

tay: kahol sqo Gaga' naha' nanak 'molah mlahang sqo qnxan naha', ro kahol naha' sa kinblayqan tonox naha' mlahang sqo mosa' mtnaq mbhoyaw kwara' mnqyanox cyox maki' sqo qsahoy na lhlahoy. aw' ga, maki' sqo pins'rox Gaga' na Sexo' qani qo Genzyomin qani ga, wal si kawngat kwara' qo Kinri' na kklahang naha' nanak sa qqyanox naha' la. kwara' qo Gaga' na kklahang naha' sa qalang naha', ro kwara' qo Ggga' na paylhoyan naha' ozi lga, ini' naha' saysay ozi. nano' ya qani qo mosa' mako' s'iwan Sexo' tmatok tonox sa Genzyominzok qani.
english: Indigenous peoples maintain tribal order according to traditional customs, and ecological balance according to traditional wisdom. But in the process of modern state-building, indigenous peoples lost the right to steer their own course and govern their own affairs. The fabric of traditional societies was torn apart, and the collective rights of peoples were not recognized. For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.

tay: balay ga mnaki' nanak kay' na Genzyominzok ha, nano' aring sqo babaw na kawas Amirika' ka 1945 lqo shtoy na Sexo' kmayal sa kay' naha' nanak, memaw wal si lohing mskawngat kwara' qo kay kay' naha la. nano' qo Pinpoco' hya' lga, sisay maha wayal mskawngat balay laha' hya' la. nano' qo Sexo' sa wayal qani ga, ini' naha' si iyal inlongan balay qo kklahang sa Gaga' na Gezyominzok qani, nano' ya qani qo mosa' mako' s'iwan Sexo' tmatok tonox sa Genzyomin qani.
english: Indigenous peoples had their own languages. However, with Japanese rule aiming to assimilate and turn all into imperial subjects, and with the ROC government banning tribal languages after 1945, indigenous peoples' languages suffered great losses. Most Pingpu languages have disappeared. Successive governments have been negligent in the protection of indigenous cultures. For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.

tay: nano' sqo kawas wayal qasa ga, ini' baqi kwara' nqo sqoliq Ta'o' ga, inhyo'on mosa' smi' kya Lanyo' qo inlaxan na Hoco hweryaw. niwan nyox naha' si pqmoli sa kinmxyalan na Hoco hweryaw qo sqoliq na Ta'o' qani. nano' ya qani qo mosa' mako' s'iwan Sexo' tmatok tonox sa sqoliq Ta'o'.
english: Without the knowledge of the Yami tribe, the government stored nuclear waste on Orchid Island. Tribe members on the island had to suffer the negative consequences. For this, I apologize to the Yami people on behalf of the government.

tay: aring sqo wahan na kahol bzinah qo Taywan qani lga, nano' qo Pingpoco' tay saysaw wsilong qo tqso' balay wal naha' ptqihon. Sexo' minlahang laha' qani ga sbahon naha' qo lalo' naha' ro magal sa lalo' na minlahang laha , nano' ya qani qo mosa' mako' s'iwan Sexo' tmatok tonox sa Pingpoco' qani.
english: Ever since outsiders began arriving in Taiwan, the Pingpu ethnic group on the western plains have born the brunt of the impact. One ruling power after another eroded the individual and collective identities of the Pingpu ethnic group. For this, I apologize to the Pingpu ethnic group on behalf of the government.

tay: nano' sqo 'myonaw qo mlahang sa rhzyal qani ga, wayal minblayqon smyok na Sexo' qo pinsina' na Genzyominzok ha. ro nano' wayal balay swalan na Sexo' ro wal cikay ozi qo pintzyoaw naha'. misow qani lga, kya lqo si say hopa' balay rinrogan na"Yoencominco' cipnxwa'"qani, ga ini si inlongan balay na Sexo'. mssoqi' iyal qo ptzyoaw myan, ro ini' pintayhok pintzyoaw myan, ro ini' qblaq iyal qo pintzyoaw myan. nano' ya qani qo mosa' mako' s'iwan Sexo' tmatok tonox sa Genzyominco' qani.
english: After the democratic transition, the country began to respond to the appeals of indigenous movements. The government made certain promises and efforts. Today, we have an Indigenous Peoples Basic Law that is quite advanced. However, government agencies have not given sufficient weight to this law. Our actions have not been fast enough, comprehensive enough or sound enough. For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.

tay: si ta' mlox maha Syakay na "twoyo_en wnxwa'" Taywan qani. ga, tayhok ssawni' qani ga, kwara' pinsbaq sqo kklahang sa sklawkah hi', ro Kyo_ ik, Kezay Sekat, sangka' sa Sezi', ro pzyox qo sngoson qotox qotox pcyowagan ga, ini' pqbbaq na' sqo kinpzyox na iyat Genzyominzok. tmrang sqani ozi na' qo knita' naha' sa Genzyominzok, ro si say maha kincikoy knita' naha' sa Genzyominzok ga nyox msthay cikay na'. ini' pintayhok na' pintzyoaw na Sexo', ro yasa qo niwan nyox simo pqmolan na' ka iyat naha' kinbaq ka kinmxayal na inlongan mamo qani. nano' ya qani qo mosa' mako' s'iwan Sexo' tmatok tonox sa Genzyominzok qani.
english: Taiwan is known as a culturally diverse society. But even today, indicators on health, education, economic livelihood, political participation and more still show gaps between indigenous and non- indigenous peoples. Meanwhile, stereotypes and even discrimination against indigenous peoples have not gone away. The government has not done enough, so indigenous peoples have suffered pain and frustration unknown to other ethnic peoples. For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.

tay: ini' tayhok na' kinlawkahan myan mtzyoaw, ro ongat ozi sqoliq mita' sqo ini' pintayhok kinlawkah pintzyoaw myan, yasa qo nyox simo ps'bkan ro mocing sawni' qani. yaqih sami balay la! nano' qo tnatok myan tonox ssawni' qani ga, ana maha talagay kin mqssoqi' balay qani ga, yani qo nyox t'aring na' ki! ini' sako' kosa maha ta qo ryax pinsqzinot kinmxyalan inlongan mamo sa spayat kbhol msyaw kawas wayal qani ga, psi ptmasoq sqo qotox binrwan biro' qani, ro qotox kay' na tnatok mako' tonox qani. ana ga inlongan mako' balay lmnglong maha, tnatok mako' ssawni' qani ga, minkahol sqo 'ringan mosa' mtbalay kwara' nyox qsahoy na Koka' qani.
english: Our efforts have fallen short, and succeeding generations have been blind to this inadequacy. Because of this, your hardship has continued to this day. For this we are truly sorry. Today's apology is long overdue, but it is a beginning. I do not expect any one speech or phrase of apology to wipe away four centuries of pain and suffering by the indigenous peoples. But I do hope with all my heart that today's apology will set this country and all its people on the path towards reconciliation.

tay: anay mako' skahol sqo kinblayqan tonox smi' sa kay' na Genzyominzok kmayal sqo nyox ta' aylhoyan ssawni' qani. kay' na 'Tayal hya' ga ka "balay balay na zyoaw" ga, Balay sawn naha'. ro mtbalay hya' ga Sbalay sawn naha', niwan maha o twangan naha' sa "S" qo glaing na Balay qasa. balay balay sqo mtbalay qani ga, m'oboy qo awsa' kkyalan na sazing kay' qani hya'. qotox ozi qo kay' qani hya' ga, spzyang balay na mtbalay qani hya' ga, nano' si ki minkahol sa inlongan balay mosa' mssongos mkal sa zyoaw balay ga, thozyay mtbalay qo zyoaw.
english: Please allow me to shed light on this occasion with a piece of indigenous wisdom. In the Atayal language, truth is called "Balay", and reconciliation is called "Sbalay", so you simply add an "S" sound to "Balay". Truth and reconciliation are in fact two related concepts. In other words, only by facing the truth sincerely can reconciliation be attained.

tay: Gaga' na Genzyominzok hya' iy kya qo wal naha' inzhoqon saxa' lga, ato' na maki' inlongan naha' aki' mosa' Sbalay ga, motow paylhoyon na Mrhow qo msinzyoaw rrosa' qasa. paylhoyon naha' ga, iyat maha yaqo mosa' tmatok tonox, yaqo ppgwah sa inlongan naha' balay, ro kmayal sqo maha swa' maha qasa. tmasoq kmayal sa inlongan naha' lga, mplaw mnbow qwaw kya la, ro kwara' wayal ka kinzyaqih inlongan naha' lga, wayal balay ozi la. yani qo sawn naha' Sbalay.
english: In indigenous cultures, when a tribe member has offended another and intends to reconcile, an elder brings together the offender and the offended – not to produce a direct apology, but to allow each side to frankly share their inner journeys. When this truth-telling concludes, the elder calls for everyone to drink together, so that what is past is truly past. This is "Sbalay".

tay: nyox mako' pkmn_gawn balay sqo inlhoyan ta' ssawni' qani ga, yani qo mosa' psbalay zyoaw na Sexo' sqo Genzyominzok. kwara' ka inzhoqan sqo kinwayal qani ga, kwara' ka zyoaw balay wayal qasa ga, si say maha kyaqo wal mako' baqon kwara' ga, wayal mako' skayal kwara' ro ongat ana qotox wal mako' zhoqan kmayal. nano' kira' ozi ga, kaylanay na Genzyominzok ozi qo inllongan naha'. ini' sako' kosa maha aki' mamo swalan qo inlongan mako', ga, inlongan mako' balay mnaga' sqo maha kana pinpayposal lawzi qo inzhoqan sa wayal qani, pkaki' balay qotox ryax nqo mosa' mtbalay balay.
english: I hope today's occasion can be a "Sbalay" between the government and the indigenous peoples. I have spoken of past mistakes and truths the best I can, with nothing held back. In a moment, our indigenous friends will speak. I do not dare ask you to forgive, here and now. But I sincerely ask you to sustain the hope that past wrongs will not be repeated, and that one day, this country can see true reconciliation.

tay: sawni' qani hya' ga t'aring nanak qani hya' na, mosa' thozyay mtbalay hya' ga ini' kaki' sqo inlongan na Genzyominzok, skita' sqo pintzyoaw na Sexo'. baqon mako' maha nqwaq nanak ga ini' qtnaq, mosa' mtbalay balay qani hya' ga, mosa' skita' sqo kwara' pintzyoaw sa Genzyominzok na Koka' qani qo spzyang balay pspngan.
english: Today is only a beginning. The duty for reconciliation lies not with the indigenous peoples and the Pingpu ethnic group, but with the government. I know that words of apology alone are not enough. What we actually do for the indigenous peoples will decide whether reconciliation succeeds or stumbles.

tay: anay simo kmayal sqani, mosa' ps'rxon na Sotoxo' qo sawn maha " Genzyominzok Rekisi' segi'" sqo " Cwansing cng'i' Weyoenxwe'". mosa' mako' skahol sa lalo' na Mrhow Koka', mgppaylahoy na sqoliq, ro kwara' Rayxyo na qotox qotox zok msqon mosa' hmkangi' sqo Segi' na Rikisi', ro mosa' myan ptnaqon mkayal sa pptzyoaw sa awsa' na Koka' babaw niya' ozi.
english: Therefore, I am here to announce that we are setting up an Indigenous Historical Justice and Transitional Justice Commission under the Presidential Office. As the head of state, I will serve as convener and work hand in hand with tribal representatives to pursue historical justice. We will also discuss, on the basis of equality, the future policy direction of this country.

tay: mosa' mako' grhgon balay hya' ga, mosa' krhon balay mita' na i'ingkay na Sotoxo' hya' ga, yaqo pinssongos psblayqan na Genzyominzok sqo Sexo' qani. nano' mosa' yaqo pinglgan inlongan kwara' nqo pins'rox Rayxyo na qotox qotox zok, kwara' kin na glow na Pinpo co' ozi qo ggalan poqing pptzyoaw na Sexo'. Gaga' na ptzyowaw qani ga, mosa' yasa qo pinsqtoxan inlongan kwara' na Genzyominzok, mosa' thozyay payhtow sqo hngzyang inlongan na kwara' Genzyomin.
english: I want to stress that this commission places the greatest importance on equality between the country and the indigenous peoples. The election of tribal representatives, including for the Pingpu ethnic group, will take as basis the consensus of peoples and tribes. This commission will serve as a mechanism for collective decision-making by indigenous peoples, and will ensure that the voices of tribe members find true expression.

tay: qotox ozi ga, mosa' mako' kyalon ozi qo Gyose'ing maha si' qotox sa ryax na pkaygi' nqo zyowaw na "lahoy na prorow sqo Yoencominco' cipnxwa' ". nano' qo wal mthozyay pinsqtoxan pinkyalan na I'ingkay ka ppcyowagon naha' qani ga, mosa' yasa qo mosa' minblayqon mpkayal sa qotox qotox ini' ptnaq aylhoyan na Gyose'ing qo mosa' ptzyoawgon na Sexo' babaw niya'. kwara' qo zyowaw qani ga, kwara' kin na hhkangi' sa wayal naha' sginpong na Rikisi', awsa' rmorow sa kklagang qalang na Genzyominzok nanak, mosa' mintnaq psglabang sa kezay na qnxan naha', mosa' kyo'ik sqo 'olah kinbahan sa Gaga' naha', kklahang sa kklawkah hi' naha', ro yaqo awsa' mlahang sa kinri' nqo sqoliq cyox maki' tay hogal.
english: In addition, I will request that our Executive Yuan convene regularly the Indigenous Peoples Basic Law Promotion Committee, and use the Yuan's authority to coordinate and handle matters related to any consensus reached by the above-mentioned commission. These matters include the following: to retrieve historical memories, to promote indigenous self-government, to seek fair economic development, to ensure continuation of culture and education, to safeguard indigenous health, and to protect the rights of urban indigenous peoples, etc.

tay: nano' qo gaga' na Genzyominzok ka ini' balay pqbbaq sa qnxan misow qani kroma' ga, mosa' myan psr'xon qotox sa mosa' baq balay sa Gaga' qnxan Genzyomin ka sawn maha " Genzyominzok Horit xokomo' cyosing", spwah sqo Gaga' ka minblayqan smpong ps'rox, mosa' pingaygyot pshawhway smbalay sqo aki' msoling pingrgol na Gaga' qnxan mamo sqo Horit qani.
english: Where modern laws and indigenous traditional cultures are at odds, we will set up an Indigenous Legal Service Center with a high degree of cultural sensitivity, to reduce through institutional design the growing clashes between indigenous customs and modern laws.

tay: mosa' myan kyalon kwara' qo pptzyowaw maha ihi' kbalay qo zyowaw na wayal kyapon ro wayal skokso na Horit ka smnbo' sqo iyat sinpong sa kklhangan Sexo' ka qqsinow sqo qzyonam naha' nanak ka Genzyominzok qani, yalaw gi bali naha' sptbazi qo bno' naha' qasa! nano' qo yan nqani ka sisay maha pin'anak na zyowaw ga, hknyanay ta' sqo mosa' baqon gmobah kbalay.
english: I will ask the relevant agencies to immediately pull together cases in which indigenous community members have been indicted or sentenced for hunting, where the hunting was done in accordance with traditional customs, on traditional lands, and for non-transactional needs, and where the animals hunted were not protected by conservation laws. For such cases we will deliberate solutions.

tay: mosa' myan kyalon kwara' qo pptzyowaw maha, kwara' pintzyowaw balay nqo cyox syon sa rhzyal na Ta'o' zok ka inlaxan na "Hoco hweryaw" qani ga, ani minblaq kmayal kwara ssawn mako'.ini' ptmasoq balay kbalay sa zyowaw na Hoco' hweryaw qani na' ga, aki' biqan cikay nangi' mosa' smawm cikay sa kinmxyalan mamo.
english: I will also direct relevant agencies to present an investigative report on the decision-making process of nuclear waste storage on Orchid Island. Before finding a permanent solution for the nuclear waste, we will provide the Yami tribe appropriate compensation.

tay: aw' row, maki' sqo snyan inlongan na aki' nyox ps'rox sqo lalo' naha' sraral, ro mosa' ta' Syoning sqo lalo' naha' balay qani ka Pinpoco' qani ga, mosa' myan minblayqon minbzinah lmnglong mocing sa zik na tmsoqan byacing na tay mqiro' byacing qani, aki' thozyay maki' ozi qo Knri' naha' ro lalo' naha'.
english: At the same time, under the principle of respecting the Pingpu ethnic group's self- identity, and recognizing their identity, we will examine relevant laws before September 30 of this year, so that Pingpu ethnic group identity will receive the rights and status it deserves.

tay: 'ringan byacing tay mawpow qotox lga, mosa' myan 'ringon kikak kbalay, ro mosa' myan skayal kya qo rhzyal qzyonam kwara' na Genzyominzok. Gaga' nqo Borak kohoning hya' lga, nyow myan rima' ptzyowagon la, babaw niya' lga, mosa' myan pngaygyoton mtzyowaw balay qo spzyang inllongan balay na Gaga' na kklahang qalang nanak na Genzyominzok. mosa' myan pkhaylagon ozi qo pptzyowaw myan, mosa' smato' sa Ripo_ing qo zyoaw spzyang mamo krhon mita' zyoaw ka "Genzyominzok sizit ho","Genzyominzok toci ro kayyokoho","Genzyominzok gengo hattengho"mosa' sinsa kya Ripo_ing.
english: On November 1 of this year, we will begin to delineate and announce indigenous traditional territories and lands. The system of tribal public corporation is already in place. In the future, the ideals of indigenous self-government will be realized step by step. We will step up the pace and submit for legislative deliberation three laws of great importance to indigenous peoples: the Indigenous Peoples Self-Government Law, the Indigenous Peoples Land and Sea Areas Law, and the Indigenous Languages Development Law.

tay: babaw kinryax kira' lga, mosa' sami maylahoy na sengkok Genzyominzok gyose kaygi'. mosa' pzyox balay qo mosa' minblaq kmayal na Sexo' sqo Cngco' qani. babaw niya maki' sqo 'ringan ryax na taymspat byacing ga, mosa' simo shokok na Gyose'ing zyowaw pincyoagan myan sqo zyowaw na "Genzyominzok rikisi' segi'" ro rinrogan pincyoagan myan sqo "Cwanzing cng'i'" qani. aki' sptzyowaw balay qo "Genzyominzok rikisi' segi'" ro psr'ox sqo poqing balay Gaga' na kklahang qalang na Genzyominzok, cyogal qani rrorow sqo zyowaw na pptzyoaw sa Genzyominzok.
english: Later this afternoon, we will convene a national indigenous peoples administrative meeting. In that meeting, the government will elaborate on the policies. On every August 1 to come, the Executive Yuan will report to the indigenous peoples our progress on restoring historical justice and transitional justice. To implement the Indigenous Peoples Basic Law, to serve indigenous historical justice, and to lay the foundation for indigenous self- government – these are the three major goals for the government's policy towards indigenous peoples.

tay: plwanay simo kwara' ka nyox maki' sqani, ro kwara' ka Genzyominzok nyow zmangay sa Tiribi', ani sako' gmrhow hosyo sqani. pinlawa' mako' simo mwah mlahang mita' qani ga, bali yaqo mosa' niwan mwah simo rmaw mpanga' sikining. wahiy sako' smgsow ro psbaqiy sako', aki' thyayon mtzyowaw balay na Sexo' qo sinnawnan myan qani, ro aki' sami ini' kzyan sa wayal ka min'oqo' lawziy.
english: To all of our indigenous friends here and watching on TV and online: I invite you to stand witness. I invite you not to endorse, but to oversee. Please keep pressure on the government and right its course where necessary, so that it will realize its commitments and right historical wrongs.

tay: mhway simo balay kwara' Genzyominzok, simo qo psbaq sami ka sqoliq na pptzyowaw sa zyowaw na Koka' qani, rhzyal ka nyox ta' qplan qani, ro Gaga' qnxan sraral qani ga ongat mosa' thozyay smzyonaw kinkraho' balay na Khaci' niya', kwara' qo kinkrhwan Khaci' niya' qani ga, aki' ta' syan sa kraho' balay na ttrhwan lalo' niya'.
english: I want to thank all of our indigenous friends. You remind everyone in this country that there is irreplaceable value in the land we tread on and the traditions we inherit. This value deserves dignity.

tay: babaw niya', mosa' myan skahol sa rinrogan pincyowagan myan, aki' ini' pskawngat kwara' kay' nha ro Gaga nha nyox maki' sa rhzyal Taywan qani, ro tayta ini ptzyowazyowaw sa rhyal nha nanak kwara' kinbahan nyox maki sa Taywan qani ana mocing kknwan.
english: In the future, we will push for policies to ensure that succeeding generations of indigenous tribes and all ethnic peoples in Taiwan never lose their languages and memories, that they are never separated from their cultural traditions, and that never again are they lost in a land of their own.

tay: anay mako' mlawa' kwara' Syakay ta maha msqona ta' kinlawkah mosa' mqbaq sa Rikisi' ta', aki' ta' mqbaq ozi sa Gaga' na kwara' ka ini' ptnaq glglow nyox maki' sa rhzyal ta' qani. pawsaw ta sa mosa' ptbalay ro pawsaw ta' sa mosa mgblaq qnxan ta' kwara', gyahay ta sqo giqas ro blaq balay na Taywan babaw niya'.
english: I call upon our entire society to come together and get to know our history, get to know our land, and get to know the cultures of our many ethnic peoples. Let us work towards reconciliation, a shared existence and shared prosperity, and a new future for Taiwan.

tay: anay mako' splawa' kwara' sqoliq Koka' ta' maha, anay ta skahol sa ryax sawni' qani, pglganay ta' kinllawkah kbalay qotox sa spzyang balay Segi' na qalang, qotox sa spzyang balay "twoyo_en Pingtng" na qalang.
english: I call upon all citizens to seize the opportunities offered by this day – to join together, work hard, and build a country of justice, a country of true diversity and equality.

tay: piyox ko ini ptna mlahang glow gaga lga, thoyay mosa pkayan kwara glow gaga ro mwah ms'on pcrox otox alang. mrhow p'aras otox glow gaga ga mrhow gaga " san naha
otox alang Tayal ga togan hopa nko lnhoyan gaga naha, yani hayi ms'otox gaga"
kwara mnaki lobow" nko c'oli babaw cinbwanan hani ga
english: nanak lubuw na Tayal ru Scyek maki Taywan hani ga myasa calay knryasan nya

tay: knita mo ga skayan ta ke' knxan Tayal"
english: spgluw nya ku tkba’an sku CD."

tay: lokah ta kwara, t'aring ta la.
lokah ta kwara. kisa ga sba'an cimo nya psba biro sankeno kmayan nni'on ke ta Tayal.
english: Hello everyone. Today I am going to teach you how to say food in Tayal.

tay: ba'on so mong ke na psba biro?
english: Do you understand what the teacher says?

tay: psba biro, ini mo ba'iy. kayan cikah loyi ma?
english: I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

tay: ini mo pongiy, hopa cikah hngiyan so ma?
english: I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

tay: kita cahay kwara! pglow kinang mlpow loyi.
english: Look here, please! Repeat after me.

tay: lpow loyi. hopa cikah hngiyang mamo.
english: Read it again. Please speak louder.

tay: iya htow hngiyang. iya kayan ke.
psba biro, waya mo yngyan bbrwan mo la.
english: I forgot to bring my pen.

tay: psba biro, waya mo yngyan ccong mo la.
english: I forgot to bring my eraser.

tay: ksiyo cikah ccong nya mlow m'was biro syaw so.
english: Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

tay: syogiy co cikah ccong so ma?
tehok cahay tkba'an ta, pkita ta 'nyan otox hngawan loyi.
english: Class dismissed, see you next week.

tay: la'i co nya Pasang, Hayong kinang.
english: I am Pasang’s son, my name is Hayung.

tay: tkba biro co nya Yokan, Wilang kinang.
english: I am a student of Yukan, my name is Wilang.

tay: heya ga soyan mo, Temo lalo nya.
english: He’s my brother, his name is Temu.

tay: heya ga Pisoy, heya ga yata mo.
heya ga lpyong mo, lalo nya ga Yayot.
english: She is my friend and her name is Yayut.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?

tay: sa'ing soyan mo ro otox sswe mo.
english: I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

tay: pisa he kwara otox sali mamo?
english: How many people are in your family?
There are four of us in our family.

tay: lalo cyo nya ptyawon mama so?
english: What does your uncle do for a living?
Does your sister have a job?

tay: heya ga cyo mtiyaw beh pkhgop mga'ing.
ango, ana ga heya ga Bonon.
ango, hlawax ci kwara otox sali myan.
english: Yes, we are all very tall.

tay: cyo m'was biro sswe so nerin la?
english: Does your sister go to school?

tay: kba kmayan ke Tayal sswe so?
english: Do your siblings speak the language?

tay: ang, kba kmayan ke Tayal kwara naha.
english: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.

tay: cyo so mlow maki yaba yaya so?
english: Do you live with your parents?

tay: ang, nyo co mlow maki yaba yaya mo.
english: Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

tay: cyo so mlow maki oba oya so?
english: Do you live with your grandparents?

tay: ini, ini co glow naha maki.
english: No, I didn’t live with them.

tay: nyo co mlow maki yaba, yaya ro soyan mo mlikoy.
english: I live with my father, mother and brother.

tay: cyo beh llyong Mklesan alang myan.
english: Our tribe is in the Greyfriars watershed.
When are you going back to the tribe?
I will go back in the summer.

tay: mhto wagi la, kilox ci kayan nya.
english: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?
It's cold, so wear more clothes.

tay: ini, nyo sbehoy la, sbehoy ci.
ini skinot ro ini kilox soni, ble ci.
english: It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

tay: ongat yolong nya babaw kayan, nyo mhto bengah la.
english: There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

tay: mswat walax nya mico, mhto wagi lga, mhto hongo lotox oyi la.
english: The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

tay: maha keno kayan nya beh kya?
english: What's the weather like where you are?
We're going to have a big storm here.
Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.

tay: skinot ci kayan nya, piyox cmi lokos.
english: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

tay: mosa hopa walax nya kisa, aras ci roko.
english: It's going to rain heavily, you must bring an umbrella.

tay: waya cmo bicyo soni ci, ini ba'iy mosa mwalax kisa.
english: It just thundered, and it might rain later.

tay: waya mwalax soni ci, nyo mswat mico la.
english: It just rained, and now it's stopped.

tay: yani hayi waya mwalax la, nyo mhoyi to'iy.
english: It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

tay: waya mwalax? ca nyo mhoyi kwara he so?
english: Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

tay: cyo mwalax tanox, ini co aras roko.
english: It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

tay: hopa ci behoy nya, memaw ga'ing tonox mo sbehoy.
english: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

tay: hopa ci wagi nya, memaw kging tonox mo bon wagi.
english: The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

tay: ini co aras oyi, hata bayi.
english: I don't have one either, let's go buy one.
Let's go buy a pen, shall we?
Well, I still have to buy erasers.
Let's go get breakfast, shall we?

tay: iyat co, mnani co sali la.
english: No, I've already eaten at home.

tay: waya co mongiy skolo sbin. la.
english: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

tay: waya co mongiy maras sbin la.
english: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

tay: nano s'onaw ta mani sbin mo.
english: Then let's eat my lunch box together!
What did you have for lunch?

tay: kani co pslokah kryaxan pwasan brio.
english: I want a nutritious school lunch.
What did you have for lunch?

tay: nyo co maras sbin soni, s'onaw ta mani cka wagi.
english: I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!
Let's go play basketball, shall we?
Please help me with the broom.
Okay, here's a broomstick for you.

tay: rogiy co magan tapang haca ma?
english: Can you help me with the cloth?

tay: nyo co kmagaw, kayan Hayong haca mraw iso mosa magan.
english: I'm sweeping the floor, you ask Hayung to help you.

tay: cla ci ssamaw oraw haca, haliy cmong cikah.
english: The floor is dirty, go clean it.
Okay, I'll go get the cloth.

tay: cla ci tobong haca, haliy cmong cikah.
english: That window is very dirty, go clean it.

tay: ini nya ha, nyo mo ini so'iy kmagaw cahay nya.
english: Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.
I'm going to see my teacher.

tay: mosa so ino maso m'was biro?
english: What do you do after school?

tay: mosa co mlow m'was lpyong mo.
english: I'm going to sing with my friends.

tay: mosa ino heya maso m'was biro?

english: She’s at home, please come in.

tay: ini aki sali, lalo yaw so?
english: She’s not here. What do you want?

tay: oba, Sayon kinang, gyahiy cikah lihon.
english: Grandpa, I’m Sayun, please open the door.

tay: Yabong, Rimoy kinang, nyo co mwah hkani iso la.
english: Yabung, this is Rimuy, I’ve come to see you.

tay: bsya ta ci ini pkita la.
aw ha! krmaton miso ci. nahay owah mtisan!
english: Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s chat!
Please sit down and have some tea.

tay: talagay! ble ci nbon ocya mamo.
aw ga! myasa ci texan kwara bbway hani.
maso phapoy kgabi yaya la, nahay owah mani!
english: Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!
Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.

tay: iriy mani ro nbo, bali so c'oli.
english: Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.

tay: piyox ci waya mo ni'on la, tngi ci la.
english: I ate a lot, I’m full.

tay: mosa co la, wahay miso mita babaw nya.
english: I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.

tay: gbyan ci la, mosa co sali la.
aw, ongat yaw so ga owah tisan sali mo.
english: Okay, come to my house sometime.

tay: lokah ta kwara, kisa ga rason cimo nya psba biro mosa ta alang Tayal mita bkis.
english: Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

tay: oba, nyo cami mwah mita iso la.
english: Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

tay: talagay! kba cimo kmayan ke Tayal! talagay myasa ci!
english: You guys speak Thai! That’s great!

tay: lokah ta kwara, kisa ga rason cimo nya psba biro mosa ta mtiyaw mayah lmyon.
english: Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

tay: psba biro, mosa cami kwara myan.
english: Teacher, we all have to go.

tay: owah mlahoy kwara, aras y'aya mamo.
english: Come and line up and bring your tools.

tay: aw, psba biro, nyo cami maras y'aya la.
english: Yes, teacher, we’ve brought our tools.

tay: ini tehok nya, theya ci nya.
english: Not yet, it’s still far away.

tay: iso osa magan tapang psosaw piyit.

english: Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

tay: lokah ta kwara, mosa ta mita yngayan ksino kisa.
english: Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

tay: talagay myasa! kosa ta keno mosa?
english: Awesome! How are we going to get there?

tay: ble mlahoy kwara, lama ta bayi kipo la.
english: Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

tay: gleng nya ga glow piyit, sorow nya ga glow m'o, ble nanak osa mita.
english: There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

tay: iya kngongo, nano osa mita piyit iso.
english: Don’t worry, then you go and see the birds.

tay: babaw otox tmoting lga owah mlahoy kwara ta.
english: We’ll be back in an hour.

tay: piyox ci m'o waya mo texan, piyox ci piyit oyi.
english: I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.

tay: ngwey co cikah, m'wix ci kakay mo.
english: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

tay: piyox ci c'oli nya nyo mlngya cahay.
english: There are a lot of people swimming here.

tay: haca ga iyik ci 'sya nya, mlngya ta cahay lga yaca la.
english: The water is deep there, so we just swim here.
What kind of car did you take?
How do you go to church?

tay: kmoyit toroy yaba mo, glgan co nya mlow mosa.
heya ga maha keno mosa pwasan biro kryax?
english: How does he usually go to school?

tay: heya ga mlow toroy iyik oraw mosa pwasan biro.
english: He took the subway to school.

tay: maha keno mosa bayi rami oya so?
english: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?
She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.
How are you going to get to Orchid Island?
I want to take a boat to Lanyu.
How did he get to Orchid Island?

tay: mlow glgan mlaka mosa Lanyiy heya.
english: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

tay: mlow lalo toroy mosa Takaw heya?
english: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

tay: mlow spito kisya mosa Takaw heya.
english: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.
Did he take a train to Taitung?

tay: ang, mnlow kisya mosa Tayto heya.
english: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.
Did he take a train to Taitung?

tay: iyat, mnlow glgan mlaka mosa Tayto heya.
english: No, he took a plane to Taitung.
Is there a bus stop near here?

tay: kyan, kora gleng khani lga texan so glgan baso la.
english: Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

tay: cyo ino ko sobeh ci glgan iyik oraw cahay?
english: Where is the nearest MRT station?

tay: ongat glgan iyik oraw nya cahay, nanak haya glgan so.
english: There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

tay: pisa ryax nya mlow ta glgan baso ga tehok ta pwasan biro?
english: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

tay: mpo magan pongkang lga tehok pwasan biro la.
pisa ryax nya mlow ta spito kisya ga tehok ta Taycyo?
english: How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?

tay: otox tmoting lga tehok Taycyo la.
english: I will come to Taichung in an hour.

tay: bsya ryax nya kmoyit toroy mosa ta alang Ulay?
english: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

tay: mlow so glgan iyik oraw ga knwan tehok so sali mo?
english: How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?
Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

tay: laxiy owah, ini piyox ba'on mo.
english: Don't come, I don't know much.

tay: ongat yaw so 'lyan? ana co mosa mita iso?
english: Are you free this afternoon? I'd like to visit you, is that okay?
Okay, I'll wait for you at home.

tay: ongat yaw so coxan? aki co mosa tkba iso yaw na lela na Tayal.
english: Are you free tomorrow? I would like to ask you about the legendary stories of the Atayal people.

tay: mosa co rgyax coxan, iyat co kaki sali.
english: I'm going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won't be home.

tay: pnongan mo ga piyox ci ba'on so knxan gaga lela na Tayal, smoya co mosa tkba iso.
english: I heard that you are very knowledgeable about the traditional customs of the Atayal and I would like to ask you a few questions.

tay: ini piyox knba'an mo, ana ga mosa miso sba'an kwara knba'an mo.
english: I don't know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

tay: ana miso galon lotox? maha kya ga mosa ba'on sbiro babaw nya.
english: Can I record? It will be easier to record in the future.

tay: waya co rima mhenas m'eso pgan spat kawas la.
heno la! nyo co rima bkis la.
kahon co llyong Mklesan alang na Pyahaw.
english: I'm from the Bihue tribe of the Greyfriars.
Is your wife also an Atayal?

tay: pisa kwara ke ba'on so kmayan?
kba co kmayan ke na Tayal ro ke na Troko.
p'ason ci thoyay co mwah mita tkba iso, ana so kmayan cikah gaga na mloyak?
english: It's a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

tay: ana, mrkyas co ga mosa co mloyak rgyax kryax.
english: Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

tay: mhway so, talagay myasa ci pnsba so soni.
english: Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

tay: knayan miso ga calay ci ini kbros kwara, kahon pnsba na bnkisan.
english: All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

tay: tehok cahay tkba miso kisa. mhway so ci kwara pnsba so.
english: That's all for today's interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

tay: mosa co la, babaw nya ga smoya co mong piyox hayi yaw na lela.
english: I'm going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.
Hello, what are you looking for?
I want to buy a cup.
Hello, what are you looking for?
I want to buy a hat.

tay: bayi co copo, cyo mamo tbayi?
english: I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?
Yes, how many do you want to buy?
No, we don't sell betel nut.
How many packs do you want to buy?
I want to buy sweet potatoes.
All the sweet potatoes are sold out.
I want to buy two bottles of oil.
How many pounds do you want to buy?
How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?
I want to buy two catties.
I want to buy two green onions.

tay: nyo mhra togan nhon, siy miso bi'iy kwara.
english: There are three left, you can have them all!
How much is this bag of rice?

tay: kwara pila ga posan otox, posan lga yaca la.
cahay ga m'eso pgan magan pila.
twangay mo bayi cikah, siy tna'iy otox kbhon pila.
english: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

tay: kwara pila ga magan kbhon mpo.
siy co galiy magan kbhon pila la ki?
kwani ga hmet ci la, ana so mhway cikah?
english: It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

tay: ini ga, kwani ga waya mhway ci la.
english: No, this is already very cheap.

tay: galon mo otox cnabo pang kiyay hani.
english: I want this packet of cookies.

tay: pang kiyay hani ga tiyon pila, smoya so bayi binah nya loyi?
english: $30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

tay: ana co ksiyo cikah pila so?
english: Can I borrow money from you?
Yes! How much do you need?

tay: waya co mongiy maras pila la, ana co ksiyo cikah pila so?
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?
I don't have any money either!

tay: waya co mongiy maras pila la, ana co ksiyo cikah pila so?
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

tay: iyat co, pilaw knsyogan so pila mo ga ini cako bi'iy nya.
english: No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

tay: ana co ksiyo cikah lokos so?
ana co ksiyo cikah biro so?
ksyogiy co cikah zitengsya so ki?
english: Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

tay: ana, ana ga wahiy cako ci mato coxan.
english: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

tay: mwalax la, ini co aras roko, ksyogiy co cikah roko so ki?
english: It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me your umbrella?

tay: otox ci roko mo, siy ta s'on pcro la.
english: I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

tay: kwani ga knsyogan mo pilaw biro so, nyo miso wahan me la.
english: This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

tay: biro lalo smoya so mita loyi ga kayan cako.
english: You can tell me what else you want to read.

tay: knwan bi'an miso knsyogan mo pila?
english: When do I have to repay the money I borrowed from you?

tay: ana, texiy kyan pila so ga kayan cako.
english: It doesn't matter, you can talk about it when you have money.

tay: knwan bi'an cako knsyogan so pila mo?
english: When are you going to pay me back?
I'll return it to you tomorrow.

tay: knwan bi'an cako knsyogan so biro mo?
english: When are you going to return my book?

tay: iyat miso waya bi'an hesa la?
english: Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

tay: bbrwan hani ga knsyogan so nya Wilang?
english: Did Wilang lend you this pen?
Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

tay: bbrwan hani ga nwahan so ksiyo Masaw?
english: Did you borrow this pen from Masaw?

tay: iyat, kwani ga mnayi yaya mo.
english: No, this is what mom bought.

tay: ongat cimo la, osa ksiyo cikah cimo Sima.
english: We are out of salt, let's borrow some from Sima.

tay: hay kmayan Yageh haca wahiy cako me pila mo.
english: Go tell Yageh to give me my money back.

tay: pisa kwara pila knsyogan nya pila so?
english: How much has she borrowed from you in total?

tay: mosa co mayah ro mohi rami.
english: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

tay: nyo k'man ci la, nyo co smlyat k'man, ksya'an mo 'sya kisa.
english: There’s too much grass, I’m cutting it, I’ll have to water it later.

tay: hay magan cikah soki ro karoh mo aras cahay ma?
english: Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?
Put it next to the door of the warehouse.

tay: waya so spoxon kmoyah oraw la?
english: Did you turn over the soil?

tay: waya mo spoxon kmoyah mico ci, naga cikah lga tboxon mo la.
english: I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

tay: ba'on kmyot nohiy so rami la?
english: Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

tay: nyo cahay kanrang ga ba'on magan la, cyo haca sina ga ini ba'iy magan na.
english: The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.
Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

tay: haliy smko cikah kho mo ki?
english: Will you help me with the barn?
We’re releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

tay: iyik tara mo ga piyox ci kniyak mo 'cyox la.
english: The fish basket has been full of fish.
How do you usually catch fish?
I shoot fish with a spear.
Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

tay: cmi co t'oya kmiyak ksino kryax, kroma ga magan co patos ro maras co hoyin mosa mloyak.
english: I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.

tay: cahay ga to'iy nwahan biyak kahong.
english: This is the road the boar took.

tay: kwe ga rapan na biyak kahong, nano yaca cahay ga to'iy nwahan na biyak kahong.
english: These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

tay: helaw ta mosa mita t'oya ta, yani hayi cyo ciri ksino la.
english: Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

tay: yani hayi cyo sokan hoyin la. nahay hayi hay ta mlow.
english: The dog seems to have smelled it. Let’s follow them.

tay: kwani ga rangay, wahan ta kmiyak olit.
english: This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.

tay: cyo so pcyan haca ga lalo kyaca?
english: What is that thing you put there?

tay: kyaca ga t'oya, s'agan mo ciri para.
english: It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

tay: mhway gnalo na lotox bnkisan, piyox ci pnaga ta ksino soni.
english: Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

tay: ango ha! rasaw ta alang ta le'aw ta m'aso ro s'on mani.
english: Yeah! Let’s take it back to the tribe and share it!

tay: ryax soni psba biro ga psba'an cimo san keno kmayan ke Tayal ko ksino.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Tayal language today.

tay: ryax soni psba biro ga psba'an cimo san keno kmayan ke Tayal ko bway nni'on.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Tayal language today.

tay: psba biro, ini co aras biro. .
english: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.

tay: s'on mita biro ko m'was biro syaw so haca.
english: Share the book with your classmate next to you.
I will lend you my eraser.

tay: mhngi ta m'was biro la, thoway mosa sali!
english: It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

tay: mhngi ta m'was biro la, sgagay ta la.
english: The class is over, goodbye everyone.

tay: lokah ta kwara! lalo mo ga Tacyo.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Tacyu.

tay: lokah ta kwara! lalo mo ga Yoming.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Yuming.

tay: Among lokah so, kinang ga Takong.
Bato lokah so, kinang ga Asaw.
yaya cako nya Yohaw, kinang ga Yabong.
sswe cako nya Yohaw, lalo mo ga Uma.
english: I am Yuhaw’s sister. My name is Uma.

tay: heya ga psba biro mo, lalo nya ga Pasang.
soyan mo mlikoy heya, Take lalo nya.

english: What is your elder sister’s name?
My elder sister’s name is Habaw.
What is your younger sister’s name?
My younger sister’s name is Ipay.
How old is your elder brother?
How old is your younger brother?

tay: alang mamo ga kyan pwasan biro?
english: Do you have schools in your community?

tay: cyo so m'was biro beh pwasan biro alang so?
english: Do you study in your tribe’s school?

tay: ang, s'on cami m'was biro beh pwasan biro ga yani cami ci otox sali.
english: Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

tay: iyat, heya ga lpyong sswe mo mlikoy.
english: No, he is my younger brother’s friend.

tay: iyat, heya ga sswe mo knerin.
english: No, she is my younger sister.

tay: pisa kwara c'oli otox sali naha?
english: How many people in their family?

tay: magan he kwara otox sali naha.
english: There are five people in their family.

tay: pisa kwara la'i otox sali mamo?
english: How many children in your family?
There are four children in our family.

tay: pisa kwara sswe so mlikoy ro sswe so knerin?
english: How many younger siblings do you have?

tay: ongat sswe mo mlikoy, kyan togan sswe mo knerin.
english: I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.

tay: pisa kwara soyan so mlikoy ro soyan so knerin?
english: How many older siblings do you have?

tay: ongat soyan mo mlikoy ro soyan mo knerin.
english: I don’t have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?

tay: ang, heya ga soyan mo mlikoy.
ang, heya ga c'oli na Tayal.
maha keno kayan nya ryax soni?
skinot hayi kayan nya, piyox nbo 'sya kilox.
english: It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

tay: maha keno kayan nya ryax soni?
kilox hayi kayan nya, piyox nbo 'sya.
english: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

tay: tyaba ci wagi nya, pomok kbobo wah.
english: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

tay: piyox ci yolong nya, ongat wagi kayan.
english: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

tay: ongat wagi coxan iya, piyox yolong ro hopa behoy nya.
english: It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.

tay: maha keno kayan nya ryax haca?
english: How was the weather that day?

tay: skinot hayi ryax haca, mhto so tanox ga posa oba.
english: It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.

tay: maha keno kayan nya mhngi na ryax?
english: How’s the weather on the weekend?

tay: mhngi na ryax ga myasa ci kayan nya.
english: It will be sunny on the weekend.

tay: ba mwalax kayan nya ryax haca?
english: Will it be rainy that day?

tay: ryax haca ga myasa ci kayan nya, iyat pwalax.
english: It will have no rain and be sunny that day.
Will it be rainy that day?
Yes, it will be rainy that day.

tay: mswat kayan la, nyo mhto wagi la.
english: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

tay: nyo mwalax la, ini co aras roko.
english: It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

tay: nyo ini wala mico, soro ryax cka wagi lga ba mwalax la, mosa so tanox ga aras roko.
english: It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

tay: mwah kawas na kmisan ga ba skinot?
english: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

tay: ang, mwah kawas na kmisan ga mosa skinot ci, piyox posa lokos.
english: Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.
Will it be very hot in summer this year?

tay: ang, mosa kilox ci ryax na 'bagan hani, piyox nbo 'sya.
english: Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

tay: ksli so ryax na tmangaw abaw?
ksli co ryax na tmangaw abaw, hlhon ci kayan nya.
english: I like spring because the weather is warm.

tay: ksli so ryax na mhow abaw?
ini co ksli ryax na mhow abaw, piyox ci sbehoy ryax mhow abaw.
english: I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

tay: wa co mongi maras biro mako la.
english: I forgot to bring the textbook.
I will share it with you.

tay: wa co mongi maras ccong mako la.
english: I forgot to bring the eraser.

tay: wa so mongi maras bbrwan la?
english: Do you forget to bring your pen?

tay: aw, ksyogiy cako bbrwan so ga?
english: Yes, can you lend me a pen?
What would you like for lunch?
What would you like for dinner?
What did you have for breakfast?
What did you have for lunch?

tay: osa lama iso, halan miso hkani kisa.
english: You go first and I will catch up later.

tay: iyat, hata lama mhakot biro ha.
english: No, we have to carry books first.

tay: ini nya, nyo co 'mwax pyato nya.
english: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.
Why didn’t you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.

tay: maso so m'was biro lga pcwa so la.
english: What are you going to do after school?

tay: maso m'was biro nko heya lga lalo tyawon nya la?
english: What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

tay: ini kaki sali ko Yabong, kinang ga Ipay, kyan lalo yaw so? mwah Yabong lga kyalon mo la.
english: Yabung is not at home. I am Ipay. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

tay: oya, cami ga Uma ro Iwan, gyahi blihon.
english: Grandma, we are Uma as and Iwan, please open the door for us.

tay: kinang ga Boya, nyo co mwah hkani Yokan.
english: I am Buya, I am here for Yukan.

tay: oya, nyo co mwah mita iso.
english: Grandma, I am here to see you.

tay: bsya ci ini so owah la. longon miso calay.
english: You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

tay: Sayon, nyo co mwah cisan iso.
english: Sayun, I am here to play with you.

tay: nahay owah miyok, bsya ci n_gong miso la.
english: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

tay: nohi mo nanak ngahi hani, tlami mani.
english: This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!
The sweet potato is so sweet.

tay: owah! nohi mo nanak bway nni'on hani, tlami mani.
english: Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

tay: tama, nohi mo teton hani ini kisi iyo tlami mani.
english: Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.
Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

tay: ini co thoyay mani 'cyong, kani cako ringgo kinang.
english: I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.

tay: litan mako bway nni'on kni'an miso.
english: Let me peel the fruit for you.

tay: mhway so, piyox ci bo' nya bway hani.
english: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

tay: piyox mani, piyox ci nhapoy mo rami.
english: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

tay: ox, ble ci sokan ro ble ci ni'on.
english: Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.
Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.
I’ll make myself at home then.
Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

tay: piyox ci wa mo ni'on la, iyat co kani la.
english: I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

tay: ryax soni ga rason cimo beh rgyax ki.
english: I will take you to the mountains today.

tay: kmayan yaya mo ga piyox ci potot beh rgyax ma.
english: Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

tay: ryax soni ga rason cimo beh cla'an ki.
english: I will take you to the fields.
Are we going to loosen the soil?

tay: rason ta nya beh syaw llyong ko psba biro.
english: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

tay: rason ta nya beh rgyax ko psba biro.
english: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.
Are we going to the riverside today?

tay: iyat, rason ta nya beh rgyax ko psba biro.
english: No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.
Are we going to the mountains today?

tay: iyat, mosa ta beh cla'an kisa.
english: No, we are going to the fields.

tay: psba biro, mosa ta mita lalo beh llyong?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

tay: psba biro, mosa ta mita lalo beh rgyax?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.
What are we going to do in the fields?

tay: mosa ta beh cla'an ga mita nohi ta teton, kya cyo halan ktahi ro h'ying la!
english: We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

tay: psba biro mosa ta mlngya beh llyong?
english: Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

tay: iyat, mosa ta mita nko klesay.
english: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

tay: psba biro mosa ta mohi rami beh cla'an?
english: Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?
We are going to loosen the soil today.

tay: soni ga wa cako mita ci myanox na klesay la.
english: Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

tay: ye! wa! sli cako ci piray, myasa ci texan.
english: Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.
Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

tay: texay ta cahay ha, kya osa theya ci ki!
english: Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

tay: ang, iyat myan mosa theya ci.
english: Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

tay: kya tenah, thoway mkhani takoy so la.
english: Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.

tay: mnglong co aki helaw hayi texan.
english: I want to see them right away.

tay: kosa so keno mosa tatak so?
english: How do you go to the block-house?

tay: piray co toroy mosa tatak mo.
kosa nya keno mosa beh halan pkhgok?
english: How does he go to the hospital?

tay: mkhani mosa beh halan pkhgok ko heya.
kosa so keno mosa beh Ponghow?
english: How do you go to Penghu?

tay: pglow cako glgan mlaka mosa beh Ponghow.
english: I go to Penghu by plane.

tay: kosa so keno mosa beh Ponghow?
english: How do you go to Penghu?

tay: pglow cako xone mosa beh Ponghow.
english: I go to Penghu by boat.

tay: Uma pglow so lalo mosa beh pwasan biro?
english: How does Uma go to school?

tay: wa mlow kisya wayan beh pwasan biro ko Uma la.
english: Uma goes to school by train.

tay: pglow lalo mosa kyokay ko Piling?
english: How does Piling go to church?

tay: pglow zitensya mosa kyokay ko Piling.
english: Piling goes to church by bicycle.

tay: mlow so cyeyon mosa m'was biro?
english: Do you go to school by MRT?

tay: iyat, mlow co baso mosa m'was biro.
english: No, I go to school by bus.

tay: mlow so zitensya mosa m'was biro?
english: Do you go to school by bicycle?

tay: ang, mlow co zitensya mosa m'was biro.
english: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

tay: pglow so kisya spito mosa beh Takaw?
english: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

tay: ang, pglow co kisya spito mosa Takaw.
english: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

tay: mosa so beh Tayto ga pglow so kisya ga pglow so glgan mlaka?
english: Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

tay: pglow co glgan mlaka, glgan mlaka ro kisya ga helaw tehok glgan mlaka iya.
english: I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

tay: mosa so kyokay ga pglow so baso ga piray so toroy?
english: Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

tay: piray co toroy mosa beh kyakay, miray toroy ro mlow baso ga myasa miray toroy iya.
english: I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

tay: sali so ro bbisan llamo ga sobeh?
english: Is the market close to your house?

tay: ini sobeh, mlow co otobay kryax mosa beh bbisan llamo haca.
english: No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

tay: yobing kyoko ro pwasan biro ga sobeh?
english: Is the post office close to the school?

tay: sobeh ci, mkhani lga tehok la.
english: Yes, it is within walking distance.
Is the restaurant close to the station?

tay: mhto eki lga mkhani cikah magan miray royox rong tmoting lga tehok la.
english: It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.
I would like to visit you.

tay: iyat co kaki sali, kyan yaw mo soni, babaw nya la ki.
english: I am out today. How about another day?

tay: coxan ga kyan yaw so? halan miso hkani hmenas cka wagi ki.
english: Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

tay: ang, n_gong miso beh sali mo.
english: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

tay: kyalaw miso cikah ana mo pgalan hngiyang so? brwan mako biro.
english: Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.
Would you mind if I do the video recording?

tay: ya'eh texan kyasan mo, stetay ci kho mo oyi, ana ini pgaliy.
english: No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.

tay: nano siy miso pgaliy syasing nanak la ki.
english: Then I will just take photos.

tay: mhway so swalan cako mwah tkba yaw iso.
english: Thank you for accepting the interview.
You are welcome. What would you like to know?

tay: kyalaw miso cikah, maki so mrkyas ga lalo tyawon so?
english: What do you do when you are young?

tay: maki lela ga knsat cako, ana ga wa cako malax la.
english: I was a police officer but I am retired now.
Then, are you working at the moment?

tay: nyo cako tiyaw beh pwasan biro mico la.
kyalaw misa cikah, nyo maki beh alang ta la'i so oyi?
english: Do your kids live in the tribe too?

tay: ongat, cyo maki beh maci la'i maki iya.
english: No, my kids are all living in the city.

tay: iso nanak otox nyo maki hani la?
english: Then, do you live by yourself?

tay: nyo co sma'an otox hoyin ro otox piyit, otox sali mako naha oyi.
english: I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

tay: cyo cako sma'an otox 'ngyaw oyi, kyan mnayat ta sino sbes ga ini siy kliyang.
english: I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

tay: tba'ay miso cikah, yaw na Gaga psani mloyak.
english: I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

tay: ini piyox ba'on mo, ana ga ba'on mo kmayan ga kyalon misa kwara.
english: I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

tay: y'aya na mloyak ga maki lalo psani nya?
english: Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

tay: y'aya na mloyak ga ya'eh tringan ko knerin.
english: Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

tay: ana mosa mlo mloyak nko knerin haca?
english: Then, can women go hunting together?

tay: ba'a la, ba'a thoyay mosa mloyak knerin iya la.
english: No, women cannot go hunting either.

tay: Hayong, ongat owaw sali la, osa bayi owaw.
english: Hayung, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

tay: cyo kyan otox sopan owaw beh ppoyan kya nya ana ini osa bayi la!
english: There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

tay: ini tna otox ci sopan, osa bayi sa'ing sopan loyi.
english: One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

tay: bayi co owaw bicyo, kyan ga?
english: I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?
Yes! How many bottles do you need?

tay: bayi cako sa'ing sopan, bayi cako otox ckoyon kapa bwax loyi.
english: I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

tay: nyo cahay bwax ki, lalo galon so loyi?
english: Here is the rice, what else do you need?

tay: bayi cako baying loyi, kyan ga?
english: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

tay: waya so'on bayi baying myan la.

english: I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?

tay: bayi cako lokos rtong owit nya.
english: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

tay: kyan mlabow ro mwasi nya oyi.
english: We have white and blue ones too.

tay: bi'iy cako otox lokos mwasi nya.
english: Please give me the clothes in blue.

tay: Yokan mnwah so ino soni? mnwah so miyiy he?
english: Yukan, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

tay: ini, mnwah cako rmaw bayi rami oya mo.
english: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

tay: maha kya ga, kyan yaw so gbyan? s'on ta mani ga?
english: No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?
No, I want to buy some clothes.
Then, I will go with you.

tay: lokah so, pisa pila rami hani?
english: Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

tay: otox nhlan rami hani ga posan notan pila.
english: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?

tay: iking ngahi ga tiyon notan pila.
english: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

tay: bi'iy cako sa'ing nhlan rami ro iking ngahi.
english: Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

tay: Meban, wa co mongi maras bbrwan mo la, syogay mo cikah 'ra so ga?
english: Meban, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?
I don’t have one either. This is Habaw’s.

tay: syogay mo cikah ga? helaw ci bi'an miso.
english: Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

tay: mhway so, mhway so say kya Habaw oyi.
english: Thank you and thank Habaw for me.

tay: mwa co smato sa'ing biro hani.
english: I want to return these two books.
No problem and what else do you need?

tay: mosa co ksiyo togan biro hani loyi.
english: I would like to borrow these three books.

tay: aw la, kya yngiy togan ryax lga wahiy smato la.
english: Sure and remember to return them after three days.

tay: ini cako bi'iy ccong mako nya.
english: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

tay: wayan miso bi'an hesa la ha.
ca ini texi ccong mako la?
english: Then, why is my eraser missing?

tay: kya so waya syogan Sabow la.
english: Did you lend it to Sabuw?

tay: ini mo ba'i, halan mo kmayan heya ha.
english: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.
I will lend you my eraser first.

tay: Habaw, oba hani ga syogan so nya Piho?
english: Habaw, did Piho lend you this coat?

tay: iyat, mnayi co nya yaya mo.
english: No, my mom bought it for me.

tay: tna ci oba mamo, cimo Piho.
english: Piho’s coat is the same as yours.

tay: mkalox oba nya ko heya, ini tna pnatas myan.
english: His coat is black, so our colors are different.

tay: Xomi, wayan so syogan pila Wilang?
english: Xumi, did you borrow money from Wilang?

tay: ang, obeh mako halan smato soni la, mongi co maras pila la.
english: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.
Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.
Okay, I will tell Wilang for you.

tay: rangay iya ga tmmah olit, tlnga' iya ga ciri olo poreh.
english: It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

tay: kba ka san kaca, waya ini a'ow nosa mo, nano ini cako ciri.
english: No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

tay: nano sba'an miso san keno posa sa'ing toya hani.
english: Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

tay: wa myasa ci la! maha kaca lga mwa co ciri sino oyi la. .
english: Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

tay: royox ci k'man cla'an la, osa beh kho magan soki kawit, hata cla'an kya.
english: The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

tay: cyo maki syaw loko kya, mosa so miyok kho lga texan so la.
english: It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

tay: thoway magan, kotay so nya. mhengot ci soki kawit haca.
english: Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

tay: cyo maki beh kyaho khoni haca toya mo.
english: My trap is under that tree.

tay: nyo mako bbiro cahay, nano ba'on mako cyo ino toya mo.
english: I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

tay: tara 'cyox kwe, han ta posa gong ga kmiyak 'cyox.
english: This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

tay: cami ga ongat tara myan kmiyak 'cyox, ana ga pnek myan cami.
english: We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

tay: ini myan pnek cami, babaw nya mwah so lga sba'iy cako la ki?
english: I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

tay: ang, nano s'on ta mosa pnek 'cyox la ki.
english: Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

tay: nano babaw nya sba'an miso san keno kle tara 'cyox.
english: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

tay: cyo miyiy boli so la, kya cyo ciri 'cyox! nahay lhoyiy.
english: Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

tay: ini ha, lokah ci miyiy xone hani la, lhoyon mo cahay boli pnekan hani, osa magan ami haca iso.
english: Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

tay: lhoyiy kora cahay 'cyox haca, khlolay ta mholoy.
english: Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

tay: alagay myasa, piyox ci nagan ta soni tey, spon kwara takin hani.
english: Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

tay: helaw hayi hata la, hay ta m'aso naha oyi.
english: Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

tay: iya gno la, nahay tama tman.
english: Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

tay: swali cako, nyo cako mso'i la.
te magan ryax hngawan soni, mhngi coxan, hata ms'on mtisan.
english: It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!
Great! Let’s go to the riverside.

tay: te pisa ryax hngawan coxan iya?
english: What day will it be tomorrow?

tay: te togan ryax hngawan coxan, hata mahi boro coxan 'lyan ga.
english: Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

tay: ongat lalo yaw so coxan sasan?
english: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

tay: coxan ga ryax hngawan, pglow co yaya mo mosa Kyokay.
english: Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

tay: ppota' cako la, mosa cako bokan ha.
english: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

tay: psba biro, ga'ing ci nbwas mo, mosa cako bokan ha.
english: Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.
May I go wash my hands?

tay: obeh mhngi m'wasan biro la, osa kisa.
english: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

tay: psba biro, ga'ing ci tonox mo, psina cako mhngi 'lyan.
english: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

tay: aw, pnba longan mosa sali wah.
english: Okay, take care and go home.

tay: psba biro, mwah hngawan te otox ryax hani ga psina cako mhngi, mosa co pkita pkhgok.
english: Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

tay: cyo ga'ing nbwas nya, wayan bokan.
english: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

tay: psba biro, cyo ga'ing olo Yokan, wan lama psina mhngi soni la.
english: Teacher, Yukan has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

tay: Piling Piho lalo mo, mpo kawas mo la.
english: My name is Piling Piho, and I’m 10 years old.
Are you ethnic group from the Atayal?

tay: tayan kwara c'oli otox sali so?
english: Are all your family members indigenous?

tay: ang, Tayal kwara c'oli otox sali mo.
english: Yes, my whole family is Atayal.

tay: tayan kwara c'oli otox sali so?
english: Are all your family members indigenous?

tay: iyat, yaba mo ga Tayal, yaya mo ga Tewan.
english: No, my father is Atayal, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

tay: yaba so kwaca? pisa kawas nya la?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

tay: yaba so kwaca? pisa kawas nya la?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

tay: iyat, bkis alang myan kwaca, mspat pgan kawas nya la.
english: No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

tay: pisa kawas soyan so likoy la?
mpo spat kawas soyan mo likoy la.
cimo soyan so likoy ga mhenas piyox ci kawas hopa heya?
english: Is your brother much older than you?

tay: tehok kbhon mspaton si'em bawi mo.
bsya ini ta pkita la, wa so bawi loyi.
english: I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

tay: awha, tehok kbhon mtiyon si'em bawi mo la.
ini, cyo so mn'o mita la.
ango, tehok mtiyon kongkin thoy he mako mico la.
mosa cako beh bbrwan ptyawon hkani psba biro.
english: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.
He’s going to throw away the trash.

tay: cyo beh lngya'an kya, heya ka mosa pcpong mlngya kisa.
english: He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

tay: cyo ino Yabong? heya mosa pcpong t'enah kisa.
english: Where is Yabung? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

tay: cyo beh lhoyan crxan kya, halan mako smoy.
english: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.
Let’s go to the playground together.

tay: mosa cako lama bayi ni'on kryaxan ha, halan miso hkani kisa.
english: I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.

tay: pglow ta mosa meli sbing ha!
english: Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

tay: osa hkani c'oli, mosa cako hkani psba biro.
english: You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

tay: Takon, mosa so pcpong msilay boro kisa ?
english: Is Takun competing in croquet today?

tay: iyat, heya ka mosa pcpong khoton bawi.
english: No, he’s competing in high jump.

tay: mosa so pcpong ps'es ryax onrokay haca?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

tay: mosa so pcpong ps'es ryax onrokay haca?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

tay: lalo ptyawon ta ps'es ryax onrokay haca?
english: What will we do in the sports day?
We will compete in tug of war.

tay: ps'es ryax onrokay haca ga pbayiy ta nni'on?
english: Will we sell food at the sports day?

tay: lokah so ci, iso mnagan te otox cnrxan!
english: Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!

tay: cyo kya, cyo m'abi beh 'byan nya.
english: Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

tay: ongat, wayan tanox mico hani, gbyan mosa mwah sali la.
english: No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

tay: cyo beh yatox bawi sali, karaw haliy hkani kya.
english: He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

tay: iso Wilang ga, bsya ci ini miso texi la, lokah so?
english: It’s Wilang. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

tay: lokah, nyo cako mwah cisan iso.
english: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

tay: cyo beh poyan kya phapoy rami, halan mo smoy.
english: He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

tay: wayan kmiyak welong beh libo walong kya.
english: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

tay: ini aki sali oba mamo, cyo maki beh cla'an, naga beh sali mamo.
english: Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

tay: bsya ci ini miso texi la, wa so bawi la.
english: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

tay: m'es cako ci texan miso mwah.
english: It’s so good to see you.

tay: bne mo cimo kaway hani, hali posa tl'to pskow kya.
english: Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

tay: ca bsya ci ini so owah la, mosa co tmapeh kwara naha ms'on ta mani myox.
english: It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

tay: ana la, nbo co ocya lga myasa la, hata mtisan beh wahan tama c'oli kya.
english: No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

tay: mhway ci spkani so kinang, mosa cako la.
english: Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

tay: knot mo mico welong hani, rasi thwayi mani.
english: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

tay: pstna ta beh pwasan biro ga? mosa ta pgalan lotox c'oli.
english: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

tay: hata beh pslyan kya, plokos cako lokos Tayal mosa.
english: Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

tay: myasa ci texan sakora alang myan, gmyah phpah nya lga owah la ki.
english: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

tay: n'gon beta tmangaw abaw lga , mso'i ci la.
english: That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

tay: owah s'esan ryax na kmloh la.
english: Then come during our Harvest Festival!

tay: aw la, m'es cako ci mnaga owah ryax haca.
english: Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

tay: ca so mosa maki alang rgyah loyi?
english: May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.

tay: ca so ini psba biro beh alang b'nox?
english: Why not teach in the city?

tay: baha mcwa llongon mo ci alang mako rgyax, aki kyan lalo ccyok mako mtiyaw yaw alang.
english: Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

tay: kba'an so ci tminon gey, ima psba iso?
english: You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

tay: sba'an cako nya oya mo, maki alang myan rgyax ga heya kba ci tminon.
english: It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.
How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

tay: tminon hani ga gaga myan, nglong cako moboy yaw na gaga.
english: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

tay: owaw trakis hani ga ble ci nbon.
kba so ci gey, bsya tyawon p'owaw hani?
english: You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

tay: ini, otox hngawan lga maso la. lman sklwan trakis ro pagay hkay ha, s'on magon tamon lga, ana kopon beh cahoy slaman la.
english: No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

tay: nyo kya 'ryox ro ino, nohi mo nanak kwara kwani.
english: I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

tay: bison mo sa'ing hani pisa pila?
kwara ga sa'ing kbhon myiman pila.
sli mo ci lokos hani, pisa pila?
english: I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

tay: hmet ci la, ana cikoy cikah ga?
english: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

tay: ini ba'i ki, cikoy loyi ga ongat galon mako pila la.
english: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

tay: ana la! nano bayi cako otox lokos mkalox.
english: Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

tay: bayi cako kotan rami ro limok hani.
english: I want this knife and this pot.

tay: sa'ing seng pila kwara, knle mo nanak kwani, bsya ci ckaw.
english: It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

tay: aras cako spkita lpyong mwah bayi, aki so hmway cikah ga?
english: I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?
Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

tay: owah mita cikah ow, nyo cako pbayiy lokos ro kbobo oyi.
english: Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

tay: otox lokos ga togan kbhon myiman pila, togan ga otox seng pila.
english: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

tay: bayi cako otox lga maso la, bi'iy co mganos nya.
english: I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

tay: myasa so, nglong cako bayi somon ro m'aw moso co he 'syang.
english: Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

tay: waya so'on tbayi somon la, nyo kya pang nira iya, bayi so?
english: The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

tay: aw la , bi'i cako otox, mwah cako bayi myox babaw nya loyi.
english: Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

tay: aw, ckoyay mako yobing kapa ha, myiman pila kwani.
english: Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.

tay: lawkah simo kwara ga.pata'aring ta la.
lawkah simo kwara ga. sawni ga pasaba'ay simo ni pasaba biro sawon nano kamayan lalo Tayan ko moto ta nani'on hiya.
english: Hello everyone. Today I am going to teach you how to say food in Thai.

tay: ba'on so mong kayi pasaba biro ga?
english: Do you understand what the teacher says?

tay: pasaba biro, ini mo ba'iy mong. kayan lawziy aw?
english: I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

tay: ini mo pongi. mosa balayi kahanayang tikay aw?
english: I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

tay: katayox ti hani! galo kong lamapo lawziy.
english: Look here, please! Repeat after me.

tay: lapagaw ta lawziy. karaho tikay hanayang mamo.
english: Read it again. Please speak louder.

tay: pasaba biro, yamangiya kong maras inpit la.
english: I forgot to bring my pen.

tay: pasaba biro, yamangiya kong maras i'ing la.
english: I forgot to bring my eraser.
