tay: kasiyok i'ing ki bih so gamalo miro.
english: Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

tay: masi roni ko pinkaba'an ta la, pakatayox ta soro na pahangi'an lawziy.
english: Class dismissed, see you next week.

tay: kozing ga la'i ni Soyan Pawan, Tali Soyan lalo mo.
english: I am Suyan’s son, my name is Tali.

tay: kozing ga makabaga biro ni Yopas, lalo mo ga Tali.
english: I am a student of Yupas, my name is Tali.

tay: lalo ni yaba mo ga Pawan Kayno.
english: My dad’s name is Pawan Kaynu.

tay: hiya ga basoyan mo tamalong, lalo niya ga Pasang.
english: He is my brother, his name is Pasang.

tay: lalo niya ga Yomin Tali pi?
ho' lalo niya ga Yomin Tali.
english: Yes, his name is Yumin Tali.

tay: lalo niya ga Tali Nawpas pi?

english: No, his name is Yumin Tali.

tay: hiya ga Poyap. yata mo ko hiya.
hiya ga wagi mo, lalo niya ga Amoy.
english: She’s my friend, her name is Amuy.

tay: maziman kayan ni yaba mo la?
maziman kayan ni yaba mo so kayan hani?

english: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

tay: kiyan sazing ko basoyan tamalong ki basoyan kanayrin, ro otox ko saway tamalong ki saway kanayrin.
english: I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.
How many people are in your family?
How many people are in your family?

tay: payat hi kwara ko otox sali mo.
english: There are four of us in our family.

tay: nano ko ki patawawan ni mama so?
english: What does your uncle do for a living?

tay: kiyan patawawan ni basoyan so kanayrin?
english: Does your sister have a job?

tay: ki ma'omah yayowaw na koysang hiya.
sazing hi hasa ga matasaway aw?
ho ga, kozing ga Atayan ki.
ho, babawi sami kwara otox sali.
english: Yes, we are all very tall.

tay: niya miro lako saway so kanayrin la?
english: Does your sister go to school?

tay: ba kamayan kayi Tayan ko saway so tamalong ro kanayrin aw?
english: Do your siblings speak the language?

tay: ho, ba kamayan kayi Tayan laha.
english: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.

tay: magalo so maki ki yaba ro yaya aw?
english: Do you live with your parents?

tay: ho, niyan ko magalo maki ki yaba ro yaya mo.
english: Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

tay: magalo so maki ki yotas ro yaki aw?
english: Do you live with your grandparents?

tay: ini yo, ini kozing pagalo maki ki yotas ro yaki mo.
english: No, I didn’t live with them.

tay: niyan so magalo maki ki ima?
niya kozing magalo maki ki yaba,yaya ro basoyan mo tamalong.
english: I live with my father, mother and brother.

tay: niyan maki ino ko sali mamo?
ki maki i Bariy ko sali miyan.
niyan maki i Liyong Paynox ko alang mo.
english: My hometown is in the northern region of Athens.

tay: niyan maki ino ko alang mamo?
niyan maki i Maybanan ko alang miyan.
kanowan ga moto so mosa alang?
english: When are you going back to the tribe?

tay: mahangi loyox i Abangan ga moto kong mosa i alang.
english: I will go back in the summer.

tay: mahato witox la,makilox balay kayan la.
english: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?

tay: sakinot ki, kapayox malokos so latan yo.
english: It's cold, so wear more clothes.

tay: ini yo, masabayhoy la, tala'ato balay ki.
ayat pasakinot ro ayat pakilox oziy, balayi balay.
english: It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

tay: pakosa nano ko kayan malahangan sawni?
ongat yolong babaw kayan, mahato ko yangah la.
english: There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

tay: maha nano ko kayan ti tanox?
nisan masiwat ko walax, niyan witox ro mahato hawngo liyotox oziy la.
english: The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

tay: maha nano ko kayan so kiya hiya?
raho ko bayhoy miyan roni hiya.
english: We're going to have a big storm here.

tay: Balayi ko kayan so kiya hiya?
ho' yo, mahato so raho waitox.ay.
english: Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.

tay: masakinot ko kayan, kapayox hazi' malokos latan.
english: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

tay: na tikay han pawalax kisa la, laxiy yangay maras so tabakoy ki.
english: It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

tay: nisan sababo biso ki, mosa mawalax kisa yo!
english: There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.

tay: minwalax sawni, hani laga masiwat walax la.
english: It just rained, and now it's stopped.

tay: asi ga minwalax la yo,mahozi ko to'iy ki.
english: It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

tay: niya mawaax pi? howaka ka mahozi kwara' ko hi so?
english: Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

tay: ki mawalax tanox, ini kozing aras so tabakoy.
english: It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

tay: tiya kinraho ko bayhoy, maymaw maxayan tonox mo ka sinbahoyan niya.
english: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

tay: tiya kinraho ko witox, maymaw matyabos tonox ka sinbowan niya.
english: The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.

tay: yamngiya kong maras so babiro' la.
english: I forgot to bring my pen.

tay: yamangiya kong maras so oway la.
english: I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

tay: ini kong aras oziy,halay ta mabaziy.
english: I don't have one either, let's go buy one.
Can we go buy a pen?
Well, I still have to buy erasers.

tay: hata mabaziy so ni'on kanama aw?
english: Let's go get breakfast, shall we?

tay: laxan mo, manani kozing sali la.
english: No, I've already eaten at home.

tay: yangan mo i pasakilox ko sabili la.
english: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

tay: yamngiya kong maras so sabili' la.
english: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

tay: nano o pagalagaw ta mani ko sabili mo la.
english: Then let's eat my lunch box together!

tay: nano ko ni'on so aliyan la?
english: What are you having for lunch?

tay: pakani kong so kryaxan na pakaba'an biro.
english: I want a nutritious school lunch.

tay: nano ko ni'on so aliyan la?
english: What are you having for lunch?

tay: niya kozing maras so sabili sawni,pagalawgaw ta mani aliyan ki!
english: I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!

tay: hata i tamapak mari lating aw?
english: Let's go play basketball, shall we?

tay: hata i tamapak mari yakiyo aw?
laxan mo, patayox kong so biro'.

english: Please help me with the broom.
Okay, here's a broomstick for you.

tay: ragi kong magan so i'ing gali aw?
english: Can you help me with the cloth?

tay: niya kong kamagaw, toy iy to Kacaw ramaw iso magan.
english: I'm sweeping the floor, you ask Kacaw to help you.

tay: ma'oraw ko raxayan,haliy i ta'owax tikay.
english: The floor is dirty, go clean it.

tay: awo,hala kong magan so gali' han.
english: Okay, I'll go get the cloth.

tay: ma'oraw ko nyaway hasa,hali i ami'ing tikay.
english: That window is very dirty, go clean it.

tay: na' tikay han,ini mo maso'iy kamagaw hani na.
english: Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.

tay: nano ko patawawan so kisa la?

english: I'm going to see my teacher.

tay: kamaso so miro kisa laga, nano yowaw so la?
english: What do you do after school?

tay: mosa kong gmalo i rawin mo ma'owas.
english: I'm going to sing with my friends.

tay: kamaso miro hiya laga ,nano ko yowaw niya la?
ma'ot kong niyan sali i Maya aw?
english: May I ask if Maya’ is home?
She’s at home, please come in.

tay: ma'ot kong ni, niyan sali i Poyap aw?
ongat sali yo, kiya nano ko yowaw so?
english: She’s not here, what can I do for you?

tay: yotas, kozing ga Maya', gyahiy tikay lihon.
english: Grandpa, I’m Maya’, please open the door.

tay: Poyap, kozing ga Maya', mowah kong hamkani so manaw iso.
english: Puyap, I’m Maya’, I’ve come to play with you.

tay: ho ga! sanon miso la.hazi owah matisan han!
english: Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s chat!

tay: tala'ong, nabo tikay so saha han.
english: Please sit down and have some tea.

tay: tiya~ kinbalay balay bogon ko saha' mamo.
mani'ay ta so baboway ra'iri han!
aw! balayi balay taxan ko baboway ra'iri hani.
balayi ni'on ko baboway ra'iri hani ?
ho yo,balayi balay ni'on ko babaoway hanii.
kamaso pahapoy kabagi'an yaya la,hazi owah mani laki!
english: Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!

tay: aw, hala kong mayma ba han.
english: Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.

tay: kalawkah mani ki, bliy so sa'oli .
english: Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.

tay: payox wayan mo ni'on la, matangi la ki.
english: I ate a lot, I’m full.

tay: kapayox hazi mani, laxiy i abaga yo.
pahari kong la ki, makataxay ta saotox la.
english: I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.

tay: malahangan la, mosa kozing sali la yo.
aw, kiyan la hari so ga, iri mowah matisan sali mo.
english: Okay, come to my house sometime.

tay: lawkah simo kwara ga, rason simo mosa matisan so yayotas na alang ta riyax sawni.
english: Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

tay: yotas, mowah sami matayox iso yo.
english: Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

tay: wa ! ba simo kamayan kayi ta Atayan ki! tiya kinbalay!
lawkah simo kwara' ga,rason simo pasaba'biro' mosa ma'omah so mayah tarakis.
english: Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

tay: owah babako hani kwara,lalongi maras ko babingan so pa'omah ki.
english: Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

tay: owah mabako hani kwara, langlong maras ko babingon so patayowaw mamo ki.
english: Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

tay: aw, pasaba biro, niya sami malas so babingan pa'omah la.
english: Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.

tay: ini tayhok na, towahi na yo.
english: Not yet, it’s still far away.

tay: osa' i magan so koko iso.
english: You go get the bird catcher.
Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

tay: lawkah simo kwara' ga, riyax swani ga mosa ta i libo' na sinanan.
english: Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

tay: tiya kinbalayi yo! pakosa ta nano mosa kiya?
english: Awesome! How are we going to get there?

tay: pgalo ta so galagan kolo bas.
inlay pabako kwara mamo, nama ta mabaziy so kipo han.
english: Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

tay: ti galayng hani ga libo kabahani,ti soro hiya ga sali o',katayox kiya nanak ki .
english: There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

tay: nay'iri, nan osa matayox kabahani iso.
english: It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

tay: otox pasapangan witox la ga,waha ta masatana roni ki .
english: We’ll be back in an hour.

tay: nano ko wayan so taxan sawni?
wayan mo taxan la ko payox na o',ro payox na kabahani.
english: I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.

tay: na kong tikay,mabaytox ko kozih mo la.
english: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

tay: habayaw ko tayan niya malangiya roni.
english: There are a lot of people swimming here.

tay: yazik ko siya hasa hiya, asi ta palangiya roni ga asa la.
english: The water is deep there, so we just swim here.
What kind of car did you take?

tay: ganalo kong so kolo bas mowah yo.

english: How do you go to church?

tay: papiray tarako yaba mo panga kong niya.
moto mahanono mosa barowan karariya hiya?
english: How does he usually go to school?

tay: moto gamalo so to'iy zik mosa barowan hiya.
english: He took the subway to school.

tay: maha nano mosa mabaziy tabihi yaki so?
english: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

tay: moto miray so otobay hiya mosa mabaziy tabihi.
english: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.

tay: pakosa so nano mosa i Laniy?
english: How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

tay: pagalo kong so aso mosa i Laniy.
english: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.

tay: pakosa nano mosa i Laniy hiya?
english: How did he get to Orchid Island?

tay: pagalo so sakoki hiya mosa i Laniy.
english: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

tay: pagalo nano tarako' mosa i Takaw hiya?
english: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

tay: pagalo so haylaw kisiya hiya mosa i Takaw.
english: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

tay: ganalo so kisya mosa Taytong hiya pi?
english: Did he take a train to Taitung?

tay: ho,ganalo so kisiya hiya mosa i Taytong.
english: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

tay: ganalo so kisiya hiya mosa i Taytong pi?
english: Did he take a train to Taitung?

tay: ayat ki, ginalo so sakoki hiya mosa i Taytogn.
english: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

tay: kiyan ko nanan so galagan bas llingay roni aw?
english: Is there a bus stop near here?

tay: kiyan ,pakora so galayng tikay la ga mosa so taxan ko nanan na bas la.
english: Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

tay: ki ti ino ko payang sawbih nanan so to'iy zik roni?
english: Where is the nearest MRT station?

tay: ongat ko galagan na to'iy zik roni hiya,mosa nanak takosi ko ba'on so gamalo ki.
english: There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

tay: gamalo so bas ga katowa so kabasiya ga patayhok i barowan?
english: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

tay: mapo magan ara' pasapagan witox ga patayhok i barowan.
galalo so haylaw kisya ga katowa' bsiya ga patayhok i Tahayton?
english: How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?

tay: otox pasapangan witox la ga patayhok i Tahayton la.
english: I will come to Taichung in an hour.

tay: moto basiya miray so torako mosa i Ulay aw?
english: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

tay: kina so mosa otox pasapangan witox.
mosa katowa basiya ko ganalo so to'iy zik mowah sali mo?
english: How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?

tay: mosa i maposan ara' pasapangan witox.

english: Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

tay: aw, ya'asa ko longan mo oziy.
laxiy, ongat sa'ayong ko ba'on mo.
english: Don't, I don't know much about it.

tay: kiyan hari so i babaw kinryaxan? mowa na mosa kong macisan iso aw?
english: Are you free this afternoon? I'd like to visit you, is that okay?
Okay, I'll wait for you at home.

tay: kiyan hari so sasan aw? mowan na mosa kong maot iso sawon sinpong kayi na Gaga Atayan so ralali.
english: Are you free tomorrow? I'd like to ask you about the legendary story of the [Atayal] tribe.

tay: mosa kozing ragiyax sasan, ayat kong p'aki sali.
english: I'm going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won't be home.

tay: payox ko ba'on so yayowaw Gaga na Atayan sarali , mowa na pa'osay miso tikay aw.
english: I heard that you know a lot about the traditional customs of the Atayal, so I would like to ask you a few questions.

tay: ini kapayox ko bba'on mo ki, sikila talamaw mo so rango samiyok ko pana'ot so.
english: I don't know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

tay: ma'ot kong ga mosa balayi i galan so limo raywan aw? kosa na naki i balayi sabior layla.
english: Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

tay: pa'osay miso tikay pisa ko kayan so la?
rayma wayan so ma'iso pagan masapat kayan mo la.
ini la ki',rayma kong yotas la.
pa'osay miso tikay minkahon so ino?
nakahong kong ti gi alang Mabanan.
pa'osay miso tikay Atayan oziy kanayrin so ga?
ayat yo, hiya ga tayan alang na Poyoma.
ba so kamayan kayi ni nano?
ba kong kamayan kayi na Atayan sqliq ro kayi Atayan sa'oli.
english: I speak [Sykoriak Atayal] and [Zed Oli Atayal].

tay: pa'asonko riyax sawni ka ba kong macisan ki iso la, kayan cikay ko sawon na Gaga aliyap aw?
english: It's a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

tay: aw, moto kong lawkah mosa maliyap ragiyax sako la'li kong na.
english: Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

tay: mahoway so la,tiko pinsaba so sawni ga balayi balay ki.
english: Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

tay: tiko wayan miso saba' hani ga misi so sinbilan kayi na yayotas rarali', ya'ani balay ko pinyowan mo sawni.
english: All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

tay: tayhok roni ko pana'ot miso la,mahoway la pin'azit so pasaba' sawni la.
english: That's all for today's interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

tay: ba'a la, patasala ta sa'otox lawziy ki .
mamawsa kong la ro, sa'otox riyax ga mowa na mowah kong minpong lawziy ka yayowaw sarali lawziy ki.
english: I'm going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.

tay: lawkah so ga,nano ko banason so?
english: Hello, what are you looking for?
I want to buy a cup.

tay: lawkah so ga,nano ko banason so?
english: Hello, what are you looking for?
I want to buy a hat.

tay: pabaziy kong so tako, niya simo matabaziy aw?
english: I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?
Yes, how many do you want to buy?

tay: niya simo tabaziy so pinnang aw?
ongat, ini sami tabaziy na pinnang.
english: No, we don't sell betel nut.
How many packs do you want to buy?
I want to buy sweet potatoes.

tay: wayan so'on tabaziy ko ngahi' hiya la.
english: All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

tay: pabaziy kong so sazing yoyot abora.
english: I want to buy two bottles of oil.

tay: otox yoyot balay hara miyan la.
english: We only have one bottle left.

tay: ragiy kong mosa mabaziy na bato.

english: How many pounds do you want to buy?

tay: mosa pisa tanatin banason so bato?
english: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?
I want to buy two catties.

tay: pabaziy kong so sazing baningan na inow.
english: I want to buy two green onions.

tay: togan baningan hara ko hani, agan kwara la ki!
english: There are three left, all for you!

tay: pisa pila otox yobing bowax hani?
english: How much is this bag of rice?

tay: otox yobing ga sazing kabahon pila.
sa'onon kwara' ga mposan otox pila, noway i maposan pila' laga asa la.
hani ga ma'iso pagan magan pila.
pabaziy kong lawziy tikay, patahaki so otox kabahon pila.
english: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

tay: hiko so yamagan kabahon pila aw?
lawkah sa'ayong hani hiya la, mosa balayi hawiyon tikay aw?
english: It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

tay: ayat ba'on yo, payang mahanok hani la ki.
english: No, this is already very cheap.

tay: galon mo otox yobing pinkan hani.
english: I want this packet of cookies.

tay: pinkan hani ga mtayon pila, pa'agan so yowaw binah na aw?
english: $30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

tay: mosa balayi i kasiyok kong pila so aw?
english: Can I borrow money from you?

tay: yamngiya kong maras so pila la,mosa balayi i kasiyok kong pila so aw?
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

tay: laxiy ,tiko kinsyok so so sarali na pilaini mo naga ini so bi'i na.
english: No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

tay: mosa balayi i kasiyok kong tikay latan so aw?
mosa balayi kasiyok kong biro so aw?
wayan mo pakasiyo ki Lawa la.
pakasyoki kong na lilinsa' so wa?
english: Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

tay: aw, sikila ga wahiy mayi lawziy sasan ki.
english: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

tay: niyan mawalax la, ini kong aras so tabakoy, kasiyoki kong tikay tabakoy aw?
english: It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me one?

tay: otox balay ko tabakoy mo, pagalagaw ta amamok ki!
english: I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

tay: biro hani ga kinsiyok miso so wayan ka sa'otox, pabazih miso la.
english: This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

tay: yahani ko pinkasiyok so kong na biro, ba'anay miso la.
english: This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

tay: ato na samawgan so mataoax nano biro na ga, kayan kong lawziy ki.
english: You can tell me what else you want to read.

tay: kanowan ko awsa mo pabzih pila so la?
english: When do I have to pay you back?

tay: noway iri', kiyan ko lowan so laga pakyalay ta kiya la.
english: It's okay, you can talk about it when you have money.

tay: kanowan ko 'owah so pabazih pila mo la?
english: When are you going to pay me back?

tay: wahay mo mayi sasan ko pila so.
english: I will return it to you tomorrow.

tay: kanowan ko 'owah so pabazih biro mo la?
english: When are you going to return my book?

tay: ayat miso wayan sabay so sahaysa ko biro so la pi?
english: Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

tay: ti ko babiro' hani ga pinkasyok so ni Masaw pi?
english: Did Masaw lend you this pen?

tay: ho, kinsiyok mo ki hiya so sawni.
english: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

tay: kinsoyok so ki Maray ko inpit hani pi?
english: Did you borrow this pen from Maray?
No, this is what mom bought.

tay: ongat ko Tamoyox la,osa kasyok tamoyox ki Sayon.
english: We are out of salt, let's borrow some from Sayun.

tay: hali kamayan i Poyap maha psogi pila mo la.
english: Go tell Puyap to give me my money back.

tay: haliy kamayan i Poyap maha pasiyogi ko pila mo.
english: Go tell Puyap to give me my money back.

tay: pisa ko kohay niya pila ki iso pi?
english: How much does she owe you?

tay: mosa kong mohi tabihi' i ra'iri'.
english: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

tay: payox sa'ayon ka'amam la, niyan kong i samriyat ka'amam, kisa laga pasiyan mo siya' la.
english: There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

tay: ragiy kong tikay magan so sawki ro karoh aw?
english: Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?

tay: ki mo siyon i bih na Kawin.
english: Put it next to the plow rake.
Did you turn over the soil?

tay: nisan mo i tanabon, pagahap kong kisa la.
english: I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

tay: ba'on kamiyot ko panohiy so na tabihi' la?
english: Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

tay: mosa ba'on kamiyot ko tamana hani hiya la,sina ti ki hasa hiya ga ayat ba'on kamiyot na.
english: The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

tay: waw! tiya kinpayox kanowih so na ngahi'.
english: (sighs) Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

tay: ragiy kong pinta' i kaho aw?
english: Will you help me with the barn?

tay: niya sami pawsa ttara' so siyox.
english: We're releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

tay: payox siyo lako niyan i posong hani la.
english: The fish basket has been full of fish.

tay: moto so maha nano kamayap so siyox karariyax?
english: How do you usually catch fish?

tay: moto mo sabing so tawnox samabo so siyox.
english: I shoot fish with a spear.

tay: moto so sabing bahawni mosa i maliyap aw?
english: Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

tay: moto kong pawsa so ta'oya' tiri' mo sino, karoma' ga moto kong maras so patos ro hozin mosa maliyap.
english: I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.

tay: to'iy hani ga anwahan na waywak nahi.
english: This is the road the boar took.

tay: hani ga pilong kozih na waywak nahi', misa so to'i hakayan na waywak nahi' ko hani.
english: These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

tay: tanahaw ta mosa matayox ko ta'oya ta ,asi ga niyan tari'on so asino la.
english: Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

tay: asi ga wayan sawkan na hozin ko bawyas niya la .hazi ta mosa gamalo kiya.
english: The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.

tay: nano ko niya so sakalayi so yowaw hani?
hani ga ta'oya na marahan, moto i tm'atom so awlit.
english: This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.

tay: nano ko niyan so sakowan sa yowaw ti hasa hiya?
english: What is that thing you put there?

tay: hasa ga ta'oya na tiri so kozih, moto miyan tiri so para.
english: It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

tay: mahoway ko liyotox binkis ka mayi so awyat, kiyan ko bani'an ta niya asino so sawni.
english: Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

tay: ho' bayay la, rasaw ta inbalayi amalo' alang ta la ki!
english: Yeah! Let's take it back to the tribe and share it!

tay: ho balay la, rasaw ta inbalayi amaso i alang ta ki!
english: Yeah! Let's take it back to the tribe and share it!

tay: pasaba'an sami kwara ni pasaba biro sawni ga, nano sawon kayi Atayan ko lalahoy hiya.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of plants in Tayal language today.

tay: hasa ga latan ni Watan pi?
ayat, hani ga oba ni Poyap.
pasaba biro, ini kong aras biro.
english: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.

tay: pagalo matayox ki bih so galo miro.
english: Share the book with your classmate next to you.

tay: wayan mayowaw ko i'ing mo la.

english: I will lend you my eraser.

tay: kamaso ta miro la, pinbaga to'iy mosa so sali ki!
english: It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

tay: kamaso ta miro la, masagaya ta kwara la.
english: The class is over, goodbye everyone.

tay: lawkah simo kwara, lalo mo ga Bayso.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Baysu.

tay: lawkah simo kwara, lalo mo ga Toyaw.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Tuyaw.

tay: lawkah so Laysa, kozing ga Kagi.
Boya lawkah so, kozing ga Payan.
kozing ga yaya ni Pisoy, kozing ga Sayon.
kozing ga saway kanayrin ni Yopas, lalo mo ga Kagaw.
english: I am Yupas’s sister. My name is Kagaw.

tay: hiya ga pasaba biro mo, hiya ga Yomin.
hiya ga basoyan mo tamalong, hiya ga Yoraw.
nano lalo ni basoyan so kanayrin?
english: What is your elder sister’s name?

tay: Komo ko lalo ni basoyan mo kanayrin.
english: My elder sister’s name is Kumu.

tay: ima lalo ni saway so kanayrin?
english: What is your younger sister’s name?

tay: Pisoy lalo ni saway mo kanayrin.
english: My younger sister’s name is Pisuy.

tay: pisa kayan ni basoyan so tamalong?
english: How old is your elder brother?

tay: pisa kayan ni saway so tamalong?
english: How old is your younger brother?

tay: kiya pakaba'an biro i alang mamo?
english: Do you have schools in your community?

tay: niya so miro sako pakaba'an biro i alang so?
english: Do you study in your tribe’s school?

tay: how ga, isi sami ga otox so sali miro i pakaba'an biro.
english: Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

tay: nano ki patawawan ni yaya so?
nono ki patawawan ni yaba so?
ayat, hiya ga rawin ni saway mo tamalong.
english: No, he is my younger brother’s friend.

tay: ayat, hiya ga saway mo kanayrin.
english: No, she is my younger sister.

tay: pisa kwara hi ko sali naha?
english: How many people in their family?

tay: magan hi kwara ko sali naha.
english: There are five people in their family.
How many children in your family?

tay: payat kwara ko la'i sali miyan.
english: There are four children in our family.
How many younger siblings do you have?

tay: ongat saway mo tamalong, kiyan togan ko saway mo kanayrin.
english: I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.
How many older siblings do you have?
I don’t have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?

tay: how, hiya ga basoyan mo tamalong.
masakinot kayan yo, kapayox manabow siya kilox.
english: It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

tay: makilox kayan yo, kapayox manabow siya.
english: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

tay: raho witox niya, longiy ko tasasi so kilox ki.
english: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

tay: payox yolong niya, ongat witox ko babaw kayan.
english: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

tay: mosa ongat witox sasan, payox yolong ro raho ko bayhoy.
english: It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.
How was the weather that day?

tay: masakinot riyax hani, palokos so zibon mahatow so tanox.
english: It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.

tay: mosa maha nano kayan hangi'an riyax?
english: How’s the weather on the weekend?
It will be sunny on the weekend.
Will it be rainy that day?

tay: balay kayan ko riyax kasa, ayat pawalax.
english: It will have no rain and be sunny that day.
Will it be rainy that day?
Yes, it will be rainy that day.

tay: masiwat la, niya mahato ko witox la.
english: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

tay: mawalax la, ini kong aras so tabakoy.
english: It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

tay: ini walax miso sawni la, babaw kinriyax la ga mosa mawalax, mahato so tanox ga aras so tabakoy.
english: It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

tay: babaw otox kayan ga mosa sakinot ko amisan aw?
english: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

tay: how, babaw otox kayan amisan ga mosa sakinot, kapayox malokos so latan.
english: Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

tay: miso kayan i abagan hani ga mosa makilox aw?
english: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

tay: ho, mosa makilox ko abagan, kapayox manabow so siya.
english: Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

tay: balay so kayan tamangaw abaw aw?
sagalan mo kayan tamangaw abaw, mali ko kayan niya.
english: I like spring because the weather is warm.

tay: sagalan so kayan masaho abaw aw?
ini mo sagaliy kayan masaho abaw, moto payox rahoyan niya.
english: I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.
I forgot to bring the textbook.
I will share it with you.
I forgot to bring the eraser.
Do you forget to bring your pen?
Yes, can you lend me a pen?
What would you like for lunch?
What would you like for dinner?
What did you have for breakfast?
What did you have for lunch?

tay: osa nama iso halay miso hamkani kisa.
english: You go first and I will catch up later.

tay: laxan mo, halay ta hamakot so biro han.
english: No, we have to carry books first.

tay: ini na, niya kong amowax so piyato na.
english: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

tay: howa so ka ini payma ba?
english: Why didn’t you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.

tay: nano ko niya so patayagon sawni?
english: What were you doing just now?

tay: mosa kong hamkani i pasaba biro.
english: I went to meet the teacher.

tay: kamaso so kabaga biro la ga nano ko yowaw so la?
english: What are you going to do after school?

tay: kamaso miro la ga nano ko yowaw niya la?
english: What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

tay: ongat sali Yoma yo! kozing ga Kagaw nano ko yowaw so pi? mowah Yoma la ga kiyalaw mo la.
english: Yuma is not at home. I am Kawgaw. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

tay: yaki, sami ga Yoma ki Iwan, ragiy sami gamiyah so lihon!
english: Grandma, we are Yuma and Iwan, please open the door for us.

tay: kozing ga Boya, mowah kong hamkani i Pihaw ki.
english: I am Buya, I am here for Pihaw.

tay: basiya so ini owah la, sanon miso balay la.
english: You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

tay: Laway, mowah kong hamkani iso manaw.
english: Laway, I am here to play with you.

tay: haziy owah sahoy, basiya miso nawon la.
english: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

tay: haniy ga panohiy mo na ngahi, kani tikay han!
english: This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!
The sweet potato is so sweet.

tay: inah! haniy ga panohiy mo na baboway, kani tilay moriy.
english: Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

tay: tala'ong, hani ga panohiy mo na tiyay kani tikay moriy!
english: Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

tay: om! sabing balay ko tiyay hani.
english: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

tay: ini kong kani so yotak, mani kong so ringo la ga asa la.
english: I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.

tay: pata kong so baboway ro kani ki.
english: Let me peel the fruit for you.

tay: mahoway so, payox bow niya ko baboway hani.
english: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

tay: bi'ay miso so siya nabow ki.
english: I will bring you some water.

tay: kapayox tikay mani, payox ko tanahok mo na rami.
english: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

tay: om! balayi balay sawkan ro balay ni'on oziy.
english: Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

tay: kapayox mani, payox niya hani na.
english: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.
I’ll make myself at home then.

tay: kapayox mani, payox niya hani na.
english: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

tay: payox waya mo ni'on la, ayat kong pakani la.
english: I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

tay: rason simo pasaba biro mosa i ragiyax riyax sawni.
english: I will take you to the mountains today.

tay: kamayan ko yaya maha o payox potot i ragiyax.
english: Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

tay: rason simo pasaba biro mosa i sala riyax sawni.
english: I will take you to the fields.

tay: mosa ta i tamabon oraw aw?
english: Are we going to loosen the soil?

tay: rason ta ni pasaba biro mosa i siyaw gawng.
english: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

tay: rason ta ni pasaba biro mosa i ragiyax.
english: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

tay: mosa ta siyaw gawng riyax sawni aw?
english: Are we going to the riverside today?

tay: ayat, rason ta ni pasaba biro mosa i ragiyax.
english: No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.

tay: mosa ta ragiyax riyax sawni aw?
english: Are we going to the mountains today?

tay: ayat, mosa ta i sala riyax sawni.
english: No, we are going to the fields.

tay: pasaba biro, nano ko halan ta matayox siyaw gawng?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

tay: pasaba biro, nano ko halan ta matayox i ragiyax?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.

tay: nano ko halan ta matayowaw i sala?
english: What are we going to do in the fields?

tay: mosa ta matayox panohiy ta tiyay i sala, pinbaga na tahiy ro banga ki!
english: We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

tay: pasaba biro, mosa ta malangiya siyaw gawng aw?
english: Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

tay: ayat, mosa ta matayox na layngon.
english: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

tay: pasaba biro, mosa ta mohiy tabihi sala aw?
english: Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

tay: mosa ta tamabon oraw riyax sawni.
english: We are going to loosen the soil today.

tay: nanak sawni ko mintayox kong so mayanox na layngon.
english: Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

tay: kiyan piray ko niya palaka kiya.
ye! wa! sagalan mo balay ko piray, tiya kinbaytonox.
english: Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

tay: kiyan piray ko niya palaka kiya.
ayat piray ko hasa, hasa ga banga.
english: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

tay: yangay ti roni, ka'osa twahiy sa'ayong ki!
english: Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

tay: aw, ayat sami mosa twahiy sa'ayong.
english: Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

tay: laxiy i pazinah, tahoway hamakay ba'a so matakoy.
english: Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.

tay: maha kong naki mo yanga taxan.
english: I want to see them right away.

tay: pakosa so nano mosa i takak?
english: How do you go to the block-house?
How does he go to the hospital?
How do you go to Penghu?

tay: pagalow kong kolo palaka mosa Pongxo.
english: I go to Penghu by plane.
How do you go to Penghu?
I go to Penghu by boat.

tay: nano galagan so mowah sali la?
pgalow kong kisya zik mosa sali.
Kagaw pagalow so nano mosa i pakaba'an biro?
english: How does Kagaw go to school?

tay: pagalow kisya Kagaw mosa pakaba'an biro.
english: Kagaw goes to school by train.

tay: Soyan pagalow so nano mosa i kyokay?
english: How does Suyan go to church?

tay: pagalow na lilinsya Soyan mosa kyokay.
english: Suyan goes to church by bicycle.

tay: pagalow so kisya zik mosa miro aw?
english: Do you go to school by MRT?

tay: ayat, pagalow kong bas mosa miro.
english: No, I go to school by bus.

tay: pagalow so lilinsya mosa miro aw?
english: Do you go to school by bicycle?

tay: ho, pagalow kong lilinsya mosa miro.
english: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

tay: pagalow so kisya haylaw mosa Takaw aw?
english: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

tay: ho, pagalow kong kisya haylaw mosa Takaw.
english: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

tay: mosa so i Taytong ga pagalow so kisya ini ga pagalow so kolo palaka?
english: Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

tay: malow kong kolo palaka hiya ga, yanga so malow na kisya hiya.
english: I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

tay: mosa so Kyokay ga pagalow so bas ka papiray so torako?
english: Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

tay: miray kong torako mosa Kyokay hiya ga, yanga so sagalow bas hiya.
english: I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

tay: katowa sawbih ki raho banasan ko sali so?
english: Is the market close to your house?

tay: ini kasawbih, moto kong gamalow so otobay mosa raho banasan.
english: No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

tay: kasawbih kaba'an biro ko sasatowan so biro aw?
english: Is the post office close to the school?

tay: sawbih ay, hamakay la ga tayhok la.
english: Yes, it is within walking distance.

tay: sawbih ki nani'an ko nanan bas aw?
english: Is the restaurant close to the station?

tay: mahato so nanan ro hamakay tikay la ga tayhok la.
english: It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

tay: mowa ni mosa kong matisan iso.
english: I would like to visit you.

tay: kiyan yayowaw mo sawni ini kong akiy sali, sa'oto la ki.
english: I am out today. How about another day?

tay: kiyan hariy so sasan aw? halay miso hamkaniy babaw kinriyax.
english: Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.
Sure, I will wait for you at home.

tay: ma'ot kong maha mosa balay i galay miso so kay aw? galan mo so sasako na babiro.
english: Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.

tay: mosa balay magan kong so limo aw?
english: Would you mind if I do the video recording?

tay: ya'ih ko sinrakiyasan mo. ini mo tarayoy oziy ko tawbong mo, lahiy ki.
english: No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.

tay: nano o pasingiy la ga asa la.
english: Then I will just take photos.

tay: mahaway so amalo so so pana'ot.
english: Thank you for accepting the interview.

tay: ongat ya'ih niya, nano ko sapa'ot so ga pa'ot.
english: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

tay: ma'ot kong so nano ko yayaowa so sako la'i so?
english: What do you do when you are young?

tay: salali ga minkong kinsat, hani la ga malax kong la.
english: I was a police officer but I am retired now.

tay: nano o miso hani ga kiyan ki so pamahon aw?
english: Then, are you working at the moment?

tay: niya kong i ma'omah yowaw pakaba'an biro.
niya kong ma'ot maha o niya maki alang ko lala'i so aw?
english: Do your kids live in the tribe too?

tay: ini, niya maki i owis kwara lala'i mo.
english: No, my kids are all living in the city.

tay: aw so i otox nanak hi maki sali la?
english: Then, do you live by yourself?

tay: kiyan otox hozin ro otox kabahani mo. otox mo sali laha oziy.
english: I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

tay: kiyan otox ngiyaw mo oziy, kiya ko yanox psabays ga ini ka'ilang.
english: I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

tay: mowa na ma'ot kong tikay kosa na gaga pasani na maliyap.
english: I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

tay: ini kapayox ko ba'on mo, siki la kiya la ba'on mo ga nano syokaw miso.
english: I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

tay: kiya la sawon pasani ko babing mamo so ya'aya na aliyap aw?
english: Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

tay: moto ini babingiy na kanayrin ko ya'aya aliyap miyan hani ki.
english: Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

tay: nano o moto balay sarason maliyap ko kanayrin aw?
english: Then, can women go hunting together?

tay: ya'ih, moto ini osa maliyap ko kanayrin hiya.
english: No, women cannot go hunting either.

tay: Yopas, ongat owaw micyo sali la, osa mabaziy owaw micyo.
english: Yupas, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

tay: kiya otox yoyot ki i pahapoyan, ka baziy la.
english: There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

tay: ini katana otox yoyot, osa mabaziy lawziy so sazing yoyot han.
english: One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

tay: pabaziy kong so owaw miyo, niya simo tabaziy aw?
english: I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

tay: kiyan ay! mosa pisa ko banason so?
english: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

tay: pabaziy kong so sazing yoyot, ro pabaziy kong lawziy so otox yobing bowax.
english: I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

tay: niya haniy ko bawax, kiyan ko banason so na aw?
english: Here is the rice, what else do you need?

tay: pabaziy kong so bato na, kiyan simo aw?
english: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

tay: wayan miyan maso'on tabaziy lako bato la.

english: I want to buy some clothes.

tay: mosa maha nano ko kakosa niya pi?
english: What kind of clothes do you like?

tay: pabaziy kong so ra'atong ozit na latan.
english: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

tay: maha nano ko matanah haniy hiya ?
kiyan ko natas binah iro na aw?
kiyan ko iro pala'ow ro masingaw iro miyan na.
english: We have white and blue ones too.

tay: bi'iy kong so otox na masingaw iro latan.
english: Please give me the clothes in blue.

tay: Yomin manowah so ino sawni? nowah so mayoy ?
english: Yumin, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

tay: ayat, manowah kong ramaw tabaziy tabihiy ni yaki mo .
english: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

tay: han , kiyan hari so malahangan aw ? mowah so gamalo kozing maso'on kagabiy aw!
english: No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

tay: ayat yo , mosa kozing mabaziy so latan.
english: No, I want to buy some clothes.

tay: nano o, hala kong gamalow iso.
english: Then, I will go with you.

tay: lawkah so ga, pa'osay miso pisa pila ko otox bahon tabihi hani?
english: Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

tay: otox bahon tabihi hani ga maposan pila.
english: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?

tay: otox tanatin ngahi hani ga matayon pila.
english: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

tay: bi'iy kong so sazing bahon tabihi ro otox tanatin ngahi.
english: Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

tay: Pito, yangan mo maras inpit, mosa so pakasiyok kozing aw?
english: Pitu, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

tay: ongat kong oziy, hani ga mara ni Payan.
english: I don’t have one either. This is Payan’s.

tay: nano kasyokay ta tikay han aw? yanga miso bi'an.
english: Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

tay: mahoway so, mahoway so kosa Payan oziy ki.
english: Thank you and thank Payan for me.

tay: mowah kong pabaziy sazing biro haniy.
english: I want to return these two books.

tay: aw ki, nano lawziy ko galon so?
english: No problem and what else do you need?
I would like to borrow these three books.

tay: asa la. longi so togan riyax laga wahiy may la ki.
english: Sure and remember to return them after three days.

tay: ini so bi'iy kong ko i'ing mo na.
english: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

tay: wayan miso bi'an sako sahaysa la
nano howa ka ini loy ko i'ing mo la.
english: Then, why is my eraser missing?

tay: ini so wayan pakasyoki ni Yayot pi.
english: Did you lend it to Yayut?

tay: ini mo ba'iy, halay mo ma'ot hiya.
english: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

tay: namaw miso kasiyok ko i'ing mo han.
english: I will lend you my eraser first.

tay: Siwat, kinsyokan so ki Bayso ko latan haniy?
english: Siwat, did Siwat lend you this coat?

tay: ayat, hani ga banaziy kong ni yaya mo ki.
english: No, my mom bought it for me.

tay: matana ki iso ko latan oba ni Watan.
english: Watan’s coat is the same as yours.

tay: oba niya ga makalox irow hiya, ini patana ki sami ko irow niya.
english: His coat is black, so our colors are different.

tay: Simoy, kinsiyok so pila ni Tahos aw?
english: Simuy, did you borrow money from Tahus?

tay: ho, naki sawni ko awsa mo may hiya, yangan mo maras so pila la.
english: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

tay: nano o kanowaw ko osa so pabazih hiya ?
english: Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.
Okay, I will tell Okay, I will tell for you. for you.

tay: awlit ga isi ki ta'oya so marahan ta'atom, pakohiy ga isi ki talangan so tiri awlo, ya'ani ko ini patakari.
english: It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

tay: nano o pasaba'ay miso sazing taya'an ro sawon nano pawsa so ta'oya.
english: Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

tay: aw ro! ya'asa balay! ya'ani la ga soro niya mosa kong tiri so sinow oziy la.
english: Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

tay: royox ko ka'aman sala la, haliy magan ki kaho na sawki, hala ta i sala.
english: The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

tay: ki siyaw na kaho ko loko , mayop so kaho laga taxan so la.
english: It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

tay: pinbaga magan, laxiy agan pangih, hingo ko sawki.
english: Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

tay: laxiy i pa'aliy ko ta'oya mo ki!
ki i yaho na kahawni hasa ko ta'oya mo.
english: My trap is under that tree.

tay: niyan mo siyon so toring, ko roni , ba'on mo kiy ino ko ta'oya mo.
english: I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

tay: hani ga sagoyo, sagoyo miyan siyox i siyaw na gawng.
english: This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

tay: ongat ko sagoyo miyan hasa hiya, moto sami isi panayp magan siyox.
english: We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

tay: ayat kong nabing so bawli nayp na, pasaba'iy kong saotox aw?
english: I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

tay: aw yo ! pagalow ta sa'otox mosa panayp
english: Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

tay: nano o pasaba'ay miso tamoni so sagoyo sa'otox.
english: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

tay: niya maha tari tari ko nayp so la, ini ka niya tiri so siyox, haziy i haliy pasakalo.
english: Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

tay: na tikay, maylay sa'ayong ko aso, niya kong ti hani pasakalow nayp, haliy kong ramaw magan so tahong aras roni . aw
english: Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

tay: sakalagiy iso ko siyox pakora ki kozing, ragay miso pasakalo.
english: Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

tay: tiya kinbalay! payox ko anagan ta , sapon siyax kwara ko yawa la.
english: Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

tay: tila la, halay ta amaso kwara galow ta.
english: Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

tay: laxiy gnaw la, ihiy tl'ong tlngan.
english: Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

tay: soni ga te magan ryax, sasan ga phngi, hata mglow mosa mgnaw.
english: It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!
Great! Let’s go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

tay: sasan ga te togan ryax, hata tmpak mari 'lyan sasan ki!
english: Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!
What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

tay: sasan ga ryax rehay, pglow kong yaya mosa kyokay.
english: Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.
I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

tay: psba biro, mxayan nbowas mo, mosa kong pstiyan.
english: Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.
May I go wash my hands?

tay: sobih ta phngi la, naga cikay ro osa la.
english: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

tay: psba biro, mxayan balay tonox mo, phngi kong 'lyan.
english: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.
Okay, take care and go home.

tay: psba biro, babaw rehay te otox ryax ga phngi kong, mmosa kong ptayox koysang.
english: Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.
She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

tay: psba biro mxayan olo ni Hayong, phngi hiya kisa.
english: Teacher, Hayung has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

tay: lalo mo ga Walis Pihaw, mpow kayan mo la.
english: My name is Walis Pihaw, and I’m 10 years old.
What ethnic group are you from?
Are all your family members indigenous?

tay: ho, Tayan sami kwara otox sali.
english: Yes, my whole family is Atayal.
Are all your family members indigenous?

tay: 'yat, yaba mo ga Tayan, yaya mo ga seho.
english: No, my father is Atayal, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

tay: hiya ga yaba so? pisa kayan nya la?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

tay: ho, hiya ga yaba mo, mt'yo pgan kayan nya la.
hasa ga yaba so? pisa kayan nya la?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

tay: 'yat, hiya ga nbkis alang myan, mspat pgan kayan nya la.
english: No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

tay: pisa kayan bsoyan so tmalong la?
mpow mspat kayan bsoyan mo tmalong la.
twahiy hinnari kayan mamo ki bsoyan so tmalong?
english: Is your brother much older than you?

tay: bsya ta ini pktayox la, wayan so tmwang kinwawai lrwa?
english: I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

tay: ho yo, kbhon mtyon kongbon kinwawi mo la.
ini ay, tkari so tayox la.
ini ki, wayan kong kthoy la.
ho, mtyon kongcin kong miso soni la.
mmosa kong ptyawgan psba biro hkangi psba biro.
english: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.
He’s going to throw away the trash.

tay: ki pitong plngyan, mmosa pspong mlngya kisa ko hiya.
english: He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

tay: ki ino ko Tapas? mmosa pspong mzinah kisa ko hiya.
english: Where is Tapas? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.
She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.
Let’s go to the playground together.

tay: hala kong mbaziy kryaxon mo han, halay miso hkangi kisa.
english: I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.

tay: hata mglow lmeli magan bento ki!
english: Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

tay: hkangi binah, mmosa kong hkangi psba biro.
english: You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

tay: mmosa pspong tmoting rmoro mari ko Lahoy kisa?
english: Is Kacaw competing in croquet today?
No, he’s competing in high jump.

tay: ryax na onrokay ga mosa so pspong?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

tay: ryax na onrokay ga mmosa so pspong?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

tay: mosa kong pspong tmoting rmoro mari.

english: What will we do in the sports day?

tay: pspong ta mglow hmoloy kthoy snyow.
english: We will compete in tug of war.

tay: mmosa ta tbaziy nni'on i onrokay?
english: Will we sell food at the sports day?

tay: cyakin lokah so, iso wayan magan pyang gleng!
english: Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!
Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

tay: ongat, nisan wayan tetanox, mmwah sali gbyan.
english: No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

tay: Temo ga, bsya ini txiy la, lokah so ga?
english: It’s Temu. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

tay: lokah ay! mowah kong mcisan iso.
english: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

tay: ki pksyos rami toboy, halay mo smoy.
english: He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

tay: wayan kmyap wilong sko libo wilong ko hiya la.
english: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

tay: ini kaki sali yotas mamo, ki mki s'la, kki sali mnaga hiya.
english: Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

tay: bsya ta ini pktayox, raho ro wawi so la.
english: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

tay: txan mo niyan so ga m'as balay inlongan mo.
english: It’s so good to see you.

tay: phngaran hani ga bbay simo , posa sahoy tenpinsyang.
english: Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

tay: bsya so ini owah, kyalaw mo kwara pglow ta mlaw mani.
english: It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

tay: noway la, 'si ta nbo s'ha, hata mpcisan n_gan lpiyong.
english: No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

tay: mhoway innagan so, mmosa kong sali la.
english: Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

tay: nisan bowakon ko wilong hani, rasi sali thhway mani.
english: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

tay: babaw kinryax sasan ga, pktayox ta aw?
english: Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

tay: pktayox ta pkba'an biro aw? nki ta galan syasing beromo.
english: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

tay: nano hata pslyan, pklatan kong latan Tayan.
english: Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

tay: memaw blay txan kwara kaka na sakora alang myan. mkaka lga wahi kong mcisan!
english: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

tay: aw n_gon tmango abaw na, bsya s'yong la.
english: That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?
Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

tay: howa so ka pbinah alang myanox?
english: May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.

tay: howa so ini 'ki heci psba biro?
english: Why not teach in the city?

tay: ye'igi snon mo alang mo, ro nki kong mowah smyok rmaw alang ozi.
english: Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

tay: ba so balay tminon, ima cinba iso?
english: You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

tay: yaki mo, hiya ga pyang ba tminon alang myan.
english: It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

tay: howa so ka nki smogan mkbaga tminon?
english: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

tay: tminon ga gaga ta, lngalong kong maha mosa pslohing gaga.
english: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

tay: cyakin lay nobon balay owaw tayan.

english: You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

tay: ini, kyala otox rehay lga blay la. sbihan tmahok ko rhkay ro bowax han, twangan posa kona ro nble'on p'imaw lga blay t'zyon sahoy hlaman la.
english: No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

tay: meloh ro ino tayan, pinmohi mo nanak.
english: I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

tay: bnason mo sazing hani ga pisa pila?
sgalan mo latan hani, pisa pila?
english: I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

tay: lokah s'yong la, ya'ih khnok cikay?
english: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

tay: 'yat ki, mhoy lga mosa kong akazi la.
english: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

tay: aw la! bnasaw mo otox mkaloh latan.
english: Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

tay: bnason mo kot hani ro tapa hani.
english: I want this knife and this pot.

tay: sazing syan kwara, kinblay mo nanak, ana bsya ga 'yat phiri.
english: It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

tay: niya mo rason rawin mo mowah mbaziy , blay khnok cikay?
english: I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

tay: aw la! khoy mo mposan posn.
english: Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

tay: owah tayox cikay! ana latan bosi ga kyan.
english: Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

tay: otox latan ga togan kbhon mziman, togan latan lga otox syan.
english: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

tay: pbaziy kong otox nanak, ita ko g'anos.
english: I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

tay: lokah so, pbaziy kong somon ro lnlogan ma'aw na syam.
english: Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

tay: ongat somon hiya la, kyan ko plgan tana na kona, pbaziy so?
english: The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

tay: aw la, bi'iy kong otox, waha kong s'otox mbaziy ko somon hiya la.
english: Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

tay: aw skoyaw mo na kapa, hani ga mziman.
english: Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.

tay: lokah simo kwara', t'ringa ta' la.
lokah simo kwara'. kira' ga, psbaqan simo ni sinsi maha nano' son na 'Tayal qo nniqon.
english: Hello everyone. Today I am going to teach you how to say food in Thai.

tay: lawkah simo kwara'. kira' ga, psbaqan simo ni sinsi maha nano' sawn na 'Tayal qo nniqon.
english: Hello everyone. Today I am going to teach you how to say food in Thai.

tay: baqon so' mong ke' ni sinsi?
english: Do you understand what the teacher says?

tay: baqon so' mong kay' ni sinsi?
english: Do you understand what the teacher says?

tay: sinsi, ini' mako' baqi mong. kayal lozi minxal ko?
english: I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

tay: sinsi, ini' mako' baqi mong. kazyal lawzi minxal ma'?
english: I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

tay: ini' mako' pongi, pkraho' cikay hngzyang so' ko?
english: I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

tay: ini' mako' pawngi, pkraho' cikay hngzyang so' ma'?
english: I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

tay: ini' mako' pongi, pkhngzyang cikay ke' so' ko?
english: I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

tay: ini' mako' pawngi, pkhngzyang cikay kay' so' ma'?
english: I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

tay: kita' sqani! glo kozing lmpow minxal.
english: Look here, please! Repeat after me.
Read it again. Please speak louder.
Read it again. Please speak louder.

tay: sinsi, zmongi' sako' maras inpit la.
english: I forgot to bring my pen.

tay: sinsi, zmongi' sako' maras ssom la.
english: I forgot to bring my eraser.

tay: sinsi, zmongi' sako' maras ssawm la.
english: I forgot to bring my eraser.

tay: ksyogi cikay qo ssom ni rogak ka cyox bih so'.
english: Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

tay: ksyogi cikay qo ssawm ni rogak ka cyox bih so'.
english: Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

tay: nway mocing sqani qo pinqbaqan ta' soni', mkta ta' babaw rihay la.
english: We’ll go up here and see you next week.

tay: nway mocing sqani qo pinqbaqan ta' sawni', mkta ta' babaw rihay la.
english: Class dismissed, see you next week.

tay: kon ga, 'laqi' ni Yokan. Maray lalo' mako'.
english: I am Yukan’s son, and my name is Maray.

tay: kon ga pinsbaqan ni Yokan. Maray lalo' mako'.
english: I am a student of Yukan, my name is Maray.

tay: ima' qo lalo' ni yaba' so'?
lalo' ni yaba' mako' ga, Yokan.
hya' ga, qbsozyan mako'. lalo' nya' ga, Takon.
english: He’s my brother, his name is Takun.

tay: hya' ga, rangi' mako', lalo' nya' ga, Amoy.
english: She’s my friend, her name is Amuy.

tay: pira' kawas ni yaba' so' la?
mzimal kawas ni yaba' mako' la.

english: How many brothers and sisters do you have?
How many brothers and sisters do you have?

tay: sazing qbsozyan mako', qotox sswe' mako'.
english: I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

tay: sazing qbsozyan mako', qotox ssgway' mako'.
english: I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

tay: pira' hi' kwara' qotox so' ngasal.
english: How many people are in your family?

tay: spayat hi' kwara' qotox mako' ngasal.
english: There are four of us in our family.

tay: nano' cyox pcyowagon ni mama' so'?
english: What does your uncle do for a living?

tay: cyox molo pcyowagon qo qbsozyan so' kneril?
english: Does your sister have a job?

tay: cyox molo pcyowagon qo qbsozyan so' knayril?
english: Does your sister have a job?

tay: cyox mtzyowaw byo'ing qo qbsozyan mako' kneril.
cyox mtzyowaw byo'ing qo qbsozyan mako' knayril.
aw. wagiq sami kwara' myan qotox ngasal.
english: Yes, we are all very tall.

tay: cyox mqwas biro' sswe' so' kneril la?
english: Does your sister go to school?

tay: cyox mqwas biro' saysgway' so' knayril la?
english: Does your sister go to school?

tay: baq kmal ke' na 'Tayal qo sswe' so'?
english: Do your siblings speak the language?

tay: baq kmal kay' na 'Tayal qo saysgway' so'?
english: Do your siblings speak the language?

tay: aw ay. baq kmal kwara' nha'.
english: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.

tay: aw ay. baq kmal kwara' naha'.
english: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.
I have three brothers and sisters.

tay: cyox simo mglow maki' ki yaba' yaya' so'?
english: Do you live with your parents?

tay: aw. mglow sami maki' ki yaba' yaya' mako'.
english: Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

tay: cyox simo mglow maki' ki yotas yaki' so'?
english: Do you live with your grandparents?
No, I didn’t live with them.

tay: mglow sami maki' ki yaba', yaya' ro qbsozyan mako' mlikoy.
english: I live with my father, mother and brother.

tay: knwan ga, mosa' so' qalang so'?
english: When are you going back to the tribe?

tay: knwan ga, mawsa' so' qalang so'?
english: When are you going back to the tribe?
I will go back in the summer.

tay: mhtow wagi' la, mkilox balay qo kayal.
english: The sun is coming out, it’s very hot.
It’s cold, so wear more clothes.

tay: ini' kghzyaq ro ini' kkilox kayal soni', blaq qsliq.
english: It’s neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

tay: ini' kghzyaq ro ini' kkilox kayal sawni', blaq qsliq.
english: It’s neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

tay: ongat yolong babaw kayal mhtow bingah la.
english: There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

tay: mnisan mswat, smbo' wagi' la, kya hawngo' otox la.
english: The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

tay: mnisan mswat, smbo' wagi' la, kya hawngo' 'lyotox la.
english: The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

tay: nyox sn'yal behoy nya' te sami.
english: We’re going to have a big storm here.

tay: nyox sn'yal bayhoy nya' tay sami.
english: We’re going to have a big storm here.
Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.
I have to go to school.
The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

tay: pqwalax hazi' kira', laxi zyongi' maras roko'.
english: It’s going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

tay: minsbiso soni' si baqi sa pqwalax kira'.
english: There was thunder just now, and it’s supposed to rain later.

tay: minsbiso sawni', si baqi sa pqwalax kira'.
english: There was thunder just now, and it’s supposed to rain later.
It just rained, and now it’s stopped.
It just rained, and now it’s stopped.

tay: hazi' minqwalax la, nyox si khozyaq qo toqi.
english: It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

tay: mqwalax pi? swa' so' nyox si qrqaros?
english: Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

tay: mqwalax ay. izyat sako' minnaras roko'.
english: It’s raining! I didn’t bring an umbrella.

tay: sn'yal behoy, memaw nyox mxal tonox mako' znyopan nya'!
english: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

tay: sn'yal bayhoy, maymaw nyox mxal tonox mako' znyopan nya'!
english: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

tay: mkilox balay bnwan na wagi' wah, memaw nyox mtkgil tonox mako' la.
english: The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.

tay: mkilox balay bnwan na wagi' wah, maymaw nyox mtkgil tonox mako' la.
english: The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my chopsticks.
I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

tay: ini' sako' aras ozi, hala ta' mbazi.
english: I don’t have one either, let’s go buy one.
Let’s go buy a pen, shall we?
Let’s go buy a pen, shall we?

tay: aw, pbazi sako' ssom ozi na'.
english: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

tay: aw, pbazi sako' ssawm ozi na'.
english: Well, I still have to buy erasers.
Let’s go get breakfast, shall we?
Let’s go get breakfast, shall we?

tay: izyat sako' mosa'. kinnama' sako' ngasal la.
english: I don’t want to go, I’ve eaten at home.
I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

tay: zngyan mako' hmlngaw sbil mako' la.
english: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.
I forgot to pack a lunchbox.
I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

tay: nano' si ta' kr'agi maniq sbil mako' la!
english: Then let’s eat my lunch box together!
What are you having for lunch?
I want a nutritious school lunch.
What do you want to eat for lunch?

tay: nyox sako' maras sbil, nano' mglga ta' kryax!
english: I’ve brought a lunchbox today, let’s eat together at noon!
Let’s go play basketball, shall we?
Let’s go play basketball, shall we?

tay: izyat sako' mosa', pkita' sako' biro'.

english: Please help me with the broom.
Can you help me with the cloth?
Can you help me with the cloth?

tay: nyox sako' kmagaw, hali magal kosa Yomin.
english: I’m sweeping the floor, you ask Yumin to help you.

tay: m'oraw qo rhzyal, hali somi cikay ha.
english: The floor is dirty, go clean it.

tay: m'oraw qo rhzyal, hali sawmi cikay ha.
english: The floor is dirty, go clean it.
Okay, I’ll go get the cloth for you.

tay: m'oraw qo tobong qasa, hali somi cikay ha.
english: That window is very dirty, go clean it.

tay: m'oraw qo tobong qasa, hali sawmi cikay ha.
english: That window is very dirty, go clean it.

tay: ini' na' ha, nyox mako' ini' soqi kmagaw na' qani.
english: Wait a minute, I’m not done sweeping here yet.
I’m going to look for my teacher.
I’m going to look for my teacher.

tay: nano' pcyowagon so' i tmasoq ta' mqwas biro' kira' la?
english: What are you going to do after school today?

tay: mawsa' sami mglo mqwas ki rangi' mako'.
english: I’m going to sing with my friends.

tay: nano' pcyowagon nya' i tmasoq mqwas biro' kira?

english: She’s at home, please come in.

tay: nyox ini' kaki' ngasal. nano' zyowaw so' pi?
english: She’s not here, what can I do for you?

tay: yotas, kozing ga Pepay. gyah cikay blihon ha ko?
english: Grandpa, this is Paypay, can you open the door please?

tay: yotas, kozing ga Paypay. gyah cikay blihon ha ma'?
english: Grandpa, this is Paypay, can you open the door please?

tay: kozing ga, Kayno'. mwah sako' cisal iso'.
english: I’m Kaynu’ and I’ve come to talk to you.

tay: aw rwa! s'non miso' balay la. ihi, 'wah aki' ta' mcisal ha!
english: Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s talk!
Please sit down and drink water.
Please sit down and drink water.
Please sit down and have some tea.
Please sit down and have some tea.

tay: talagay! blaq balay nbon ocya' mamo!
mniqa ta' cikay bway qhoniq ha.
aw! blaq balay ktan inrkyasan na bebway qhoniq qani.
aw! blaq balay ktan inrkyasan na baybway qhoniq qani.
blaq so' niqon qo bway qhoniq qani?
blaq pinhapoy ni yaya' la. ihi' 'wah maniq la!
english: Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!

tay: aw. hala sako' mima' qba' ha.
english: Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.

tay: qiri' maniq ki, bali so' sqoliq.
english: Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.

tay: pzyox wal mako' niqon la, mtngi' balay la.
english: I ate a lot, I’m full.

tay: mmosa' sako' la, wahay miso' mita' lozi babaw nya'.
english: I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.

tay: mmawsa' sako' la, wahay miso' mita' lawzi babaw nya'.
english: I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.

tay: nyox mlhngan la. aki' mosa' ngasal la.
aw. mhhriq so' ga 'wah cisal ngasal mako'.
english: Okay, come to my house sometime.

tay: aw. mhayhriq so' ga 'wah cisal ngasal mako'.
english: Okay, come to my house sometime.

tay: lokah simo kwara', rasaw simo mcisal ki nnbkis na qalang ni sinsi kira' ki.
english: Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

tay: aw! hala ta' mcisal na ke' 'Tayal ki nnbkis.
english: Okay! We’re going to talk to the seniors in ’Tayal.

tay: aw! hala ta' mcisal na kay' 'Tayal ki nnbkis.
english: Okay! We’re going to talk to the seniors in ’Tayal.

tay: yotas, nyox sami mwah mita' iso' la.
english: Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

tay: talagay! baq simo kmal ke' 'Tayal ga! ta kinblaq!
english: You guys speak Thai! That’s great!

tay: talagay! baq simo kmal kay' 'Tayal ga! ta kinblaq!
english: You guys speak Thai! That’s great!

tay: lokah simo kwara', rason ni sinsi mqomah cinboxan trakis kira'.
english: Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

tay: lawkah simo kwara', rason ni sinsi mqomah cinboxan trakis kira'.
english: Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

tay: 'wah mbko sqani kwara', aras qeqaya' mamo.
english: Everyone come here and line up, remember to bring your tools.

tay: 'wah maybko sqani kwara', aras qayqazya' mamo.
english: Everyone come here and line up, remember to bring your tools.

tay: aw. sinsi, nyox sami maras qeqaya' kwara' myan la.
english: Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.

tay: aw. sinsi, nyox sami maras qayqazya' kwara' myan la.
english: Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.
Not yet, it’s still far away.
You go get the bird catcher.
Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.
Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

tay: lokah simo kwara'. mosa' ta' mita' zzngazyan qqsino kira'.
english: Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

tay: lawkah simo kwara'. mawsa' ta' mita' zzngazyan qqsino kira'.
english: Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

tay: inblaq mbko kwara'. pbazi ta' kipo' la.
english: Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

tay: mkora' te gleng ga, qqbhniq, te soro ga, mqmqo'. si osa zmangay sa sozyan mamo ki.
english: There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

tay: mkora' tay glayng ga, qqbhniq, tay soro ga, mqmqo'. si osa zmangay sa sawzyan mamo ki.
english: There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

tay: han, nway! nano' si osa' mita' qbhniq iso' la.
english: It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

tay: ato' qotox tmocing lga, 'wah msli' sqani lki.
english: We’ll be back in an hour.

tay: nano' kwara' wal so' ktan soni'?
nano' kwara' wal so' ktan sawni'?
pzyox mqo' wal mako' ktan, ro pzyox qbhniq ozi.
english: I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.
Hurry up, we have to go.

tay: naga' sako' cikay ha. nyox m'oy kakay mako'.
english: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

tay: hbazyaw balay tayal nyox mlngyaq sqani.
english: There are a lot of people swimming here.

tay: zzik qsya' nya' tehasa hiya' si ta 'lngyaq sqani.
english: The water is very deep, so we can swim here.

tay: zzik qsya' nya' tayhasa hizya'. si ta 'lngyaq sqani.
english: The water is deep there, so we just swim here.
What kind of car did you take?
How do you go to church?

tay: gmnlow sako' torak ni yaba mosa'.
english: I took a ride with my dad.

tay: motox mhnano' mosa' gako' krryax qo hya'?
english: How does he usually go to school?

tay: motox mhnano' mosa' gako' krayryax qo
english: How does he usually go to school?

tay: motox gmlow cyeyon mosa' gako' qo hya'.
english: He took the subway to school.

tay: minhnano' mosa' mbazi ramat qo yaki' so'?
english: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

tay: wal gmlow otobay mbazi ramat qo hya'.

tay: mhway so'! blaq balay pincbaq so' sawni'.

english: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

tay: mha nano qo kayal na soxan?
soxan ga ongat wagi, yolong ga cingay balay.
english: It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.

tay: ryax nxan qasa ga hmswa kayal?
english: How was the weather that day?

tay: ryax qani ga hzyaq cikay, mosa tanox ga plokos oba'.
english: It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.
How’s the weather on the weekend?
It will be sunny on the weekend.

tay: ryax qasa ga mosa mqwalax ga?
english: Will it be rainy that day?

tay: ryax qasa ga pkwagi kayal, iyat pqwalax.
english: It will have no rain and be sunny that day.

tay: ryax qasa ga mosa mqwalax pi?
english: Will it be rainy that day?

tay: aw! ryax qasa ga mosa mqwalax.
english: Yes, it will be rainy that day.

tay: mswat la, wagi cyox hmtow la.
english: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

tay: mqwalax la, ini sako aras roko.
english: It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

tay: misow ga ini qwalax, babaw ska wagi lga mosa qwalax la, mosa tanox ga aras roko.
english: It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

tay: qmisan kawas hnyan ga mosa hzyaq balay ga?
english: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

tay: aw, kawas hnyan ga mosa hzyaq balay plokos cingay lokos.
english: Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

tay: kawas qani ga mosa mkilox balay ga?
english: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

tay: bagan ga mosa mkilox balay, qeri mnbo qsya.
english: Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

tay: smoya so ryax tmango abaw ga?
smoya sako ryax na tmango abaw. hrhol balay kayal.
english: I like spring because the weather is warm.

tay: smoya so ryax hoqan abaw ga?
ini sako soya ryax hoqan abaw, ryax hoqan abaw ga cingay msbehoy.
english: I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.
I forgot to bring the textbook.
I will share it with you.
I forgot to bring the eraser.
Do you forget to bring your pen?
Yes, can you lend me a pen?

tay: nano cyox so niqon kryaxan ga?
english: What would you like for lunch?
What would you like for dinner?
What did you have for breakfast?
What did you have for lunch?

tay: osa lama, wahay miso kangi kira.
english: You go first and I will catch up later.

tay: iyat sako, mosa sami lama hmakot bbiro.
english: No, we have to carry books first.

tay: ini na, nyox sako qmwax pyato'.
english: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.
Why didn’t you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.
What are you going to do after school?
What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

tay: Lawa, cyox so maki ngasal ga?
Lawa, cyox so maki ngsal ga?
ini kaki ngasal lawa ay! kon ga Ipay, maki nano zywaw pi? kyalaw mako mwah Lawa.
english: lawa is not at home. I am Ipay. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

tay: yaki, sami ga Lawa ro Ciwas!
english: Grandma, we are lawa and ciwas, please open the door for us.

tay: kon ga Watan, nyox sako mwah kangi Temo.
english: I am watan, I am here for temu.

tay: yaki nyox miso wahan mita la.
english: Grandma, I am here to see you.

tay: bsiq balay ini so wah la, longon miso balay.
english: You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

tay: Watan mwah sako mzoy iso la.
english: watan , I am here to play with you.

tay: hay wah qsahoy, nyox miso ngon bsiq balay.
english: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

tay: qani ga ngahi noya sako, qaniq cikay!
english: This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!
The sweet potato is so sweet.

tay: wah! qani ga noya mako bway, qani cikay.
english: Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

tay: tama cikay ha! qani ga noya mako btasaw na qeton niqi cikay ktay!
english: Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.
Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

tay: iso ga qaniq so yotak ga?
kon ga ini sako qaniq yotak, maniq ko ring'go yasa la.
english: I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.

tay: anay miso sqilis bway ro pniqay so.
english: Let me peel the fruit for you.

tay: mhoway so, bway qani ga, cingay balay boq nya.
english: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.
I will bring you some water.

tay: cingay hazi maniq, cingay balay ramat hnapoy mako.
english: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

tay: oy! blaq balay sokan ro blaq niqon ozi.
english: Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

tay: cingay hazi maniq, nyox cingay hazi qani na.
english: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.
I’ll make myself at home then.

tay: cingay cikay qaniq, nyox cingay balay qani na.
english: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

tay: wan ko maniq cingay iyal la, iyat sako thoyay maniq lozi la.
english: I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

tay: sinsi rasay simo mosa rgyax kira.
english: I will take you to the mountains today.

tay: kmal qo yaya mha cingay balay koy na rgyax.
english: Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.
I will take you to the fields.
Are we going to loosen the soil?

tay: sinsi ga rason ta nya syaw llyong.
english: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

tay: sinsi ga rason ta nya rgyax.
english: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

tay: mosa ta bih syaw llyong kira pi?
english: Are we going to the riverside today?

tay: iyat, sinsi ga rason ta nya rgyax.
english: No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.
Are we going to the mountains today?
No, we are going to the fields.

tay: sinsi, nano qo 'san ta mita syaw llyong?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

tay: sinsi, mosa ta mita nano qo rgyax?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.
What are we going to do in the fields?

tay: mosa mita noya ta qeton bih slaq, pinbaq cikay maki qtahi ro hzing ay!
english: We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

tay: sinsi, mosa ta mlngiq llyong ga?
english: Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?
No, we are going to see dragonflies.

tay: sinsi mosa ta moya ramat bih slaq ga?
english: Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?
We are going to loosen the soil today.

tay: sqasa ga klosan cyox msbzih mlaka kya.
tehok soni wal sako balay ktan mqyanox na klosan.
english: Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

tay: sqasa ga cyox msbzih mlaka kya qo kperay.
ye! ye! smoya sako kperay bintonox balay.
english: Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

tay: sqasa ga cyox msbzih mlaka kya kperay.
qasa ga iyat kperay, qasa ga hzing.
english: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

tay: si kita sqani, laxi osa twahiq iyal ki!
english: Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

tay: aw, iyat sami mosa stwahiq iyal.
english: Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

tay: laxi qinah ksoqiy hkangi nway so ini ptakoy.
english: Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.
I want to see them right away.
How do you go to the block-house?

tay: mha nano mosa byo'ing qo hiya?
english: How does he go to the hospital?
How do you go to Penghu?
I go to Penghu by plane.
How do you go to Penghu?
I go to Penghu by boat.

tay: Lawa ga wal mlow glgan mosa pqwasan?
english: How does lawa go to school?

tay: Lawa ga wal mlow kisya mosa pqwasan.
english: lawa goes to school by train.

tay: Sayon ga wal mlow nano mosa kyokay?
english: How does Sayun go to church?

tay: Watan ga wal mlow zitensya mosa kyokay.
english: watan goes to church by bicycle.

tay: iso ga mlow so ceyon mosa pqwasan?
english: Do you go to school by MRT?
No, I go to school by bus.

tay: iso ga mlow zitensya mosa pqwasan ga?
english: Do you go to school by bicycle?

tay: aw, mlow sako zitensya mosa pqwasan.
english: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.
Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?
Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

tay: mosa so tayto ga mlow so kisya ini ga mlow kololaka ga?
english: Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

tay: mlow ko kololaka, mlow kololaka ro mlow kisya ga helaw qo kololaka hiya.
english: I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

tay: mosa so kyokay ga tama so baso ini ga qmozit so glgan ga?
english: Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?
