tay: qmozit sako glgan ga helaw hazi qo tama baso hiya.
english: I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.
Is the market close to your house?

tay: ini sobeh mtama sako otobay mosa bbiran qqaya.
english: No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.
Is the post office close to the school?

tay: sobeh balay hkangi kakay lga tehok la.
english: Yes, it is within walking distance.

tay: nniqan nniqon ga sobeh ngan baso?
english: Is the restaurant close to the station?

tay: hto ngan baso ro hkangi zmagan spong lga tehok la.
english: It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

tay: iso ga maki zyowaw so soni?

english: I would like to visit you.

tay: kya zyowaw mako soni ini ko kaki ngasal. babaw nya ma.
english: I am out today. How about another day?

tay: yasa soxan maki zyowaw so pi? mosa ko kangi iso babaw ska wagi.
english: Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

tay: aw ga, kaki ko ngasan n_gay miso.
english: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

tay: pqotay miso cikay baqon ro_ing ga aki mako brwan.
english: Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.
Would you mind if I do the video recording?

tay: yaqih sako ktan nyox ko ini smzyot qho' na ay.
english: No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.
Then I will just take photos.

tay: mhway so smwan so wahan mkal.
english: Thank you for accepting the interview.

tay: ongat zywaw qmhot, nano qo pqotno so?
english: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

tay: pqotay miso nano qo pincwagan so mrkyas?
english: What do you do when you are young?

tay: galan sako kinsat nyox ko hngaw miso qani la.
english: I was a police officer but I am retired now.

tay: yasa ga nyox so mtzyowaw na?
english: Then, are you working at the moment?

tay: pqotay miso, cyox maki qalang laqi so ozi ga?
english: Do your kids live in the tribe too?

tay: iyat, cyox maki hogan laqi mo.
english: No, my kids are all living in the city.

tay: yasa ga iso nanaq qotox hi' nyox maki ga?
english: Then, do you live by yourself?

tay: nyox sako qmayat qotox hozil ro qotox qhniq lozi, lha ga cingasan mako.
english: I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

tay: nyox sako qmayat ngyaw ozi, maki qnyatan smbes ini sako pkilang la.
english: I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

tay: aki miso pqotan cikay, zyowaw na psaniq pqalop.
english: I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

tay: ini sako baqi piyox zywaw, kya baqon mo ga ssyokon miso kmal kwara.
english: I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

tay: simo qo mosa ptqalop ga maki nano psaniq nya?
english: Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

tay: mosa sami qmalop ga ini swali kneril tmring qqaya pqalop.
english: Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

tay: yasa ga thoyay mosa mglow qmalop qo kneril pi?
english: Then, can women go hunting together?

tay: ini ay kneril hiya ga ini swali ptqalop.
english: No, women cannot go hunting either.

tay: Watan, ongat qwaw trakis ngasal la, iso osa maziy qwaw trakis.
english: watan, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

tay: kinzyaw ga maki qotox yoyot, laxi baziy la!
english: There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

tay: qotox yoyot ini tnaq, osa maziy sazing yoyot lozi.
english: One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

tay: baziy sako qwaw trakis, nyox simo tbaziy ga?
english: I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?
Yes! How many bottles do you need?

tay: baziy sako sazing yoyot ro qotox ssabo bwax.
english: I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

tay: nyox sqani bwax nano baziy so lozi ga?
english: Here is the rice, what else do you need?

tay: baziy sako bazing maki simo ga?
english: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

tay: wal soqon tbaziy bazing myan la.

english: I want to buy some clothes.

tay: nano llamo na szyon so ga?
english: What kind of clothes do you like?

tay: baziy sako r'tong qozit na lokos.
english: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

tay: maki plqoy ro msryaw sami na.
english: We have white and blue ones too.

tay: biqi sako qotox msryaw na lokos.
english: Please give me the clothes in blue.

tay: Watan mwah so ino soni la mnwah so slokah hi' so ga?
english: watan, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

tay: iyat! mnwah sako rmaw yaki tbaziy ramat.
english: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

tay: mha kya ga, maki zywaw so gbyan smoya' so mglow kon kgabi ga.
english: No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

tay: ongat ay! mosa sako maziy lokos.
english: No, I want to buy some clothes.

tay: yasa ga msqon ta mglow mosa.
english: Then, I will go with you.

tay: lokah so, pqotay miso cikay pira pila qotox qaxan ramat qani?
english: Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?
The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?

tay: qotox tncin ngahi ga mtzyon pila.
english: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

tay: biqiy sako cikay sazing taba' ramat ro qotox tncin ngahi.
english: Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

tay: watan mongi sako maras inpit la baqon so ksyow inpit cikay ma?
english: watan, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

tay: ongat rwa mako ozi la qotox ga rwa Lawa hiya qani.
english: I don’t have one either. This is Lawa’s.

tay: yasa qo ksyogay mako cikay ma? helaw ko pbbiq iso lozi.
english: Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

tay: mhoway so, biqiy hnway mako Lawa ozi.
english: Thank you and thank lawa for me.

tay: bzihiy sako miq sazing biro qani.
english: I want to return these two books.
No problem and what else do you need?

tay: ksyogon mo cyogan bbiro qani lozi.
english: I would like to borrow these three books.

tay: aw la. laxi zngi wahiy sbzih miq babaw cyogan ryax lozi.
english: Sure and remember to return them after three days.

tay: ini sako bzihan miq ssom na ki.
english: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

tay: wal mako bzihan miq hera la.
yasa ga swa ini 'loy ssom mo la.
english: Then, why is my eraser missing?

tay: iso ga ini so wan ksyogan Watan la.
english: Did you lend it to watan?

tay: ini mako baqiy 'say mo maqot hiya.
english: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.
I will lend you my eraser first.

tay: Sayon, lokosoba' qani ga kinsyogan so nya Watan ga?
english: Sayun, did watan lend you this coat?

tay: iyat qani bnaziy ni yaya mo.
english: No, my mom bought it for me.

tay: lokosoba' na Watan ga mtnaq rwa so.
english: watan’s coat is the same as yours.

tay: lokosoba' nya ga mqalox, ini ptnaq qo ptasan ta.
english: His coat is black, so our colors are different.

tay: Sayon so ksyogon pila Watan pi?
english: Sayun, did you borrow money from watan?

tay: ago, aki mako sbiq pila kinsyogan soni, mongi sako maras pila la.
english: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

tay: yasa ga knwan qo sbiq so?
english: Then, when will you return the money?

tay: soxan ga sbiq mako pila kinsyogan mako hiya.
english: I will return to him tomorrow.
Okay, I will tell watan for you.

tay: qoli ga aki ta skahol rangay kmzyap, kogih ga aki ta skahol ta tlnga' kmzyap.
english: It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

tay: obaq so mha qani nyox sako mn'oqo la.
english: No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

tay: yasa ga cbqay so mha nano kbalay sazing toqi na tlnga' lozi.
english: Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

tay: aw ga! talagay blaq! moci qani lga mosa sako kyapon qsinow la.
english: Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

tay: qroyox iyal k'man na slaq la, osa magan soki beh kho', mosa ta slaq.
english: The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

tay: cyox syaw na yawa mzyop so kho' lga ktan so la.
english: It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

tay: pn_gabaq magan, laxi agan qilis, hmnyot balay soki.
english: Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

tay: cyox maki kyaho qhoniq qasa qo rosa mo.
english: My trap is under that tree.

tay: cyox mako syan tamas sqani, bqqon mo cyox ino qo rosa mo.
english: I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

tay: qani ga skoyo', syan myan syaw gong kzyap qolih.
english: This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

tay: sami sqasa hiya ga ongat skoyo' myan, sami ga pnep myan kmzyat qolih.
english: We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

tay: wan ko ini pnep knan, hnyan qani ga pcbaqi sako ma?
english: I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

tay: aw ga! msqon ta mosa pnep babaw nya.
english: Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

tay: yasa ga cbaqay miso kbalay skoyo'.
english: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

tay: cyox mzoy boyaw so la aw ini maki qolih krongan la! iso ga helaw hazi sklow la.
english: Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

tay: naga mzoy iyal qo qaso la. nyox sako sklow boyaw sqani, osa rmaw kon magan tara' sqasa.
english: Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

tay: sklow qolih wah kon sqani. 'ragay miso sklow.
english: Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

tay: talagay blaq la! soni ga hboyaw ta balay, nyox s'onan qoliq skoyo' la.
english: Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

tay: helaw ta hazi mosa ro say ta pqaniq kwara.
english: Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

tay: laxi h_yapas la, nhay osa' tama' sa thekan so'.
english: Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

tay: swali' sako', nyox sako' mqsoqi' la!
soni' ga te pira' ryax nqo rehay la?
te zmagal ryax na babaw rehay, phangaw ta' soxan, hala ta' hm_yapas te tanox ma'?
english: It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!

tay: aw ga! hata' hm_yapas syaw gong.
english: Great! Let’s go to the riverside.

tay: soxan ga te pira' ryax na babaw rehay la?
english: What day will it be tomorrow?

tay: soxan ga te cyogal ryax na babaw rehay, hata' mzyoy mari babaw kinryax soxan!
english: Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!
What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

tay: soxan ga hngawan ryax, sami ki yaya' mo ga mosa' sami kyokay.
english: Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

tay: nyox sako' aki' mkmotaq, mosa' sako' psqcyan.
english: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

tay: nyox mtkgil iyal qo tonox mo.
sinsi, nyox mxal kto' mako', mosa' sako' psqcyan.
english: Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.
May I go wash my hands?

tay: sobih ta' ptmasoq mqbaq la, lawa' cikay ro osa'.la.
english: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

tay: sinsi, nyox mxal balay tonox mako', aki' sako' mhngaw babaw kinryax.
english: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.
Okay, take care and go home.

tay: sinsi, phngaw sako' te qotox ryax na rehay 'nyal, mosa' sako' pkita' sinsi phgop.
english: Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

tay: cyox mxal kto' nya', cyox sa psqcyan.
english: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

tay: sinsi, cyox mxal btakan nya', phngaw kira'.
english: Teacher, he has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

tay: cyox mkilox lozi qo tonox nya'.
kozing ga Yomin Bato', mopow kawas mako' misow qani.
english: My name is Yumin Batu’, and I’m 10 years old.
What ethnic group are you from?
Are all your family members indigenous?
Yes, my whole family is Atayal.
Are all your family members indigenous?

tay: iyat, yaba' mako' ga 'Tayal, yaya' mako' ga plmokan.
english: No, my father is Atayal, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

tay: qasa ga yaba' so'? pira' kawas nya' la?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

tay: qasa' ga yaba' so'? pira' kawas nya' la?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

tay: iyat, hya ga mrhow na qalang myan, mspat pgan kawas nya' la.
english: No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

tay: mopow spat kawas nya' qo qbsozyan mo la.
mstwahiq zyowaw na kawas mamo ki qbsozyan so'?
english: Is your brother much older than you?

tay: bsyaq ta' iyat minkita' la, wal tmwang kinwagiq so' lrwa?
english: I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

tay: aw la, kbhol ro mtzyol inci kinwagiq mako' la.
ini' ay, nyox mtkari knita' so' la.
aw, misow qani ga mtzyol konking la.
mosa' sako' hmkangi' sinsi sqo bbrwan.
english: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.
He’s going to throw away the trash.

tay: cyox te lobong lngyaqan, mosa' mspong mlngyaq kira' qo Tali'.
english: He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

tay: cyox ino' qo Ciwas? mmosa' mspong mqzinah kira' la.
english: Where is Ciwas? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

tay: cyox sa kraho' na pslyan, halay mako' mlawa'.
english: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.
Let’s go to the playground together.

tay: hako' mbaziy kryaxon mako' ha', 'say miso' hmkngi' kira'.
english: I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.
Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

tay: osa' hmkangi' sqoliq, mosa' sako' hmkangi' sinsi.
english: You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

tay: Yomin pspong ta' mari' ka tcingon kira'?
english: Is Kacaw competing in croquet today?

tay: iyat ay, mosa' mspong mtazil ay!
english: No, he’s competing in high jump.

tay: ryax na onrokay ga, mosa' so' mspong nano'?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

tay: aw ay, mosa' sako' mspong mqzinah.
ryax na onrokay ga, mosa' so' mspong nano'?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

tay: mosa' sako' mspong sqo mari' tcingon.
nano' qo ppcyowagon ta' ryax na onrokay?
english: What will we do in the sports day?
We will compete in tug of war.

tay: ptbaziy ta' nniqon sa ryax na onrokay?
english: Will we sell food at the sports day?

tay: nyox so' magal icibang la, ta' kinlokah so'!
english: Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!
Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

tay: ini' kaki' ngasal, misan wal tanox, mwah ngasal gbyan.
english: No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

tay: cyox te sazing 'rkan, hali' hmkangi' kya.
english: He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

tay: Temo, bsyaq miso' iyat kintan la, lokah so' ga?
english: It’s Temu. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

tay: lokah sako' ay, nyox sako' mwah cisal iso'.
english: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

tay: cyox tmahok ramat te phpoyan, 'say mako' mlawa'!
english: He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

tay: wal kmzyap ngta' sa libo' ngta'.
english: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

tay: ini' kaki' ngasal qo yotas mamo, cyox qmayah, 'si' n_ga kya ngasal..
english: Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

tay: bsyaq miso' iyat kintan la, nyox so' wagiq la.
english: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.
It’s so good to see you.

tay: bniq mako simo qo pngran qani, hali smi' sa tenpingsyang.
english: Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

tay: bsyaq iyat so' minnwah la, plwanay mako' kwara' mtswe so' ha, aki' mwah mplaw maniq.
english: It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

tay: laxi' lnglong nano' la, si ta' nbo ocya', hala ta' mcisal te tangha'.
english: No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

tay: blaq balay qo innaga' so', hala sako' la.
english: Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

tay: misan tnahok qo ngta' qani, aras iso', hali' thhway maniq ngasal.
english: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

tay: aki ta' mkita' babaw kinryax soxan ma', smwayal so'?
english: Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

tay: nano' mkta' ta' sa pqwasan biro' ma? psyasing ta'.
english: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

tay: nano' hata' sqo pslyan na 'tayal, plokos sako' lokos na 'Tayal.
english: Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

tay: m'phpah qo lapaw na qalang myan ga blaq balay ktan, mha ni m'phpah lga 'wah mcisal qalang myan la!
english: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

tay: siki tehok qo tngawan abaw, iyat hazi' pnaga kya' la!
english: That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?
Then come during our Thanksgiving Festival!

tay: aw ga! pnaga' sako' balay ay!
english: Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

tay: swa' so' mbzinah mosa' maki' qalang rgyax lozi?
english: May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?

tay: mosa' sako' pcbaq biro' lelaqi' na pqwasan biro' qalang myan.
english: I want to return to teach at the local school.

tay: swa' so' ini' pcbaq biro' te hogal pi?
english: Why not teach in the city?

tay: baha hmswa' ga sm'ino' sako' qalang mako', ro aki' mako' 'benahon miq qalang mako' qo pinqbaqan mako'.
english: Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

tay: baq so' balay tminon, ima' pincbaq iso'?
english: You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

tay: yaki' mako', hya' ga spzyang balay baq tminon nqo qalang myan.
english: It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

tay: swa' so' lmnglong mha pqbaqay ta' qo tminon?
english: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

tay: tminon hiya' ga gaga' nqo qnxan ta' nanak, aki' sako' nyox 'moboy sqo gaga' na qnxan ta'.
english: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

tay: talagay kinblaq nbon qo qwaw trakis qani!
baq so' balay wah! bsyaq la? sni' so qwaw qani?
english: You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

tay: ini' kbsyaq, ki'a hazi smka' byacing lga blaq la. psklwan ta' rhkil ini' ga trakis ro shzi' sa bloko' ro mbasaw lga s'imaw na tamol ro, mokan na abaw bgazyaw, mktzyo' lga tkron sa salaw la.
english: No, It takes about two weeks. to steam the glutinous rice or millet and pour it into a round container to dry, then put in the yeast and cover it with a giant taro, then put it into an urn and seal it after three days.

tay: kya qo lacyaw ro qinow, pinmohi' mako' nanak ay!
english: I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

tay: pira' pila' kwara' qo sazing qani?
kwara' ga rosa kbhol ro mzimal pila'.
lokos qani qo szyon mako', pira' pila' wah?
english: I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?
It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

tay: ongat qbaqan, skhway mako' cikay lga, pshotaw sako' la.
english: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

tay: aw pi! nano' lokos mqalox qasa qo bziraw mako'.
english: Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

tay: hocyo qani ro kloban qani qo galon mako'.
english: I want this knife and this pot.

tay: sazing seng kwara', kinnalay mako' na qba' nanak, mosa' so' bsyaq balay bengon..
english: It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

tay: kyalaw mako' rngrangi' mako' mha 'wah mbazi sqani, ro pkhway cikay lma'!
english: I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

tay: aw, nano' hyo'aw ta' mposal pasento.
english: Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

tay: wahi mita' cikay! ana lokos ro qbobo' ga nyox kwara'.
english: Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

tay: qotox lokos ga cyogal kbhol ro mzimal, cyogal lokos lga qotox seng la.
english: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

tay: nanak yaqani qo bziron mako', biqi sako' sa giqas.
english: I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

tay: lokah so' ga, smoya' sako' qotox snbwal na rhkil mami' ro syam maqaw.
english: Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

tay: wal nha soqon mbazi la. nyox na' qo rhkil na tana', pbazi so'?
english: The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

tay: aw pi, nano' biqi sako' qotox, mm'wah sako' mbazi mami' lozi babaw nya'.
english: Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

tay: aw, anay miso' smabo' ro tkraw mako' sa yobing. mzimal pila'.
english: Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.

tay: ya mamo ramas, pasaring ta micow sonbaba' la kay.
ya mamo ramas. pasba'on mo cimo ci sasonno komaṟal ka nani'on na ita Itaṟal soni.
english: Hello everyone. Today, I am going to teach you how to say the Atayal language for food.

tay: ya mamo ba'on mong ka ke' na sinsi'?
english: Do you understand what the teacher says?

tay: sinsi' kaṟal totox loṟi, ini mo ba'i' mong.
english: I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

tay: ka yaba' hari' ka ke' so sinsi', ini mo pongi'?
english: I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

tay: galow lonpow kinang totox, katox sani.
english: Look here, please! Repeat after me.

tay: yaba' haṟi' ka ke' mamo, lapagiy totox loṟi.
english: Read it again. Please speak louder.

tay: ṟomongi' co maras ci papatas la sinsi.
english: I forgot to bring my pen.

tay: ṟomongi' co maṟas ci papoṟot la sinsi.
english: I forgot to bring my eraser.
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

tay: pakaciki' co ci papoṟot so aw?
pakakatox ta babow ni la, tehok sani soni la kay.
english: Class dismissed, see you next week.

tay: ole' co ni Yokan Toṟeh, Pawan Yokan ralo' mo.
english: I am the son of Yukan, and my name is Pawan.

tay: seyto' co ni Bakan, Pawan Nokan ralo' mo.
english: I am Bakan’s student, my name is Pawan.

tay: Iyong Pawan ralo' ni ka yaba' mo.
Koras Walis ka hiya, asoṟan mo malikoṟ.
english: He is my brother, his name is Kuras.

tay: Walis Pawan ka ralo' ni hiya ?
ho', Walis Pawan ka ralo' ni hiya.
Walis Pawan ka ralo' ni hiya?
aṟat, Koṟas Watan ralo' ni hiya.
yata' mo ka hiya, Temi Pawan ka ralo' ni.
Iwal Pawan ka ralo' ni, rangi' mo ka hiya.
english: She is my friend and her name is Iwal.

tay: malapṟow sa'ing ka ingkaṟalan ni hiya'.

english: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

tay: sa'ing ka asoṟan lo otox ka sose' mo.
english: I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

tay: ongat co na asoṟan malikoṟ kong.
pira' ci'oli ka otox moṟow mamo?
english: How many people are in your family?

tay: paṟat ci'oli ka otox moṟow min.
english: There are four of us in our family.

tay: cel so lonpow ci patas ino'?
cel co lonpow patas cika Hori'.
english: I went to school in Puli.

tay: amol papomahon ni ka mama' so?
english: What does your uncle do for a living?
Does your sister have a job?

tay: cel momaṟah moṟow ising ka hiya.

english: Yes, I’m from the Atayal tribe.

tay: ho', babawi' kora ka otox moṟow min.
english: Yes, we are all very tall.

tay: waṟal lonpow patas ka sose' so kanel la?
english: Does your sister go to school?

tay: ba' komaṟal ci ke' na Itaṟal ka sose' so aw?
english: Do your siblings speak the language?

tay: ho' ba' komaṟal ci ke' na Itaṟal ka laha' kaca.
english: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.

tay: magalow mamo maki ci ka yaba' yaya' so?
english: Do you live with your parents?

tay: ho', magalow co maki' yaya' yaba' mo.
english: Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

tay: magalow so maki' yotas yaki so?
english: Do you live with your grandparents?

tay: ini, ini min pagalow maki' ci yotas yaki mo.
english: No, I didn’t live with them.

tay: ima ka nel so gilgan maki'?
magalow co maki' yaba' yaya' lo asoṟan mo malikoṟ.
english: I live with my father, mother and brother.
I’m from [Nantou]. *The [Hualien] is free to change places.
When are you going back to the tribe?

tay: mahngow ka papasba'an la ga, mosa' co alang la.
english: I will go back in the summer.

tay: yona ino' ka kaṟal soni aṟ?
makilox ka kaṟal, matata' wagi' la.
english: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?

tay: kapayox malokos ci lokos, gahṟa' caṟong.
english: It's cold, so wear more clothes.

tay: ini kakilox wa, sabehol tikiy oṟi tantana caṟong.
yona ino' ka kaṟal soni' aṟ.
tantana caṟong wa, ini kakilox lo ini kagahṟa' oṟi.
english: It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

tay: yona ino' ka karal malahngan hiya?
pakaṟak hangitox wa, ongat ṟaṟolong ka kaṟal oṟi.
english: There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

tay: yona ino' ka kaṟal tanox aṟ?
pakaṟak ka wagi', nahna minsot ka awalax, matata' ka hongo na amotox la.
english: The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

tay: yona ino' ka kaṟal cimonan hiya aṟ?
english: What's the weather like where you are?
We're going to have a big storm here.
Very well, out of the big sun.

tay: maha' co papasba'an ci ke' la.
english: I have to go to school.

tay: papayox malokos ci lokos gahṟa' caṟong ka kaṟal.
english: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

tay: iya' ṟongi' maras ci taṟasi', yaba' awalax kira' haṟi la.
english: It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

tay: pasbalong ci micow, hala omolax cobay kira' haṟi la.
english: There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.
It just rained, and now it's stopped.

tay: mahoṟi ka to'oy, yona minnolax cobay wa.
english: It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

tay: honco' mahoṟi' ka hi' si so? minnolax aw?
english: Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

tay: ini' co aras ci taṟasi', nel omolax tanox wa.
english: It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

tay: mako' nel mohal ka tonox mo tinlaman yopan na bexoṟ.
english: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

tay: mako' masmamoy ka tonox mo', pinsawagen na wagi'.
english: The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.

tay: ṟomongi' co maras ci papatas la.
english: I forgot to bring my pen.

tay: ṟomongi' co maras ci pataṟak la.
english: I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

tay: ini co aras oṟi, hata' miniy aw.
english: I don’t have one either, let’s go buy one.
Let’s go buy a pen, shall we?

tay: ho', pabiniy co ci papoṟot oṟi na.
english: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

tay: hata' miniy ci nani'on sasan aw?
english: Let’s go get breakfast, shall we?

tay: minnani' co moṟow kong la, aṟat co.
english: No, I’ve already eaten at home.

tay: ṟomongi' co mosa pakakilox ci ka tinbihlan mo la.
english: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

tay: ṟomongi' co maras ci ka tinbihlan la.
english: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

tay: pagagalow ta mami' ci ka tinbihlan mo la!
english: Then let’s eat my lunch box together!

tay: amol ka nani'on so cakan rex?
english: What are you having for lunch?

tay: pakani co ci tinnahok na papasba'an ci ke'.
english: I want a nutritious school lunch.

tay: amol ka nani'on so cakan rex?
english: What are you having for lunch?

tay: pagagalow ta mani ga, nel co maras ci tinbihlan!
english: I’ve brought a lunchbox today, let’s eat together at noon!
Let’s go play basketball, shall we?

tay: aṟat co wa, maha' co lonpow ci patas.

english: Please help me with the broom.
Okay, here’s a broomstick for you.
Can you help me with the cloth?

tay: agal sa si Pawan, nel co comopah hang.
english: I’m sweeping the floor, you ask Pawan to carry it for you.

tay: awi' tikiy ka raxal hani, maṟokat la.
english: The floor is dirty, go clean it.

tay: ho', maha' co magal ci ka gali' hang.
english: Okay, I’ll go get the cloth.

tay: maṟokat caṟong ka garaso' hani, awi tikiy.
english: That window is very dirty, go clean it.

tay: iya' hang kay, ini' co tamaso' comopah na.
english: Wait a minute, I’m not done sweeping here yet.

tay: mamaha co malahang ci ka sinsi'.
english: I’m going to see my teacher.

tay: pisco' so malax papasba'an ci ke' la?
english: What do you do after school?

tay: mamaha min mawas ci ka rangi' mo.
english: I’m going to sing with my friends.

tay: pisco' i malax papasba'an ci ke' ka hiya la?

english: May I ask if Iwal is at home?

tay: awah matatama' moṟow ṟik, nel sani ka Iwal.
english: She’s at home, please come in.
May I ask if Saun is home?

tay: amol la sikalahan so hiyan? ongat moṟow ka hiya.
english: She’s not here, what can I do for you?

tay: yotas, komoy co, sigawah co ci a'alo'.
english: Grandpa, I’m Kumuy, please open the door.

tay: Pawan Temo co, nel co moh sonlalahaw tikiy sinang.
english: Pawan, I am Temu, I have come to play with you.

tay: talagay ta kinbose' ini pakakatox la.
cobay wa! lonlongong miso' caṟong, patisal ta tikiy hang.
english: Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s chat!
Please sit down and have some tea.

tay: talagay kinramasan abon ka ocya' so hani.
ho' ga! talagay kinramasan taxan ka pinnahgalan so aṟ.
inah haṟi' moh mani ci kingabenan, maso' tomahok ka yaya' la.
english: Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!

tay: ho', mohala' co mema' ci aba' hang.
english: Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.

tay: iya' kasaṟox kay, aṟat so' ci'oli'.
english: Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.

tay: matangi' co la, talagay ka kinnane'en mo.
english: I ate a lot, I’m full.

tay: maha' co la, mamoh co matox sinang babow ni loṟi.
english: I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.

tay: awah salahaw babow ni loṟi kay.
ho', awah salahaw moṟow mo i mahngow so'.
english: Okay, come to my house sometime.

tay: ramas mamo? rason mini matisal ci nannabkis ni sinsi' soni'.
english: Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

tay: nel min matox sinang la tas.
english: Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

tay: talagay mamo kinramasan, ba' mamo' komaṟal ci ke' na Itaṟal.
english: You guys speak Atayal! That’s great!

tay: ramas mamo? rarason mo cimo cika ato' na toṟakis kira'.
english: Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

tay: iya' ṟongi' ci angaya', awah matikalow sani.
english: Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

tay: ho', masmaso' min magal ci angaya' la.
english: Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.
Not yet, it’s still far away.

tay: ho' maha' co pose' ci ose'.

english: You go get the bird catcher.

tay: ho', maha' co somecow ci kabahni'.
english: Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

tay: ramas mamo? mamaha' ta' ci ka tongoyen kira'
english: Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

tay: talagay kinramasan, payo ta ino' mosa aṟ?
english: Awesome! How are we going to get there?

tay: awah matakalow sani, pabiniy ta' ci kipo'.
english: Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

tay: taxi', kakabahni' ka nel galeng, bokoy haca ga kokoya'.
english: There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

tay: mangongo' co caṟong ci koya' kong sinsi'.
eṟi nak ga, osa' matox ci kabahni' iso'.
english: It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

tay: otox wagi' la ga, awah masasli' sani kay.
english: We’ll be back in an hour.

tay: payox ka koya' lo kabahni' kintox mo.
english: I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.

tay: na' co tikiy, nel masaoṟiy ka papak mo na.
english: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

tay: talagay ka ci'oli' nel lomangoy sani.
english: There are a lot of people swimming here.

tay: ṟaṟik ka ose' saca hiya', langoy ta' sani' ita'.
english: The water is deep there, so we just swim here.

tay: yo so na ino' moh aṟ?
tinpanga' so' ci ṟaṟolo' amol aṟ?
english: What kind of car did you take?

tay: yo so' na ino' mosa' kiyokay aṟ?
english: How do you go to church?

tay: pinanga' co ci ṟaṟolo' ni yaba' mo.
yo so' na ino' mosa' papasba'an ci ke' aṟ?
english: How does he usually go to school?

tay: tapanga' ci ceyon mosa' papasba'an ci ke' ka hiya'.
english: He took the subway to school.

tay: yona ino' mosa' miniy ci ṟago' ka yaki' so'.
english: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

tay: tapanga' ci otobay ka yaki' mo.
english: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.

tay: payo so' na ino' mosa' Lani aṟ?
english: How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

tay: patapanga' co ci hone' mosa' Lani.
english: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.

tay: patapanga' ci amol mosa' Lani ka hiya' aṟ?
english: How did he get to Orchid Island?

tay: patapanga' ci hikoki' mosa Lani ka hiya.
english: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

tay: patopanga' ci amol mosa' Kawsyong ka hiya'?
english: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

tay: patapanga' ci kawte mosa kawsyong ka hiya.
english: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

tay: patopanga' ci kisya' mosa' Taytong ka hiya'?
english: Did he take a train to Taitung?

tay: ho', patapanga' ci kisya' mosa Tayto' ka hiya.
english: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

tay: patopanga' ci kisya' mosa' Taytong ka hiya'?
english: Did he take a train to Taitung?

tay: aṟat, patapanga ci hikokiy mosa Tayto ka hiya'.
english: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

tay: kelan na papahngagan ci baso' ka syaw hani?
english: Is there a bus stop near here?

tay: kelan wa, magalo'ing so mosa la ga, taxan so la.
english: Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

tay: cel ino' ka sobeh carong eki' na ceyon sani?
english: Where is the nearest MRT station?

tay: as ki ka tapanga' hayya' wa, ongat la pahngagan na ceyon sani.
english: There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

tay: piṟa' wagi' topangan so baso' nano' papasba'an ci ke'?
english: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

tay: patehok haṟi' malapṟow ṟamagal honkang tehok papasba'an ci ke'.
maha' piṟa' wagi' topanga' kawte tehok Taycong?
english: How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?

tay: otox wagi' ga tehok Taycow la.
english: I will come to Taichung in an hour.

tay: maha' bose' pata'oṟit ci ṟaṟolo' nano' Ulay?
english: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

tay: maha' kito' kinbose' topanga' so' ceyon tehok moṟow mo?
english: How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?
Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

tay: aṟat payox ka kinnaba'on mo, iya' aw.
english: Don’t, I don’t know much about it.

tay: mak mosa' co matisal sinang gaben, mahngow so' aw?
english: Are you free this afternoon? I’d like to visit you. Is that okay?
Okay, I’ll wait for you at home.

tay: patisal ta' tikiy ci insa' na Itaṟal coxan i maki' so moṟow aw?
english: Are you free tomorrow? I’d like to ask you about the legendary story of [the Atayal]. *[Amis] please change to your respective tribe

tay: aṟat co pakikiy moṟow coxan, mamaha co nanahi'.
english: I’m going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won’t be home.

tay: pinongan mo komaṟal ka ci'oli ga, iso' ka ba' caṟong ci insa' na Itaṟal ma, pa'oci hako' tikiy.
english: I heard that you are very familiar with the traditional customs of the Atayal, I would like to ask you a question.

tay: pa'ocan miso ci kinnoba'on mo', aṟat son payox ka kinnaba'an mo oṟi.
english: I don’t know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

tay: ma'iro' mapgan maspat ka ingkaṟalan mo.
amol ka ke' ba'on so' komaṟal?
ba' co komaṟal ci ke' na Itaṟal lo Bonon.
english: I can speak Atayal and Bunun.

tay: ma'as caṟong moh matisal sinang, pa'oci co ci gagaṟox na maloṟak aw?
english: It’s a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

tay: ho', makaroṟox co mosa' maloṟak i se'eneng co hang.
english: Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

tay: talagay kinramasan ka pissaba' so' soni', bahbah so' caṟong.
english: Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

tay: cincaṟong ka ke' mo hani. sinbili' na nabkis rali' kay.
english: All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

tay: bahbah so' caṟong, tehok sani ka pintisalan ta' soni'.
english: That’s all for today’s interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

tay: patisal ta babow ni la, bahbah so caṟong.
mamaha co hang, mamoh co mong ci ka isa' na nabkis rali' sinang babow ni loṟi.
english: I’m going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.
Hello, what are you looking for?
I want to buy a cup.
Hello, what are you looking for?
I want to buy a hat.

tay: kelan ka kopo' mamo aw? pabiniy co.
english: I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?
Yes, how many do you want to buy?

tay: ongat wa! ini min paginbiniy ci sabiki'.
english: No, we don't sell betel nut.
How many packs do you want to buy?
I want to buy sweet potatoes.

tay: waṟal so'on maginbiniy kora' ka ngahi' la.
english: All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

tay: mpabiniy co ci sa'ing sosok na abora'.
english: I want to buy two bottles of oil.

tay: mastahaṟ ci otox sosok baliy la.
english: We only have one bottle left.
How many pounds do you want to buy?

tay: maha' pira' ka baṟing babinaron so'?
english: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?
I want to buy two catties.

tay: mpabiniy co ci sa'ing binnahlan na inow.
english: I want to buy two green onions.

tay: togal binahlan nel sani, agal kora' la!
english: There are three left, all for you!

tay: pira' pila' ka otox cinabo' na box hani?
english: How much is this bag of rice?

tay: maposal otox kolaboy kora'. anak maposal kolaboy la ga.
ni, ma'ira mapgan ṟamagal ka kolaboy hani.
patong co miniy tikiy, patehki mo otox kabhol kolaboy.
english: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

tay: kahyow tikiy aw, maskito' caṟong ka hani?
english: It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

tay: aṟat wa, mahyow caṟong ka hani la.
english: No, this is already very cheap.
I want this packet of cookies.

tay: matol kolaboy ka kamce' hani, amol ka babinaron so' na?
english: $30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

tay: anak co koncik ci pila' sinang?
english: Can I borrow money from you?

tay: ho' ga! pira' ka kacikan so'?
english: Yes! How much do you need?

tay: anak co koncik ci pila' sinang? ṟomongi' co maras la.
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

tay: ini' co nak aras ci pila' oṟi wa!
english: I don’t have any money either!

tay: anak co koncik ci pila' sinang? ṟomongi' co maras la.
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

tay: aṟat co, ini' hako beni ka kincikan so' pilaw na.
english: No, you haven’t paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

tay: anak co koncik ci lokos so?
anak co koncik ci patas so?
wal mo pakacikan ci ka Iwal la.
pakacikiy co ci ritensay' so' aw?
english: Can I borrow your bicycle, please?
Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

tay: nel omolax la, ini' co aṟas ci taṟasi' pakacikiy co ci taṟasi' so' aw?
english: It’s raining, I don’t have an umbrella, can I borrow one?

tay: pagalow ta maktaṟasi', otox baliy ka taṟasi' mo.
english: I only have an umbrella, let’s stick together!

tay: ni, kani ka patas kincik mo sinang pilaw.
english: This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

tay: patas amol ka maktaxan so' na, kaṟali' co.
english: You can tell me what else you want to read.

tay: babi' miso kanon ka pila' kincik mo la?
english: When do I have to pay you back?

tay: eri nak, maki ka pila' so' la ga , beni co la.
english: It doesn’t matter, you can talk about it when you have money.

tay: babi' so' kanon ka pila' kincikan so kinang la?
english: When are you going to pay me back?
I will return it to you tomorrow.

tay: kanon babi' hako ka patas kincikan so' la?
english: When are you going to return my book?

tay: wal miso be'an ci hiṟa' la ca?
english: Didn’t I return it to you yesterday?

tay: pinkacik sinang ni Yokan ka papatas hani?
english: Did Yukan lend you this pen?
Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

tay: kincikan so Yokanan ka papatas hani?
english: Did you borrow this pen from Yukan?

tay: aṟat wa, bininiy ni yaya' mo.
english: No, this is what mom bought.

tay: osa' kacik tikiy ci timo' ni Temi hang, ongat ka timo' la.
english: We are out of salt, go borrow some from Temi.

tay: wahi co mato' ci pila' kincikan so' si Temi.
english: Go tell Temi to give me my money back.

tay: piṟa' ka pila' alo'ing ni sinang?
english: How much does she owe you?

tay: mamaha co mamohi' ci ṟago' ṟago'an ki.
english: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

tay: nel co minnarang ci kaman wa. payox caṟong ka kaman, papose' co ci ose' kira' haṟi' la.
english: There’s too much grass, I’m cutting it, I’ll have to water it later.

tay: ita ka keweh lo lalabah mo haca?
english: Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?

tay: cel mo pacelon ci ka syaw na ot.
english: Put it next to the plow rake.
Have you turned over the soil?

tay: maso' co tomabol, pagaṟa' co la.
english: I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

tay: tana' halan komit ka ṟago' pinmohi' so' la?
english: Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

tay: tana' kotan ka tamana' hani hiya' la, ini' ka ciyak hiya' na.
english: The cabbages here are ready to harvest, but the cucumbers there are not yet ready to harvest.

tay: talagay ka ngahi' kinehol so' aṟ!
english: Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

tay: rogiy co posa' koho' ṟik aw?
english: Will you help me with the barn?

tay: nel min posa' ci ṟakok kakaṟak ci ocyox.
english: We’re releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

tay: payox ka ocyox kinṟak cel cika kobo' la.
english: The fish basket has been full of fish.

tay: yo mamo' na ino' konṟak ci ocyox?
english: How do you usually catch fish?

tay: as co osa' meta' ci ocyox kong.
english: I shoot fish with a spear.
Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

tay: konṟak co na binong, kong. ga, tagit co maras ci hoṟil lo hapoy mosa' moloṟak.
english: I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.

tay: to'oy pinkakayan na baṟok nanahi' hani.
english: This is the road the boar took.

tay: papak na baṟok ka hani, kani ka to'oy naha.
english: These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

tay: yona cel tonroṟi' ci asinow ka binong ta' la, hali' ta' matox.
english: Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

tay: yona wal sonkanox ka hoṟil la, ololi ta' mosa'.
english: The dog seems to have smelled it. Let’s follow them.

tay: kato' sinbale' na oṟati' kani, kakaṟak ci olit.
english: This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.

tay: amol ka cel so' posan saca hiya'?
english: What is that thing you put there?

tay: binong tatiroṟi' ci papak kani, kakaṟak ci para'.
english: It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

tay: talagay payox ka bini' na amotox itan soni.'
english: Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

tay: ho' wa, hali' ta' pasa'on mani' ci raral alang.
english: Yeah! Let’s take it back to the tribe and share it!

tay: pasba'on mo cimo ci kakaṟal ci asinow na Itaṟal kira'.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Tayal language today.

tay: pasba'on mo cimo ci kakaṟal ci pinnahgalan na Itaṟal kira'.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Tayal language today.

tay: aṟat, Iwanan ka lokos pababawen hani.
sinsi', ini' co aras ci patas.
english: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.

tay: pagalow matox bang na intana'an so hang.
english: Share the book with your classmate next to you.
I will lend you my eraser.

tay: pa'alax ta papasba'an la, kinhayow mosa moṟow kay.
english: It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

tay: pa'alax ta papasba'an la, pasagagiy ta la kay.
english: The class is over, goodbye everyone.

tay: ye mamo' ramas, Watan ka ralo' mo.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Yakan.

tay: ye mamo' ramas? Temo ka ralo' mo.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Temu’.

tay: Yokan, ramas so, Sapo co kong.
Piyo ramas so, Sapo co kong.
yaya ci ni ni Walis, Bakan ka ralo mo.
sose' co ni ni Watan, Apiy ka ralo' mo.
english: I am Watan’s sister. My name is Apiy.

tay: sinsi' mo ka hiya, Iyong ka ralo' ni.
asoṟan mo malikoṟ ka hiya, Watan ka ralo' ni.
rangi' mo ka son Sapo hani.
amol ralo' ni ka asoṟan so kanel hiya?
english: What is your elder sister’s name?

tay: Komoy ralo' ni ka asoṟan mo kanel. hiya.
english: My elder sister’s name is kumuy.

tay: amol ralo' ni ka sose' so kanel hiya?
english: What is your younger sister’s name?

tay: Yabong ralo' ni ka sose' mo kanel hiya.
english: My younger sister’s name is Yabung.

tay: pira' ingkaṟalan ni ka asoṟan so malikoṟ?
english: How old is your elder brother?

tay: malapṟow ṟamagal ingkaṟalan ni ka hiya la.
pira' ingkaṟalan ni ka sose' so malikoṟ?
english: How old is your younger brother?

tay: ṟamagal ingkaṟalan ni ka hiya la.
kelan na papasba'an ci ke' ka alang mamo?
english: Do you have schools in your community?

tay: cel so lonpow patas ci ka alang so?
english: Do you study in your tribe’s school?

tay: ho', yo min na otox moṟow maki ci ka papasba'an ci ke'.
english: Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

tay: amol ka pomahon ni yaya so?
amol ka pomahon ni yaba' so?
aṟat, rangi' ni sose' mo malikoṟ ka hiya.
english: No, he is my younger brother’s friend.

tay: aṟat, sose' mo kanel ka hiya.
english: No, she is my younger sister.
How many people in their family?

tay: ṟamagal ci'oli kora otox moṟow naha.
english: There are five people in their family.
How many children in your family?

tay: paṟat kora' ka ole' moṟow min.
english: There are four children in our family.
How many younger siblings do you have?

tay: ongat ka sose' mo malikoṟ, ga, togal ka sose' mo kanel.
english: I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.
How many older siblings do you have?
I don’t have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?

tay: ho', asoṟan mo malikoṟ ka hiya.
gahṟa' haṟi' ka kaṟal soni, papayox haṟi' ma'abo' ci ose' na makilox.
english: It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

tay: makilox haṟi' ka kaṟal soni, kapayox haṟi' ma'abo' ci ose'.
english: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

tay: yaba' ka wagi' soni taxi' nak haṟi'.
english: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

tay: paṟolongan wa, ongat wagi' ka kaṟal.
english: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

tay: ongat ka wagi' coxan, paṟolongan lo yaba' ka behoṟ oṟi'.
english: It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.
How was the weather that day?

tay: gahṟa' haṟi' soni wa, palokos ci pababawen mosa mamo tanox.
english: It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.
How’s the weather on the weekend?
It will be sunny on the weekend.
Will it be rainy that day?
It will have no rain and be sunny that day.
Will it be rainy that day?
Yes, it will be rainy that day.

tay: masot la, matata' ka wagi' la.
english: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

tay: omolax la, ini' co aras ci taṟasi.
english: It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

tay: ini awalax micow hang. gaben ka pawalax ni, aras ci taṟasi mosa mamo tanox.
english: It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.
Will it be very cold in winter next year?

tay: ho', pakagahṟa' mohla'iy ka kokaṟal, papayox haṟi malokos.
english: Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.
Will it be very hot in summer this year?

tay: ho', pakakilox ka abagan, papayox ma'abo' ci ose'.
english: Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

tay: sonkisli' so ci kaṟal na pakabagan?
holhol ka kaṟal na pakabagan, kisli mo caṟong.
english: I like spring because the weather is warm.

tay: sonkisli' so ci kaṟal na pakmohla'iy?
payox behoṟ ka pakmohla'iy hiya', aṟat mo kisli'.
english: I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

tay: ṟomogi' co maṟas ci patas. la.
english: I forgot to bring the textbook.
I will share it with you.

tay: ṟomongi' co maṟas ci papoṟot. la.
english: I forgot to bring the eraser.
Do you forget to bring your pen?

tay: ho', pakaciki hako ci papatas so aw?
english: Yes, can you lend me a pen?

tay: amol nani'on so cakan na rex aṟ?
english: What would you like for lunch?
What would you like for dinner?

tay: amol kine' so ci ka sasan?
english: What did you have for breakfast?

tay: amol kine' so cakan na rex?
english: What did you have for lunch?

tay: mosa' kalama', han miso malahang kira' la.
english: You go first and I will catch up later.

tay: aṟat co, mamaha' min romili' ci patas.
english: No, we have to carry books first.

tay: ini' na, nel co omox ci ṟating hang.
english: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

tay: innoxan mo ka ṟating mo la.
honco' so ini pema' ci aba'.
english: Why didn’t you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.

tay: pisco' so i malax papasba'an ci ke' la?
english: What are you going to do after school?

tay: pisco' la malax papasba'an ci ke' ka hiya aṟ?
english: What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

tay: ongat moṟow Apiy wa! Iwal co kong, amol la sikalahang so hiyan aṟ? panocan mo i moh ka hiya la.
english: Apiy is not at home. I am Iwal. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

tay: yaki, Sama laha ci Apiy wa, sigawahi' min ci a'alo'!
english: Grandma, we are Sama and Apiy, please open the door for us.

tay: Piyo co kong, moh co malahan Pawanan.
english: I am Piyu, I am here for Pawan.

tay: yaki, nel co matox sinang la ga.
english: Grandma, I am here to see you.

tay: lonlongon miso caṟong la wa, bose' so ini' awah la.
english: You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

tay: moh co tikiy salahaw sinang ga.
english: I am here to play with you.

tay: bose' co nak palamoh sinang la, awah matatama ṟik.
english: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

tay: talami mani' ka ngahi' pinmohi' mo hani.
english: This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!
The sweet potato is so sweet.

tay: awah! talami' mani ka pinnahgalan pinmohi' mo.
english: Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

tay: tatama'! talami mani ka atiy pinmohi' mo aṟat pinse'en ci ayo' kani.
english: Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

tay: aṟ! cacibing ni'on ka atiy hani. wa!
english: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

tay: pakani co ci ringgo ini co kani ci namoro' kong.
english: I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.
Let me peel the fruit for you.

tay: payox aṟingo' ka pinnahgalan hani wa, bahbah so.
english: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

tay: siagal miso ci ose' a'abon aw?
english: I will bring you some water.

tay: kapapox mani' kay, payox tinnahok mo ka raramat.
english: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

tay: aṟ! talangay ramas ni'on ramas sinkanaxan ni.
english: Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

tay: kapayox mani', hongel nel sani na.
english: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.
I’ll make myself at home then.

tay: kapayox mani', hongel nel sani na.
english: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

tay: payox kine' mo la, tana' la wa.
english: I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

tay: rarason min ni nanahi' ni sinsi' kira'.
english: I will take you to the mountains today.

tay: payox potot nanahi' ma ka yaya.
english: Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

tay: rason ta ni momaṟah ni sinsi' kira'.
english: I will take you to the fields.
Are we going to loosen the soil?

tay: rarason ta ni syaw na loling ni sinsi'.
english: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

tay: rarason ta ni nanahi' ni sinsi'.
english: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

tay: mamaha' ta syaw na loling kira'?
english: Are we going to the riverside today?

tay: aṟat, rarason ta ni nanahi' ni sinsi'.
english: No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.
Are we going to the mountains today?
No, we are going to the fields.

tay: amol halan ta matox syaw na loling sinsi'?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

tay: amol halan ta matox nanahi' sinsi'?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.
What are we going to do in the fields?

tay: mamaha ta matox ci atiy pinmohi' ta momaṟah, taxi' haṟi' ka mama' laha' ci banga' kay.
english: We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

tay: mamaha' ta lomangoy syaw na loling sinsi'?
english: Teacher, are we going to swim in No, we are going to see dragonflies. the river?

tay: aṟat, maha' ta matox ci lalosan.
english: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

tay: mamaha' ta mamohi' ci ṟago' momaṟah sinsi'?
english: Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?
We are going to loosen the soil today.

tay: cel molaka' saca kora' ka lalosan.
nanak soni' mintox co ci minyanox na lalosan kong.
english: Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

tay: cel molaka' saca kora' ka ṟapiriy.
wa! talagay kinramasan taxan ka ṟapiriy, kisli' mo caṟong.
english: Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

tay: cel molaka' saca kora' ka ṟapiriy.

english: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

tay: iya' osa' tohya' caṟong kay, katox sani tana' la.
english: Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

tay: iya' tatalang, kinhayow maskakiy mayakoṟa' mamo'.
english: Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.
I want to see them right away.
How do you go to the block-house?

tay: yo naino' mosa' moṟow ising ka hiya?
english: How does he go to the hospital?

tay: maskakiy mosa' moṟow ising ka hiya.

english: How do you go to Penghu?

tay: patapanga co ci hikoki' mosa Pongho.
english: I go to Penghu by plane.
How do you go to Penghu?

tay: patapanga co ci hone' mosa pongho.
english: I go to Penghu by boat.

tay: patapanga so ci amol mosa moṟow?
tapanga' co ci ceyon mosa moṟow.
Yabong' patapanga' so ci amol mosa papasba'an ci ke'?
english: How does Yabung go to school?

tay: tapanga' kisya mosa papasba'an ci ke' ka Temi.
english: Temi goes to school by train.

tay: patapanga' ci amol mosa kiyokay ka Pawan?
english: How does Pawan go to church?
Pawan goes to church by bicycle.

tay: tapanga' so ci ceyon mosa' papasba'an ci ke'?
english: Do you go to school by MRT?

tay: aṟaṟt, tapanga' co ci baso' mosa papasba'an ci ke'.
english: No, I go to school by bus.

tay: paritensy'a so mosa' papasba'an ci ke'?
english: Do you go to school by bicycle?

tay: ho', pascitensya co mosa' papasba'an ci ke'.
english: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

tay: patapanga so ci kawte mosa Taka'o?
english: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

tay: ho', patapanga so ci kawte mosa Taka'o.
english: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

tay: patapanga so ci kisya' hala hikoki' mosa tayto'?
english: Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

tay: patapanga' co ci hikoki', halilaw tehok ka hikoki' laha ci kisya'.
english: I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

tay: patapanga' so ci baso hala pataoṟit ci ṟaṟolo' mosa' kiyokay?
english: Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

tay: patioṟit co ci ṟaṟolo' mosa kiyokay, omabas mamicow tehok ka pati'oṟit ci ṟaṟolo' laha ci ka tapangan baso.
english: I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.
Is the market close to your house?

tay: tapanga' co ci otobay mosa sobsy, tohya' haṟi wa.
english: No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

tay: sibeh papasba'an ci ke' ka yobing?
english: Is the post office close to the school?

tay: sibeh wa, tehkan micow i maskakiy.
english: Yes, it is within walking distance.
Is the restaurant close to the station?

tay: matata' nanon ṟaṟolo', maskakiy tikiy la ga, tehok la.
english: It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.
I would like to visit you.

tay: babow ni la wa, aṟat co pakiki moṟow kira' kelan na a'osa mo.
english: I am out today. How about another day?

tay: mahngow so coxan? halan miso malahang gaben kay?
english: Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

tay: ho' ga, non miso moṟow mo.
english: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

tay: silo'ing miso kay? papatasan mo ka pintasalan ta.
english: Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.
Would you mind if I do the video recording?

tay: iya' aw. beco ramas taxan, mahahobo'' ka koho' mo oṟi'.
english: No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.
Then I will just take photos.
Thank you for accepting the interview.

tay: ini' haco', amol ka kakaṟal so?
english: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

tay: amol pinmahon so ci ka se'eneng so hang?
english: What do you do when you are young?

tay: minkensaco' co rali' hang, malax co micow la.
english: I was a police officer but I am retired now.
Then, are you working at the moment?

tay: nel co mosa momaṟah papasba'an ci ke'.
nel maki alang ka ole' so oṟi'?
english: Do your kids live in the tribe too?

tay: ini, cel maki alang yaba' ka ole' mo.
english: No, my kids are all living in the city.
Then, do you live by yourself?

tay: totox ka hoṟil lo otox ka kabahni' nel mo rangon, yominna otox moṟow.
english: I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

tay: otox ka ngaw nel mo rangon oṟi', inikino' ka kelan na gagigan.
english: I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

tay: magamol ka gagaṟox na moloṟak mamo' hiya.
english: I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

tay: aṟat payox ka kinnoba' mo, ga' pa'ocan miso ci kinnaba'on mo.
english: I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

tay: magamol ka gagaṟox mamo ci babingon na mosa maloṟak?
english: Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

tay: ini pabingi' kanel ka babingon na maloṟak hiya.
english: Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

tay: mosa lonoli' maloṟak ka kanel oṟi' aw?
english: Then, can women go hunting together?

tay: ini' osa lonoli' maloṟak ka kanel oṟi'.
english: No, women cannot go hunting either.

tay: Piyo, osa miniy ci agow ongat agow moṟow ta la.
english: Piyu, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

tay: cel pabitaṟakan kotox sosok na, iya' biniy hang!
english: There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

tay: ini' tana' otox sosok, osa' miniy sa'ing sosok moh so kay.
english: One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

tay: pabiniy co ci agow, kelan baninaron mamo?
english: I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

tay: kelan wa! pira' ka binaron so?
english: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

tay: sa'ing sosok binaron mo, lo pabiniy co otox cinnabon na box na.
english: I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

tay: nel ka box, amol ka babinaron so na?
english: Here is the rice, what else do you need?

tay: pabiniy co ci baṟing na, kelan mamo?
english: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

tay: wal so'on miniy ka baṟing min la.

english: I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?

tay: pabiniy co ci porong oṟit na lokos.
english: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

tay: kelan na malabo' lo mokaṟal. oṟɨ'.
english: We have white and blue ones too.

tay: bi'i' co totox lokos mokaṟal aw.
english: Please give me the clothes in blue.

tay: Sapo, minsa so ino' ci micow? minsa so ṟomoy ci hi'?
english: Sapu, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

tay: aṟat, minsa co romow pabiniy ci ṟago' ni yaki mo.
english: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

tay: ox, mahngow so malahngan? moh so gonlow mani mami' kinang.
english: No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

tay: aṟat co, maha co miniy ci lokos.
english: No, I want to buy some clothes.
Then, I will go with you.

tay: ramas so, pira' otox binnahlan ka rago' hani?
english: Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

tay: maposal ka otox binahlan ṟago' hani.
english: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?

tay: matol ka otox toting ngahi' hani.
english: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

tay: bi'i' co tikiy ci ṟago' sa'ing binahlan lo ngahi' otox toting.
english: Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

tay: Piyo', nel co ṟomongi' maras ci papatas la, pakacikiy co hang?
english: Piyu’, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

tay: ongat ka kinang oṟi', Yoman ka hani.
english: I don’t have one either. This is yuma’s.

tay: kacikiy ta tikiy hang? sibi' miso micow.
english: Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

tay: bahbah so, kaṟali' tikiy ka Yoma oṟi kay.
english: Thank you and thank Yuma for me.

tay: nel co moh somato ci sa'ing patas hani.
english: I want to return these two books.

tay: ho'ga, amol ka gagalon so nan?
english: No problem and what else do you need?

tay: pakacit co ci togal patas hani na.
english: I would like to borrow these three books.

tay: ho' ga, iya' ṟongi' wahi' mato' maktogal kay.
english: Sure and remember to return them after three days.

tay: ini' soko' pabinahi ka papoṟot mo na.
english: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

tay: honco' mo ini taxi' ka papoṟot mo la?
english: Then, why is my eraser missing?

tay: ye so wal pakacikan Pawan la?
english: Did you lend it to Pawan?

tay: ini' mo ba'i', hali' mo ma'ot ka hiya.
english: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

tay: pakaciki' miso ka papoṟot mo hang.
english: I will lend you my eraser first.

tay: Yoma, pinkacikan sinang ni Pawan ka lokos pababawen hani?
english: Yuma, did Pawan lend you this coat?

tay: aṟat wa, bininiy kinang ni yaya mo ka hani.
english: No, my mom bought it for me.

tay: mintana sinang ka lokos pababawen ni Temo.
english: Temu’s coat is the same as yours.

tay: makalox ka pababawen ni hiya ini pintana' ka iro' min.
english: His coat is black, so our colors are different.

tay: Temi, konacik so ci pila' ni Piyo?
english: Temi, did you borrow money from Piyu?

tay: ho, halan mo mato' lake' kira' hiyan, ga, ṟomongi' co maras ci pila' la.
english: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.
Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.

tay: ho' ga, han mo komaṟal ka Piyon.
english: Okay, I will tell Piyu for you.

tay: cobay hiya ga, karapon na kato' pasiliy ka olit hiya lo piyori' ga, kaṟapon na waṟo' hiya.
english: It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

tay: koba' nak yonani, yaga cobay ini' bah magal, magoṟow ka pinsa' mo.
english: No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

tay: pasba'on miso sobale' ci kato' sa'ing hani.
english: Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

tay: ho' wa! at kinramasan! pa'agal co babow ni la.
english: Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

tay: hamagal ka keweh cel soko', babawi' ka kaman momaṟah ta la, mamaha' ta momaṟah.
english: The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

tay: maṟok so soko' la ga, cel bang na baloko' taxan so la.
english: It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

tay: taxi' haṟi kay, pihoṟi' ka keweh haca.
english: Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

tay: iya kilkahi' ka kato' mo kay!
cel yaho' na kahoni' ka kato' mo.
english: My trap is under that tree.

tay: ba'on mo nak pinsa' mo' kato' hani, cel nak ki ka pinkegal mo.
english: I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

tay: kobo' kani, paposon min syaw na loling kakaṟak ci ocyox.
english: This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

tay: ongat la kobo' camingan, panyek min na baboli' cami.
english: We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

tay: aṟat co mining ci panekan na, pasba'i' hako' babow ni la wa?
english: I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

tay: ho' ga! paglow ta mosa' panyak babow ni la.
english: Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

tay: pasba'on miso sonbale' ci kobo' babow ni la.
english: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

tay: cel maṟoy ka panekan so la ga, kelan na ocyox tari'on la! as holo'i'.
english: Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

tay: iya' hang kay, maṟoy caṟong ka hone' hani, paholoy co sani ci panekan, hemagal ka ami' mo cel saca.
english: Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

tay: holo'i' sani ka ocyox so, ragan miso homoloy.
english: Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

tay: at kinramasan caṟong soni wa! pahponan na ocyox kora' ka ami' la.
english: Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

tay: nainah ta magiy, halan ta mapoli' ka cel moṟow haca.
english: Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

tay: sasaṟox la wa! sonṟaho' co la.
rex ṟamagal soni', mahngow coxan la, hata maglow salahaw aw?
english: It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!

tay: ho' ga! hata' syaw na loling.
english: Great! Let’s go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

tay: rex togal coxan, hata' salahaw boro' coxan gaben aw?
english: Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!
What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

tay: pahngagan rex coxan, maha' min kiyokay ci yaya' mo.
english: Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.
I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

tay: sinsi', moxal ka labos mo, maha' co mastanox.
english: Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

tay: anak co mosa' mema' ci aba' ga?
english: May I go wash my hands?

tay: osa' kira' haṟi la, pahngow ta' haṟi la.
english: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

tay: sinsi', moxal ka tonox mo, pahngow co gaben la.
english: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

tay: ho', katox haṟi mosa' so' moṟow.
english: Okay, take care and go home.

tay: sinsi', pahngow co babow rex otox hani, maha' co paktox ising.
english: Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

tay: ho', bale' malahang ci hi' so'.
moxal ka labos ni, cel mastanox.
english: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

tay: sinsi', cel moxal na olo' ka Temo, mahngow soni'.
english: Teacher, Temu has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

tay: Watan Nawi co kong, malapṟow ingkaṟalan mo la.
english: My name is Watan Nawi, and I’m 10 years old.
What ethnic group are you from?
Are all your family members indigenous?

tay: ho' wa, Itaṟal kora' otox moṟow min.
english: Yes, my whole family is Atayal.
Are all your family members indigenous?

tay: aṟat, Itaṟal ka yaba' mo hiya', Pamokan ka yaya' mo.
english: No, my father is Atayal, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

tay: ole' so' ni ima' ka iso'?
ole' co ni Watan Nawi kong.
yaba' so' ka haca? pira' ingkaṟalan ni la?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

tay: yaba' so' ka haca? pira' ingkaṟalan ni la?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

tay: aṟat, nabkis alang min ka hiya', maspat mapgan ka ingkaṟalan ni la.
english: No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

tay: pira' ingkaṟalan naka asoṟan so' malikoṟ la?
malapṟow maspat ingkaṟalan naka asoṟan mo malikoṟ la.
mastohya' la ingkaṟalan mamo ci asoṟan so' malikoṟ?
english: Is your brother much older than you?

tay: otox kabhol maspatol ka kinbabawen mo.
bose' ta' ini' pakakatox la, ya so' wal morkes la?
english: I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

tay: ho' wa, otox kabhol matol kinbabawen mo la.
ho', matol toting kinsagan mo micow la.

english: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.
He’s going to throw away the trash.

tay: cel lalangoyan ki, pacacapong lomangoy kira' haṟi ka hiya'.
english: He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

tay: cel ino' ka Yoma? pacacapong tomalang kira' haṟi ka hiya'.
english: Where is Yuma? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

tay: cel pasasilen ki, hali mo malawa'.
english: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.
Let’s go to the playground together.

tay: maha' co miniy ci nani'on cakan rex hang, halan miso' malahang kira' haṟi la.
english: I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.

tay: paglow ta' mosa' romili' ci tinbili'!
english: Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

tay: kalahang ci ci'oli' ka iso', maha' co malahang sinsi' kong.
english: You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

tay: pacacapong tomoting ci boro' kira' ka Yawi aw?
english: Is Yawi competing in croquet today?
No, he’s competing in high jump.

tay: macacapong tomalang ci kaca ga, pacacapong so' oṟi?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

tay: macacapong tomalang ci kaca ga, pacacapong so' oṟi?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

tay: pisco' ta' patatalaman ki ci kaca ka ita'?
english: What will we do in the sports day?
We will compete in tug of war.

tay: paginbiniy ta' ci nani'on matatalang ci kaca?
english: Will we sell food at the sports day?

tay: hapṟow so' caṟong! magal so' ti'imin!
english: Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!
Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

tay: ongat, wal tanox ci micow, malahngan onel ni moṟow la.
english: No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

tay: cel mabel nikay. hali malahang bawi' ga.
english: He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

tay: koba' nak Temi, bose' miso' ini' taxi la, ramas so'?
english: It’s Temi. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

tay: ramas co ay! moh co matisal sinang.
english: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

tay: cel patakalox ci ṟago' nane'an ki, hali mo malawa' hang.
english: He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

tay: wal konṟak ci gilong obo' gilong ki.
english: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

tay: ongat moṟow yotas mamo. cel momaṟah, na' moṟow hiyan ga.
english: Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

tay: bose' ta' ini' pakakatox la, wal so' morkes la.
english: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.
It’s so good to see you.

tay: ni ka sapoto' hani, hali posa' pingsyang hang.
english: Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

tay: talagay so' kinbose' ini' awah la! sipalawa' mo moh mani' kora' naha hang.
english: It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

tay: eri' nak la, ma'abo' co ci ocya laga ramas la. papatisal ta' cacka' na moṟow.
english: No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

tay: bahbah so' caṟong, maha' co moṟow la.
english: Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

tay: nah na kinot ka gilong hani. aras moṟow sahyawi mani'.
english: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

tay: pakakatox ta' papasba'an ci ke' aw? paloing ta'.
english: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

tay: hata' pasasilen ki ga, palokos co ci lokos itaṟal mosa'.
english: Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

tay: ramas taxan ka ṟapak na aṟimox i makṟapak ka alang min. awah malahang kinang i makṟapak laga.
english: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

tay: as ka non nano pakabagan la ong, bose' caṟong la!
english: That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?
Then come during our Harvest Festival!
Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

tay: honco' so' maha' maki alang la?
english: May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.

tay: honco' so' ini' pasba' patas alang banox?
english: Why not teach in the city?

tay: longlong co nak alang mo, hita co comik nak ci alang mo.
english: Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

tay: ba' so caṟong tomino', ima' pisba' sinang?
english: You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

tay: yaki' mo, ba' caṟong tomino' maki' alang ka hiya'.
english: It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

tay: honco' so' maksonbaba' tomino' ka iso'?
english: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

tay: gagaṟox min nak ka tomino', maklomohing co nak ci gagaṟox mo.
english: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

tay: ramas caṟong abon ka agow cobay hani.
ba' so' caṟong wa, bose' sinbale'an ka hani?
english: You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

tay: ini', otox ṟinogan laga tana' la. maho'il tinahkan ka rangil lo box laga, imagon ci tamol kaca ka poson tahan la.
english: No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

tay: kelan na orik lo inow kocon, pinmohi' mo nak kora' kay!
english: I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

tay: binaron mo kora' sa'ing, maha pira' pila' la?
kisli' mo ka lokos hani, pira' pila' la?
english: I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

tay: maskito' caṟong la, ṟakah mahyow haṟi aw?
english: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

tay: ṟakah, mahyow caṟong laga maha co parara'iy la.
english: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

tay: ho' ga! pa'agal co totox ci makalox na lokos.
english: Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

tay: galon mo ka boli' lo tepeh hani.
english: I want this knife and this pot.

tay: maposal kabhol kora', sinbale' mo nak na aba' ka hani, maha so' bose' bingon.
english: It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

tay: anak mahyow haṟi na? pa'aras co ci rangi' mo moh miniy.
english: I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?
Alright! I’ll get you a discount..

tay: awah awah matox, kelan kora' ka lokos lo tamoko'.
english: Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

tay: otox lokos ga togal ṟamagal kabhol, togal lokos laga malapṟow kabhol la.
english: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

tay: tana' otox binaron mo la, bi'iy co ci ga'aṟos ni.
english: I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

tay: ramas so', makminiy co ci mami' rangil lo asinow pinnahkan na ma'ow.
english: Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

tay: maso' miniy ka mami' hiya' la, kelan co na tana' kapah na, pabiniy so' aw?
english: The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

tay: ho' ga! bi'iy co totox, mamoh co miniy ci mami' babow ni la.
english: Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

tay: ho', ta'oṟiy mo kapa, marimal karetan kora'.
english: Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.

tay: lawkah cimo kahabaag! manaringay ta' la.
english: Please stand up! Salute the teacher!

tay: tikow papasibaq mo icimo kisa' ga, nanowan san ko nananiqon.
english: Today the teacher is going to teach you how to talk about food.

tay: baqon so' kayi' ni papasibaq qow?
english: Do you understand what the teacher says?

tay: papasibaq, ini' mo baqi. pakabalayq so' komaal lawwiy co qotox qow?
english: I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

tay: ini' mo pongi, karahowal tikay ko kayi' so' qow?
english: I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

tay: kitaal i roni, galgiy kowing i lompow co qotox.
english: Look here, please! Repeat after me.

tay: yani! balayq cobalay ko linpow mamo.
english: Yes! You have read it very well.

tay: lpow lawwiy co qotox, karahowal ko hanaang.
english: Read it again. Please speak louder.

tay: papasibaq, ongian mo maras ko papateq la.
english: I forgot to bring my pen.

tay: papasibaq, ongian mo maras ko papawng co pinateq la.
english: I forgot to bring my eraser.

tay: kabawx coko bays so' co papawng co pinateq.
english: Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

tay: kabaxay mo ko papawng co pinateq so' qow?
pasikiaw ta' i roni makibaq han, makitalay ta' lawwiy i casan.
olaqi' kowing ni Payan, ralo' mo ga Hayong.
english: I’m Payan’s son, my name is Hayung.

tay: Sayon a ralo' mo, pasibaqan kowing ni papasibaq Tayax.
english: My name is Sayun and I’m a student at Tayax.
Mom and Dad are safe and healthy, thank you!

tay: Baay na Payan ralo' ni yaba' mo.
yolah mo ihya', Bawnay ko ralo' niya'.
english: He’s my brother, his name is Bawnay.

tay: hiya' ga Kawban, yata' mo ihya'.
ihya' ga rawin mo, ralo' niya' ga Bagan.
english: She’s a friend of mine, her name is Bagan.

tay: piya' a kaal so' ka hani?
magalpow a kaal mo ka hani.
piya' a kaal niya' ka hani la?
magalpow co rosa' a kaal niya' ka hani.
piya' a kaal ni yaba' so' ka hani?
maymal kaal ni yaba' mo ka hani.

english: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

tay: kiya a caxa' yolah mo, caxa' iyah, ro' caxa' ko sowayi' mo na kanayril.
english: I have a brother, a sister, and a younger sister.

tay: papiya' cimo ka qotox co imowag?
english: How many people are in your family?

tay: saspat cami ka qotox co imowag.
english: There are four of us in our family.

tay: kiya kowing mateq i papatiqan Tabilas.
english: I went to primary school in Wenshui.

tay: nanowan ko patowawon ni mama' so'?
english: What does your uncle do for a living?

tay: kiya i matwwaw iyah so' qow?
english: Does your sister have a job?

tay: kiya matwwaw i papakitalan co moxaal.
owal, ibabaweq cami kahabaag ka qotox co imowag.
english: Yes, we are all very tall.

tay: mateq i sowayi' so' na kanayril laqow?
english: Does your sister go to school?

tay: baaq komaal co kayi' na Itaal ko sowasowayi' so' qow?
english: Do your brothers and sisters speak the language?

tay: owal, baaq komaal co kayi' na Itaal naha'.
english: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.

tay: qotox kakian so' ki yaba' yaya' qow?
english: Do you live with your parents?

tay: owal ga, maglow kowing ki yaba', yaya'.
english: Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

tay: maglow so' ki yotas, yaki' qow?
english: Do you live with your grandparents?

tay: ini', ini' kowing paglow ki nha'.
english: No, I didn't live with them.

tay: maglow kowing ki yaba', yaya' ro yolah.
english: I live with my father, mother and brother.

tay: kiya i Mabatoan ko imowag niyam.
english: Our home is in Ching An.

tay: kiya i Tinabolan ko tiqalangan mo.
kiya i Yawas ko tinqalangan niyam.
maosa' so' kanowan i tinqalangan mamo?
english: When are you going back to the tribe?

tay: mohngeq kowing i mohngeq gabagan ko papatiqan ga mosa' kowing i tiqalangan.
english: I will go back in the summer.

tay: pakahtow a wagi' la, makilox cobalay.
english: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?
It's cold, so wear more clothes.

tay: ini' kagihaaq, ini' owiy ow kakilox sawni', balayq cobalay a kisleq.
english: It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

tay: okas a hamhom i babaw na kaal, pakahtow a boliqow la.
english: There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

tay: yani na' masowat ko qowalax, matowagi' ro' pakahtow a hakri' na otox la.
english: The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

tay: homicowa' ko kaal tagi ki cimo kiya?
sabayhow co mamati' tagi ki cami i roni.
english: We're going to have a big storm here.

tay: balayq a kaal tagi ki iso' qow?
