english: Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.

tay: tala'to' a kaal, kapayox masiyato' co siyato'.
english: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.
I'm going out for a walk.

tay: pakrahowal a qowalax i kisa', laxi ongi' maras co hawsowa.
english: It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

tay: yani na' mabico sawni', paqowalax cobalay kisa'.
english: There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.
It just rained, and now it's stopped.

tay: asiga qominowalax la, mahoweq a raneq.
english: It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

tay: qominowalax qow? micowa' so' ka asika howehoweq?
english: Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

tay: qomowalax tagi latanox, ini' kowing aras co hawsowa.
english: It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

tay: rahowal ko bayhow omiyop, moxaal a tonox mo.
english: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

tay: mamati' a wagi', maimag siptokakayran mo na tonox.
english: The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.

tay: omongi' ci maras co papateq la.
english: I forgot to bring my pen.

tay: omongi ci maras co qaqoway la.
english: I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

tay: ini' co aras owiy, halay ta' mabaynay.
english: I don't have one either, let's go buy one.

tay: halay ta' i mabaynay co papatas qow?
english: Let's go buy a pen, shall we?

tay: owal, pabaynay kowing na' co papawng co pinatas.
english: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

tay: halay ta' i mabaynay co kaknamaon qow?
english: Let's go get breakfast, shall we?
No, I've already eaten at home.

tay: ongian mo homakhok ko sibileq mo la.
english: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

tay: ongian mo maras ko sibileq mo la.
english: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

tay: nano' niqaw ta' kawsa' ko sibileq mo ga!
english: Then let's eat my lunch box together!

tay: nanowan ko naniqon so' i qaliyan?
english: What are you having for lunch?

tay: paqaneq kowing co naniqon na papatiqan.
english: I want a nutritious school lunch.

tay: paqaneq so' co nanowan i qaliyan?
english: What are you having for lunch?

tay: maras kowing co sibileq sawni', magalgay ta' maneq i qaliyan.
english: I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!

tay: halay ta' i magonawo' co mari' qow?
english: Let's go play ball, shall we?

tay: halay ta' i tomoting co mari' qow?
alani kowing co cacaping han qow.
english: Please help me with the broom.

tay: owal, biqanay miso' ko cacapoh kahani.
english: Okay, here's a broomstick for you.

tay: alani kowing co capang han qow?
english: Can you help me with the cloth?

tay: kiya kowing comapoh, alani kowing kosa i Amoy.
english: I'm sweeping the floor, ask Amuy to help you.

tay: kiya kowing comaping, alani kowing kosa i Amoy.
english: I'm sweeping the floor, ask Amuy to help you.

tay: maorag ko raralan, osaliy comawm tikay.
english: The floor table is very dirty, go wipe it.

tay: owal, halay kowing magal co cacawm.
maorag coqaang ko tohong kahaca, osaliy comawm tikay.
english: That window is very dirty, go clean it.

tay: ini' na', ini' mo na' naqariy comapoh ko i roni.
english: Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.

tay: nanowan ko waw so' i kisa'?

english: I'm going to see my teacher.

tay: nanowan ko waw so' i mohngeq mateq?
english: What do you do after school?

tay: maosa' kowing gomlow coko rawin mo i maqowas.
english: I'm going to sing with my friends.

tay: nanowan ko waw niya' i mohngeq matas?

english: He said he was going swimming.
She’s at home, please come in.

tay: okas wala, kiya a waw so' qow?
english: She's not here. What can I do for you?

tay: otas, Tawyo' kowing, gawah co balihon.
english: Grandfather, I am Tawyu', please open the door.

tay: Bawto', Maya' kowing, mowah kowing komiyom iso'.
english: Bawtu', I'm Maya', I've come to see you.

tay: ingasow ta' cobalay ini' pakitaal la.
english: It's been a long time since we last met.

tay: owal wala! longolongon mi so' cobalay, nabibowiy owah ga, maskakaroay ta'.
english: Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let's chat!
Please sit down and have some tea first.

tay: waw! balayq cobalay nobown ko cha mamo.
ca ga! maniqay ta' co oqooqo'.
owal, talan ga kiiy cobalay balayq ko oqooqo' ka hani.
owal yo! sahahiya' cobalay i niqon.
manaqro' tomahok co kakagabiyan i yaya' la, nabowibowiy owah i maneq ga.
english: Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!

tay: owal, mimaay kowing co qaba' han.
english: Okay, I'll go wash my hands.

tay: kakaya i maneq, baliy ta' coqoleq.
english: Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you're not an outsider.

tay: payox niqon mo la, matngi' cobalay la.
english: I ate a lot, I'm full.

tay: kapayox tikay maneq, laxi ko mobaga'.
maosa' kowing la, wahay mi so' mitaal lawwiy i babaw niya'.
english: I'm leaving, I'll see you next time.

tay: mahantan la, maosa' kowing imowag la.
owah lawwiy magonawo' i babaw niya' yo!
owal, kiya hreq na waw so' ga owah magonawo' i imowag mo.
english: Okay, come to my house sometime.

tay: lawkah cimo kahabaag! rarason cimo kisa' ni papasibaq i tinqalangan na Itaal mitaal co nanabakis na Itaal.
english: Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

tay: owal ga, sawbeh ta' patayhik la.
otas, mowah cami mitaal iso' la!
english: Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

tay: waw! baaq cimo komaal co kayi' na Mato'owal! balayq cobalay!
english: Wow! You would say Matuuwal! That’s great!

tay: lawkah cimo kahabaag! rarason cimo kisa' ni papsibaq lomaco' co ki'man na torakis.
english: Hello everyone, today my teacher is going to take you to pull out the weeds of millet.

tay: owah kahabaag tibalong i roni, laxi ongiiy maras ko paptawwa mamo.
english: Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

tay: owal, papasibaq, magal cami kahabaag co papatawwaw la.
english: Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.
Not yet, it’s still far away.

tay: Pihaw, osa' i poqosiya' iso' co pahpah qow?

english: You go get the bird catcher.

tay: owal, halay ci papagiyay co kabahneq.
english: Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

tay: lawkah cimo kahabaag! maosa' ta' i aangayan co waqbox i kisa'.
english: Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

tay: yani wala! paphicowa' ta' i mosa'?
english: Awesome! How are we going to get there?

tay: nababalayq i tibalong, pabaynay ta' co gaglow la.
english: Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

tay: powg ga kakbahneq, qoroqoro' ko tagi sog, gowagiy nanak cimo.
english: There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

tay: hanoan ga, nano' osa' omangay co kakabahneq na iso'.
english: It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

tay: qotox pincapngan co wagi' lga masaotoay ta' i roni lawwiy.
english: We’ll meet back here in an hour.

tay: payox cobalay ko kintalan mo ka qoro' ro balayq talan ka kakbahneq.
english: I saw a lot of snakes, and a lot of beautiful birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.

tay: ini' na', ma'oway a kokoy mo.
english: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

tay: magalgay ta' mosa' i lomangoy qow?
habaag cobalay a itaal kiya lomangoy i roni.
english: There are a lot of people swimming here.

tay: yayk a qosiya' i tagi haca, asi ta' langoy i roni.
english: The water is deep there, so we just swim here.

tay: gomilow so' kolo' na nanowan co mowah?
english: What kind of car did you take?
How do you go to church?

tay: rason co na kolo' ni yaba'.
homicowa' mosa' papatiqan kariariax i hiya'?
english: How does he usually go to school?

tay: gomlow na ciyeyon mosa' papatiqan i hiya'.
english: He took the subway to school.

tay: homicowa' mosa' mabaynay co raramat i yaki' so'?
english: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

tay: miray co otobay mosa' mabaynay co raramat i hiya'.
english: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.
How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

tay: paglow ci co parnah mosa' i Lanyo.
english: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.
How did he get to Orchid Island?

tay: paglow na kolo' na manbahaag mosa' Lanyo i hiya'.
english: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

tay: golow na nanowan mosa' Kawsiyong i hiya?
english: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

tay: gominlow na kawtiye' mosa' Kawsiyong i hiya'.
english: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

tay: gominlow na kolo' na haponeq mosa' Taytong i hiya' qow?
english: Did he take a train to Taitung?

tay: owal, gomlow na kolo' na haponeq mosa' Taytong i hiya'.
english: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

tay: gominlow na kolo' na haponeq mosa' Taytong i hiya' qow?
english: Did he take a train to Taitung?

tay: iqaat, gomlow na kolo' na manbahaag mosa' Taytong i hiya'.
english: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

tay: kiya a nanaan co bas' tagi rowni qow?
english: Is there a bus stop near here?

tay: kiya ga, osaosa' tiykay ro' tatalan ko nanaan co bas' la.
english: Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

tay: kiya ino' ko maksasawbeh i roni ka nanaan co ciyeyon?
english: Where is the nearest MRT station?

tay: okas a ciyeyon i roni, paasiy so' glow co takosi' la.
english: There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

tay: pakakitowa' kiningasow ga patayhok i papatiqan?
english: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

tay: cakaan ro cakaan pincapngan co wagi' ga tayhok i papatiqan.
gomlow co kawtiye' aring Taype' ro Taycong ga kitowa' pincapng co wagi' ga patayhok?
english: How long does it take to take the THSR from Taipei to Taichung?

tay: qotox pincapngan co wagi' ga tayhok la i Taycong.
english: I will come to Taichung in an hour.

tay: mogoaring Cirong miray co kolo' ga pakingasow tayhok i Ulay qow?
english: Is it a long drive from Keelung to Wulai?

tay: iy okas a tomokyi' i raraneq ga, patayhok i qotox pincapng co wagi'.
english: If the road condition is good, it will take about an hour to get there.

tay: gomlow si co ciyeyon mowah imowag mo ga, pakingasow qow?
english: Did it take you long to come to my house by subway?

tay: baaq si gomlow na tamayray qow?
english: Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

tay: pakbalayq mi so' i paqocan qow?
pakbalayq mi so' i paqocan qow?
laxi, ini' kapayox ko baqon mo.
english: Don't, I don't know much about it.

tay: kiya hreq na waw si qaliyan qow? pakbalayq i wahan mi so' maqot qow?
english: Are you free this afternoon? I'd like to visit you, is that okay?
Okay, I'll wait for you at home.

tay: kiya a hreq na waw si casan qow? papaqot ci iso' co wawwaw na nanabakis na Itaal cownga'.
english: Are you free tomorrow? I would like to ask you about the legendary stories of the Atayal people.

tay: maosa' ci ragiyax casan, pakaokas ci imowag yo!
english: I'm going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won't be home.

tay: iso' ko paqocay ta' mha co gi', pongan ko kayi ga, iso' cobalay ko baaq co wawwaw ro' Gagagaga' na nanabakis na Itaal cownga'.
english: I heard that you are very knowledgeable about the traditional customs of the Atayal and would like to ask you a few questions.

tay: ini' kapayox a baqon mo, asikinaga kiya ko baqon mo ga baliy ci palqing comiyok.
english: I don't know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

tay: pakbalayq i alan mo co qalimo' qow? nakiy ani kanowan ga parhorhow ca linanglong ko waw kahani.
english: Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

tay: paya' a kaal si la kahani?
maqiso' kinamlapgan co mamaspat kaal mo kahani la.
masilolox so' co lawkah so' wala! ini' patoqaqalinga' a linanglong so'.
english: 98 also? You live a long and healthy life! You're still thinking clearly.

tay: aqeh la! nabakis ci la cobalay.
Itaal ko kanayril so' owiy qow?
english: Is your wife also an Atayal?

tay: baaq si komaal co kayi' na nonowan?
baaq ci komaal co kayi' na Mato'owal, To'ya', Sipoto' ro' baaq co hayhayi' co kayi' na Kamciyolang owiy.
english: I speak Brunei Atayal, Mandarin, Hakka and Minnan.

tay: paqason mo cobalay ko pinaskakaro' mi ki iso' sawni', kalani tikay ko pisaneq na qaqalowaap qow?
english: It's a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

tay: owal, mamati' ci mosa' qomalowaap i ragiyax co mogomalak co na'.
english: Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

tay: mahoway so'! balayq cobalay ko pinasibaq so' kowing sawni'.
english: Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

tay: cobalay ko pinqaqwo' mo sawni ka sinbil na nanabakis.
english: All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

tay: pasikiaw ti roni ko pinskakaro' ta', mahoway so' cobalay ka sipasbabaq cami kahabaag.
english: That's all for today's interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

tay: kaa obaga'! maskakaroay ta' babaw niya' lawwiy.
maosa' ci la, nagaaw mi mowng babaw niya' lawwiy ko wawwaw na nanabakis cowonga' ka payox.
english: I'm going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.

tay: owal la! nahahiyaw i mosa' kiy! mapapogagagayay ta' la!
english: Okay! Take care. See you later.

tay: lawkah so'! nanowan ko babinason so'?
english: Hello, what are you looking for?
I want to buy a cup.

tay: lawkah so'! pabaynay so' co nanowan?
english: Hello, what do you want to buy?

tay: pabaynay ci co qotox a qabobing.
english: I want to buy a hat.

tay: pabaynay ci co taronaw, matbaynay cimo qow?
english: I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?
Yes, how many do you want to buy?

tay: okas, ini' cami patibaay co pinnong.
english: No, we don't sell betel nut.

tay: piya' co cabo' ko babinason so'?
english: How many packs do you want to buy?
I want to buy sweet potatoes.

tay: giqaron i matbaynay ko bonga' la.
english: All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

tay: pabanay ci co osayng tahosan papkarangi'.
english: I want to buy two bottles of cooking oil.

tay: qotox nanak tahosan ko tha nha' na bininasan.
english: We only have one bottle left.
How many pounds do you want to buy?

tay: piya' tintin ko bato' ka babinason so'?
english: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?
I want to buy two catties.

tay: pabaynay ci co osayng bhol a nigi'.
english: I want to buy two onions.

tay: togal co bhol nanak ko kiya la, biyanay mi so' kahabaag la.
english: There are three left, you can have them all!

tay: piya' pila' ko qotox cabo' ka bowax kahani?
english: How much is this bag of rice?

tay: maposal co qown pila' kahabaag, hanoan i maposal pila' la.
mamaqiso' kinamlapgan co imagal pila' kahabaag i roni.
towangay mo tikay lawwiy, siqonaw ta' co kabhol pila'.
english: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

tay: asi mo bayqiy co imagal kabhol pila' qow?
mamati' coqaang ko hani la, pakbalayq i mahnok tikay qow?
english: It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

tay: aqeh yo! anaga mahnok cobalay ko hani lga.
english: No, this is already very cheap.
I want this bag of cookies.

tay: matol pila' ko pingkan kahani, paagal si co roma' ka qaraqarax na' qow?
english: The cookies are $30, anything else you need?

tay: pakbalayq ci kabawx co pila' ki iso' qow?
english: Can I borrow money from you?
Yes! How much do you need?

tay: omongi' ci maras co pila' la, pakbalayq ci kabawx co pila' ki iso'qow?
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

tay: ini' co aras co pila' wala!
english: I don't have any money either!

tay: omongi' ci maras co pila' la, pakbalayq ci kabawx co pila' ki iso' qow?
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

tay: iys, ini' so' pasayogiy kowing na' ko kinabaxan ka pila' cko yani.
english: No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

tay: pakbalayq mo kabaxan ko sitowing so' qow?
pakbalayq mi kabaxan ko rowas so' qow?
kabaxay ta' ko tamayray so' qow?
english: Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

tay: owal, asikinaga sato' lawwiy i casan ke!
english: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

tay: qomowalax la, ini' co aras co hawsowa, kabaxay ta' co hawsowa han qow?
english: It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me your umbrella?

tay: qotox nanak ko hawswa mo, taomokay ta' kawsa'.
english: I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

tay: yani ko pinkabawx si kowing coko yani ko rowas kahani, biqanay mi iso' la.
english: This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

tay: nanowan ko rowas ka tatalon so' na', kalani kowing.
english: You can tell me what else you want to read.

tay: papsayogan mi so' kanowan co pila'?
english: When do I have to pay you back?

tay: hanoan, kiya a pila' so' lga kaal la.
english: It doesn't matter, you can talk about it when you have money.

tay: papsayogan si kanowan ko pila mo?
english: When are you going to pay me back?
I'll return it to you tomorrow.

tay: papsayogan si kanowan ko rowas mo?
english: When are you going to return my book?

tay: aqow mi so' sipasayo cohisa' la!
english: Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

tay: pinkabawx so' ni Yokeq ko papateq ka haniy qow?
english: Did Yukeh lend you this pen?

tay: owal, kinabaxan mo ki hiya' sawni'.
english: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

tay: kinabaxan so' ki Yokeh ko papateq ka hani qow?
english: Did you borrow this pen from Yukeh?

tay: iqaat, binaynay ni yaya' ko hani.
english: No, this is what mom bought.

tay: okas a timo' la, osa' kabawx co timo' ki Yoma'.
english: We're out of salt, go borrow some from Yuma'.

tay: osa' komaal Tiwas maha pasayogi ko pila mo.
english: Go and ask Tiwas to return my money.

tay: piya' pila' ko kosa' niya' ki iso'?
english: How much does she owe you?

tay: maosa' ci paparoxaw momowa' co paroxaw.
english: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

tay: somiliyat ci co ki'man ka kehma coqaang, papqosiyaan mi kisa'.
english: There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

tay: papa'owah ko sasiliyat kikow kawso' han qow?
english: Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?
Put it next to the plow rake.
Did you turn over the soil?

tay: yani mo na' tinabol, gagahapan mi kisa'.
english: I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

tay: pakbalayq i hibagon ko pinomowa' so' ka paroxaw la qow?
english: Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

tay: balayq hibagon la ko tamana' ka hani, tikow sina' tigi haca ga aqeh kikon na'.
english: The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

tay: apaaw! kinapayox kinayi' so' ka bonga'.
english: Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

tay: anlo'ani ci somirhow i tawbow han qow?
english: Will you collect it for me?
We're releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

tay: makasion ca wawwaw' a qinleh la.
english: The fish basket has been full of fish.
How do you usually catch fish?
I shoot fish with a spear.

tay: baaq si combo' na bohinow co qboqbox qow?
english: Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

tay: alon mo na talnga', takikol, wahiy… ko qboqbox, mahanano' ga maras ci co xowil ro patos i qomalowaap.
english: I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.
This is the road the boar took.

tay: ra'ro' na bawwak ko hani, kahi' toqiy na bawwak san ko hani.
english: These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

tay: nabowiybowiy mosa' gomawwag ko wahiy ta', asiga tiroweq la.
english: Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

tay: sawkan na xowil la, nabobowisay ti gomlow.
english: The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.

tay: rangay ko hani, a'pox co qawlit.
english: This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.

tay: nanowan ko sokoon so' ka haca?
english: What is that thing you put there?

tay: wahi ko haca, tatiroweq niyam co para'.
english: It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

tay: mahoway cobalay ko Utox na nanabakis, payox cobalay ko qboqbox ka inagal niyam sawni'.
english: Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

tay: owal wala! rasaw ti tinqalangan manbabalayq i qomaso maneq.
english: Yeah! Let's take it back to the tribe and share it!

tay: pasibaqay cimo ni papsibaq kisa' co hacowalon komaal na kayi' na Mato'owal ko qaqasino.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Matuuwal language today.

tay: pasibaqay cimo ni papsibaq kisa' co nanowan san na Mato'owal ko oqooqo'.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Matuuwal language today.

tay: ima' papawng co pinatas ko hani?
siyato' ni Tayax ko haca qo?
iqaat, ciyak ni Maya' ko hani.
papsibaq, ini' kowing aras co rowas.
english: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.

tay: paglo mitaal kinko tagi kiyl so'.
english: Share the book with your classmate next to you.

tay: magaang ko papawng co pinatas mo la.
kabaxanay mo iso' ko papawng co pinatas mo.
english: I will lend you my eraser.

tay: paalax ta' matas la, panabaq i raan mosa' imo.
english: It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

tay: paalax ta' matas la, mapapogagayay ta' kahabaag!
english: The class is over, goodbye everyone.

tay: lawkah ta' kahabaag! ralo' mo ga Boyong.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Buyung.

tay: lawkah ta' kahabaag! ralo' mo ga Takon.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Takun.

tay: Boyong lawkah so'! ikowing ga Ingaw.
Takon lawkah so'! ikowing ga Ingaw.
ikowing ga yaya' ni Iban, ikowing ga Tawyo'.
ikowing ga sowayi' na kanayril ni Iban, ralo' mo ga Ali'.
english: I am Kaynu’s sister. My name is Ali’.

tay: hiya' ga sinsi' mo, ralo' niya' ga Hayong.
hiya' ga qomisowan mo na mamaliko, ralo' niya' ga Qomaw.
nanowan ko ralo' ni qomisowan na kanayril so'?
english: What is your elder sister’s name?

tay: ralo' ni qomisowan na kanayril mo ga Amoy.
english: My elder sister’s name is Amuy.

tay: nanowan ko ralo' ni sowayi' na kanayril so'?
english: What is your younger sister’s name?

tay: ralo' ni sowayi' na kanayril mo ga Tapas.
english: My younger sister’s name is Tapas.

tay: baqon so' ko ralo' niya' qo?
piya' kaal ni qomisowan na mamaliko so' kaal ka hani la?
english: How old is your elder brother?

tay: magalpo co imagal kaal niya' ka hani la.
piya' kaal ni sowayi' na mamaliko so' kaal ka hani la?
english: How old is your younger brother?

tay: imagal kaal niya' ka hani la.
kiya papatasan i tinqalangan mamo qo?
english: Do you have schools in your community?

tay: kiya so' matas i papatasan na tinqalangan qo?
english: Do you study in your tribe’s school?

tay: owal ga, asi cami ga qotox co imo i matas papatasan.
english: Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

tay: hiya' ga qomisowan na kanayril mo.
hiya' ga sowayi' na mamaliko mo.
nanowan ko patowawon ni yaya' so'?
nanowan ko patowawon ni yaba' so'?
hiya' ga sowayi' na mamaliko so' qo?
iqaat, hiya' ga rawin ni sowayi' na mamaliko mo.
english: No, he is my younger brother’s friend.

tay: hiya' ga qomisowan na kanayril so' qo?
iqaat, hiya' ga sowayi' na kanayril mo.
english: No, she is my younger sister.

tay: papiya' kahabaag ko qotox naha' co imo?
english: How many people in their family?

tay: imagal kahabaag ko qotox naha' co imo.
english: There are five people in their family.
How many children in your family?
There are four children in our family.

tay: papiya' ko sowayi' na mamaliko ro sowayi' na kanayril so'?
english: How many younger siblings do you have?

tay: okas sowayi' na mamaliko mo, togal ko sowayi' na kanayril mo.
english: I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.

tay: papiya' ko yolah ro iyah so'?
english: How many older siblings do you have?

tay: okas a yolah ro iyah mo.
english: I don’t have any older siblings.

tay: papiya' ko matasasowayi' na mamaliko ro kanaril so'?
english: How many siblings do you have?

tay: okas a matasasowayi' na mamaliko ro kanayril mo.
owal ga, hiya' ga Itaal owi.
gihaaq tikay ko kaal, kapayox manobowag co qosiya' ka makilox.
english: It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

tay: makilox tikay ko kaal, kapayox manobowag co qosiya'.
english: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

tay: rahwal a wagi', laxi ko omongi' maras co tataomok.
english: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

tay: payox hamhom, okas wagi' i kaal.
english: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

tay: pakaokas wagi' i casan, payox hamhom, rahowal bayho.
english: It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.

tay: homicowa' ko kaal coko riax ka yani?
english: How was the weather that day?

tay: gihaaq tikay kaal coko riax ka hani, pasiyato' co siyato' ka kehma i maosa' lata'.
english: It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.

tay: paphicowa' ko kaal i riax hahangiqan?
english: How’s the weather on the weekend?

tay: pakbalayq ko kaal i riax hahangiqan.
english: It will be sunny on the weekend.

tay: paqowalax i riax ka yani qo?
english: Will it be rainy that day?

tay: pakbalayq ko kaal cko riax ka yani, iqaat paqowalax.
english: It will have no rain and be sunny that day.

tay: paqowalax a kaal cko riax ka yani qo?
english: Will it be rainy that day?

tay: owal, paqowalax coko riax ka yani.
english: Yes, it will be rainy that day.

tay: masowat la, pakahto a wagi' la.
english: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

tay: qomowalax la, ini' kowing aras co hawsowa.
english: It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

tay: ini' qowalax kahani, paqowalax i minaneq qaliyan, aras co hawsowa i patgi lata'.
english: It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

tay: pakgihaaq i qamisan pilag a kaal qo?
english: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

tay: owal, paktala'to' i kaal pilag, kapayox masiyato'.
english: Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

tay: pakakilox i gabagan kaal kahani qo?
english: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

tay: owal, pakakilox cobalay i gabagan, kapayox manobowag co qosiya'.
english: Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

tay: balayq so' ko gabagan ka tikay qo?
balayq mo cobalay i gabagan ka tikay, halhol a kaal.
english: I like spring because the weather is warm.

tay: balayq so' ko qamisan ka tikay qo?
aqeh mo ko qamisan ka tikay, poyox a mamati' ka bayho.
english: I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

tay: omongi' kowing maras co rowas la.
english: I forgot to bring the textbook.
I will share it with you.

tay: omongi' kowing maras co papawng co pinatas la.
english: I forgot to bring the eraser.

tay: omongi' so' maras co papatas la qo?
english: Do you forget to bring your pen?

tay: owal, kabaxay mo ko papatas so' qo?
english: Yes, can you lend me a pen?

tay: nanowan ko naniqon so' i komoriax?
english: What would you like for lunch?

tay: nanowan ko naniqon so' i komogabiyan?
english: What would you like for dinner?

tay: nanowan ko niqon so' co komonama'?
english: What did you have for breakfast?

tay: nanowan ko niqon so' co komoriax?
english: What did you have for lunch?

tay: minaneq kowing co hyi' na waylong.
halay ta' i komcacri' co mari'.
osaosa' iso' han, osalay mi so' komiyom i kisa'.
english: You go first and I will catch up later.

tay: halay ta' i magonawo' co mari'.
laxi, halay ta' i homakot co rowas han.
english: No, we have to carry books first.

tay: qominowax so' co gi'nox la qo?
iqaat na', kiya kowing qomowax co salaman.
english: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.

tay: qominowax so' co ngaqowaq la qo?
english: Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

tay: qominowax so' co salaman la qo?
naqaron mo qomowax ko salaman la.
micowa' so' ka ini' payma' co qaba'?
english: Why didn’t you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.

tay: nanowan ko pakawaw so' i malax matas?
english: What are you going to do after school?

tay: nanowan ko pakawaw niya' i malax matas?
english: What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

tay: Ali', kiya so' i imowag qo?
Ali', kiya so' i imowag qo?
okas imo i Ali', Iwal kowing, kiya a waw qo? mowah i Ali' ga panqaqoanay mo.
english: Ali’ is not at home. I am Iwal. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

tay: aki', Amoy ro Ali' cami, gawahani cami co balihon.
english: Grandma, we are Amuy and Ali’, please open the door for us.

tay: Boya' kowing, mowah kowing komiyom i Yopas.
english: I am Buya’, I am here for Yupas.

tay: aki', mowah kowing mitaal iso' la.
english: Grandma, I am here to see you.

tay: ingaso so' cobalay ini' owah la, longolongon mi so' cobalay.
english: You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

tay: Ali', mowah kowing komiyom iso' magonawo' la.
english: Ali, I am here to play with you.

tay: nabowibowi patgi imowag, ingaso mi so' nagaon la.
english: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

tay: pinomowa' mo ko bonga' kahani, qaneq co mama'!
english: This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!
The sweet potato is so sweet.

tay: ibowi! pinomowa' mo ko oqooqo' kahani, qaneq co mama'.
english: Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

tay: tahonak! pinomowa' mo ko qatiyay kahani, qaneq co mama'.
english: Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

tay: waw! lalbing cobalay ko qatiyay kahani.
english: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

tay: aqeh kowing maneq co iyok, maniqay kowing co pingkwo'.
english: I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.
Let me peel the fruit for you.

tay: mahoway so'! payox cobalay a booq nako oqooqo' kahani.
english: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.
I will bring you some water.

tay: kapayox i maneq, payox tinahok mo ka raramat.
english: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

tay: waw! sahahiya' sawkan ro sahahiya' cobalay owi i niqon.
english: Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

tay: kapayox i maneq, payox na' i roni.
english: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.
I’ll make myself at home then.

tay: kapayox i maneq, payox na' i roni.
english: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

tay: payox cobalay niqon mo la, iqaat maosa' i niqon laa.
english: I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

tay: rarason cimo ni papsibaq i ragiyax kisa'.
english: I will take you to the mountains today.

tay: payox kowi' i ragiyax mha i yaya'.
english: Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

tay: rarason cimo ni papsibaq i claq kisa'.
english: I will take you to the fields.

tay: maosa' ta' i maxmox co rawq qo?
english: Are we going to loosen the soil?

tay: rarason ta' ni papsibaq i siyag na loliyong.
english: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

tay: rarason ta' i ragiyax ni papsibaq.
english: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

tay: maosa' ta' i siyag na loliyong i kisa' qo?
english: Are we going to the riverside today?

tay: iqaat, rarason ta' i ragiyax ni papsibaq.
english: No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.

tay: maosa' ta' i ragiyax i kisa' qo?
english: Are we going to the mountains today?

tay: iqaat, maosa' ta' i claq i kisa'.
english: No, we are going to the fields.

tay: papsibaq, nanowan ko tatalon ta' i siyag na loliyong?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

tay: papsibaq, nanowan ko tatalon ta' i ragiyax?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.

tay: nanowan ko osalan ta' i claq?
english: What are we going to do in the fields?

tay: maosa' ta' i claq mitaal cko pinomowa' ta' ka qatiyay, panabaq kiya a qatahi', bowayng yo!
english: We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

tay: papsibaq, maosa' ta' lomangoy i loliyong qo?
english: Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

tay: iqaat, maosa' ta' omangay co qaqlayngan.
english: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

tay: papsibaq, maosa' ta' momowa' co paparoxaw i claq qo?
english: Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

tay: maosa' ta' i gomaxbox co rawq i kisa'.
english: We are going to loosen the soil today.

tay: kiya a qaqlayngan i haca ka manbahaag tagi roni manbahaag tagi haca.
yani koiwng na' mitaal co maqiyanox cobalay ka qaqlayngan.
english: Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

tay: kiya a tatayo' i haca ka manbahaag tagi roni manbahaag tagi haca.
ye! wa! balayq mo tatayo', magbatonox cobalay.
english: Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

tay: kiya a tatayo' i haca ka manbahaag tagi roni manbahaag tagi haca.
iqaat tatayo' ko haca, haca ga tatina' na bowayng.
english: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

tay: asi angay i roni, laxi ko mosa' tatohi' coqaang yo!
english: Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

tay: owal, qaat cami maosa' tatohi' coqaang.
english: Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

tay: laxi ko maktaliyom, anahiyahiyaw i homakay naki ini' katako.
english: Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.
I want to see them right away.
How do you go to the block-house?

tay: miniray kowing co kolo' mosa' i tatak.
hominicowa' hiya' mosa' i papkitalan co kinmoxaal?
english: How does he go to the hospital?

tay: hominakay hiya' mosa' i papkitalan co kinmawxa'.

english: How do you go to Penghu?

tay: gominlo kowing na kolo' ka manbahaag mosa' i Pngho'.
english: I go to Penghu by plane.
How do you go to Penghu?

tay: gominlo kowing na parnah mosa' i Pngho'.
english: I go to Penghu by boat.

tay: gominlo so' na nanowan co mowah i imowag?
gominlo kowing na cieyon co mowah i imo.
gominlo na nanowan i Pokaw co mosa' i papatiqan?
english: How does Pukaw go to school?

tay: gominlo na kolo' na hapoy i Pokaw co mosa' i papatasan.
english: Pukaw goes to school by train.

tay: gomilo na nanowan i Kayno' co mosa' i kiyokay?
english: How does Kaynu go to church?

tay: gominlo na tamayray i Kayno' co mosa' i kiyokay.
english: Kaynu’ goes to church by bicycle.

tay: gomlo so' na cieyon mosa' i mateq qo?
english: Do you go to school by MRT?

tay: iqaat, gomlo kowing na bas' mosa' i matas.
english: No, I go to school by bus.

tay: gomlo so' na tamayray mosa' i mateq qo?
english: Do you go to school by bicycle?

tay: owal, gomlo kowing na tamayray mosa' i matas.
english: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

tay: gomlo so' na kawte' mosa' i Kawsyong qo?
english: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

tay: owal, gomlo kowing na kawte' mosa' i Kawsyong.
english: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

tay: gomlo so' na kolo' na haponeq qoga kolo' ka manbahaag mosa' i Taytong?
english: Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

tay: gomlo kowing na kolo' na manbahaag, ini' kanga' tayhok nko gomlo co kolo' na manbahaag ko gomlo co kolo' na hapoy.
english: I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

tay: gomlo so' na bas' qoga miray co kolo' mosa' i kiyokay?
english: Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

tay: miray kowing na kolo' mosa' i kiyokay, masiohiohi nko gomlo na bas' ko miray nanak co kolo'.
english: I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

tay: makasasawbeh imowag mamo ko babinasan co aninanowan qo?
english: Is the market close to your house?

tay: ini' pakasasawbeh, gomlo kowing na otobay mosa' i babinasan co aninanowan.
english: No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

tay: makasasawbeh i papatiqan ko yocyo' qo?
english: Is the post office close to the school?
Yes, it is within walking distance.

tay: makasasawbeh i aotoan co kolo' ko naniqan qo?
english: Is the restaurant close to the station?

tay: matgi lata' na aotoan co kolo' ro' homakay co mamagalpo co qayaw ga tayhok la.
english: It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

tay: kiya a hreq na waw si kisa' qo?

english: I would like to visit you.

tay: kiya a waw mo kisa', iqaat co pakakiya imo, iyog ko riax qo!
english: I am out today. How about another day?

tay: pakakiya a hreq na waw si casan qo? wahay mi so' komiyom i minaneq qaliyan.
english: Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.
Sure, I will wait for you at home.

tay: pakbalayq ci magal co kayi' qo? papateq mo.
english: Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.

tay: pakbalayq i magal co qalimo' qo?
english: Would you mind if I do the video recording?

tay: laxi gii! aqeh ci talan, ini' kagawi owi ko qabqob.
english: No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.

tay: nano' asi ci agal co qalimo'.
english: Then I will just take photos.

tay: laxi owi ko magal co qalimo'.
mahoway so' ka siwalan si kowing i maskakaro' ro mapaqot.
english: Thank you for accepting the interview.

tay: congos niya', nanowan ko papaqot so'?
english: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

tay: paqocay mi so' han, nanowan ko waw si co olaqi' so'?
english: What do you do when you are young?

tay: mintga kinsat kowing conga', ga malax ci la kahani.
english: I was a police officer but I am retired now.

tay: kiya a waw so' kahani qo?
english: Then, are you working at the moment?

tay: kiya i tinqalangan ragiyax owi ko olaqi' so' qo?
english: Do your kids live in the tribe too?

tay: okas, kiya i qalang qowis ko olaqi' mo.
english: No, my kids are all living in the city.

tay: iso' nanak ko kiya i roni qo?
english: Then, do you live by yourself?

tay: soman ci co qotox xowil ro qotox a kabahneq, qotox mo co imo owi nha'.
english: I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

tay: qotox ko ngiyaw ka saanan mo owi, sombabaas ikowing, naki ti ini' ka sapeeq mha co.
english: I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

tay: paqocay mi so' tikay cko Gaga' ka papisaneq i qomalowaap.
english: I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

tay: ini' kapayox a baqon mo, gi' ini' papbiingi co wawwaw na qaqalop na mamaliko ko kaknayril, ga' kiya ko baqon mo ga kalanay iso' kahabaag.
english: I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

tay: kiya a Gaga' mamo ka papisaneq na qaraqarax na qaqalowaap qo?
english: Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

tay: ini' papbingiani cko kaknayril ko wawwaw na qaqalop na mamaliko.
english: Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

tay: pakbalayq maglo mosa' i qomalowaap ko kanayril qo?
english: Then, can women go hunting together?

tay: aqeq cobalay! paysan gomlo mosa' qomalop ko kanayril owi.
english: No, women cannot go hunting either.

tay: Kayno', okas a qowaw i imo la, osa' mabaynay iso' han.
english: Kaynu, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

tay: kiya na' qotox tahosan i gaghapoyan, hanoan ini' baynay la!
english: There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

tay: iqaat pakacka' i qotox tahosan, osa' mabaynay lawwi co osayng tahosan.
english: One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

tay: pabaynay ci co qowaw, matibaynay cimo qo?
english: I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

tay: kiya ga, piya' a babinason so'?
english: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

tay: pabaynay kowing co osayng tahosan ro qotox cabo' a bowax.
english: I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

tay: kiya roni ko bowax, nanowan ko aalon so' na'?
english: Here is the rice, what else do you need?

tay: pabaynay kowing owi co bato', kiya qo?
english: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

tay: naqaron matibaynay ko bato' niyam la.

english: I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?

tay: pabaynay kowing cko isting a oyit ka sitowing.
english: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

tay: kiya na' a maoba' kinko mawaseq.
english: We have white and blue ones too.
Please give me the clothes in blue.

tay: Kayno', minosa' si ino' sawni' la? minosa' si maktaliyom qo?
english: Kaynu’, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

tay: iqaat, minosa' ci romag yaki' matibaynay co raramat.
english: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

tay: aqo mowani, kiya a hreq na waw si gabiyan qo? papaglo si maneq ki kowing qo?
english: No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

tay: aqeh, maosa' ci mabaynay co sitowing.
english: No, I want to buy some clothes.
Then, I will go with you.

tay: lawkah so'! piya' pila' qotox co bhol ko paroxaw kahani?
english: Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?
The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?
Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

tay: mabinasay ci co osayng bhol paroxaw ro qotox tintin a bonga'.
english: Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

tay: Kayno', omongi ci maras co papatas la, pakbalayq si sipkabawx ikowing ko iso' qo?
english: Kaynu’, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

tay: okas a ikowing owi, yani ko Pokaw ko hani.
english: I don’t have one either. This is Pukaw’s.

tay: nano' pakbalayq i sipkabawx kowing co pilapilag qo? nabowibiwisaw mi pasayo iso'.
english: Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

tay: mahoway so', mahoway so' kosa i Pokaw owi.
english: Thank you and thank Pukaw for me.

tay: papasayo ci cko osayng ka rowas kahani.
english: I want to return these two books.

tay: owal, paagal si co nanowan na' qo?
english: No problem and what else do you need?

tay: pakabawx ci na' co togal ka rowas kahani.
english: I would like to borrow these three books.

tay: owal, kaa ongii pa'bowinah i makatoo'.
english: Sure and remember to return them after three days.

tay: ini' so' pa'bowinahi kowing na' ko papawng co pinateq.
english: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

tay: micowa' ka magaang lko papawng co pinateq mi la?
english: Then, why is my eraser missing?

tay: ini' so' ka sipkabawx i Kayno' lga.
english: Did you lend it to Kaynu’?

tay: ini' mo baqi, halay mi maqot hiya'.
english: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

tay: pakbaxanay mi so' ko papawng co pinatas mo han.
english: I will lend you my eraser first.

tay: Pokaw, pinkabawx iso' ni Kayno' ko sitowing ka kehma kahani qo?
english: Pukaw, did Kaynu’ lend you this coat?

tay: iqaat, binaynay ikowing ni yaya' mo.
english: No, my mom bought it for me.

tay: macka' kinko iso' ko sitowing ka kehma ni Kayno'.
english: Kaynu’’s coat is the same as yours.

tay: magaoo' ko siyato' niya' ka kehma, ini' packa' iro' kinko ita'.
english: His coat is black, so our colors are different.

tay: Pokaw, komnabawx si co pila' ki Kayno' qo?
english: Pukaw, did you borrow money from Kaynu’?

tay: owal, naki mi pinsayogan hiya' sawni', omongi ci maras co pila' la.
english: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.
Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.

tay: owal, kalanay mi so' i hiya'.
english: Okay, I will tell Kaynu’ for you.

tay: asiki rangayon ko qawlit, alon na toqowaq qoga rapal a tikoxi'.
english: It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

tay: aqo mowani, naoqoon mi la, kahi' ini' co tiroweq.
english: No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

tay: yani cobalay gii! naki ci magal tikay.
english: Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

tay: kehma coqaang ko ki'man i claq la, osali magal i tatak ko sasiliyat, halay ti claq.
english: The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

tay: kiya kiyl na kagisi', osa' i tatak ro tatalon si la.
english: It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

tay: panabaq i magal, ngawson cobalay ko sasiliyat.
english: Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

tay: kiya cko yaho' na kahoneq kahaca ko wahi mo.
english: My trap is under that tree.

tay: kawbo' ko hani, sokoon niyam i gawng.
english: This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

tay: okas a kawbo' niyam, asi cami panayp.
english: We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

tay: qaat kowing pinanayp na', pasibaqi kowing babaw niya' qo?
english: I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

tay: owal! magalgay ti babaw niya' mosa' panayp.
english: Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

tay: nano' pasibaqay mi so' kabalay co kawbo' i babaw niya'.
english: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

tay: mawiwi' ko babaan si la, ini' ka komat a qoleh lga? nabowibowi i pasiklo ga.
english: Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

tay: nohanhan, manlaglag a qaso la. holoyaw mi roni ko babaan, osa' tagi haca magal co kari'.
english: Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

tay: holoy tagi kowing roni ko qoleh, ragay mi so' homoloy.
english: Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

tay: wa! balayq cobalay inowah ta' sawni', makasion a wawa' la.
english: Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

tay: laxi ko maganawo' la, nabowibowi i matahonak i tatahonakan.
english: Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

tay: apaw wala! hanoan kiy! somiyahoq kowing la!
papatowawan tagi imagal sawni', paohngeq i casan, magalgay ta' i mosa' maganawo' ga!
english: It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!

tay: owal! halay ta' i siyag na loliyong.
english: Great! Let’s go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

tay: papatowawan tagi togal i casan, maosa' ta' i maganawo' co mari' i kominoriax casan ga!
english: Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

tay: nanowan ko waw so' i kasasanan casan?
english: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

tay: a'hahangiqan i casan, maosa' kowing ki yaya' i kiyokay.
english: Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

tay: mikimotaq kowing, maosa' kowing i papasqotian.
english: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

tay: papsibaq, moxaal a nabowas mo, maosa' kowing i papasqotian.
english: Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

tay: pakabalayq kowing i mosa' i mayma' co qaba' qo?
english: May I go wash my hands?

tay: sawbeh paohngeq i mateq la, osa' i kisa'.
english: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

tay: papsibaq, moxaal a tonox mo, paohngeq kowing i kominoriax.
english: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.
Okay, take care and go home.

tay: papsibaq, paohngeq kowing i babaw na a'hahangiqan i paptowawan tagi qotox, maosa' kowing i pakitaal co kowisang.
english: Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

tay: owal, nabalayq i malahang ko hihihi'.
moxaal a nabowas niya', kiya i papasqotian.
english: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

tay: papsibaq, moxaal a waqcog ni Atong mohngeq sawni'.
english: Teacher, Atung has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

tay: micowa' ka ini' owah i Haking?
ralo' mo ga Baay na Payan, magalpo a kaal mo ka hani.
english: My name is Baay na Payan, and I’m 10 years old.

tay: Baay na Payan ko ralo' mo.
english: My name is Baay na Payan.

tay: olaqi' so' na Itaal na nanowan?
english: What ethnic group are you from?

tay: Itaal kahabaag ko itaal i imowag so' qo?
english: Are all your family members indigenous?

tay: owal ga, Itaal cami kahabaag ka qotox co imowag.
english: Yes, my whole family is Atayal.

tay: Itaal kahabaag ko itaal i imowag so' qo?
english: Are all your family members indigenous?

tay: iqaat, Itaal i yaba' mo, To'iya' i yaya' mo.
english: No, my father is Atayal, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

tay: olaqi' kowing ni Payan na Boyong.
english: I am Payan na Buyung’s child.

tay: haca ko yaba' so' qo? piya' a kaal niya' la?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

tay: mamatoo' kinamlapgan a kaal niya' la.
haca ko yaba' so' qo? piya' a kaal niya' la?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

tay: iqaat, nabakis na tinqalangan niyam i hiya', mamaspat kinamlapgan a kaal niya' la.
english: No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

tay: piya' a kaal ni qomisowan na mamaliko so' la?
magalpo co mamaspat kaal ni qomisowan na mamaliko mo la.
payox a kaal kin rahowal ni iso' i qomisowan na mamaliko so' qo?
english: Is your brother much older than you?

tay: imagal co kaal a inowaw niyam.
kabhol co masopatol kongfn ko kin ibabaweq mo.
ingasog ta' ini' pakitaal la, ini' so' ka manrakiyas laga?
english: I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

tay: owal ga, kabhol co matool kongfn kowing la.
ini', tomnaoqo so' i mitaal la.
owal, matool tintin kowing ka hani la.
maosa' kowing i pankongs' komiyom i papsibaq.
english: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.

tay: maosa' pakati' co siyop i hiya'.
english: He’s going to throw away the trash.

tay: kiya i lalangoyan i hiya', maosa' i macacpong lomangoy kisa' i hiya'.
english: He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

tay: kiya ino' i Binay? pacacpong maktaliyom kisa' i hiya'.
english: Where is Binay? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

tay: kiya i litang i hiya', halay mo i homowaw i hiya'.
english: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.

tay: magalgay ta' mosa' i paptaliyoman ga!
english: Let’s go to the playground together.

tay: halay kowing i mabaynay co kakriaxan han, kiyomaw mi so' i kisa'.
english: I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.

tay: magalgay ta' mosa' i romileq co sibileq ga!
english: Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

tay: kiyom coqoleq iso', maosa' kowing i komiyom i papsibaq.
english: You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

tay: Lawsing pacacpong so' tomoting co mari' i kisa' qo?
english: Is Kacaw competing in croquet today?

tay: iqaat, pacacpong co mastatayl i hiya'.
english: No, he’s competing in high jump.

tay: riax ka pacacpngan i maktaliyom ga maosa' so' i macacpong qo?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

tay: owal ga, pacacpong kowing co maktaliyom.
riax ka pacacpngan i maktaliyom ga maosa' so' i macacpong qo?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

tay: riax ka pacacpngan i maktaliyom ga nanowan ko pakawaw ta'?
english: What will we do in the sports day?

tay: papacpong ta' i mahaholoy co siniyog.
english: We will compete in tug of war.

tay: riax ka pacacpngan i maktaliyom ga nanowan ko nananiqon ka paptibinason ta'?
english: Will we sell food at the sports day?

tay: magal so' co capaang tagi magalayng, lawkah so' cobalabalay!
english: Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!

tay: kiya i imog i yaki' qo?
kiya, kiya i maqilaap i qaqlapan i hiya'.
english: Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

tay: kiya i imog i yaki' qo?
okas, yani na' matgi latanox la, asiki gabiyan ga ma'owah imowag.
english: No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

tay: kiya i imog i yotas qo?
kiya i masnaposal tinanton na imowag, osa' komiyom i riyatox iso'.
english: He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

tay: aqo i Kagi'! ingasog so' cobalay ini' tali la, lawkah so' qo?
english: It’s Kagi’. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

tay: balayq ga! wahan mi so' i komiyom maskakaro'.
english: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

tay: kiya i gaghapoyan homalngag co raramat, halay mi komaal i hiya'.
english: He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

tay: arowa i libo' na waylong romakaap co waylong i hiya'.
english: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

tay: okas imowag i yotas mamo, kiya i claq i hiya', naga' imowag cimo i hiya' han.
english: Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

tay: ingasog ta' cobalay ini' pakitaal la, ibabaweq so' la yo!
english: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.
It’s so good to see you.

tay: binayq icimo ko pangran ka hani, asiki sokoon i pingsiyang.
english: Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

tay: ingasog ini' owah la, korongoon mi cimo kahabaag i maneq.
english: It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

tay: hanoan ga, hanoan kowing asi nobowag co cha, maskakaroay ta' i papaskakaroan.
english: No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

tay: maosa' kowing i imog la, mahoway cobalay ko ginalayng so'!
english: Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

tay: yani na' tinoting ko waylong ka hani, aras iso' imowag tihiyahiyaw i maneq.
english: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

tay: pakbalayq ti makitaal i komnoriax casan qo?
english: Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

tay: makitalay ti papatasan qo? paagal cami co qalimo'.
english: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

tay: nano' halay ti papasotoan ga, papsitowing ci co sitowing na Itaal i mosa'.
english: Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

tay: kehma i makpahpah ko qaym na kabahneq i tinqalangan niyam ga balayq cobaly i talan, iy makpahpah lga wahi ci komiyom ga!
english: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

tay: aqo asiki nagaon roo' gabagan ka tikay, ingasog coqaang lqo!
english: That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

tay: nano' owah i tatobonan co kinloh la!
english: Then come during our Harvest Festival!
Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

tay: micowa' so' ka mabowinah lawwi maqiyanox i tinqalangan?
english: May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.

tay: micowa' ka ini' kakiya i tinqalangan qowis pasibaq co rowas pisa?
english: Why not teach in the city?

tay: aqeh gi longolongon mo ko inkaholan mo, mowa' na kahowayon ti pasayog ko rngo' ta' mha co owi.
english: Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

tay: baaq si cobalay i tominon co capang, ima' ko pinasibaq iso'?
english: You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

tay: yaki' mo, ihya' cobalay ko capaang na baaq i tominon co capang i tinqalangan niyam.
english: It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

tay: micowa' so' ka miki makibaq co tatinon co capang?
english: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

tay: Gaga' niyam cobalay ko tominon co capang, palohingaw ta' ko Gaga' mha ci lomanglong.
english: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

tay: balayq cobalay i noboon ko qowaw na torakis ka hani.
baaq so' cobalay! ingasog i poqowawon qo?
english: You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

tay: bali baqon, ani ini' kaanga' ga togal, imagal co bowating, qoga kaingasogon coqaang i lomqing lawwi. obogan, hopongon, basawan han ko mami' na torakis. paqopaqon co manbaxbox ko tamol, anabalabalayqon i omimag kinko mami' na torakis ro tokoraon ca matapah, towangan lawwi co masamag kinko mami' na torakis ka tala'to' na tinahok ka qosiya' ro' tarahrahgan i omomok somirho la. ingasog sokoon ga ararrowa i masiokas ko mami' na torakis ro payox owi i boqan a qowaw ro' sahahiya' cobalabalay i noboon. poqowaw na riax co balayq na qowaw! kaa kogi i nomaga'…!
english: Depends on the situation, but it takes at least three to five months or even longer. After soaking, steaming, and cooling the millet, the koji is pounded into powdered form, sprinkled on top of the millet, stirred well, packed into urns, and poured with a certain percentage of cold boiled water, then sealed and stored in a cellar. The longer the rice is stored, the more it dissolves, the more fluid the sake becomes, and the better the flavor. Let time brew the wine! Wait patiently

tay: kiya a laciyaw ro qinog i roni, pinomowa' mo nanak kahabaag yo!
english: I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

tay: piya' pila' i binason ka kawsa'?
osayng kabhol co maymal pila' kahabaag.
balayq mo ko siyato' ka hani, piya' pila'?
english: I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

tay: mamati' coqaang la, pakaaqeh i mahnok tikay qo?
english: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

tay: aqeh, sihwi' coqaang ga pakaokas tikay a inagal mi la.
english: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

tay: owal la! nano' malay ci cko magaoo' ka siyato' ka haca.
english: Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

tay: alaw mo ko saliwa' kinko balayan ka haca.
english: I want this knife and this pot.

tay: maposal kabhol pila' kahabaag, tinoting mo nanak na qaba' ko hani, pakingasog cobalay i siptawwaw.
english: It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

tay: kalanay mo cko rawirawin mo mha owah mabaynay, balayq i mahnok tikay qo?
english: I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

tay: owal la! howianay mi so' co sapaat kabhol.
english: Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

tay: owah mitaal ga! kiya kahabaag matibaay co siyato', qabobo'.
english: Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

tay: qotox siyato' ga togal kabhol maymal pila', magalpo kabhol pila' i togal.
english: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

tay: hanoan qotox ko binason mo, bayqi ci co giqas.
english: I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

tay: lawkah so'! pabaynay ci co papaah ro siyam na maqaw.
english: Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

tay: si'naqro' matibaay ko papaah la, kiya na' a miyafon na tana', pabaynay so' qo?
english: The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

tay: owal la! bayqi ci co qotox, mowahay ci mabaynay i babaw lawwi.
english: Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

tay: owal! tokoraanay mi so' ca obot, mowani ga maymal habangan.
english: Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.

tay: lokah cimo qabax. tgaring ta lay.
lokah cimo qabax. kisa ga, sbaqon cimo kmayan ke na nniqon na Tayal qani.
english: Hello everyone. Today I am going to teach you how to say food in Thai.

tay: baqon mamo mong ke na sesiy ga.
english: Do you understand what the teacher says?

tay: sesiy, ini mo kbaqi mong. ana so kmayan min qotox loyi.
english: I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

tay: ini mo pongi ke so, tyaba hayi kmayan ke so ga?
english: I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

tay: ktayox cqani! glox kingan kmayan min qotox.
english: Look here, please! Repeat after me.

tay: lpox min qotox loyi. tyaba hayi ke mamo.
english: Read it again. Please speak louder.

tay: sesiy, wal mo kngyan maray enpit mo la.
english: I forgot to bring my pen.

tay: sesiy, wal mo kngyan maray ccom mo la.
english: I forgot to bring my eraser.

tay: ksiyox cikay ccom qa seto so.
english: Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

tay: ksyogay ta cikay ccom so ga?
tqbaq ta ski cqai ha, tqbaqay ta babaw nya la.
english: Class dismissed, see you next week.

tay: kinngan ga laqi ni Maray, Kaco lalo mo.
english: I am the son of Maray, and my name is Kacu.

tay: kinngan ga seto ni Maray, Kaco lalo mo.
english: I am a student in Maray, my name is Kacu.

tay: hiya ga, qbsoyal mo mlikoy, Koras lalo nya.
english: He is my brother, his name is Kuras.

tay: hiya ga Pisoy. Yata mo hiya.
hiya ga rangi mo, Lomoy lalo nya.
english: She is my friend and her name is Lomuy.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?

tay: maki saying qbsoyal mo mlikoy ro kneril, qotox swahi mo mlikoy ki kneril.
english: I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.
How many people are in your family?
There are four of us in our family.

tay: cyan maki ino pqwasan so biro?
nya co mqwas biro cqa Giran.
cyan mtiyaw nano mama so hiya?
english: What does your uncle do for a living?

tay: cyan mtiyaw qbsoyal so kneril ko?
english: Does your sister have a job?
Yes, I’m from the [Atayal] tribe. *[Amis] Please change to the respective ethnic group.
Yes, but she is of the Atayal tribe.

tay: oya, hlawax calay qabax moyax myan.
english: Yes, we are all very tall.

tay: cyan mqwas biro swahi so kneril la?
english: Does your sister go to school?

tay: oya, cyan mqwas biro hiya la.
baq kmayal ke Tayal swahi so?
english: Do your siblings speak the language?

tay: oya, baq kmayal ke Tayal naha.
english: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.

tay: msqon cimo maki moyax ki yaba ro yaya so?
english: Do you live with your parents?

tay: oya, msqon cami maki moyax ki yaba ro yaya mo.
english: Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

tay: msqon cimo maki moyax ki yotas ro yaki so?
english: Do you live with your grandparents?

tay: ini, ini cami msqon maki moyax ki yotas ro yaki mo.
english: No, I didn’t live with them.

tay: msqon so maki moyax ki ima?
msqon co yaba yaya ro qbsoyal mlikoy maki moyax.
english: I live with my father, mother and brother.
I’m from the Four Seasons Tribe.
Our home is in the Four Seasons Tribe.
My hometown is in the Four Seasons Tribe.

tay: qalang myan ga cyan maki Skikon
english: Our tribe is in Four Seasons Tribe.

tay: knwan baq so mosa qalang mamo?
english: When are you going back to the tribe?

tay: hngawan ryax bagan lga, mosa co moyax la.
english: I will go back in the summer.

tay: nyan mhtox wagi nya la, kilox calay kayal nya.
english: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?

tay: lto calay tanox, piyox hayi mlokos.
english: It's cold, so wear more clothes.

tay: ini, nyan sbehoy la, sbehoy calay tanox.
ini kilos ro ini klto, coni, blaq calay kayal nya.
english: It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

tay: oka yolong nya, cyan mhtox qa knitoh la.
english: There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

tay: mica na mhngaw qwalax nya, mhtox wagi ro hongo otox la.
english: The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

tay: maha nano kayal mamo kya hiya?

english: We're going to have a big storm here.

tay: blaq kayal nya, tyaba wagi nya cqani.
english: Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.

tay: lto kayal nya, piyox hayi mlokos.
english: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

tay: baq tyaba qwalax nya kisa, kngyay so maray broko.
english: It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

tay: wal motong mebong coni, pqwalax hayi kisa la.
english: There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.

tay: qnwalax coni ha, nyan mhngaw qwalax nya la.
english: It just rained, and now it's stopped.

tay: pisan hayi qnwalax la, nya mhoyiq qa ryaniq qani.
english: It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

tay: minqwalax ko? cwa so nya si qaros?
english: Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

tay: cyan mqwalax tanox, ini co aray broko.
english: It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

tay: tyaba calay behoy nya, mxan calay tonox mo, sbyohan na behoy qani.
english: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

tay: tyaba calay wagi nya, txing calay tonox mo sbo' wagi qani.
english: The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

tay: ini co aray oyi, hata mes ha.
english: I don’t have one either, let’s go buy one.
Let’s go buy a pen, shall we?

tay: oya ga, pbes co ccom loyi.
english: Well, I still have to buy erasers.
Let’s go get breakfast, shall we?

tay: iyat co, mnaniq co moyax la.
english: No, I’ve already eaten at home.

tay: kngyan mo skilox sibing mo la.
english: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

tay: kngyan mo maray sibing mo la.
english: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

tay: sqon ta maniq sibing mo lga!
english: Then let’s eat my lunch box together!
What are you having for lunch?

tay: pqaniq co nhapoy ni pqwasan biro qani.
english: I want a nutritious school lunch.
What are you having for lunch?

tay: nyan co maray sibing coni, sqon ta maniq knryax ki!
english: I’ve brought a lunchbox today, let’s eat together at noon!
Let’s go play basketball, shall we?
Please help me with the broom.
Okay, here’s a broomstick for you.

tay: biqi co cikay tapan qaca ha ga?
english: Can you help me with the cloth?

tay: nyan co cmapoh mwani, kayan cikay Kaco pragay so nya miq.
english: I’m sweeping the floor and you asked Kacu to carry it for you.

tay: claq calay qa phlan ta roq qani, hali cmong cikay.
english: The floor is dirty, go clean it.

tay: oya, haqa co magan tapan ha.
english: Okay, I’ll go get the cloth.

tay: claq calay qa tobon qaca, hali cmong cikay.
english: That window is very dirty, go clean it.

tay: ini na cikay, ini mo soqi cmapoh cqani na.
english: Wait a minute, I’m not done sweeping here yet.
I’m going to see my teacher.

tay: masoq so mqwas biro lga, nano iyaw ptiyawon so?
english: What do you do after school?

tay: mosa co msqon mqwas qwas ki rangi mo.
english: I’m going to sing with my friends.

tay: masoq mqwas biro hiya lga, nano iyaw ptiyawon nya la?
nyan maki moyax hiya, wah miyok cka.
english: She’s at home, please come in.

tay: ini aki moyax hiya, maki nano iyaw so?
english: She’s not here, what can I do for you?

tay: yotas, kingan ga Pisoy, wahi cikay blihon so ha.
english: Grandpa, I’m Pisuy, please open the door.

tay: Yabon, kingan ga Macyan, nyan co mwah msqon mcisan iso la.
english: Yabun, I’m Macyan, I’ve come to play with you.

tay: oya wa! llongon miso calay. owah mcisan ha!
english: Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s chat!
Please sit down and have some tea.

tay: talagay kinblaq boxon ocya mamo wa.
owah ha, niqa ta qenan ha!
oya ga! talagay kinblaq ktalan qenan qani.
oya, lbing ro blaq calay niqon.
masoq phapoy k'abi yaya mo la, wah maniq n'os ha!
english: Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!

tay: oya ga, haqa co mema qba ha.
english: Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.

tay: piyox calay wal mo niqon la, ktngi co calay la.
english: I ate a lot, I’m full.

tay: wa, blaq calay niqon nhapoy mamo.
mosa co la, mwaha co ktayox iso babaw nya loyi.
english: I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.

tay: mnkon calay la, mosa co moyax la.
owah mcisan babaw nya loyi ay!
oya, oka iyaw so ga, owah mcisan moyax mo.
english: Okay, come to my house sometime.

tay: lokah cimo qabax, rayon cimo mkan bnheci qalang ta kisa.
english: Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

tay: yotas Tasaw, nyan cami mwah mkan iso la.
english: Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

tay: wa! baq cimo kmayan ke Tayal ga! talagay kinblaq.
lokah cimo qabax, rayon cimo mtiyaw cqa qmayax trakis kisa.
english: Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

tay: owah mblaq cqrox cqani, aray qa qqaya qmahon mamo.
english: Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

tay: sesiy oya, nya cami ming qqaya qmahon myan la.
english: Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.

tay: ini na, ato thyaq hayi na.
english: Not yet, it’s still far away.

tay: oya, haqa co miliq qsya kingan hiya.
osa magan qqaya ppgayas qbhniq iso hiya.
english: You go get the bird catcher.

tay: oya, haqa co ppgayas qbhniq kingan hiya.
english: Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

tay: lokah cimo qabax, rayon cimo ktayox qnayat naha qbsinox kisa.
english: Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

tay: talagay kinblaq wa! pkosa ta maha nano mosa a?
english: Awesome! How are we going to get there?

tay: blaq ta cqrox cqani, pbes ta kipo lay.
english: Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

tay: cyan maki laso qa qbhniq hiya, mehong nya lga maqo, ktali kya nanak cimo la.
english: There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

tay: sesiy baq co mngongo maqo kingan hiya.
ana moqo la, osa ktayox qbhniq iso hiya.
english: It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

tay: qotox tmocing kisa lga, mwah ta msqon msli cqani la.
english: We’ll be back in an hour.

tay: nano qbsinox wayal so ktalon coni?
piyox calay maqo ro, piyox qbhniq wayal mo ktalan oyi.
english: I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.

tay: na' co cikay, moyay calay kakay mo la.
english: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

tay: piyox calay cqoliq nyan lmngyaq cqani.
english: There are a lot of people swimming here.

tay: cilong qsya nya cqani hiya, si ta lmngyaq cqani la.
english: The water is deep there, so we just swim here.
What kind of car did you take?
How do you go to church?

tay: pnganon co toroy ni yaba mo mosa.
maha nano mosa pqwasan biro krryax hiya?
english: How does he usually go to school?

tay: qmet zitensya mosa pqwasan biro hiya.
english: He rode his bicycle to school.

tay: maha nano mosa mes ramat qa yaki so?
english: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

tay: qmet otobay mosa mes ramat qa hiya.
english: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.
How are you going to get to Yilan?
I want to take a bus to Yilan.
Why is he going to Japan?
He took a plane to Japan.

tay: pglox toroy nano mosa Takaw hiya?
english: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?
He took a train to Kaohsiung.

tay: pglox kisya mosa Heto hiya ga?
english: Did he take a train to Taitung?

tay: oya, pglox kisya mosa Heto hiya.
english: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

tay: pglox kisya mosa Heto hiya ga?
english: Did he take a train to Taitung?

tay: iyat, pglox xikoki mosa Tayto hiya.
english: No, he took a plane to Taitung.
Is there a bus stop near here?

tay: maki, mosa so laso cikay lga si ktli qa aki baso la.
english: Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

tay: minas sobih na eki kisya cqani ga, cyan maki ino?
english: Where is the nearest train station to here?

tay: oka aki kisya cqani, haya nanak hlgon so la.
english: There is no train station here, you can only take a taxi.

tay: glox baso ga knwan ptehok ta pqwasan biro?
english: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

tay: mpox magan pong baq tehok pqwasan biro.
glox kisya ga, akya knwan ptehok ta Taycyo?
english: How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?

tay: qotox tmocing lga baq tehok Taycyo.
english: I will come to Taichung in an hour.

tay: qmoyot ta toroy mosa Ulay ga baq bsyaq?
english: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

tay: glox so baso mwah moyax mo ga akya ktwa ryax?
english: How long did it take you to take the bus to my house?
Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

tay: iyat co, ini kpiyox qbaqon mo.
english: Don’t, I don’t know much about it.

tay: maki iyaw so qlyan qani ga? smoya co mosa mkan iso, pswan so?
english: Are you free this afternoon? I’d like to visit you, is that okay?
Okay, I’ll wait for you at home.

tay: maki iyaw so cyogan ga? akya miso tqbaqon iyaw Tayal cyonga.
english: Are you free tomorrow? I’d like to ask you about the legendary story of the Atayal.

tay: mosa co rgyax cyogan, ini co kaki moyax ay!
english: I’m going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won’t be home.

tay: pnong mo ga, baqon so calay qabax iyaw na Tayal, smoya co tqbaq cikay iso.
english: I heard that you are very familiar with the traditional customs of the Atayal, I would like to ask you a question.

tay: ini kpiyox ciyan qbaqon mo, ana ga tlamay mo kmayan.
english: I don’t know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

tay: ana miso psingon cikay? maha cqani ga baqon mo mmiro babaw nya. la.
english: Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

tay: qeso mpox lpgan spat kawas mo la.
ini ga, tyaba kawas mo la.

english: I’m from [Four Seasons Village]. *Please change it to an ethnic location.

tay: nano na ke ga baqon so kmayan?
baq co kmayan ke na Tayal ro Troko.
english: I can speak Atayal and Telugu.

tay: mqas co calay mwah tqbaq iso, lani pinqoyo cikay gaga na qmalop qani ga
english: It’s a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

tay: oya pqiyay miso, garin co sening na ga, si co osa qmalop rgyax kryax.
english: Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

tay: mhway so calay, talagay kinblaq pinqiyan so coni qani.
english: Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

tay: cbalay pinqiyan mo qani ay, snbilan ni bnheci myan cyonga.
english: All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

tay: ski cqani tnbaqan miso la. mhway calay pinsbaq so qani.
english: That’s all for today’s interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

tay: ini, pkayan ta babaw nya loyi.
mosa co la, akya co smoya mong piyox hayi iyaw qnxan cyonga.
english: I’m going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.
Hello, what do you want to buy?
I want to buy a cup.
Hello, what do you want to buy?
I want to buy a hat.

tay: pbes co kopo, cyan cimo tbes ga?
english: I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?
Yes, how many do you want to buy?

tay: cyan cimo tbes binro oyi ga?
ini ay, ini cami tbes binro.
english: No, we don't sell betel nut.
How many packs do you want to buy?

tay: biqi co tyongan cnabo na bwax.

english: I want to buy sweet potatoes.

tay: wal soqon tbes ngahi myan la.
english: All the sweet potatoes are sold out.
I want to buy two bottles of oil.

tay: qotox calay yoyot nyan sthay la.
english: We only have one bottle left.
How many eggs do you want to buy?
How many eggs do you want to buy?
I want to buy ten eggs.

tay: pbes co saying nhol na nexi.
english: I want to buy two green onions.

tay: tyogan nhol nyan sthay la, si ali qabax qani la.
english: There are three left, all for you!

tay: pisa pila nya qotox cnabo na bwax qani?
english: How much is this bag of rice?

tay: qotox cnabo ga, saying qbhol pila.
mposan qotox pila qabax, mposan pila biqi co mica la.
qeso mpox lpgan magan pila cqani.
ptmwan co mes loyi, thkon mo ski qotox kbhol pila.
english: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

tay: magan kbhol pila si co hali kesan lga?
hmet ciyan la, hali co khway hayi ga?
english: It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

tay: iyat kbaqon ay, wayal miso halan khway lay.
english: No, this is already very cheap.
I want this packet of cookies.

tay: mtiyol pila nya qani, ato na beson so ga?
english: $30 for the cookies, anything else you need?
Can I borrow money from you?

tay: oya ga! pisa pila ksyoxon so?
english: Yes! How much do you need?

tay: wal mo kngyan maray pila la, ana co ksiyox pila iso?
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

tay: ini co aray pila oyi ay!
english: I don’t have any money either!

tay: wal mo kngyan maray pila la, ana co ksiyox pila iso?
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

tay: iyat co, wal miso ksiyoxn pila cnxan na ro, ini so biqi kingan na.
english: No, you haven’t paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

tay: wal mo ksyoxan cqa Ciwas la.
ksyoxay ta cikay zitensya so ga?
english: Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

tay: oya ga, ana ga biqi co loyi cyoxan ay.
english: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

tay: mqwalax la, ini co aray broko, ksyogay ta broko ga?
english: It’s raining, I don’t have an umbrella, can you lend me your umbrella?

tay: qotox nanak broko mo, si ta sqon proko lga!
english: I only have an umbrella, let’s stick together!

tay: knsyoxan so cnxan na biro kingan qani, psyoxay miso la.
english: This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

tay: smoya so ktayox biro nano loyi, kyali co ay.
english: You can tell me what else you want to read.

tay: akya knwan psyoxon miso pila a?
english: When do I have to pay you back?

tay: ana moko ha, pkyala ta maki pila so la.
english: It doesn’t matter, you can talk about it when you have money.

tay: biqon so knwan kingan. knsyoxan so pila mo la?
english: When are you going to pay me back?
I will return it to you tomorrow.

tay: knwan biqon so biro mo lga?
english: When are you going to return my book?

tay: iyat miso wal biqon chesa lga?
english: Didn’t I return it to you yesterday?

tay: ksyoxan so nya Kaco enpit qani ga?
english: Did Kacu lend you this pen?

tay: oya, ksyoxan mo comi hiya qani.
english: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

tay: knsyox so Kaco enpit qani ga?
english: Did you borrow this pen from Kacu?

tay: iyat ay, mnes ni yaya mo.
english: No, this is what mom bought.

tay: oka cimo la, osa ksyox cikay cimo qa Piho.
english: We’re out of salt, let’s go borrow some from Pihu.

tay: kayan Pisoy, biqi co knsyoan nya pila kosa.
english: Go tell Panay to give me back my money.

tay: pisa pila wal so nya ksyoxan ga?
english: How much does she owe you?
I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

tay: piyox ciyan k'man nya la, nyan co smliyat k'man, pqsya co kisa loyi.
english: There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

tay: praxi co maray cikay soki ro karoh ga?
english: Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?

tay: cyan maki biyh na bakit qsya.
english: Put it next to the bucket.

tay: wal so kmahon roq qani la?
english: Did you turn over the soil?

tay: mica mo na scyokan roq qani, tmobol mo kisa la.
english: I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

tay: baqon kmot ramat mnoya so lga?
english: Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

tay: baqon kmot tmana qani la, iyat qbaqon hmikot sina qaca na ay.
english: The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

tay: wa! talagay piyox qnehoy so ngahi qani ay.
english: (sighs) Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

tay: praxi co smi cqa qho ga?
english: Will you help me with the barn?

tay: nyan cami smi ami, pkiyap cami qolih.
english: We're releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

tay: piyox qolih wal miyok cqa sqoyo qani la.
english: The fish basket has been full of fish.

tay: maha cimo nano kmiyap qolih krryax?
english: How do you usually catch fish?

tay: sbo' mo panat qa qolih qani.
english: I shoot fish with a spear.

tay: mosa so mo' qbsinox ga, baq so pckaw bneloq ko?
english: Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

tay: smi co rosa kmiyap qbsinox hiya, kroma maray co patos ki hoyil mosa qmalop.
english: I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.
This is the road the boar took.

tay: qnapan na biyok qani, mica qbaqon mo maha, toqi na biyok qani
english: These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

tay: halay ta mlaw rosa ta ha, hay cyan mciriq qbsinox lay.
english: Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

tay: nyan sokan qa hoyil mo la, na hay hayi glgay ta.
english: The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.

tay: nano qqaya cyan so qblayon qaca?
qani ga rangay, skiyap mo qolit.
english: This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.

tay: nano qaya cyan so syan cqaca a?
english: What is that thing you put there?

tay: qani ga skakay, skiyap myan para qani hiya.
english: It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

tay: mhway calay knalo na otox bnheci, piyox calay qbsinox cniriq ta.
english: Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

tay: oya wa! rayaw ta qalang ro pqtogay ta qabax naha!
english: Yeah! Let's take it back to the tribe and share it!

tay: sesiy kisa ga sbaqay cimo son nano kmayal lalo na qqsinox.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Tayal language today.

tay: sesiy kisa ga sbaqay cimo lalo na bway kkhoniq.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Tayal language today.
Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.
Share the book with your classmate next to you.
I will lend you my eraser.

tay: masoq cami mqwas la, thoway mhkangi mosa moyax.
english: It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

tay: masoq cami mqwas biro la, sgagay ta la.
english: The class is over, goodbye everyone.

tay: lokah ta qabax, lalo mo ga Bato.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Batu.

tay: lokah ta qabax, lalo mo ga Pasang.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Pasang.

tay: nyan so lokah ga kingan ga Yomin.
Yomin nyan so lokah ga kingan ga Yaway.
