nyan so lokah ga kingan ga Hayong.
Hayong nyan so lokah ga kingan ga Yayot.
kingan ga yaya co ni Pasang, kingan ga Yaway.
swahi co ni Takon, lalo mo ga Yayot.
english: I am Takun’s sister. My name is Yayut.

tay: hiya ga sesiy mo psbaq biro, lalo nya ga Temo.
qbsoyan mo mlikoy qaca, lalo nya ga Bsyaw.

english: What is your elder sister’s name?

tay: Yabong lalo ni qbsoyan mo kneril.
english: My elder sister’s name is Yabung.

tay: ima lalo swahi so kneril hiya?
english: What is your younger sister’s name?

tay: Komo lalo ni swahi mo kneril hiya.
english: My younger sister’s name is Kumu.

tay: pisa kawas ni qbsoyan so mlikoy?
english: How old is your elder brother?

tay: pisa kawas ni swahi so mlikoy?
english: How old is your younger brother?

tay: qalang mamo ga maki pqwasan biro kya?
english: Do you have schools in your community?

tay: mnqwas so pqwasan biro kya qalang so?
english: Do you study in your tribe’s school?

tay: oya, mqwas biro kya ga yani hayi qotox moyax.
english: Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

tay: nano cyan ptyawon ni yaya so?
hiya ga cyan alan mnhow hetay.
nano cyan ptyawan ni yaba so hiya?
iyat, hiya ga rangi ni swahi mo.
english: No, he is my younger brother’s friend.

tay: iyat, hiya ga swahi mo kneril.
english: No, she is my younger sister.
How many people in their family?
There are five people in their family.

tay: pisa qabax he laqi moyax mamo?
english: How many children in your family?
There are four children in our family.
How many younger siblings do you have?

tay: oka mlikoy, maki tyogan swahi kneril.
english: I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.
How many older siblings do you have?
I don’t have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?

tay: oya, hiya ga qbsoyan mo mlikoy.
ghiyaq hayi kayal, klokah mnbox kilox qsya.
english: It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

tay: mkilox hayi kayan, klokah mnbox qsya.
english: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

tay: maha nano kayan te tanox coni?
tyaba wagi nya, qblaq mlahang he.
english: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

tay: maha nano kayan te tanox coni?
piyox yolong nya, oka wagi nya.
english: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

tay: oka wagi nya cogan, piyox yolong, tyaba behoy.
english: It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.

tay: mnha nano kayan nya ryax qaca?
english: How was the weather that day?

tay: ghiyaq ryax qani, kpiyox mlokos mosa so tanox.
english: It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.

tay: ryax hngawan qani maha nano kayan nya?
english: How’s the weather on the weekend?

tay: ryax hngawan qani ga blaq kayan.
english: It will be sunny on the weekend.
Will it be rainy that day?

tay: ryax qaca ga blaq kayan nya, iyat pqwalax.
english: It will have no rain and be sunny that day.
Will it be rainy that day?
Yes, it will be rainy that day.

tay: mswat qwalax nya la, phtox wagi la.
english: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

tay: qmwalax la, ini co aray broko.
english: It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

tay: ini qwalax mwani, babaw knryax ga baq mqwalax, aray broko.
english: It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

tay: qmisan kawas ga mwah ghiyaq kayan nya?
english: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

tay: oya, qmisan kawas ga mwah ghiyaq, kpiyox mlokos kya.
english: Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

tay: 'bagan pilax qani ga baq mkilox kayan nya?
english: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

tay: oya, baq mkilox kayan nya, klokah mnbox qsya.
english: Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

tay: smoya so ryax na tmangox abax?
smoya co ryax na tmangox abax, kkilox kayan nya.
english: I like spring because the weather is warm.

tay: smoya so ryax na hoqan abax?
ini co soya ryax na hoqan abax, piyox bbehoy nya.
english: I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.
I forgot to bring the textbook.
I will share it with you.
I forgot to bring the eraser.
Do you forget to bring your pen?

tay: oya, pksyogi co enpit so ki?
english: Yes, can you lend me a pen?
What would you like for lunch?
What would you like for dinner?
What did you have for breakfast?
What did you have for lunch?

tay: osa nama iso, mosa co hkangi iso kisa.
english: You go first and I will catch up later.
No, we have to carry books first.

tay: ini na, nyan co qmwax pyato.
english: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.

tay: wan so qmwax nqwaq la ga?
english: Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

tay: wan mo qwaxan pyato mo la.

english: Why didn’t you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.

tay: masoq so mqwas biro laga phcwa so la?
english: What are you going to do after school?

tay: masoq mqwas biro hiya ga mosa ino?
english: What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

tay: ini kaki moyax Yabong ay! kingan ga Ipay, maki yaw ga? mwah ga kyalaw mo Yabong.
english: Yabung is not at home. I am Ipay. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

tay: Yaki, cami ga yaway ki yayot, gwahi blihon ha.
english: Grandma, we are yaway and yayut, please open the door for us.

tay: kingan ga Toli, nyan co mwah khangi Yokan.
english: I am Toli, I am here for Yukan.

tay: Yaki nyan co mwah mkan mlaw iso la.
english: Grandma, I am here to see you.

tay: bsyaq so ini owah la, krmaton miso calay.
english: You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

tay: Komo, nyan co mwah cisan iso la.
english: Kumu, I am here to play with you.

tay: nahay owah cka, bsyaq miso mna la.
english: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

tay: noya mo ngahi qani, tlami maniq.
english: This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!
The sweet potato is so sweet.

tay: owah! qani ga pinnoya mo bway khoniq, tlami maniq.
english: Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

tay: tama! qani ga noya mo qcyay tlami maniq!
english: Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

tay: o! lbing calay niqon qcyay qani.
english: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

tay: iyat co kaniq onak, kaniq co ringo hiya.
english: I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.

tay: taqay mo bway khoniq pniqay miso.
english: Let me peel the fruit for you.

tay: mhoway so, piyox boq bway khoniq qani.
english: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.
I will bring you some water.

tay: klokah maniq, piyox hnapoy mo rramat.
english: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

tay: klokah maniq, piyox ramat nyan na.
english: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.

tay: klokah maniq, piyox ramat nyan na.
english: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

tay: piyox wan mo niqon la, iyat co kaniq la.
english: I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

tay: kisa sesiy ga rayon cimo nya rgyax.
english: I will take you to the mountains today.

tay: kmayan Yaya maha piyox koy rgyax.
english: Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

tay: kisa sesiy ga rayon cimo nya qmayah.
english: I will take you to the fields.
Are we going to loosen the soil?
Teacher will take us to the riverside.
Teacher will take us to the mountains today.
Are we going to the riverside today?

tay: iyat, rayon ta nya rgyax sesiy.
english: No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.
Are we going to the mountains today?
No, we are going to the fields.

tay: sesiy, mosa ta mangay nano kya gong?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?

tay: mosa ta mangay tong mlaka kya.
english: We are going to see dragonflies.

tay: sesiy, nano salon ta mangay kya rgyax?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.

tay: mosa ta mtiyaw nano kya qmayah?
english: What are we going to do in the fields?

tay: mosa ta moya qcyay kya qmayah, pnbaq ki maki paro nya ro oying ay.
english: We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

tay: sesiy mosa ta mlngyaq kya gong ga?
english: Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?
No, we are going to see dragonflies.

tay: sesiy, mosa ta moya rramat kya qmayah ga?
english: Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?
We are going to loosen the soil today.

tay: coni nanak na kintayox co minqyanox na 'tong na.
english: Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

tay: wa! siyan mo calay cyocyo qpiray qani, betonox calay.
english: Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

tay: iyat cyocyo qpiray qaca, qaca ga oying.
english: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

tay: wah mangay cqani, laxi osa thiyaq ay!
english: Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

tay: oya, iyat cami qbaq mosa thiyaq.
english: Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

tay: laxi ktlyom ki, thoway hmkani ptakoy cimo la.
english: Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.

tay: smoya cami maha nway helax ktalan.
english: I want to see them right away.
How do you go to the block-house?
How does he go to the hospital?
How do you go to Penghu?
I go to Penghu by plane.
How do you go to Penghu?

tay: gmlox co kaco gone mosa ponxo.
english: I go to Penghu by boat.

tay: gmlox co baso renki mwah moyax.
Sayon gmlox so nano mwah mqwas biro?
english: How does Sayun go to school?

tay: gmlox kisya mwah mqwas biro qa Sayon.
english: Sayun goes to school by train.

tay: Yokan ga gmlox nano mosa kyokay?
english: How does Yukan go to church?

tay: gmlox zitensya mwah kyokay qa Yokan.
english: Yukan goes to church by bicycle.

tay: gmlox so renki baso mosa mqwas biro?
english: Do you go to school by MRT?

tay: iyat, gmlox co baso mwah mqwas biro.
english: No, I go to school by bus.

tay: qmoyit so zitensya mwah mqwas biro?
english: Do you go to school by bicycle?

tay: oya, qmoyit co zitensya mwah mqwas biro.
english: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

tay: gmlox so kawtey kisya mosa takaw?
english: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

tay: oya, gmlox co kawtey kisya mosa takaw.
english: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

tay: mosa so takaw ga gmlox so kisya ini ga kaco plaka?
english: Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

tay: gmlox co kaco plaka, thoway qa kisya hiya.
english: I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

tay: mosa so kyokay ga gmlox so baso, ini ga qmoyit so toroy nanak?
english: Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

tay: qmoyit co toroy mosa kyokay, thoway gmlox baso hiya.
english: I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.
Is the market close to your house?

tay: thiyaq hayi, qmoyit co otobay mosa kya tbbesan.
english: No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

tay: ksobih kya pqwasan biro qa sskwan pila?
english: Is the post office close to the school?
Yes, it is within walking distance.
Is the restaurant close to the station?

tay: mhtox so eki baso lga, kya hayi magan cpong lga tehok la.
english: It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.
I would like to visit you.

tay: maki yaw mo coni iyat co paki moyax. babaw nya ki.
english: I am out today. How about another day?

tay: phngaw so cogan hiya ga? babaw knryax halay miso khangi.
english: Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.
Sure, I will wait for you at home.

tay: pqotay miso ana co mosa magan hngya'an? sskwan mo.
english: Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.
Would you mind if I do the video recording?

tay: ini co kbtonox ktalan, ro ini mo spyoci qa sskwan qeqaya, ana moqo la.
english: No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.

tay: nano si co psyasing nanak la.
english: Then I will just take photos.

tay: mhoway so baqon miso maqot kmayan.
english: Thank you for accepting the interview.

tay: wali nano, nano pqoton so kmayan?
english: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

tay: mrkyas so cyonga ga nano pintyawan so?
english: What do you do when you are young?

tay: nalan co knsat cyonga, ana ga nyan co mhngaw la.
english: I was a police officer but I am retired now.

tay: mwani ga cyan so mtiyaw na?
english: Then, are you working at the moment?

tay: nyan co mtiyaw gako pqwasan biro.
pqotay miso kmayan, cyan maki qalang laqi so oyi?
english: Do your kids live in the tribe too?

tay: ini, laqi mo ga maki kya qalang te hogan.
english: No, my kids are all living in the city.
Then, do you live by yourself?

tay: cyan co qmayat qotox hoyil ro qotox qbhniq, naha ga qotox moyax myan oyi.
english: I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

tay: cyan co qmayat qotox ngyaw oyi, msbes ki qinyatan ga baq mlhax.
english: I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

tay: pqotay miso kmayan kora yaw na psaniq gaga na pqalop.
english: I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

tay: ini kpiyox ciyan qbaqon mo, ana ga ktwa qnbaq mo ga kyalaw miso.
english: I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

tay: qeqaya na pqalop mamo, maki psaniq nya oyi?
english: Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

tay: qeqaya pqalop myan qani ga ini tringi na kneril.
english: Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

tay: ana msqon cimo kneril mosa qmalop oyi?
english: Then, can women go hunting together?

tay: ini, kneril ga ini kbaq qmalop psaniq.
english: No, women cannot go hunting either.

tay: Pasang, oka qwaw moyax la, osa mes bicyo iso.
english: Pasang, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

tay: cinoyok maki qotox yoyot na, ana ini osa mbes.
english: There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

tay: ini ktnaq qotox yoyot, osa mbes saying yoyot loyi ha.
english: One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

tay: pbes co qwaw, cyan cimo ptbes?
english: I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?
Yes! How many bottles do you need?

tay: saying yoyot, ro qotox cnabo bwax.
english: I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

tay: nyan cqani bwax, nano bbeson so loyi?
english: Here is the rice, what else do you need?
I want some eggs too, do you have some?

tay: wayan soqon mbes bato myan la.

english: I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?
I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.
We have white and blue ones too.

tay: bqani co qotox mgwasiq na lokos.
english: Please give me the clothes in blue.

tay: Pasang, mnwah so ino coni? nwah so phlah he ga?
english: Pasang, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

tay: ini, nwah co rmax yaki mbes ramat.
english: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

tay: han maha kya ga, nano yaw so gbyan? hata msqon maniq.
english: No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

tay: iyat ay, mosa co mbes lokos.
english: No, I want to buy some clothes.
Then, I will go with you.

tay: rangi, pisa pila qotox hnblan ramat qani?
english: Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?
The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?

tay: qotox tngcing ga mtiyol pila qa ngahi.
english: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

tay: bqani co saying hinblan ramat ki qotox tngcing ngahi.
english: Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

tay: Toli, mngi co maray enpit la, ksyoxi co cikay ki?
english: Toli, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

tay: oka kingan oyi, arwa ni Komo qani.
english: I don’t have one either. This is Kumu’s.

tay: ana ga ksyoxay ta cikay ki? masoq lga bqanon miso la.
english: Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

tay: mhoway so, mhoway so kosa Komo oyi ki.
english: Thank you and thank Kumu for me.

tay: mwah co mato kinsyoxan mo saying bbiro.
english: I want to return these two books.

tay: oya, maki na siyon so cokaw na?
english: No problem and what else do you need?
I would like to borrow these three books.

tay: oya ga. tyogan nabi lga kngyay so mwah mato.
english: Sure and remember to return them after three days.

tay: ini so sali mato na ccom mo.
english: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

tay: cyo wayan oka ccom mo la.
english: Then, why is my eraser missing?

tay: ona so wayan ksyoxan Pasang la.
english: Did you lend it to Pasang?

tay: ini mo baqi. Salay mo kmayan hiya.
english: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.
I will lend you my eraser first.

tay: Komo, lokos khmay qani ga kinsyoxan so ni Piho ga?
english: Kumu, did Pihu lend you this coat?
No, my mom bought it for me.

tay: zyanba ni Piho ga mtnaq cimo.
english: Pihu’s coat is the same as yours.

tay: mqatong qa zyanba nya, ini ptnaq patas myan.
english: His coat is black, so our colors are different.

tay: Yaway, wan so ksiyox pila ni Pasang?
english: Yaway, did you borrow money from Pasang?

tay: oya, calay ga akay mo biqan coni hiya, mingi co maray pila la.
english: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.
Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.
Okay, I will tell Pasang for you.

tay: qolit qani ga smi rangay criqon, pqocya hiya ga criqon psqolo ini ga pskakay, qani qa cbalay.
english: It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

tay: baq maha kya, nyan co m'oko la, pyanga ini co ciriq.
english: No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

tay: nano mica sbaqay miso smi qa saying pciriq qani.
english: Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

tay: oya ga! talagay kinblaq! maha cqani lga baq co ciriq babaw nya la.
english: Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

tay: qroyox ciyan k'man qmayah la, osa magan soki kya sskwan, hata qmayah.
english: The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

tay: cyan maki bih na bloko, miyop so sskwan qaya lga ktalon so la.
english: It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

tay: thoway magan, hboqay so nya. msngos soki qaca.
english: Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

tay: ktali qplay so mrosa mo qaca!
mrosa mo ga cyan maki iyik na khoniq qaca.
english: My trap is under that tree.

tay: cyan mo ssyan patas cqani, mica qa qbaqon mo maki kya.
english: I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

tay: qani ga skoyo, lanay ta smi syax na gong pskoyo tqolih kya.
english: This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

tay: oka skoyo myan cqani hiya, si cami pnep qolih hiya.
english: We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

tay: ini co pnep hiya, sbaqi co cikay babaw nya ki?
english: I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

tay: oya ga! babaw nya ga psqon ta mosa mnep qolih.
english: Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

tay: sbaqay miso pskoyo qolih babaw nya.
english: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

tay: cyan miyoy boyax nnep so la, hay cya prom qolih la! nhay heci.
english: Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

tay: ini na, lokah miyoy gone kaco qani. hetaw mo cqani nnep mo, osa thaca iso ragi co magan tara.
english: Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

tay: het ro holoy cqani qolih. ragay miso hmit.
english: Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

tay: tlagay kinblaq! piyox nagan ta, nyan so'on qolih yawa la.
english: Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

tay: nahay hata moyax, halay ta smapat maniq kya.
english: Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

tay: ta cisal loyi la, helax mtama kya cntman so.
english: Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

tay: swali co, mcoqi co tehoq la!
pisa hngawan na ryax mwani coni?
hngawan ryax mwani ga te magal ryax, mhngaw cyoxan, glox ta mosa mcisal haw!
english: It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!
Great! Let’s go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

tay: cyoxan ga te tyogan ryax na hngawan, qlyan cyoxan ga osa ta mcisal boro ki?
english: Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!
What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

tay: cyoxan ga hngawan na ryax, kingan ro yaya ga mosa cami Kyokay.
english: Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.
I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

tay: sesiy, mxal kto mo, osa co stnxan.
english: Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

tay: hoyay co mosa mima qba ga?
english: May I go wash my hands?

tay: ya kinga masoq mqwas la, nna cikah ro osa.
english: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

tay: sesiy, mxal ciyal tonox mo, qlyan ga msina co hngawan.
english: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

tay: oya, pnbaq longan mbinah so moyax.
english: Okay, take care and go home.

tay: Sesiy, sina co hngaw te qotox ryax qa hngawan, mosa co pktayox Ising.
english: Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

tay: mxal kto nya, cyan maki kya stnxan.
english: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

tay: Sesiy, mxal qolo ro qelis qba na Losing, wan mhnaw mwani coni.
english: Teacher, Losing has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

tay: Watan Silan lalo ma, mpox kawas mo mwani.
english: My name is Watan Silan, and I’m 10 years old.

tay: laqi na rok nono qa iso?
english: What ethnic group are you from?

tay: qotox cnmoyax cimo ga Genzyomin qabax?
english: Are all your family members indigenous?

tay: oya, cami qotox cnmoyax ga cqoliq Tayal qabax.
english: Yes, my whole family is Atayal.

tay: qotox cnmoyax cimo ga Genzyomin qabax?
english: Are all your family members indigenous?

tay: iyat, yaba mo ga Tayal, kaht qa yaya mo hiya.
english: No, my father is Atayal, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

tay: kingan ga laqi na Hayong Pasang.
qaca ga yaba so? pisa kawas nya la?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

tay: qaca ga yaba so? pisa kawas nya la?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

tay: iyat, hiya ga bnheci na qalang myan, spat pgan kawas nya la.
english: No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

tay: pisa kawas na qbsoyan so la?
mpox spat kawas qa qbsoyan mo la.
cpngan ga hnyason nya pisa kawas iso qa qbsoyan so?
english: Is your brother much older than you?

tay: kya magan kawas cnpngan hayi qa ini ptnaq kawas myan.
kingan ga qotox kbhol spat pgan kongbong.
mbsyaq ta ini pktayox, ini ga wan so mhlawax loyi?
english: I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

tay: oya, qotox kbhol tiyol kongbong kingan la.
ini ga nyan so mqthoy la?
ini ay, mnoqo so ktayox la.
oya, tiyol kongking kn'osox he mo.
mosa co mhkani sesiy qa pintyawan nya kya.
english: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.
He’s going to throw away the trash.

tay: cyan maki halan lngya'an kya, mosa mcpong mlngya kisa.
english: He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

tay: cyan maki ino Yabong? hiya ga mosa mcpong mktlyong kisa.
english: Where is Yabung? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

tay: cyan maki iyik moyax kya lnhoyan, sgyon mo hiya.
english: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.
Let’s go to the playground together.

tay: lmon mo mes nniqon kryax, nna cikah halay miso hkani kisa.
english: I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.
Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

tay: osa hkani cqoliq, mosa co hkani sesiy.
english: You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

tay: kisa ga mosa mcpong tcingan boro Yokan?
english: Is Yukan competing in croquet today?
No, he’s competing in high jump.

tay: ryax na onrokay ga mosa so mcpong oyi?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

tay: ryax na onrokay ga mosa so mcpong oyi?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

tay: nano ptyawan ta ryax na onrokay qaca?
english: What will we do in the sports day?

tay: mosa ta mcpong hmoloy gasing qthoy.
english: We will compete in tug of war.

tay: onrokay ta ga ptbes ta nniqon?
english: Will we sell food at the sports day?

tay: wan so magal cnpngan te qotox, klokah so ciyal!
english: Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!
Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

tay: ini kaki, wayal tanox mwani, gbyan ga mwah moyax.
english: No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

tay: cyan maki te saying krawan moyax, trkah iso hali hkani hiya.
english: He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

tay: baq iso Yoraw ga, mbisyq so ini ktaliy, lokah so ga?
english: It’s Yuraw. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

tay: lokah co, nyan co mwah hkani mcisal iso.
english: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

tay: cyan psyos rramat tnpoyan kya, sgyaw mo.
english: He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

tay: wayal miyap ngta kya libo ngta.
english: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

tay: ini kaki moyax kya yotas mamo, cyan maki claqan kya, si mnna owah nya moyax cimo.
english: Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

tay: mbsyaq ini pktayox nyan so hmlawax la.
english: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

tay: ktalan mo 'nyan so ga mqas calay longan.
english: It’s so good to see you.

tay: onray qani ga bniq cimo, syaniy iyik kolo tltow.
english: Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

tay: bsyaq ciyal ini cimo owah, sgyaw mo qabax ta sqon maniq.
english: It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

tay: ana qeri ta tyagiy la, si co nbox oca. bkal ta mcisal iyik moyax.
english: No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

tay: ta tkkoh, si ta nbox oca. mcisal ta iyik moyax.
english: Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

tay: knot coni ngta qani, aray moyax thwayiy maniq.
english: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

tay: pnkyalan mo ki iso stnaq ta qlyan soxan ki?
english: Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

tay: pstnaq ta pnkyalan sa pinqwasan biro ki? mosa co magal ega ha?
english: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

tay: nano mica hata mlahoy lnhoyan na qalang, plokos co lokos Tayal mosa.
english: Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

tay: betonox calay phpah na Sakora qa qalang myan, trang phpah nasa ga halay co hkani ki.
english: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

tay: si ga mnna ta eta tmangox abax, mcoqi ciyal la haw!
english: That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

tay: kasoq mlahang gaga Kloh laga owah qa iso!
english: Then come during our Harvest Festival!
Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

tay: pqotay miso hmcwa so mbinah mwah sqyanox qalang loyi?
english: May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.

tay: hmswa pcbaq so biro ga ini so kaki kya qalang benox?
english: Why not teach in the city?

tay: baha hmcwa s'non mo qalang mo, smoya co hoyay co smyok gmalo qalang mo.
english: Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

tay: baq so calay tminon, ima pincbaq iso?
english: You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

tay: pincbaq yaki mo, hiya ga cqoliq piyang baq tminon na qalang myan.
english: It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

tay: hmcwa so soya calay tkbaq tminon pala?
english: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

tay: tminon pala ga gaga na Tayal, soya co mc'oboy gaga na Tayal.
english: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

tay: blaq boxon calay qwaw trakis qani.
baq so calay, mosa mbsyaq klayon qani?
english: You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

tay: ini ay, kya hayi qotox hngawan ryax, mosa lman tahoq bwax ro pagay rhekil, twangan mimax cikah benhong, ro ana skron iyik yoyot la.
english: No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

tay: maki qorip ro qeno cqani, qabax qani ga pinoya mo wah!
english: I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

tay: mesay mo sayin qaca mosa pisa pila?
sqonon ga mosa saying kbhol miman pila hriqon.
siyan mo lokos qani, pisa pila hriqon?
english: I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

tay: lokos qani ga magal kbhol pila hriqon.
ston ciyal la, ini baqi tbiyaq pila hayi ga?
english: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

tay: ini kbaqi, tbyaqan pila ga mosa skyotan hayi.
english: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

tay: oya, nano mica soya co magal lokos mqatong.
english: Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

tay: galon mo lalaw qaca ro limok qaca.
english: I want this knife and this pot.

tay: sqonan ga saying seng pila, qani ga knalay qba mo nanak, tngsa longan mo mosa mbsyaq cokaw so.
english: It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

tay: lanay miso syoka lpyong mwah mes, ana so thwayon cikah ptbes?
english: I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

tay: oya raxay miso kbhol paseng ga spat paseng mesan miso.
english: Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

tay: owah ktayox cikah, ana lokos, qbobo ga nyan ptbes qabax.
english: Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

tay: pqotay miso pisa pila lokos qani?
qotox lokos ga tyogan kbhol miman pila, sqonan tyogan ga qotox seng pila.
english: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

tay: ana qotox nanak mesan mo, biqi co xqayos na lokos.
english: I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

tay: lokah so, soya co mes somol ro syam pglox hpoyan maqaw.
english: Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

tay: masoq ptbes mami la, maki menpin tana hayi na, mesan so ga?
english: The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

tay: oya, biqi co qotox cbwan, babaw nya mwah co mes loyi.
english: Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

tay: oya, raxay miso skran iyik kapa, maha qaca ga miman pila hriqon
english: Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
mqbaq balay cinbwanan Tayal beh Taywang."

tay: cn-gan msqon ta maniq ga, pnongan mo ke knahol kintayox so biro biro pinhkngyan yaw na pinqiyan qa cqoliq Taywan" qani ga
english: syanan mu calay inlungan. nyan cu genkyu yaw na gaga Tayal mwani. nanu mica

tay: cyonga pnongan yaw mha wal ms'ono rgyax Tayal, wal horon qabax ana nano, mrhow glaso qabax Tayal shiriq cinqlangan naha, ro mgyas mosa trkax babaw na b'bo rgyax "Papak wapa ana ga qotox qotox ryax wayal
cmyok maha "baqon mo, os ga tyogal linhoyan mlahang. maki linhoyan mlahang linbokyoko, linhoyan mlahang rrgyax, linhoyan mlahang qmayah. mnglong co maha
english: han baq cami ini lama muwah “pinnbaq” maha maki qutux yutas mpusal kawas knaki nya cqani

tay: mpito tmoting mosa co pwasan brio kisa.
english: I arrived at school at seven today.

tay: t'aring tkba biro la, miyok sali pwasan psba brio, kmayan p'aras glow maha, toli! tatok tonox.
english: It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

tay: hopa hngiyan myan maha, psba biro lokah so.
t'aring tkba biro lga, sba'an cami nya psba biro biro lpgan na ke atayan.
english: In class, the teacher taught us the atayan language of numbers.

tay: mlo cami psba biro lmpo, m'was cami 'was na biro lpgan.
english: We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

tay: waya mo ba'on piyox ci ke atayan.
english: I have learned many atayan languages.

tay: mosa co m'was biro otox otox rayx, tkba co ke atayan otox otox ryax, aki pongan yaya mo.
english: I go to school every day, I learn the atayan language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

tay: kyan otox soyan mo likoy, Takon lalo nya, mpo otox kawas nya.
english: I have a brother, his name is Takun, he is 11 years old.

tay: ms'on cami m'was biro otox pwasan biro.
english: We study in the same school.

tay: kinang ro soyan mo likoy ga sli cami m'was kwara.
english: Both my brother and I like to sing.

tay: sli co mosa mlngya, mhngaw m'was lga, mosa myan mlngya otox sali myan.
english: I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

tay: sli co slpyong, thoyay cami mosa m'was ro mlngya.
english: I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.
There are five people in our family.
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

tay: mlo co yaba, yaya, soyan likoy ro soyan nerin maki sali.
english: I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

tay: bawi ci yaba mo, yaba mo ga kesaco.
english: My father is tall and he is a policeman.

tay: mhekang ci yaya mo, yaya mo ga phgop mga'ing.
english: My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

tay: maki cami sali ga, pkayan cami ke Tayal yaba mo.
english: My father speaks the ethnic language with us at home.

tay: mhngi m'was biro 'bagan ga mosa cami alang rgyax.
english: We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

tay: kinang ro soyan mo ga ms'on cami kmiyak takay.
english: My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

tay: sli mo ci kwara otox sali mo.
english: I like our family very much.

tay: cami yaya mo mosa mtisan kisa.
english: I went out with my mother today.

tay: sasan ga mwasi kayan nya, ini skinot ro ini kilox kayan nya, sbehoy ci behoy nya.
english: The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

tay: mani cami pang maki babaw oraw k'man, cbong wagi he myan, hlhon calay.
english: We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

tay: kyalon mo yaya, ca mtalah kayan nya?
english: I asked my mother why the sky is red.

tay: kmayan yaya maha, ini ga mosa mwah hopa behoy la.
english: Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

tay: ongat yolong nya gbyan, mhto bengah la.
english: There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

tay: maki to'i sali ga, mkora co bengah toring cmyos kmayan.
english: On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

tay: aki iyat mwah hopa behoy, smoya co mosa mtisan tanox loyi.
english: I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

tay: pwasan biro ga cyo maki syaw sali myan, otox otox ryax ga khani co mosa m'was biro, khani co mwah sali oyi.
english: My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

tay: ini hopa pwasan biro myan, ini piyox ci nyo m'was biro, mkba myan kwara.
english: Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

tay: kwara la'i cikoy msli beh onroba, s'on mahi boro, s'on mtisan.
english: All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

tay: mlo cami mtisan kwara psba biro oyi, pwasan biro ga yani otox hopa sali.
english: The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

tay: otox otox ryax kmagaw cami, le'on myan kmagaw sali pwasan.
english: We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

tay: kroma ga cyo cmong tobong, kroma ga cyo kmagaw oraw.
english: Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

tay: kwara ong na pwasan biro ga halan myan kmagaw oyi, psyogon myan mtiyaw kwara, otox otox ryax ga cmyax ci pwasan biro.
english: We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

tay: mnwah co alang mita oba mo hesa.
english: Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

tay: bsya ci ini cami pkita la, longon mo ci heya.
english: We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

tay: mita kinang oba mo ga, kni'an co nya sikwa, pgobon co nya ocya.
english: As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

tay: cbing ci sikwa mnohi oba mo, ble calay ni'on.
english: The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

tay: sli mo ocya oba mo, ble ci gobon oyi.
english: I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

tay: tehok cka wagi lga, cami oya mo s'on myan phapoy ni'on kryaxan.
english: At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

tay: piyox ci nhapoy nya kryaxan oya mo, kyan 'cyox, welong, kabang ro mosi.
english: Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

tay: maso mani kryaxan lga, mosa cami hmbyat rami beh pmahan rami.
english: After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

tay: oya mo ga bi'an co nya piyox ci ngahi, cehoy ro ino, p'aras co nya mosa sali.
english: Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

tay: sgayon mo naha, kyalon mo maha mwah cako mita naha loyi.
english: I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

tay: rason cami nya psba biro mosa libo ksino kisa, nyo cami pnaga to'i bayi kipo beh blihon.
english: Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

tay: miyok libo ksino lga, kmayan psba biro maha, gleng ga oboy glow piyit, sorow ga oboy glow m'o, osa nanak mita kwara.
english: After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

tay: mngongo cako m'o, nano yaca iyat co kita m'o.
english: I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

tay: piyox ci piyit waya mo texan, cyo mlaka babaw khoni, ro texan mo cyo m'abi bling khoni pok haca.
english: I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

tay: cka libo ksino ga kyan zo, oma ro klit, iyat mo nita kwara ksino hani, m'es ci longan waya mo texan soni.
english: There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

tay: piyox ci waya mo galon syasing, ptexan mo yaba yaya mo.
english: I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

tay: babaw nya ga pglo cako yaba yaya mo mwah loyi.
english: Next time I will come with my parents.

tay: mhngi rayx hani ga, cami soyan mo nerin mosa myan Tayto mita mama mo.
english: This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

tay: aring myan Bnka mlo kisya mosa Tayto.
english: We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

tay: tehok Tayto lga, maras toroy mama mo wahan cami nya magan beh eki.
english: When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

tay: eki ga ini theya naha sali mama mo, maras toroy lga helaw ci tehok la.
english: The station is not far from my uncle’s house, and it’s just a short drive away.

tay: lingay sali mama mo ga kyan otox hopa ci oraw k'man, mlo cami zitensya mosa beh oraw k'man haca.
english: There is a big ranch near my uncle’s house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

tay: maki beh oraw k'man haca ga, rason cami nya mama mo mosa sm'an mit ro mlo oma.
english: In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

tay: tehok gbyan lga, mlo cami mosa mani beh ni'an maci.
english: In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

tay: maci haca ga piyox ci toroy nya, nano yaca ko mlo cami otobay mosa kya.
english: There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

tay: shri cami lga, waya naha kri'on otobay mama mo la, siy cami pglow baso mosa sali.
english: When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

tay: nyo cami tehok Bnka la, ini ba'i waya naha lon otobay mama mo lga.
english: Now that we are back in Taipei, I don’t know if my uncle’s motorcycle has been found.

tay: la'i cikoy co ga maki Pyahaw sali myan, m'was biro lga, mosa cami maki Rato, siy cami aki b'nox maci la.
english: When we were young, our family lived in Pyahaw. After I started school, we moved to Luodong and have been living in the city ever since.

tay: m'was co hopa pwasan biro lga, mnwah co tkba otox ppwasan na gaga knxan atayan, aring kya waya mo ba'on atayan na Taywan ga piyox ci ini ptna ko gaga knxan naha.
english: After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

tay: nano yaca ko kawas mhngi m'was 'bagan hani ga, cami soyan mo likoy mwah myan alang mita bkis, smoya myan tkba gaga knxan myan nanak.
english: So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

tay: mbkis ga mhenas spat pgan kawas la, ana ga yani ci tiyo pgan kawas texan.
english: The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

tay: kyalon mo heya maha pisa ke ba'on nya kmayan, hyoci ci kmayan ke Tayal, kba kmayan ke Troko, ke Tewan ro ke Nipon.
english: I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Tayal, as well as Truku, Hokkien and Japanese.

tay: sorow nya ga waya mo ba'on, aring la'i cikoy lga tkba ke Nipon, nerin nya ga Troko, maki beh ptyawan nya ga piyox ba'on nya c'oli Tewan, nano yaca ko piyox ke ba'on nya kmayan.
english: I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Truku, and he knows many Hokkien at work, so he can speak so many languages.

tay: trang cami pkkayan naga, piyox ci yaw waya skayan na bkis, yaw nko knba'an mloyak na bnkesan.
english: During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

tay: ana myan ini ba'i mong kwara, ana ga waya myan galon syasing rengwa 'ba, mosa myan le'on mong loyi.
english: Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

tay: la'i co cikoy ga ini mo ba'i gaga knxan mo nanak, cayox mo ci kinang ga atayan.
english: When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

tay: piyox waya mo ba'on lga, kinang ga la'i na Tayal, mnanak ta ci, p'ason ci ro straho ta ci.
english: The more I know, the more I feel that being a Tayal is unique and something to be proud of.

tay: 'lyan kisa ga, mosa mwah sali sswe mo likoy la.
english: My younger brother is going home this evening.

tay: cami oya mo ga mosa myan bbisan rami bayi welong, lama myan tmahok ble ni'on gbyan wahan mani sswe mo likoy.
english: My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

tay: mhenas myan bisan rami ga, babaw bisan rami ga piyox ci rami nhbyat mico.
english: We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

tay: bayi cami kanrang, warang ro kmi.
english: We bought Kale, Tomatoes and Cucumbers.

tay: kmayan tbayi bisan bbway haca maha, cbing ci ongray ro yimox mo, bayi cikah!
english: The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

tay: mhenas myan bisan syang ga, kmayan tbayi maha, lalo bison so? hopa ro msyang ci welong nya soni, otox ga togan kbhon pila.
english: We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

tay: knita na oya mo ga hmet ci la, kyalon nya tbayi maha hmway cikah.
english: Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

tay: ana ga kmayan tbayi haca maha waya hmway ci la, iyat mo heton pila la.
english: But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

tay: kmayan tbayi cyo maki syaw haca maha, owah bayi 'cyox mo, hopa ro hmway ci 'cyox mo.
english: The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

tay: poting ci ga waya myan bayi welong ro 'cyox, tehok sali lga otox hanray ni'an rrami waya myan poyon.
english: In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

tay: bsya ci mnaga cami, memaw mko'ong kayan la.
english: After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

tay: mwah rengwa sswe likoy maha, nyo siy tbah ini hngaw hetay la, babaw 'nyan hngawan ryax ga yaca thoyay co mwah sali.
english: The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

tay: kmayan oya mo maha piyox ci tnahok ta rrami la, sgiy kwara c'oli owah s'on mani.
english: Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

tay: tpihon myan glo ro llpyong, owah ms'on mani piyox ci nni'on na kgabi hani.
english: We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

tay: kyan otox glow m'was biro mo ga Hayong, heya ga ryax ryax mongi maras y'aya nya.
english: I have a classmate named Hayung, he often forgets to bring things.

tay: tkba biro cami ga, ksiyo kryax glow m'was biro bbrwan, ccong ini ga bbiro lban.
english: During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

tay: te otox, te sa'ing, te togan ga, syogan naha heya kwara.
english: Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

tay: ana ga kyan otox ya'eh sco nya, ksiyo y'aya naha lga ini nya wahiy mato kryax.
english: But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

tay: sorow nya lga ini naha ksyogiy y'aya naha la.
english: In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

tay: kyan otox ryax, mlo cami mosa mtisan kwara myan.
english: One day, we all went on an outing together.

tay: maki to'i ga, smoya mosa stanox Hayong haca, ana ga waya mongi maras lban ccong nya.
english: On the way, Hayung wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

tay: heya ga aki cyo smoya ksiyo lban ccong glow m'was biro, ana ga kmayan kwara naha maha, ini cami aras oyi.
english: He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

tay: memaw sktan ci ro ngilis Hayong haca. ms'ang kmayan heya maha, ca co nya ini ksyogiy lban ccong kwara naha!
english: Hayung burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

tay: glow m'was biro ga kyalon nya heya maha, baha mcwa ini so aras nanak, ini ga ksiyo so y'aya naha lga, ini so wahiy mato la.
english: The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

tay: kcoxan nya ga mwah m'was biro, mgebo ci mwah pwasan brio Hayong haca, kwara knsyogan nya y'aya ga waya nya halan mato glow m'was biro kwara.
english: The next day at school, Hayung arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

tay: mkora glow m'was biro tmatok tonox Hayong haca, kmayan maha babaw nya ga p'aras co nanak y'aya mo, shway nya kwara glow m'was biro waya smwa'ing ksiyo heya kwara y'aya naha lela.
english: Hayung apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

tay: yaba mo ga mlikoy mloyak alang myan.
english: My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

tay: la'i cikoy co ga, yaba ro mama mo mhto tanox gbyan kryax, maras lalaw ro patos.
english: When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

tay: cmyax kayan sasan lga, panga ksino bno naha mwah sali.
english: At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

tay: kroma ga biyak kahong, kroma ga yapit, kroma oyi ga p'oreh.
english: Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

tay: naha ga maki pkiyok alang lga ksyogon naha kwara ksino, halan naha m'aso c'oli.
english: They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

tay: mkebo cako yaba mo kryax, smoya co mlo yaba mo mosa mloyak.
english: Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

tay: kmayan yaba mo maha naga hopa kawas mo lga rason co nya mosa mlo.
english: Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

tay: mlikoy alang myan ga kba cmi t'oya kmiyak ksino oyi, naha haca ga kba cmi tlnga ro rangay.
english: The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

tay: yaba mo ga kba ci kle tlnga, kmayan yaba mo maha, kwani ga pkiyak ta p'oreh, le'on ta mita rapan na ksino, t'oya ga pcyan ta babaw to'i nwahan na ksino.
english: My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

tay: smoya co aki helaw hayi mlo kwara bkis mosa mloyak, tkba co cmi t'oya kryax, t'oya mo ga helaw ci waya ciri calay ksino.
english: In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

tay: texan co nya yaba mo lga kyalon co nya maha, babaw nya ga mosa so kba calay mloyak.
english: Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

tay: hopa kawas mo mico la, panga co bhoni ro pnelo mako, mlo co yaba mo mosa mloyak.
english: Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

tay: mwah cami alang myan lga ksyogon myan pnanga ksino, syogon myan kwara c'oli.
english: When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

tay: kmayan yaba mo maha, shway ta nhway bne'an na lotox bnkesan, thoyay ta mloyak piyox ci ksino.
english: Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

tay: mso'i co mosa m'was biro sasan la.
english: I was late for school this morning.

tay: mosa co pwasan biro ga, yngyan mo maras kabang la.
english: When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.
I didn't bring anything with me.

tay: m'was biro ga, ms'on co glow m'was biro mita biro ppwason.
english: During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

tay: pcpong miro ga, syogan co nya bbrwan ro ccong nko glow m'was biro.
english: During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

tay: kyalon co nya psba biro maha, "babaw nya ga helaw hayi mtoli, iya kso'i la!"
english: The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

tay: myasa ci lpyong mo ga Yokan, heya ga la'i Tayan oyi.
english: My good friend’s name is Yukan, and he is also an Tayal child.

tay: ms'on cami m'was biro beh alang Pyahaw.
english: We study together in the Pyahaw. tribe.

tay: ms'on cami mong bkis kmayan yaw lela, kba cami calay kmayan ke Tayan.
english: We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Tayal proficiently.

tay: bawi cako ci ro thoy cako ci, Yokan ga, creh ci ro mhekang ci.
english: I am tall and overweight, while Yukan is short and thin.

tay: Yokan ga shelaw calay, sli naha ci kwara.
english: Yukan is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

tay: soni ga onrokay na pwasan biro, piyox ci pcpong nya waya crxon nko pwasan biro.
english: Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

tay: kyan mholoy snyo, kmkah boro, mt'enah, myogi ro cmo pnelo.
english: There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
I participated in the running competition.

tay: trang t'enah cako ga, wa cako takoy la, piyox ci smoyox nya tari mo.
english: When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

tay: ana ga mtoli cako, mkora co gleng mt'enah loyi.
english: But I stood up and continued running forward.

tay: tehok co pcingan lga m'es kwara c'oli.
english: Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

tay: ana co ini agan te otox cnrxan ga, m'es cako calay, baha mcwa waya cako thoyay tmaso pcpong la.
english: Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

tay: mnlow co yaba mo mnwah mita mama mo hesa.
english: Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

tay: wa m'ilis kakay mama mo la.
kyalon cami nya, cyo bling lmo'i na sali.
english: He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

tay: kble lmo'i heya ga, waya kahon babaw lmo'i shotaw.
english: He fell off the roof while repairing it.

tay: yaba mo maras he kacing ro binro sbe nya mama mo.
english: My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

tay: cami mama mo mtisan myan cka sali, piyox ci yaw lela waya nya skayan.
english: My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

tay: gleng shri co ga, straho co nya mama mo maha wa cako mbawi la ro waya co mllaw hayi la.
english: Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

tay: kmayan co maha, "naga ble kakay na mama lga, babaw nya owah tisan sali myan oyi."
english: I said, When your foot gets better

tay: maki te sa'ing seng posan sa'ing kawas ga, sexo pklahang ko splawa naha lnhoyan na pkkayan yaw nko lalo mibonsyo tayan ga ana mosa sbiro lalo tayan nanak.
english: In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

tay: nwahan mo mita Nolay Piho mlikoy na alang tayan, heya ga bsya calay mskora nya sexo pklahang ro msina sko mibonsyo ta ga aki nanak lalo tayan sbiro ta.
english: I interviewed Nolay Piho, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

tay: pkayan cami 'nyan hngawan ryax hani ga mosa co mita sali nya.
english: We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

tay: maki sko pkayan myan ga, sba'an co nya kahon ino lalo nya, spkita co nya otox sali nya ro alang nya oyi.
english: During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

tay: kyalon mo heya maha ca otox ci longan so mosa p'iyo lalo, ya'eh so pbiro na lela heya ga?
english: I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

tay: kyalon co nya maha, baha mcwa sbiro ta ke ckoko ga ini ba'i kmayan lalo nya, kroma c'oli ga No先生 san nya, piyox calay mhto psya'an na ke.
english: He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \No Xian Sheng

tay: kmayan Nolay Piho maha, "sbiro ta ke Tayal lalo ta ga yaca ga calay ci lalo ta, lalo ta ga tgiwan na glow ta Tayal, glow otox sali, ro cnrxan ta, aki piyox hayi glow tayan ga mosa naha llwan lalo naha nanak."
english: Nolay Piho said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

tay: cami oya ga mnwah myan tbayi rrami beh bbisan rami hesa, mnaras nya nanak nohi nya rami mosa, kble myasa ni'on na nni'on tayan ro spkani nya kwara c'oli.
english: Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

tay: kwara c'oli ga sli naha ci bbisan na oya, piyox calay c'oli bayi ali roma ro cryohing, piyox ci c'oli mwah tmalam mani tnahok nya nni'on.
english: Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

tay: tnahok nya cryohing ro somon ga ble ci ni'on, kyan loyi tnahok nya m'aw tmagon syang biyak kahong, ble sokan nya ga tmapeh piyox ci llpyong, mwah m'oto bbisan myan kwara.
english: The Shansu and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

tay: trang tmahok nni'on nko oya n_ga, maki co beh syaw nya tmapeh llpyong. lokah co smoy beh syaw nya maha, "rrami ga nohi nanak, mrkyas nanak ongat iyo, nahay owah bayi ow!"
english: While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

tay: kwara tbison myan ga helaw ci waya so'on tbayi kwara, kmayan oya maha, "olong iso mwah rmaw kwara."
english: Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

tay: kahon ko lnhoyan hani ga, piyox ci waya mo kba'on nko knba'an na k'man tayan ro nni'on tayan, waya mo kba'on oyi ko kn'wix na tbayi bbisan.
english: Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

tay: texan mo oya ga cmi ci longan nni'on tayan, straho mo calay ro p'ason mako.
english: Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.

tay: mpito tmoting mgyebo soni ga, tehok kong pkba'an biro la.
english: I arrived at school at seven today.

tay: pt'aring sami miro la, myop pkba'an myan psba biro, kmayan pgleng myan maha "toli! tobon tonox!"
english: It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

tay: hmnyang sami maha "lokah so pcba biro."
mkbaga sami ga, cba'an sami ni pcba biro sa lmpo.
english: In class, the teacher taught us the Tayal language of numbers.

tay: kbalong sami pcba biro lmpo, m'owas sami owas na lmpo.
english: We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

tay: pyox kay na S'oli Tayan ba'on mo la.
english: I have learned many Tayal languages.

tay: mosa kong miro krryax, kbaga kong kay na S'oli Tayan krryax skayan mo ki yaya mo mong.
english: I go to school every day, I learn the Tayal language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

tay: lalo ni yaba mo ga Pihaw Bawxin.
english: My dad’s name is Pihaw Bawxin.

tay: lalo ni yaya mo ga Pitay Toyaw.
english: My mother’s name is Pitay Tuyaw.

tay: kyan otox bsoyan mo tmalong, lalo nya ga Tahos Pihaw, mpow otox kayan nya la.
english: I have a brother, his name is kulas, he is 11 years old.

tay: niya sami mglow miro sko otox pkba'an biro.
english: We study in the same school.

tay: kozing ro bsoyan mo tmalong Tahos ga sgalan myan m'owas.
english: Both my brother and I like to sing.

tay: smogan kong mlngya, ryax hngi'an moto sami mglow mosa mlngya otox sali.
english: I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

tay: smogan kong mkbba sa g'anos rawin ba sami mglow m'owas ro mlngya.
english: I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

tay: niya mki syaw Lyong Penox sali myan.
english: Our family lives by the Da’an River.
There are five people in our family.
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

tay: mglow sami myanox ki yaba yaya bsoyan tmalong ro bsoyan knerin.
english: I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

tay: bawi balay yaba mo yaba mo ga kinsat.
english: My father is tall and he is a policeman.

tay: mhikang balay yaya mo yaya mo ga koysang.
english: My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

tay: mki sali moto sami kyalon kay tayan ni yaba.
english: My father speaks the Atayal language with us at home.

tay: mhngi 'bagan ga moto sami mosa alang.
english: We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

tay: bsoyan mo tmalong ro knerin ki kozing mglow sami kmyap takay.
english: My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

tay: sgalan mo balay otox sali myan.
english: I like our family very much.

tay: sami ki yaya mnwah mgnaw tanox soni.
english: I went out with my mother today.

tay: memaw mslingaw ko babaw kayan sko slwan, ini kskinot ro ini kkilox ko kayan, memaw blay sinbehoyan nya.
english: The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

tay: tl'ong sami babaw be'nox k'man mani sa pang, mb'ya sko hi kinmli na witox, memaw yemli.
english: We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

tay: babw kinryax lga mtanah ko kayan la.
english: In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

tay: p'osan mo yaya, howa ka mtanah kayan la.
english: I asked my mother why the sky is red.

tay: kmayan yaya maha kyala mmwah rhoyan la.
english: Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

tay: gbyan lga ongat yolong mki babaw kayan mhto ko yangah la.
english: There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

tay: mki to'iy na 'binah sali ga, kyalon mo ko yangah.
english: On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

tay: mwani laxiy 'wah rhoyan, smogan kong mosa mgnaw tanox na.
english: I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

tay: niya mki syaw sali myan ko pkba'an biro myan, hmakay kong mosa miro krryax, hmakay oziy mwah sali.
english: My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

tay: ini kraho pkba'an biro myan, ini khbayaw mkbaga biro, mkbba sami kwara.
english: Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

tay: kwara lla'i moto sami mlahoy sko pgnahan, mglow mnaw mari, mpcisan.
english: All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

tay: mglow sami mgnaw oziy pcba biro, wiwan otox raho na sali ko pkba'an biro.
english: The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

tay: siki kmagaw sami krryax, kwagan myan ro ini k'oraw ko pbrwan myan la.
english: We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

tay: kroma ga mi'ing riwan na nyaway kroma ga kmagaw rhyan.
english: Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

tay: moto myan kwagan kwara ana ino 'ong na pkba'an biro, psogon myan ko yaw myan ro pkrraw sami, ini k'oraw balay krryax ko pkba'an myan biro.
english: We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

tay: shisa mnwah kong alang mtayox yotas.
english: Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

tay: bsya sami ini pktayox la snon mo balay hiya.
english: We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

tay: txan kong ni yotas lga pkni'an kong nya bahat pnoban kong nya ocya.
english: As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

tay: sbing balay bahat pinohi ni yotas blay balay ni'on.
english: The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

tay: sgalan mo oziy ocya ni yotas blay nobon oziy.
english: I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

tay: 'lyan lga kozing ki yaki mglow phapoy kryaxon.
english: At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

tay: pyox tnahok ni yaki syox wilong abang ro tmang.
english: Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

tay: babaw kinryax lga mosa sami pinhyan yasay kmyot tbihi.
english: After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

tay: mnagan pyox ngahi sehoy ro ino tayan ko yaki sbay kong nya maha aras sali.
english: Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

tay: sgayan mo laha ro kyalon mo maha babaw ryax halan mo tayox laha.
english: I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

tay: rason sami ni pcba biro mosa klhangan lmlalo sin'anan soni mbko sami blihon nya mbaziy kipo.
english: Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

tay: myop sami sahoy yengayan lmlamo sin'anan lga kmayan pcba biro maha te gleng ga kkbhni te sorow ga m'o osa tayox nanak simo.
english: After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

tay: mngongo kong m'o nano ye'asa ini kong osa tayox m'o.
english: I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

tay: txan mo pyox kkbhni niya plaka babaw khoni txan mo oziy pok ki m'abi bling khoni.
english: I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

tay: kyan zo oma klit mki klhangan sin'anan 'yat mo kintxan kwara 'sino hani txan mo soni m'as balay inlongan mo.
english: There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

tay: pyox pinsyasing mo spkita mo yaba yaya.
english: I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

tay: babaw nya pglow sami ki yaba yaya mowah.
english: Next time I will come with my parents.

tay: hngi'an ryax wayan hani ga bsoyan mo knerin ro kong mnwah sami Bnka tayox mama.
english: This holiday, my sister and I went to Taipei to visit my uncle.

tay: t'aring sami Toyohara mlow kisya mosa Bnka.
english: We took the train from Fengyuan to Taipei.

tay: tehok sami Bnka lga mniray haya ro mowah n_gan kisya mlmoh sami ko mama.
english: When we arrived in Taipei, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

tay: ini ktwahi ko hnari n_gan kisya ro sali na mama miray haya ini kbsya tehok la.
english: The station is not far from my uncle’s house, and it’s just a short drive away.

tay: llingay sali ni mama ga kyan otox raho na kklhangan kating mit mglow sami miray ling ling aya mosa kya.
english: There is a big ranch near my uncle’s house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

tay: mki sami klhangan mit kating lga rason sami ni mama mosa sma'an mit ro mlow oma.
english: In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

tay: gbyan lga mglow sami mosa heci kgabi.
english: In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

tay: pyox haya trako mki heci nano ye'asa ko miray sami otobay mosa kya.
english: There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

tay: pshri sami lga txan ga wayan kri'on otobay la 'si sami glow bas mshri.
english: When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

tay: miso soni niya sami mbinah Toyohara ba'aw ta wayan lowan ni mama ko otobay nya la.
english: Now that we are back in Fengyuan, I don’t know if my uncle’s motorcycle has been found.

tay: trang la'i kong na ga mki Mekarang sali myan, miro kong lga mosa sami myanox Cikoto la, 'si sami kyanox heci la.
english: When we were young, our family lived in Mekarang. After I started school, we moved to Zhudong and have been living in the city ever since.

tay: miro kong raho bbrwan lga, minkbaga kong otox pkba'an gaga na Gyenzyomin, ba'on mo ko pyox lmlamo ro blay gaga na Gyenzyomin Zok.
english: After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

tay: nano ye'asa, mhngi 'royox 'bagan hani ga, bsoyan mo tmalong ro kozing, mnwah sami alang ma'ot nnbkis, nki myan ba'on gaga myan nanak.
english: So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

tay: mspat pgan kayan ko nbkis la, ana ga txan 'si ga nisan mziman kayan na.
english: The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

tay: p'osan mo hiya nenano kay ba'on nya, pyang yoci ko knayan nya kay Tayan, ba oziy kmayan kay na Ngayngay ro kay Gipon.
english: I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Atayal, as well as Hakka and Japanese.

tay: p'osan mo hiya lga ba'on mo, aw ba sa mniro sko kay Gipon knerin nya, ga tayan mtyaw ga, ba'on nya hbayaw Ngayngay, nano ye'asa ko pyox kay ba'on nya.
english: I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Atayal, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.

tay: trang mppa'ot ro mpcisan sami ga, pyox knayan nko nbkis, yaw ro kinba'an na 'mlyap.
english: During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

tay: ana myan ini thyaziy mong kwara, si kila, wayan myan syon sko soci, mosa myan nble'on mong lozi.
english: Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

tay: la'i kong na ga ini mo ba'iy gaga nanak, sksayox mo cikay kozing ga Gyenzyomin.
english: When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

tay: pyox ba'on lga, llongon mo kozing ga Atayan, minnanak balay, kahon inlongan mo p'ason mo balay oziy la.
english: The more I know, the more I feel that being a Atayan is unique and something to be proud of.

tay: gbyan kisa mmwah sali ko sway tmalaong la.
english: My younger brother is going home this evening.

tay: yaki ro kong mosa sami bnasan yasay mbaziy wilong mnama tmahok blay ni'on na kgbyon nko sway tmalong.
english: My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

tay: hminas sami sko bnasan tbihi pyox ko memaw mtasi na tbihi.
english: We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

tay: mbaziy sami sa kongsincay sako ro tanah sopo.
english: We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

tay: kmayan ko syaw ka bnasan beboway na lawpan maha phngaran ro zimoh mo ga pyang ssbing baziy cikay.
english: The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

tay: hminas sami bnasan hi wilong kmayan Lawpan nano bnason so wilong soni ga raho ro msyam otox wilong ga cyogan kbhon.
english: We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

tay: lokah s'yong la ma yaki p'osan nya Lawpan blay khoyon cikay.
english: Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

tay: ana ga kmayan Lawpan rema mhnok la 'yat thyayon khoy la.
english: But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

tay: mki bih ko lawpan kmayan maha owah baziy syox mo syox mo ga raho ro mhnok.
english: The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

tay: te pocing mbaziy sami wilong ro syox oziy mowah sami sali tmnahok sami otox lalan rami.
english: In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

tay: niyan reng_wa ni sway mo tmalong maha si tbah ini swayan mhngi ko hitay siki rayx babaw rehay thoyay mowah sali la.
english: The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

tay: kmayan yaki pyox pinhapoy ta kayan kwara mowah mglow mani!
english: Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

tay: tpihon myan kwara geglow ro rerawin mowah mlaw sa memaw blay na kgbyon.
english: We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

tay: kyan otox rawin mo, lalo nya ga Hayang, moto mngya maras ye'aya krryax.
english: I have a classmate named Hayung, he often forgets to bring things.

tay: miro sami lga, moto mkora sko mtna mkbaga biro ksyok sa inpit, i'ing, ini ga rban.
english: During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

tay: minxaliy, minsazing, mincyogan moto myan ksyogan han.
english: Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

tay: ana ga kyan otox ya'ih na lhnyon nya, ksyok ye'aya lga, ini nya psyogi may ye'aya hasa la.
english: But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

tay: babaw nya, ini sami sogan pksyok ye'aya ki hiya la.
english: In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

tay: kyan otox ryax, mglow sami kwara mosa mgnaw tetanox.
english: One day, we all went on an outing together.

tay: mki sami ska to'iy, nki mosa mstanox ko Hayong, ana ga yengan nya maras rban i'ing.
english: On the way, Hayung wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

tay: nki ksyok sko mtna mkbaga biro, ana ga syokon naha kwara maha, ini kong aras oziy.
english: He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

tay: memaw khlan ko Hayong, ro mngilis minbci maha, howa simo ini pksyok kozing rban i'ing!
english: Hayung burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

tay: kyalon nko mtna mkbaga biro ko hiya, ye'igi, ini so aras nanak, ro pinksyok myan iso ye'aya ga, ini so wahiy may la!
english: The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

tay: kinsasan nya mgyebo, mowah miro ro tehok pkba'an biro ko Hayang, wayan nya pbnahon may mtna mkbaga biro kwara ye'aya naha.
english: The next day at school, Hayung arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

tay: mkora sko mglow mkbaga biro ko Hayong, tmatok tonox maha, babaw nya p'aras kong nanak ye'aya, mhoway simo oziy, pinksyok ki hiya.
english: Hayung apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

tay: mki alang myan, yaba mo ga pyang ba 'mlyap s'oli.
english: My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

tay: la'i kong na ga, trang gbyan lga, yaba ro mama moto maras poting ro patos mosa tanox.
english: When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

tay: slowan lga, moto niya maras sa 'sino mowah sali.
english: At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

tay: kroma ga bewak nahi, kroma ga yapit, kya roma oziy ga la'ong.
english: Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

tay: moto mki sko kyopan alang ko laha, 'maso may 'sino sko kwara otox alang.
english: They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

tay: moto kong mkebo yaba maha, pglow kong iso mosa 'mlyap.
english: Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

tay: kmayan yaba maha, raho so lga rasaw miso mlow kong la.
english: Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

tay: ttmalong na alang, moto kbalay loyang tmiri 'sino, moto kbalay loyang ro wahiy.
english: The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

tay: pyang ba kbalay loyang yaba mo, kmayan yaba maha, hani ga ttiri la'ong, siki nble'on ta tayox pilong na ''sino, wahiy ga siki syon sko to'iy hkayan na ''sino.
english: My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

tay: ye'igi smogan kong helaw mglow binkis mosa 'mlyap, kbaga kong posa loyang krryax, yanga balay wayan tmiro 'sino ko loyang mo la.
english: In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

tay: txan ni yaba lro, kyalon kong nya maha, babaw nya mosa so pyang ba trgyax.
english: Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

tay: miso soni, niya kong raho la, spanga mo ko boli ro tlak mo, gmlow yaba mosa 'mlyap.
english: Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

tay: mbinah sami alang lga, s'aso myan ko tniri 'sino ki kwara s'oli.
english: When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

tay: kmayan yaba maha, siki tmobon ta bbinkisan maha, mhoway simo may oyat, pyox tniri myan ''sino.
english: Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

tay: makaso'i kong tayhok pakaba'an biro mayabo sawni la.
english: I was late for school this morning.

tay: mosa kong i pakaba'an biro ga, yamngiya kong maras so kabang mo la.
english: When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

tay: ini kong aras ninano na yayowaw.
english: I didn't bring anything with me.

tay: miro sami ga, gamalo kong matayox biro ki bays mo miro.
english: During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

tay: pasapong ga, kasiyokan kong nya inpit ro i'ing ko galow mo miro.
english: During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

tay: kyalon kong ni pasaba biro maha, "sa'otox la ga kayabo hazi matoli, laxiy i kaso'i la ki!"
english: The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

tay: rawin mo ga Kosaw hiya ga la'i na Tayan oziy.
english: My good friend’s name is Kusaw, and he is also an Tayal child.

tay: magalo sami miro i alang Maypowan.
english: We study together in the Maypuwan tribe.

tay: moto sami magalow karariyax mong so yayowaw sarari na yotas, ba sami kwara kamayan kayi na Tayan.
english: We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Tayal proficiently.

tay: babawi ro katahoy kong, Kosaw ga kahi ro rarawo oziy.
english: I am tall and overweight, while Kusaw is short and thin.

tay: haylaw ko Kosaw, balay naha kwara hiya.
english: Kusaw is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

tay: pagazinah ko pakaba'an biro sawni, payaox ko panawsa pakaba'an biro so pasapangan.
english: Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

tay: kiyan hamoloy saniyow, papay'on mariy, mazinzh ro pasapong bahawni.
english: There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
I participated in the running competition.

tay: mazinah kong ga, matakoy kong la, payox ramoyox ko tari mo.
english: When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

tay: sikila ga matoli kong, mosa kong tagalayng mazinah lawziy.
english: But I stood up and continued running forward.

tay: tayhok kong i momo' tahakan ga pa'ason kwara na tayan.
english: Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

tay: ana kong ini agan so icibang ga, sikila ga payang kong ma'as, ya'igi waya mo maso'on anowah pasapong kani.
english: Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

tay: kozing ki yaba mo mosa matisan ki mama mo so sahaysa.
english: Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

tay: kyalon sami niya, magali mabaka' otox takayo ko ramo'iy sali.
english: He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

tay: tamapang sako ramo'iy sali kiya ga, kahon sako ramo'iy masahotaw ti hogan la.
english: He fell off the roof while repairing it.

tay: maras so hi kating ro pinnang ko yaba bay niya mama.
english: My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

tay: matisan sami ti abiyan ki mama mo, payox pinyowan niya so yayowaw sarali.
english: My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

tay: minhari so a'awsa mo ga, sapa'as kong ni mama mo maha babawi so la, ro waya hayoti ko inrakyasan so oziy la.
english: Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

tay: maha kong, "naw mo so balay kozih mama la ga, owah matisan sali mo so sa'otox."
english: I said, When your foot gets better

tay: maki so kayan ti 2022 (sazing siyan maposan sazing kayan), kiya nakaygi Sefo ka minbonsyo Yencomin balay siyon baniro so lalo na Tayan la.
english: In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

tay: pinosan mo ko basiya masina ki Sefo sasiyan lalo Tayan ko minbonsyo ka sining alang Noami Kolas.
english: I interviewed Noami Kulas, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

tay: minkayan kong ki hiya masatana'a ta ti pahangi'an hani ga mosa kong ma'ot ti sali niya.
english: We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

tay: maki sa ma'ot hani ga, galownan kong niya pinayo' ko inkaholan lalo niya, ro pasaba niya oziy ko mayanox si sali ki alang niya.
english: During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.
