tay: pa'osan mo hiya maha howa so sapawzit sa'ayong ko a'iyo lalo hani, baniro so sarali ga ya'ih pi?
english: I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

tay: sawon kong niya maha, ya'igi sakahon so lalo cyokok ga ini niya patahakiy sa'ayong kakosa na lalo niya, moto naha sawon maha "那先生", misa so moto ya'ani ko sapasiya naha oziy ma.
english: He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Na Xian Sheng

tay: maha Noami Kolas, "baniro lalo so kayi na Yencomin hani ko payang ta lalo balay, niwan na inkaholan nakisan Atayan, ro otox sali nabakis, lalo nanak saxa' mayanox hani ga, mowa na salowan hmkani sabanahan nanak kwara lalo naha ki."
english: Noami Kulas said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

tay: gamalo kong ki yaki mo mosa i pabakagan tabaziy so sahaysa, maras so pinnohiy niya nanak na tabihiy ro sakalay niya so satalam nani'on kwara na Yencomin.
english: Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

tay: sabalay'an naha kwara ko tabanasan ni yaki, tiko tamayloh ro raki tomon payox tayan bamaziy ki, payox oziy ko mowah tamalam so tanahok niya rami.
english: Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

tay: tiko tanahok niya ka mala' ro myox rahakay payang i balay ni'on, kiya otox ka anising niya so ma'aw ka hi na baywak nahiy, mimaw hamoloy so habayaw okyak ko sanawkang niya ma.
english: The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

tay: tamahok rami ko yaki mo ga, moto kong i tamapih so okyak, maki kong sasiyaw hamowaw kong maha, "tabihiy ga nohiy miyan nanak ki, kiyan na azi naya so hinbaka'an niya nanak, ihihazi owah mabaziy yo!"
english: While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

tay: ini kyanga maso'on tabaziy ko tabihiy miyan la, kamayan yaki maha, "ya'igi kiyan iso ramaw kwara ma."
english: Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

tay: tiko pintayowaw hani ga, niya mo sakaba'an ko sawon sasiyop ka'amam na Yencomin ro ninano kwara nani'on ka kinba naha, ro tinlaman mo la ko na'abok tabanasan haniy.
english: Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

tay: taxan mo ko anihon sanawgan so nani'on kwara rarami Tayan sarali ka longan yaki mo ga, payang mo sapawsa so sataraho' ro sapa'as longan balay la.
english: Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.

tay: pito tmocing tehok sako pqwasan kira.
english: I arrived at school at seven today.

tay: mqwas biro la, nyox tehok Sinsiy, kmal pgleng "toliq! tatok tonox!"
english: It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

tay: mqwas sami ga, pcbaq linpgan Sinsiy myan.
english: In class, the teacher taught us the Tayal language of numbers.

tay: mlow sami Sinsiy lmpow, mqwas sami linpgan.
english: We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.
I have learned many Tayal languages.

tay: mqwas ko biro krryax, mqbaq ko ke tayal krryax, skayal mako yaya mow.
english: I go to school every day, I learn the Tayal language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

tay: maki qotox qbsoyan mow mlikoy, Koras lalo nya, mpow qotox kawas nya.
english: I have a brother, his name is kulas, he is 11 years old.
We study in the same school.

tay: sami ka qbsoyan mow ga smawya sami balay mqwas.
english: Both my brother and I like to sing.

tay: smawya sami balay mlngyaq, trang mhngaw ga, sami qotox ngasal msqon myan mosa mlngyaq.
english: I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

tay: blaq mako smrangi giqas na rangi,aki sami msqon mqwas ro mlngyaq.
english: I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

tay: magal hi myan sami qotox ngasal.
english: There are five people in our family.

tay: sami qotox ngasal ga ciwal(cyogal) sami mtswe.
english: There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

tay: nyox sako mlow maki beh yaba yaya qbsoyan mow mlikoy ka kneril.
english: I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

tay: wagiq yaba mow, cyox m'Kinsat yaba mow.
english: My father is tall and he is a policeman.

tay: hlawax yaya mow, cyox m'Sinsiy na mita nbo' yaya mow.
english: My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

tay: maki ngasal ga skayal sako nya ke tayal yaba mow.
english: My father speaks the tayal language with us at home.

tay: mhngaw 'bagan ga mosa sami qalang rgyax.
english: We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

tay: sami ka qbsoyan mow ga msqon sami mosa kmyap qpatong.
english: My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

tay: blaq mako balay sami qotox ngasal.
english: I like our family very much.

tay: mnwah myan mzwi tanox sami ka yaya mow.
english: I went out with my mother today.

tay: qlyan ga mlabo balay kayal, ini kilox ro ini hiyaq oziy, tbasaw balay behoy nya.
english: The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

tay: mtama sami mtasiq k'mal maniq Menpaw, ro pbo wagi, hrhol balay.
english: We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

tay: babaw knryax ga, mtalah qo kayal la.
english: In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

tay: pqotan mow yaya, swa mtalah kayal.
english: I asked my mother why the sky is red.

tay: kmal yaya, mosa mwah hazi behoy wah.
english: Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

tay: mhngan ga ongat yolong kayal, mhtow kwara bengah.
english: There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

tay: maki sako ska toqiy osa ngasal ga, mkora sako bengah pqoyat.
english: On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

tay: inlongan mako ga laxiy owah behoy, smawya sako mosa mzwi na.
english: I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

tay: nyox syaw ngasal mow pqwasan, mhkani sako mosa pqwasan krryax, mhkani sako mwah ngasal oziy.
english: My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

tay: ini kyaba pqwasan myan, ini ktwa Seto nya, mkbbaq myan kwara.
english: Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

tay: msli' pzi'an tanox kwara laqi, mzwi mari, msqon mcisal.
english: All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

tay: msqon sami mzwi oziy Sinsiy, pqwasan ga qotox ka yaba na ngasal.
english: The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

tay: kmagaw myan krryax, si ki mplqoy kinwagan myan qsahoy pqbaqan biro.
english: We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

tay: maki mosa smom tobong, maki mosa kmgaw.
english: Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

tay: kwagan myan kwara qqlaq na pqwasan oziy, mrraw myan mtzyowaw, si plqwi krryax pqwasan.
english: We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

tay: nwahan mako mita yotas mow cyox qalang shera.
english: Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

tay: bsyaq iyat myan minkita la, s'non mo balay hiya qasa.
english: We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

tay: ktan sako na yotas mow lga, pniqan sako nya sa'as, pnbwan sako nya Ocya.
english: As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

tay: sbing balay pinnoya yotas mow sa'as qaniy, blaq balay niqon.
english: The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

tay: Ocya na yotas mow ga qsliq mow oziy, blaq balay nbon.
english: I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

tay: ska wagi ga, msqon ko yotas mow mtayak.
english: At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

tay: piyox balay pincyakan yaki mow, maki qolih hi ngta qabang ro masot.
english: Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

tay: babaw kryaxan lga, mosa myan qmazih magal ramat.
english: After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

tay: piyox balay pin'aras yaki mow ngahi sehoy ro qenow, rasiy ngasal ma.
english: Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

tay: psgayon mako, ro kyalon mow mha wahay miso mita babaw nya loziy. psgayon mako, ro kyalon mow mha wahay miso mita babaw nya loziy.
english: I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

tay: ryax soni ga nyox samiy rason Sinsiy mwah lmosay mita qqsinow qnalang, ro mbkow myan kyopan blihon maziy Kipo.
english: Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

tay: mzyop samiy qqsinow qnalang lga,kmal Sinsiy mha:"te gling ga qbhniq,te sorow ga mqo,ktay kya nanak. mzyop samiy qqsinow qnalang lga, kmal Sinsiy mha, "te gling ga qbhniq, te sorow ga mqo, ktay kya nanak."
english: After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

tay: mngongo sako mqo, nano ini sako kita mqo hiya.
english: I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

tay: piyox balay qbhniq ktan mako, cyox mlaka babaw qhoniq, ro ktan mako ngoyaq cyox m'abi bling qhoniq.
english: I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

tay: zik qqsinow qnalang ga maki Zo, rme, kli ka, iyat mako kntan na qqsinow, nyox mako ktan soni ga mqas ko balay.
english: There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

tay: piyox nagal mow Syasing, spkita mow yaba yaya.
english: I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

tay: babaw nya ga pglow sako yaba yaya mwah.
english: Next time I will come with my parents.

tay: hngawan ryax qaniy ga, mosa samiy mita mama myan samiy ka qbsoyan mow kneril.
english: This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

tay: aring samiy Bnka mlow Kisya mosa Tayto.
english: We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

tay: tehok Tayto lga, wahan samiy magal na mama mow beh tpr'an toroy.
english: When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

tay: ini tohiq ka n_gan Kisya ngasal mama mow, sobih balay tman toroy lga tehok.
english: The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

tay: lingay ngasal mama mow ga kya qotox rhiyal qyatan qsinow yaba balay, mglow sami hmakay kakay para mosa kya.
english: There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

tay: maki beh rhiyal qqnyatan qasa ga, rason samiy na mama mow pqaniq mit ro mtama rme.
english: In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

tay: mhngan ga, msqon samiy mosa maniq qalang hogan.
english: In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

tay: piyox toroy hogan, nano yasa qo tama samiy Otobay mosa.
english: There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

tay: aki sami mwah lga, wal qriqon sqoliq Otobay la, si samiy hakas tama Baso mwah.
english: When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

tay: nyox samiy Bnka la, ini baqiy kya nya cyox 'lwan Otobay nya lga mama mow.
english: Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

tay: cikoy samiy raral ga maki Balong ngasal myan, mqwas samiy biro ro, mwah samiy maki Cyama la, yasa si myan aki hogan mqyanox.
english: When we were young, our family lived in Balung. After I started school, we moved to Daxi and have been living in the city ever since.

tay: stazil sako mqwas Raygak lga, gmoyaw sako qotox pqbaqon gaga qnxan tayal, kahol sqaniy baq sako tayal Taywan ga bhoyon balay gaga qnxan nha.
english: After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

tay: nano yasa qo, hngawan 'bagan qaniy ga,samiy ka qbsoyan mow mosa myan qalang maqot bnkis,solo' samiy qzinah baq sqo gaga qnxan tayal.
english: So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

tay: hminas spat pgan kawas nya yotas qasa, ana ga yan aring mt'ro' ktan.
english: The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

tay: pqotan mow hiya nano llamo ke baqon so kmal, hiya ga blaq balay ke nya tayal, ro baq kmal ke thilow kmokan Gipon ana ke Amirika baqon nya oziy.
english: I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Atayal, as well as Chinese, Hokkien, Japanese and English.

tay: pqotan mako ro obaq, cipoq raral ga minnaki qalang tayal ngasal nha, hiya ga kmokan kneril nya ga Gipon, pcyogan nya ga cyox mimaw ka sqoliq Amirika, misa balay baq piyox llamo na ke.
english: I asked him to find out that he lived in the Atayal when he was a child, his wife is an Atayal, and he knows many American at work, so he can speak so many languages.

tay: trang samiy mcisal ga, piyox balay gaga na mlata wal nya skayal yotas qasa.
english: During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

tay: ana myan ini baqiy iyal mong ga, ana ga wal myan spowah Rinwasrason psyasing, baqon kbzih mita loziy.
english: Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

tay: laqi sako raral ga ini mako baqiy gaga na ita tayal, sksayox mako nanak kozing ga laqi tayal.
english: When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

tay: piyox baqon mako lga, kozing ka tayal qaniy ga, obaq si p'anak ro stgsyaw mako sinrxan mow.
english: The more I know, the more I feel that being a Atayal is unique and something to be proud of.

tay: gbyan kira ga, mwah ngasal sswe mow la.
english: My younger brother is going home this evening.

tay: mlow sako yaki mow mosa tgbiran maziy ngta, lama mnaga wahan maniq sswe mow gbyan.
english: My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

tay: hminas sami tbiran ramat, piyox balay giqas ka misan nagal na rramat.
english: We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

tay: maziy myan papak qoli ro sakow ka topo talah.
english: We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

tay: nyox syaw tbazing bway na thoki mha, "sbing balay lohiy ka bokil(qbirox) mako ay. baziy cikay ma!"
english: The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

tay: hminas samiy nyox tbaziy hhi, kmal thoki mha, "nano biron so? ngta soni qaniy ga qthoy ro msyam balay, qotox ga cyogal kbhol pila."
english: We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

tay: hmit iyal mha yaki mow, pqotan nya thoki aki hmswa hwaziy hazi.
english: Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

tay: ana ga smyok thoki mha wal hwayon la, iyat hitan la.
english: But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

tay: nyox maki te lingay na tthoki mha, wah maziy qolih mow, qolih mow ga hopa ro hway.
english: The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

tay: pocing nya lga maziy samiy ngta ro qolih, wahan mtayak ngasal si ks'on thikan niqan (Hanray) rramat pincyakan.
english: In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

tay: bsiq in_gan myan, mnkom kayal la.
english: After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

tay: qmoyot hray sswe mow mha, si ptbah iyat phngaw Hitay, si ki hngawan khnyan thoyay sako mwah la.
english: The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

tay: kmal yaki mha piyox tnahok ramat qaniy, say mlawa kwara owah maniq!
english: Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!

tay: san mako mlawa gglow ro rangi, mwah mplaw maniq.
english: We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

tay: maki qotox tnaqan mow mqwas Lesa lalo nya, mongi balay krryax.
english: I have a classmate named Lesa, he often forgets to bring things.

tay: trang samiy mqwas ga, si gryax ksyow 'enpit, ssom ro biro brwan.
english: During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

tay: minnxal, minsazing, mincyogal, ga ksyogan nha ha.
english: Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

tay: ana ga yaqih gaga nya, ksyow ga ini nya kbzihiy kroma.
english: But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

tay: pocing nya ini swayal ksyow kwara la.
english: In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

tay: maki qotox ryax, mglow samiy mosa lmosay.
english: One day, we all went on an outing together.

tay: maki myan ska pknyon, solo mosa tanox qo Lesa, ana ga ini aras rbal ssom.
english: On the way, Lesa wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

tay: aki ksyow rbal ssom, ana ga kmal kwara mha, ini samiy aras oziy.
english: He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

tay: memaw mngilis Lesa. t'oqo kmal mha, swa simow ini sako ksyogiy rbal ssom kwara!
english: Lesa burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

tay: kyalon ni tnaqan mqwas, swa so ini aras nanak, kryax ksyogan miso qeqaya ga, ini so bzihiy oziy.
english: The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

tay: kinsoxal nya mqwas biro lga, mziboq balay tehok pqwasan qo Lesa, kwara kinsyogan nya qeqaya ga wal nya bzihan tnaqan mqwas kwara la.
english: The next day at school, Lesa arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

tay: mkora sqo tnaqan mqwas tmatok tonox, kmal mha aring sqaniy lga aras sako nanak la, ro mhway simow balay pksyogan sako raral mha.
english: Lesa apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

tay: yaba mow ga lhani pqalop samiy qotox qalang.
english: My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

tay: trang sako laqi ga, yaba mow ro mama mow ga mhngan mhotang, maras lalaw ro patos.
english: When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

tay: slwan lga, hnyan maras nagal nha qqsinow.
english: At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

tay: kroma ga bzyok qnhyon, kroma ga yapit, ini si ryax maki laqong hiya.
english: Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

tay: bleqon nha qmasow beh tanox qalang, ro pngsa nha tayal.
english: They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

tay: si sako gryax kzibow yaba mow, glow sako yaba mosa mlata oziy.
english: Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

tay: kmal yaba mow mha hopa so babaw nya lga yasa qo rasaw miso la.
english: Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

tay: mlikoy tayal te qalang ga smi mrosa oziy, kbalay qzyolang ini ga tmrangay. tmrangay
english: The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

tay: baq balay kbalay srahan yaba mow, kmal mha, qaniy ga kyap laqong, si ki bleqon ta mita toro ka rapal qqsinow, ro bhngon beh toqiy nya balay.
english: My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

tay: aki sako thoyay helaw mlow bnkis mosa mlata oziy, si sako pqbaq mhong rangay krryax, nway sako helaw magal qqsinow kahol bnhong mako rrangay.
english: In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

tay: ktan yaba mow bnhong mako si kayal mha mosa so iyat kinqeri na pqalop babaw nya wah.
english: Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

tay: misow qaniy lga nyox sako mrkyas la, maras sako bhoniq pneloq, mlow sako yaba mosa mlata.
english: Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

tay: trang sami msbzinah mwah ngasal lga mosa myan spngsa nagal myan qqsinow.
english: When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

tay: kmal yaba mow mha, anay ta shway otox kinmkesan, nyox ta nya biqan qoyat ka qqsinow.
english: Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

tay: sasal ga mqsoqi sako tehok pqwasan.
english: I was late for school this morning.

tay: mosa sako pqwasan ga, mongi sako maras kabang syan biro.
english: When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.
I didn't bring anything with me.

tay: mqbaq biro lga, si sako msqon mita biro ka rogak mo la.
english: During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

tay: mspong miro ga, ksyogan sako enpit ro ssom rogak mo.
english: During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

tay: kyalon sako na sinsiy mha, "babaw nya ga giboq mtoliq sasal, laxiy qsoqi la!"
english: The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

tay: rangi mako ga Yomin lalo nya, hiya ga laqi na Tayal oziy.
english: My good friend’s name is Yumin, and he is also an Tayal child.

tay: msqon sami mqwas biro beh qalang Knyopan.
english: We study together in the Knyopan tribe.

tay: lhani sami msqon mong bnkis pqzyo sqo pinqzyowaw, baq sami balay kmayal ke Tayal kwara.
english: We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Tayal proficiently.

tay: wagiq ro qthoy sako kon, Yomin ga rroq ro hikang.
english: I am tall and overweight, while Yumin is short and thin.

tay: mlglaw balay Yomin qasa, qsliq kwara na ssqoliq.
english: Yumin is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

tay: ryax soni ga mspon na smlokah hi pqwasan myan, pyox balay qo pspngan.
english: Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

tay: maki hmoloy wasil, kmkah mari, mqzinah, yogi ro mo' slqiy.
english: There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
I participated in the running competition.

tay: trang sako mqzinah ga, mtakoy sako, msramo tari mo.
english: When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

tay: ana ga mtoliq sako ro, mkora sako gleng mqzinah loziy.
english: But I stood up and continued running forward.

tay: tehok sako pcingan lga, pqason kwara sqoliq mita.
english: Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

tay: ana sako ini laqox te qotox ga, ana ga mqas sako balay, baha hmswa wal sako masoq mspong.
english: Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

tay: mnwah myan mkal mama mo shera sami ki yaba mo.
english: Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

tay: cyox tqlisan kakay nya mama mo.
kmal qo hiya mha, cyox mbling qo namow na ngasal ma.
english: He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

tay: trang mosa kbalay qo hiya ga, mhotaw kahol namow.
english: He fell off the roof while repairing it.

tay: s'aras hi kacing ro pinro na yaba mo bbiq nya mama mo.
english: My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

tay: mcisal sami zik ngasal ki mama mo, piyox balay pinqzyowaw wal nya spinqzyo.
english: My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

tay: mshriq sami ga, straho sako nya mha wagiq so la, blaq balay inkyasan so.
english: Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

tay: kyalon mako mha, blaq kakay so lga, wahay miso mita loziy.
english: I said, \When your foot gets better

tay: maki sqo 2022 kawas ga, melahoy mrhow mkayal na Mibonsyo ga swalan miro na lalo Tayal.
english: In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

tay: pqotan mako lhani mkora mrhow msina ssyon lalo tayal Mibonsyo ka qotox mrkyas Yomin Nawi.
english: I interviewed Yumin Nawi, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

tay: wal sami rima smon hngaw ryax ga mosa sako ngasal nya maqot hiya.
english: We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

tay: trang sako maqot ga, skayal sako nya minkahol ino qo lalo nya, mqbaq sami ki sqoliq nqo ngasal nya oziy, ro qalang nya.
english: During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

tay: kyalon mako swa so si ginrhow 'myow lalo, yaqih qo sinllwan raral hiya ga?
english: I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

tay: smyok mha, baha hmswa ini 'royo sbiro lalo thilow lalo mako tayal, si sako nha ryaxiy nha "yo sen song", nano psyaqan sako nha.
english: He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Yu Xian Sheng

tay: kmayal Yomin Nawi mha, sbiro lalo tayal ga yasa qo balay nya, lalo mako tayal ga nyox mkin_giwan ita qotox mtglow ita qotox ngasal ro sinrxan ta, aki hmswa kbzihay ta lalo ta nanak.
english: Yumin Nawi said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

tay: hera ga mnwah myan tbran sami ki yaki mo, piyox balay ramat noya myan naras nya, ro kbalay nniqon na tayal oziy.
english: Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

tay: blaq kwara na sqoliq tbiran yaki mo, skway ro abaw ngahi piyox sqoliq wal maziy, piyox sqoliq mwah tmalam pincyakan nya.
english: Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

tay: tnahok nya tqiton ro somon ga blaq balay niqon, ro syam inbgan maqaw blaq balay niqon na ssqoliq, memaw mbkow maziy kwara sqoliq.
english: The corn and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

tay: nyox tmahok yaki mo ga, maki sako beh nya tmapih sqoliq. mlawa sako, "noya myan nanak ramat qaniy, ini rpsiy iyo hazi owah maziy."
english: While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

tay: helaw balay wal myan soqon tgbaziy maras myan, kmal yaki mo mha, "olong iso lokah rmaw."
english: Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

tay: zyowaw qaniy ga, baqon mako nano qo qnahol na tayal, ro gmlow mosa tgbaziy qaniy oziy ga ini balay k'law.
english: Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

tay: ktan mako yaki mo blaq nya balay moya rramat tayal, mqas sako balay maki balay smyaxan mo oziy.
english: Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.

tay: mapito wagi' tehok co papasba'an ci ke' soni'.
english: I arrived at school at seven today.

tay: palapow la. maṟok lalapgan ci patas ka sinsi'. "tatoli', pastokong" ma ka pancang.
english: It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

tay: yotas ka ke' min maha; "sinsi' ramas so'."
lonpow patas ci kaca ga, pasba'an mini lalapow ci ke' na itaṟal ni sinsi'.
english: In class, the teacher taught us the Atayal language of numbers.

tay: gonlow min lonpow sinsi'. mawas min ci awas na lalapow oṟi.
english: We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

tay: payox ka ke' na itaṟal wal mo ba'on.
english: I have learned many Atayal languages.

tay: mosa' co papasba'an ci ke' karirex. sonbaba' co ci ke' na itaṟal karirex. papongan mo yayan mo.
english: I go to school every day, I learn the Atayal language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

tay: Watan ka ralo' ni yaba' mo.
Temi ka ralo' ni yaya' mo.
kelan co totox na asoṟan malikoṟ, Iyong ka ralo' ni, malapṟow otox ingkaṟalan ni.
english: I have a brother, his name is Iyung, he is 11 years old.

tay: cel min magalow lonpow patas otox papasba'an ci ke'.
english: We study in the same school.

tay: sonkisli' min mawas kora' cami ci asoṟan mo malikoṟ.
english: Both my brother and I like to sing.

tay: sonkisli' co lomangoy. mahngow ci kaca, magalow min mosa' lomangoy otox min moṟow.
english: I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

tay: sonkisli' co sonrangi', anak min magalow mawas lo lomangoy.
english: I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

tay: cel maki Sasi' ka moṟow mo.

english: There are five people in our family.
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

tay: magalow co maki' ci yaba', yaya', asoṟan malikoṟ lo asoṟan kanel mo.
english: I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

tay: babawi' ka yaba' mo, kensaco ka hiya'.
english: My father is tall and he is a policeman.

tay: mahikang ka yaya' mo, ising ka hiya'.
english: My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

tay: maki' moṟow ka yaba' ga, makake' min ci ke' na itṟal.
english: My father speaks the Atayal language with us at home.

tay: mahngow min papasba'an ci ke' ga, mosa' min alang.
english: We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

tay: magalow min konṟak apatoṟ ci asoṟan mo.
english: My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

tay: kisli' mo caṟong ka otox moṟow mo.
english: I like our family very much.

tay: mosa' min salahaw ci yaya' mo soni'.
english: I went out with my mother today.

tay: pascex ka kaṟal bawi'. ini' kagahṟa' lo kakilox ka kaṟal oṟi, bale' sabihoṟan.
english: The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

tay: me' min ci pang banox raxal ki. comex hi' ka wagi', holhol caṟong.
english: We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

tay: kaṟalon mo ka yaya', honco' matanah ka kaṟal la?
english: I asked my mother why the sky is red.

tay: ba'ow ta' onel haṟi' ka behoṟ la maka yaya'.
english: Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

tay: ongat ṟaṟolong ka kaṟal malahngan, pakaṟek ka hangitox oṟi la.
english: There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

tay: to'oy a'osa moṟow, comon co ci hangitox.
english: On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

tay: hita ini' awah ka behoṟ, makmosa co salahaw na mikong.
english: I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

tay: cel maki' syaw na moṟow mo ka papasba'an ci ke' mo, maskakiy co karirex mosa' papasba'an ci ke'. maskakiy co moh moṟow oṟi.
english: My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

tay: ini' kayotas ka papasba'an ci ke' min, ini' kapayox ka seyto' oṟi. makakoba' min kora'.
english: Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

tay: masasali' min patatalaman kora', magalow min pasboro' lo mapatisal.
english: All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

tay: magalow salahaw caminan ka sinsi' oṟi, yona otox moṟow ka papasba'an ci ke'.
english: The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

tay: somopah min karirex, malabo' ka lalapgan sinpohan mim.
english: We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

tay: sapohan min kora' ka raṟi' na papasba'an ci ke'. bale' min mapoli' ci pomahon, malabo' karirex ka papasba'an ci ke'.
english: We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

tay: minsa' min matisal yotasan alang hira'.
english: Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

tay: bose' min ini' pakakatox la. lonlongon mo caṟong.
english: We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

tay: matox kinang ka yotas ga, pakane'an cini ci sikwa lo pa'abon cini ci ocya.
english: As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

tay: cacibing ka sikwa pinmohi' ni yotas. ramas caṟong ni'on.
english: The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

tay: kisli' mo ka ocya' ni yotas oṟi, ramas caṟong abon.
english: I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

tay: cakan na rex, magalow co pahpoy ci yaki' mo.
english: At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

tay: lanlamo' ka tinahok cakan rex ni yaki'. kelan na ocyox, gilong, tamorak lo tatacomori'.
english: Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

tay: minani' min cakan rex laga, mosa' min magal ci ṟago' ṟago'an la.
english: After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

tay: payox ka ngahi', cehoṟ, kocon bini' ni yaki', rasi moṟow ma.
english: Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

tay: pasogagiy ta' la! moh co matox cimonan babow ni loṟi son mo ka yaki'.
english: I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

tay: rason mini cika kakelan na asinow nanahi' ni sinsi' soni'. matakalow min miniy ci kipo balihon.
english: Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

tay: maṟok min cika kakelan na asinow nanahi' laga, komaṟal ka sinsi'; "galeng ga, kakabahni' kora', bokoy ga koya', sahayow nak matox kora' mamo.
english: After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

tay: mangogno' co ci koya' kong. kani ka aṟat co paktox ci kokoya'.
english: I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

tay: payox ka kabahni' intaxan mo, cel molaka' kahoni' bawi'. taxan mo ka koṟ cel mabel baling kahoni' ki oṟi.
english: I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

tay: kelan na zo, ramiy lo ngarox. aṟat co mintox kinlalayan ci asinow nanahi' yonani. ma'as co caṟong soni'.
english: There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

tay: payox ka sasing pinsasing mo. papaktox mo yaban lo yayan.
english: I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

tay: babow ni pagalow co yaba', yaya' mo moh loṟi.
english: Next time I will come with my parents.

tay: pahngagan rex hani, mosa' min matox maman Taytong cami ci asoṟan mo kanel.
english: This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

tay: pas'aring min Taypey topanga' kisya' nano' Taytong.
english: We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

tay: tehok Taytong, maras ci ṟaṟolo' moh magal caminan ka mama'.
english: When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

tay: ini' satohya' ci moṟow ni mama' ka eki'. min_gagos tikiy pati'oṟit ci ṟaṟolo' laga tehok la.
english: The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

tay: kelan na banox wasti' ka syaw moṟow ni mama'. magalow min paritensya' mosa' banox ki.
english: There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

tay: maki' banox, rason mini romanga' mit lo topanga' ramiy ni mama'.
english: In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

tay: malahngan, magalow min mosa' mani' ci mami' alang banox.
english: In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

tay: payox la ṟaṟolo' ka alang banox. kani ka topanga' min ci otobay mosa' ki.
english: There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

tay: pagiy min laga, wal kori'on ka otobay la. mako min topanga' ci baso' magiy ki.
english: When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

tay: nel min tehok Taypey micow la. yani wal lon ka otobay ni mama' laga?
english: Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

tay: yoyok co ci kaca, maki' Sasi' ka moṟow mo. lonpow co patas la ga, masoṟigal min Hori', maki' min alang banox nano' micow.
english: When we were young, our family lived in Sasi’. After I started school, we moved to Puli and have been living in the city ever since.

tay: mosa' co tase la ga, lonpow co patas gagaṟox na Itaṟal. kaca ka ba'on mo ci masinpayox ka gagaṟox na Yencominco.
english: After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

tay: kani ka. mahngow lonpow abagan pilaw hani. magalow co asoṟan mo malikoṟ mosa' min panaṟit ci nabkis alang. mak ba'on min nak tikiy ka gagaṟox na alang min.
english: So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

tay: maspat mapgan ka ingkaṟalan naka nabkis hani la. ho' ga, yona katana'an taxan na.
english: The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

tay: ana amol na ke' ka ba'on so' son mo. tahṟoti' caṟong ka ke' na Itaṟal ni. ba' ci ke' na Seediq, Talow lo Tanah tonox.
english: I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Atayal, as well as Seediq, Chinese and Japanese.

tay: panaṟican mo, kaca ka ba'on mo ci saringan yoyok sonbaba' ci ke' na "Tanah tonox." ka hiya'. Seediq ka kanel ni, hongel ka Talow kinoba'on ni momaṟah. kani ka payox la ke' ba'on ni komaṟal.
english: I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Seediq, and he knows many Chinese at work, so he can speak so many languages.

tay: makakaṟal min ci kaca ga, payox ka gagaṟox na maloṟak wal sikaṟal naka nabkis hani.
english: During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

tay: ana min wal ini' bayi haṟi mong ka roma', ho' ga, wal min pasisingan na nawilong. anak sahyawan mong babow ni.
english: Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

tay: yoyok co ci kaca, ini' mo caṟong bayi ka gagaṟox mo. sikasaṟox mo ka ciragan mo oṟi.
english: When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

tay: payox ka kinoba' mo la ga, tatiraho' mo galeng na ci'oli' ka cinragan mo Itaṟal hani,
english: The more I know, the more I feel that being a Tayal is unique and something to be proud of.

tay: onel moṟow kira' malahngan ka sose' malikoṟ la.
english: My younger brother is going home this evening.

tay: mosa' min miniy gilong babinaran ci yaki' mo. sonrama' ci nani'on gaben ni sose' malikoṟ.
english: My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

tay: moke min babinaran ci ṟago', payox ka ṟago' nah na hinoṟak.
english: We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

tay: miniy min ci tamana', kakoyas lo tolat.
english: We bought Cabbage, yams and carrots.

tay: komaṟal ka Lawpan paginbiniy ci boy syaw ki; "cacibing ka sapoto' lo nabahṟi' mo, biniy tikiy ga!
english: The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

tay: miniy min ci sapoto' lo nabahṟi'.
moke' min babinaran ci gilong ki, komaṟal ka Lawpan; "amol ka binaron so'? maseng ci yaba' ka gilong soni', otox ga togal kbhol.
english: We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

tay: maskito' caṟong ni yaki' la. panaṟit ci Lawpan maha, ya anak mahyow tikiy.
english: Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

tay: mahyow caṟong la mi Lawpan. iya' hawi'i la ma.
english: But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

tay: komaṟal kotox ka Lawpan syaw ki, awah miniy ci ocyox mo, yaba' ci mahyow ka ocyox mo.
english: The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

tay: miniy min ci gilong lo ocyox la. otox rakat ka raramat tinahok min.
english: In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

tay: bose' min mana', minakong ka kaṟal la.
english: After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

tay: moh nawilong ka sose' malikoṟ maha, ini' pahngow ka sapitay la. babow pahngagan rex onel co la.
english: The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

tay: komaṟal ka yaki'; talagay ka tinahok la. sipalawa' moh mani' kora' laga ma.
english: Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

tay: malawa' min ci raral lo rangi' moh magalow mani' kingaben la.
english: We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

tay: kelan co totox na intana'an, Yawi ka ralo' ni. ṟomongi' maras karirex ci angaya' ni.
english: I have a classmate named Yawi, he often forgets to bring things.

tay: lonpow min ci patas ga, koncik ci papatas, papoṟot lo papatasan cika intana'an mo.
english: During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

tay: min'otox, minsa'ing, aṟat ga mintogal, pakacikan naha hang.
english: Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

tay: ho' ga, ṟakah la a'osa' ni. koncik ci angaya' ga, ini' bah mobinah.
english: But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

tay: kani ka ini' pakacik hiyan ka ci'oli' la.
english: In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

tay: cel totox rex, mosa' min salahaw tanox kora' min.
english: One day, we all went on an outing together.

tay: cacka na to'oy, makmosa' mastanox ka Yawi, ho' ga, ṟomongi' maras ci kolaboy.
english: On the way, Yawi wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

tay: koncik kolaboy ci intana'an ni. ho' ga, comik hiyan kora' ka laha, ini' co nak aras oṟi son naha.
english: He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

tay: mako mangilis ka Yawi pintahlan ni. masang maha; honco' mamo ini' pakacik ci kolaboy kinang!
english: Yawi burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

tay: komaṟal hiyan ka intana'an, ya ka ini' so' bah maras ka iso', pinkacik sinang ka angaya' ga, ini' so' pabinahi kora'.
english: The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

tay: sasan, maṟabona' tehok papasba'an ci ke' ka Yawi, pabinahon ni mi' ci intana'an ni kora' ka angaya' kincikan ni la.
english: The next day at school, Yawi arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

tay: mastokong ci intana'an ni ka Yawi maha: pa'aras co nak ci angaya' babow ni la. bahbah mamo caṟong, somoṟal mamo pakacik ci angaya' kinang.
english: Yawi apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

tay: mpolata' na ci'oli' alang ka yaba' mo.
english: My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

tay: yoyok co ci kaca, mosa maloṟak malahngan ka yaba' lo mama' mo, maras ci poting lo haponi'.
english: When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

tay: pascex kaṟal laga, nel maras ci asinow bino' naha.
english: At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

tay: roma' nak ga, baṟok nanahi', arat ga ṟapit, tin_git magal ci pikoreh oṟi.
english: Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

tay: bali'on naha mapoli' balihon alang hang. a'apoli' naha ci ci'oli' alang.
english: They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

tay: satanoxan mo karirex ka yaba' mo. maha co gonlow hiyan mosa' maloṟak.
english: Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

tay: as ka yotas so' laga, kaca ka rarason miso' la mi yaba'.
english: Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

tay: ming ci loṟang konṟak ci asinow nanahi' ka malikoṟ alang. ba' sonbale' ci binong lo kato'.
english: The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

tay: ba' caṟong sonbale ci binong ka yaba' mo. komaṟal ka yaba' mo, sikaṟak ci pikoreh kani. as ka bali'on ta' matox ka pinkakayan na asinow. pacin pinkakayan ni ki ka binong ma.
english: My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

tay: omixol co nahaṟi' mosa' magalow maloṟak ci nabkis, sonbaba' co sonbale' ci binong karirex. ini' kabose', konṟak cobay ci asinow nanahi' ka binong mo la.
english: In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

tay: matox kinang ka yaba' ga, komaṟal maha; maha so' mananang na mpolata' ka iso' babow ni.
english: Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

tay: yotas co micow la, mapanga' co ci bahoni' lo panelo', magalow co yaban mosa' maloṟak.
english: Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

tay: tehok co alang laga, apolin mo ci ci'oli' alang ka asinow mo.
english: When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

tay: komaṟal ka yaba' mo maha; pa'ason ka kinnabkisan mi' ci kinramas itan. kani ka payox la asinow nanahi' inagal ta'.
english: Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

tay: sonṟaho' co mosa' papasba'an ci ke' sasan la.
english: I was late for school this morning.

tay: mosa' papasba'an ci ke' ci kaca ga, ṟomongi' co maras ci kabang la.
english: When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.
I didn't bring anything with me.

tay: lonpow min ci kaca ga, maglow co matox patas intana'an mo.
english: During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

tay: macacapong ci kaca ga, koncik co papatas laha ci papoṟot ni intana'an mo.
english: During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

tay: komaṟal kinang ka sinsi' maha, "aṟbona' haṟi matatoli' babow ni, iya' saṟaho' la."
english: The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

tay: Yawi ralo' naka rangi' mo caṟong, ole' na Itaṟal ka hiya' oṟi.
english: My good friend’s name is Yawi, and he is also an Tayal child.
We study together in the Plngawan tribe.

tay: magalow min manapong komaṟal ci insa' na nabkis rali' cika nabkis alang. ba' min komaṟal caṟong ci ke' na Itaṟal.
english: We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Tayal proficiently.

tay: babawi' ci katohoṟ co kong, mahikang ci lalabo' ka Yawi'.
english: I am tall and overweight, while Yawi is short and thin.

tay: matakalang caṟong ka Yawi, kisli' naha caṟong.
english: Yawi is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

tay: macacapong matatalang soni' ka papasba'an ci ke', lanlamo' la pacapngan sinrama' na papasba'an ci ke'.
english: Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

tay: kelan na mahaholoy, konlakah boro', matatalang, maṟoy lo conbo panelo'.
english: There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
I participated in the running competition.

tay: matatalang co ci kaca ga, matakoṟ co, masramoṟox ka tari' mo la.
english: When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

tay: ho' ga, matatoli' co tomalang na.
english: But I stood up and continued running forward.

tay: tehok co poting laga, ma'as matox kora' ka ci'oli'.
english: Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

tay: ana co ini' agal galeng, ga, ma'as co, yaka matomaso' co macacapong la.
english: Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

tay: minsa' min matisal maman cami ci yaba' hira'.
english: Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

tay: ma'ilis ka papak ni mama' la.
komaṟal caminan ka hiya', kelan totox na baling ka ramo'oy ma.
english: He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

tay: sonbale' ramo'oy ci kaca ka hiya' ga, minoh ramo'oy bawi' mastow la.
english: He fell off the roof while repairing it.

tay: siaras ci asinow wanox lo binro ni yaba' ka mama'.
english: My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

tay: mapatisal min abelan ci mama', payox ka ke' kinaṟal ni.
english: My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

tay: pagiy co ci kaca ga, babawi' so' la, moṟaṟing so' mabatonox oṟi la mi mama' mo.
english: Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

tay: komaṟal co maman mo; "bale' ka papak so' laga, awah matisal moṟow min babow ni oṟi la son mo."
english: I said, When your foot gets better

tay: 2022 ingkaṟalan ci kaca, wal totox ka pinkaṟalang na Seyho, anak patasan ci ralo' na itaṟal ka mibonsyo ta' ma.
english: In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

tay: panaṟit co cika se'eneng Temo Noma, bose' saṟe' Seyho ci papatas ralo' nak na itaṟal ka hiya'.
english: I interviewed Temu Numa, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

tay: maso' min makaṟal pahngagan rex hani ga, maha' co malahang moṟow ni hiyan.
english: We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

tay: mapatisal min ci kaca ga, bale komaṟal kinang ci inoh na ralo' ni. pakoba' ci tanmoṟow ni lo alang ni oṟi.
english: During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

tay: kaṟalon mo ka hiya', honco' so' as ki yonagon matas ci ralo' na itaṟal ka ralo' so'? ṟakah ka pinatas rali' aw? son mo.
english: I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

tay: komaṟal kinang ka hiya', siagal ci hinṟang na ralo' talow matas ka ralo' itaṟal ga, ini' pala'olo' pongan ma. roma' ci'oli' ga, Te sensong son naha malawa'. mako mapapase ka ci'oli' mong.
english: He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Tie Xian Sheng

tay: komaṟal ka Temo Noma maha; patasan nak ci ralo' itaṟal ka ralo' ta' ga, kaca ka ita' nak caṟong. pinkegal ci lahoṟ itaṟal, tanmoṟow, lo cinragan ta'. hita' ta' molo' nak ci ralo' ta' kora' ita' itaṟal.
english: Temu Numa said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

tay: gonlow co yaken mo hira' mosa' cika babainaran. maras ci lanlamo' na ṟago' pinmohi' ni nak. tomahok ci nani'on halan ni maginbiniy oṟi.
english: Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

tay: kisli' naha ka babinaran ni yaki' ki. payox ci'oli' miniy ka orik lo nasobi' ni, habaṟaw ci'oli' moh tomalang mani' ci tinahok ni oṟi.
english: Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

tay: ramas caṟong ni'on ka aṟingo' singot lo rangil tinahok ni. kelan na asinow baṟowk nanahi' pinahnok na ma'ow oṟi. as rong ci ci'oli ka sinkanaxan ni, moh matikalow babinaran min kora' naha.
english: The pigeon pea soup and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

tay: tomahok ci nani'on ka yaki' hang ga, tapeh co ci ci'oli' sisyaw kong. yotas ka ke' mo maha, "pinmohi' min nak ka ṟago' hani. aṟat pinle'an ci ayo'. nahaṟi' moh miniy!"
english: While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

tay: mingagos tikiy, maso' min maginbiniy la. komaṟal ka yaki' mo maha, "otox ci iso' ka romow la," ma.
english: Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

tay: inohan min hani ga, wal mo ba'on caṟong ka pinmohi' lo kinoba' ci nani'on na itaṟal la. ba'on mo kora' ka abok na paginbiniy oṟi la.
english: Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

tay: taxan mo yonani sonkisli' nak ci nani'on na kinnabkisan rali' ka yaki' mo ga, mako patatiṟow lo tiraho' ka linlongan mo.
english: Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.

tay: tayhok kowing co mapito' pincapngan co wagi' i papatiqan co sawni'.
english: I arrived at school at seven today.

tay: papateq la, mawp i papatiqan i papsibaq, komaal i pancang maha:"ca'rox! tobonani i papsibaq!"
english: It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

tay: komaal cami kahabaag maha, "lawkah so' papsibaq."
mateq ga, pasibaqan cami ni papsibaq co lalpo ka kayi' na Itaal.
english: In class, the teacher taught us the Tayal language of numbers.

tay: galgan niyam lompo i papsibaq, maqowas cami owi co qowas na lalpo.
english: We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

tay: payox ko baqon mo ka kayi' na Itaal.
english: I have learned many Tayal languages.

tay: mosa' kowing mateq kariariax, makibaq kowing kariariax co kayi' na Itaal, papapong mo i yaya'.
english: I go to school every day, I learn the Tayal language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

tay: ralo' ni yaba' mo ga Bayco'.
ralo' ni yaya' mo ga Iwal.
magalpo kaal mo kaal ka hani.
kiya qotox qomisowan na mamaliko mo, ralo' niya' ga Bawto', magalpo co qotox kaal niya' kaal ka hani.
english: I have a brother, his name is Bawtu’, he is 11 years old.

tay: maglo cami mateq i qotox papatiqan.
english: We study in the same school.

tay: balayq mo ki qomisowan na mamaliko ko maqowas.
english: Both my brother and I like to sing.

tay: balayq mo ko lomangoy, mohngeq kowing ga, maglo cami ka qotox co imowag mosa' i lomangoy.
english: I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

tay: balayq mo ko makasbabaq co giqas ka rawin, naki cami maglo mosa' i maqowas ro lomangoy.
english: I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

tay: kiya i Tabilas ko imowag niyam.
imagal cami ka qotox co imowag.
english: There are five people in our family.

tay: togal cami ka matasasowayi' ka qotox co imowag.
english: There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

tay: masiqon kowing ki yaba', yaya', qomisowan na mamaliko ro qomisowan na kanayril.
english: I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

tay: ibabaweq i yaba' mo, kinsac i yaba' mo.
english: My father is tall and he is a policeman.

tay: mahikang i yaya' mo, kowisang i yaya' mo.
english: My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

tay: makiya imowag i yaba' ga makaal cami na kayi' na Itaal.
english: My father speaks the ethnic language with us at home.

tay: mohngeq i hahangiqan gabagan ga mamati' cami mosa' i tinqalangan.
english: We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

tay: maglo cami kina qoqomisowan romakaap co taka.
english: My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

tay: balayq mo cobalay ko qotox mo co imowag.
english: I like our family very much.

tay: maglo kowing ki yaya' mosa' magonawo' co sawni'.
english: I went out with my mother today.

tay: mataseq a kaal co qaliyan, ini' kagihaaq, ini' owi ow kakilox, mashahiyaw a bayho.
english: The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

tay: asi cami pasisamag ca rawq i maneq co miyenpaw, halhol tagacbo' ca hihihi' ko wagi'.
english: We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

tay: matanah a kaal la co minaneq la.
english: In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

tay: paqocan mo i yaya' mha : "micowa' ka matanah a kaal la?"
english: I asked my mother why the sky is red.

tay: komaal i yaya' maha, "kiiy ma'owah a rahowal ka bayho la."
english: Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

tay: okas a hamhom ca kaal co gabiyan, pakahto a boliqo la.
english: There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

tay: maosa' cami i imowag owi la.
sikaal mo coko boliqo ko kisleq mo co mowah kowing imowag maha,
english: On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

tay: "mowa' na iqaat ma'owah a bayho ka mamati', maosa' kowing i magonawo' lawwi."
english: I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

tay: kiya i kiyl na imowag niyam ko papatiqan mo, homakay kowing kariariariax i mosa' papatiqan, mowah imowag ga homakay owi.
english: My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

tay: ini' ka rahowal ko papatiqan niyam, ini' ka habaag ko mateq, makbabaq cami kahabaag.
english: Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

tay: masaoto' cami kahabaag ka olollaqi' i paptaliyoman, maglo i magonawo' co mari', maglo i maskakaro'.
english: All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

tay: maglo ki cami magonawo' owi ko papsibaq, asiga magqotox co imowag ko papatiqan.
english: The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

tay: comaping cami kariariax, capingon niyam co maoba' cobalay ko papatiqan.
english: We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

tay: kiya ko roma' ga comawm co tohong, karoma' ga comaping co rawq.
english: Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

tay: capingon niyam kahabaag ko iqoiqong na papatiqan, mapararag cami kahabaag, maoba' cobalay kariariax ko papatiqan.
english: We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

tay: minosa' kowing tinqalangan maskakaro' ki yotas cohisa'.
english: Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

tay: ingso cami cobalay ini' pakitaal la, longolongon mo cobalay hiya'.
english: We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

tay: talan kowing ni yotas ro paqaniqan kowing niya' co bahat, panobowan kowing niya' co cha(外來語-客).
english: As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

tay: lalbing cobalay ko pinomowa' ni yotas ka bahat, sahahiya' cobalay i niqon.
english: The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

tay: balayq mo owi ko cha ni yotas, balayq owi i nobon.
english: I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

tay: pakoriax laga, gomlo kowing i tomahok co kakriaxon ki yaki'.
english: At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

tay: payox cobalay ko tinahok ni yaki', kiya a qoleh, waylong, rilom ro aang na apit.
english: Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and flying squirrel soup.

tay: komnoriax laro', mosa' cami komiko' co paroxaw i papmowaan co paparoxaw.
english: After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

tay: payox inagal ni yaki' ka bonga', cayi' ro qino, sipaaras kowing niya' mowah imowag.
english: Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

tay: mapogagay cami ga, kalon mo maha wahay cimo mitaal lawwi i babaw niya'.
english: I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

tay: rason cami ni papsibaq i aangayan co qaqasino co sawni', tibalong cami i balihon mabaynay co aangay.
english: Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

tay: mawp cami aangayan co qaqasino laro, komaal i papsibaq maha, "pog ga kakbahneq, sog ga qoroqoro', angay nanak cimo."
english: After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

tay: kaicoon mo ko qoro', kahi' kowing ini' kitaal co qoroqoro'.
english: I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

tay: payox ko talan mo ka kabahneq, manbahaag ca babaw na kahoneq, manbahaag i kiya manbahaag i roni, talan mo owi ko pook ka kiya i maqilaap ca koog na kahoneq.
english: I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

tay: kiya a tasiyang, ramayi' ro wakli' i aangayan co qaqasino, iqaat kowing minitaal na' aring conga' co qaqasino ka hani, talan sawni' laro maqas cobalay a qisleq.
english: There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

tay: payox a ingal mo ka qalimo' na qariwal, papkitaal mo i yaba' ki yaya'.
english: I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

tay: paglo kowing ki yaba', yaya' mowah i babaw niya'.
english: Next time I will come with my parents.

tay: mohngeq kahani ga, masa' kowing ki iyah i Taytong maskakaro' ki mama'.
english: This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

tay: manaaring cami i Taype' gomlo co kolo' na haponeq mosa' i Taytong.
english: We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

tay: tayhok cami i Taytong ga, miray na kolo' mowah aotoan co kolo' masacka' cami i mama'.
english: When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

tay: ini' paktatohi' cko imowag ni mama' ko aotoan co kolo', miray co kolo' ga copilapilag ro tayhok la.
english: The station is not far from my uncle’s house, and it’s just a short drive away.

tay: kiya a wahti' ka sasaanan co qaqasino i beh na imowag ni mama', maglo cami gomlo na tamayray mosa' i sasaanan co qaqasino.
english: There is a big ranch near my uncle’s house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

tay: rason cami ni mama' soman co kating, miyt ro gomlo co ramayi' i sasaanan co qaqasino.
english: In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

tay: gabiyan laro, mosa' cami maneq i naniqan qalang qowis.
english: In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

tay: payox a kolo' i qalang qowis, ro gomlo cami na otobay mosa' kiya.
english: There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

tay: mateqro' maneq papagiyay cami ga, qoriqon ko otobay la, asi cami glo co bas' mosa' imowag la.
english: When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

tay: tayhok cami Taype' kahani la, ini' baqi kiiy lowan ni mama' ko otobay la qo?
english: Now that we are back in Taipei, I don’t know if my uncle’s motorcycle has been found.

tay: kiya i Tabilas ko imowag niyam co olaqi' kowing na', mateq kowing laro, magnohyi' cami i Miyawli' la, aring kiya maqinox cami qowis roo' kahani.
english: When we were young, our family lived in Tabilas. After I started school, we moved to Miyawli’ and have been living in the city ever since.

tay: ro' co mohngeq gabagan cko kaal kahani ga, mowah kowing ki yolah mitaal maskakaro' cko nanabakis i tinqalangan, miki baqon mo tikay ko Gagagaga' na Itaal nanak.
english: So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

tay: mamaspat kinamlapgan a kaal nko nabakis la, ga' olaaqi' na' i talan.
english: The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

tay: paqocan mo mha, "nanowan ko kayi' ka baqon so'? " balayq cobalabalay a kayi' niya' na Mato'owal, baaq owi komaal co kayi' na Sipoto' ro kayi' na Gipon.
english: I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Atayal, as well as Hakka and Japanese.

tay: paqocan mo hiya' ro baqon mo la, aqomowani ka minkibaq co olaqi' na' hiya' co kayi' na Gipon, Itaal owi ko glo niya', ro habaag a Sipoto' ka baqon niya' co matawwaw, kahi' payox ko kayi' ka baqon niya' i sipakaal.
english: I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Atayal, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.

tay: payox ko sipanqaqoo' nko nabakis ka Gagagaga' na qaqalowaap co maskakaro' cami.
english: During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

tay: bali niyam kiiy baqon moong kahabaag, ga' alan niyam na soci' co qalimo', ro pakbalayq lawwi nabalbalayqon i moong.
english: Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

tay: ini' baqibaqi coqaang ko Gaga' nanak co okaqi', sikitaal cko Itaal kowing ga, ini' kabalbalayq cobalay a kisleq.
english: When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

tay: ararrowa payox tikay ko baqon lro', ararrowa i baqon mha, masqaqotox co ini' cobalay packa' kin coqoleq ko Itaal, siptoraho mo cobalay owi.
english: The more I know, the more I feel that being a Atayal is unique and something to be proud of.

tay: ma'owah imowag i gabgabiyan kisa' i sowayi' na mamaliko la.
english: My younger brother is going home this evening.

tay: mosa' kowing ki yaki' i mabainasan co raramat mabaynay co waylong, tatahok i sowayi' na mamaliko i komgabayan.
english: My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

tay: kiya kahabaag a mica na' kiniko' ka paroxaw i babinasan co raramat co hinason niyam.
english: We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

tay: mabaynay cami co kongsincay, sako ro caypo ka matanah.
english: We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

tay: homowaw ko kiya matibaynay co oqooqo' i kiyl mha, "lalbing cobalay ko pangran ro qaym mo, baynay tikay ga!"
english: The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

tay: mabaynay cami co pangran ro qaym la.
homaynas cami cko babinasan co hyi' ga, komaal ko lawpan mha, "nanowan ko babinason so'? rahowal co magnabalay ko waykong sawni', togal kabhol i qotox."
english: We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

tay: mamati' coqaang mha i yaki', paqocan niya' ko lawpan mha, "pakabalayq i mahnok tikay? "
english: Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

tay: asikinaga mahnok cobalay la, iqat babaqon i mahahowi' lga mha komaal ko lawpan.
english: But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

tay: komaal ko tagi kiyl ka lawpan mha, "owah mabaynay co qoleh mo, rahowal co mahnok ko qoleh mo."
english: The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

tay: babaw niya' lro, mabaynay cami co waylong ro qoleh owi, tahkon co qotox co naniqan ka raramat mosa' imowag la.
english: In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

tay: ingaso nagaon la, ini' salowi owi a kaal la.
english: After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

tay: mowah a kayi' na qanawan ni sowayi' na mamaliko mha, "asipatobaah aqeh mohngeq ko hitay la, asiki hahongiqan babaw lga ma'ohwa ci la."
english: The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

tay: payox ko tinahok laro, asi ta' patgiqoni i maneq la mha i yaki'.
english: Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

tay: korongoon niyam ko rawirawin, maglo komnagabaiyan ko makasiosion ca naniqan ka raramat.
english: We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

tay: kiya caxa' baays mi mateq ka Kayno', mamati' omongi' i maras co qaraqarax.
english: I have a classmate named Kaynu’, he often forgets to bring things.

tay: mateq ga, kabawx ki baays mateq co papateq, papawng co pinateq qoqa rowas ka papatiqan.
english: During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

tay: manaxleq, magnaposal, magnatoo', pakabaxan nha' co qaraqarax.
english: Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

tay: asikinaga, kiya qotox hmot niya' ka aqeh, kabawx co qaraqarax ga mamati' ini' pasayo.
english: But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

tay: babaw niya' ro ini' nha' pakikabaxi co qaraqarax la.
english: In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

tay: riax ka qotox, maglo cami kahabaag mosa' i magonawo'.
english: One day, we all went on an outing together.

tay: maki mosa' latanox Kayno' co makiya i raneq, ga' omongi' maras co cacawm co qaqotian hiya'.
english: On the way, Kaynu’ wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

tay: kabawx kinko baays niya' mateq co cacawm co qaqotian, asikinaga ciyokon nha' kahabaag mha, "ini' co aras owi yo!"
english: He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

tay: maimag mangilis co manata' i Kayno' mha, "micowa' cimo kahabaag ka ini' pakabaxani kowing co cacawm co qaqotian!"
english: Kaynu’ burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

tay: kalon nko baays mateq mha, "aqeh gi ini' so' aras nanak, anaowi ga sipkabawx so' co qaraqarax ga, ini' so' pasiyogi kariariax!"
english: The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

tay: kincasan, magagaaboq tayhok papatiqan i Kayno', sipasayo kahabaag ni Kayno' ko qaraqarax ka kinabaxan niya' kinko baays niya' kahabaag la.
english: The next day at school, Kaynu’ arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

tay: sitobon niya' kahabaag ko baybaays niya' mha, "paaras kowing cobalay co qaraqarax mo nanak i babaw niya' la, ro mahoway cimo ka sisiwaal mamo pakabawx kowing ko qaraqarax mamo cko riax ka ini' ka isting. mahoway cimo! mahoway cimo cobalabalay!"
english: Kaynu’ apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

tay: paqalowaap na itaal i tinqalangan i yaba' mo.
english: My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

tay: co olaqi' co na' ga, omobo' co takis ro mahangal na patos homakay i mahantan yaba' ki mama'.
english: When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

tay: saalowan lga, awni nha' rasan lko qinalowaap nha' ka qaqasino.
english: At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

tay: mahanano' ga bawwak na laholaho, mahanano' ga apit, iy makiya a gilaqong owi.
english: Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

tay: gayhon nha' i sogagay gawng ro siqaso kahabaag cko itaal i tiqalangan.
english: They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

tay: mamati' mi pakibogan i yaba' mha paglo ci mosa' qomalowaap owi.
english: Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

tay: komaal yaba' mha rahowal kowing lga rarason co niya'.
english: Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

tay: baaq owi kabalay co sasiyahing co qaqasino ko mamaliko i tinqalangan, kabalay co tatiroweq ca wariyong, tatiroweq ca kokoy.
english: The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making head-hold traps and leg-hold traps.

tay: baaq i poqolowang i yaba', komaal i yaba' mha, tatiroweq co gilaqong ko hani, asiki nabalbalayqon mitaal ko toqi na qasino, kakbahneq, sokoon cko hahakayan na qasino ko qolowang.
english: My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

tay: naki ti ini' kanga' gomlo kinko nanabakis mosa' i qomalowaap mha co ro', makaroox ci makibaq kabalay co sasiyahing co qboqbox kariariax, ini' kaingaso ro' tiroweq cobalay lko sinko' mo.
english: In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

tay: talan ni yaba' ro kalon co niya' mha pakacapaang kowing na patqaqasino inga''
english: Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

tay: rahowal ci la kahani, mapanga' ci co tawnox ro saliy mo, gomlo ci yaba' mosa' qomalowaap la.
english: Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

tay: mowah tinqalangan ga, siqaso kahabaag ko tinirowrq cko qotox co glo.
english: When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

tay: komaal yaba' mha, asi ta' ki sitobon ko howay na nanabakis, bayqan ta' niya' co tiniroweq ka payox.
english: Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

tay: masicoqi' co mosa' 'i' matas 'i' kasasanan la.
english: I was late for school this morning.

tay: mosa' co i' papatasan ga', omongi co maras co' kabang.
english: When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

tay: ini' co aras co' ani nanowan ka' qaraqarax.
english: I didn't bring anything with me.

tay: matas co ga', maglog co ki' rawin mo mital co' rowas.
english: During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

tay: macacpong co ga', kabaxan co na' rawin mo ko' papatiq ro' cacawam co' pinatiq.
english: During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

tay: kalon co nko' papasibaq maha', "nabowibowi 'i' tihway babaw niya' laxi ko' masicoqi lawwi la."
english: The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

tay: Yomin ko' capaang mo na' rawin. olaqi' nko' Itaal 'i' hiya' owi.
english: My good friend’s name is Yumin, and he is also an Tayal child.

tay: maglog cami matas cko' tinqalangan na' Tabilas.
english: We study together in the Tabilas tribe.

tay: maglog cami mong co' koss ki' nanabakis 'i' kariariax. baq cami komaal co' kai' na' Itaal.
english: We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Tayal proficiently.

tay: ibabawiq ro' kitho co. irarawq ro' mahikang 'i' Yomin.
english: I am tall and overweight, while Yumin is short and thin.

tay: lawkah cobalay 'i' Yomin, balaiq naha' kahabag 'i' hiya'.
english: Yumin is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

tay: yontonghowei nko' papatasan 'i' sawni, payox ko' papakal nko' papatasan na' macacpong.
english: Today was the school’s sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

tay: kiya ko' homoloy co' siniyog, komcacri' co' mari', mataliyom, yogi' ro' combo' co' sali'.
english: There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
I participated in the running competition.

tay: atona' mataliyom co ga', matako' co la. masiramox ko' tari' mo.
english: When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

tay: asikina ga' macaqrox co ro' ini co hngaw 'i' mataliyom.
english: But I stood up and continued running forward.

tay: tayhok co cko' langaag ga', maqas kahabag ko' itaal.
english: Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

tay: ani co ini agal co' tigiqotox ga', asikinaga maqas ci cobalay gi' naqalon mo ko' macacpong la.
english: Although I didn’t get first place, I’m glad because I completed the race.

tay: minosa' co ki' yaba' mi mitaal 'i' mama' mo co' hisa'.
english: Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

tay: mapangih ko' kokoy ni' mama' la.
kalon cami niya' maha', maboka' ro kiya' qotox a' kog cko' rinamowaag na' imowaag.
english: He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

tay: kiya' kabalay co' rinamowaag na' imowaag 'i' hiya' ga', asi papsihowaw cko' rinamowaag na' imowaag.
english: He fell off the roof while repairing it.

tay: rason ni' yaba' ko' hi' na' kating ro pinnong. sibiq niya' 'i' mama' la.
english: My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

tay: maskakaro' co ki' mama' cko' qaqilpan. payox ko' sikaal co niya' ka' kos.
english: My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

tay: ini co pagiyay na' ga', tarahowalon co ni' mama' maha', ibabawiq ro ara'rowa' si' magbatonox la.
english: Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

tay: komaal co maha, " atona balaiq ko' kokoy ni' mama' la ga', ma'owah 'i' maganaw 'i' imowaag mo babaw niya' owi. "
english: I said, \When your foot gets better

tay: cko' kaal ka' 2022, makaal ko' sebo maha', senbenceng nko' Yencomin ga' balaiq patasi nanaq co' ralo' na' Itaal.
english: In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

tay: paqocan mi Kyosi' na' Baay ka' kiya cko' tinqalangan ka' mogomalaq ka' minosa' 'i' masina' co' patasi nanaq ko' ralo' na' Itaal cko' senbenceng cko' sebo.
english: I interviewed Kyusi’ na’ Baay, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

tay: makaal co ki' hiya' cko' a'hangiqan ka' hani. ma'osa' co mitaal 'i' hiya'.
english: We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

tay: maskakaro' cami ka' hani ga', kaalon co niya' ko' ralo' niya' ka' minowah ino'. sipakababaq niya' kowing ko' imowag niya', tinqalangan niya'.
english: During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

tay: paqocan mi hiya', micowa' so' ka' asiki yogon ko' ralo' so'. aqih ko' capang ka' pinatas co' conga' pisa'?
english: I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

tay: kaalon co niya' maha', aqih gi' pinatiq nko' To'iya' ga', ini baqi nababalaiq 'i' papkital co' coqoliq ko' ralo' niya', pakaal co' bowinah ko' coqoliq na' maha', "Kyosiyenseng". kahi payox ko' somsasiyaq ka' kai'.
english: He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Ku Xian Sheng

tay: komaal 'i' Kyosi' na' Baay maha', "yani cobalay ko' ralo' ta' ka' pinatiq nko' Yencomin. ralo' mo ga' yani ko' ralo' na' Itaal niyam, qotox co' imowaag niyam, senben niyam, wana' ara'rowa' payox ko' itaal ka' mosa' 'i' komiyom cko' ralo' naha' nanaq."
english: Kyusi’ na’ Baay said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

tay: minosa' co ki' yaki' somko' co' qaraxqarax i' ma'a'otoan co' qaraxqarax co' hisa'. rason ni' yaki' ko' pinomowa' niya' nanaq ka' paroxaw. kabalay owi co' naniqon na' Yencomin.
english: Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

tay: balaiq na' itaal kahabag ko' saskoan co' qaraxqarax ni' yaki'. payox ko' itaal mabaynay co' laciyaw ro rawhing. payox ko' itaal mowah 'i' maniq co' tinahok niya'.
