english: Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

tay: balaiq cobalay ko' tinahok niya' ka' mala' ro papah. kiya' na owi ko' sitahok na' maqaw ka' hi' na' bawak. kinsawkan ga', payox ko' itaal mowah 'i' mitaal. payox ko' itaal ka' mowah 'i' matibalong cko' saskoan co' qaraxqarax.
english: The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

tay: tomahok co' naniqon 'i' yaki' ga', kiya' co bih niya' homoloy co' itaal. kiya' kowing cko' bih homowag maha', "pinomowa' nanaq ko' paroxaw, okas a' iyo' ro nabowibowi 'i' owah 'i' mabanay ke. "
english: While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

tay: ini ka'ingasog ro binason kahabag ko' paroxaw niyam. komaal 'i' yaki' maha', "olong iso' ko' romag."
english: Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

tay: tiko waw ka hani ga', baqon mo ko' pinkibaqan na' pinomowa' ro naniqon na' Yencomin ro kinma'bok ko' somko' co' qaraxqarax na' waw.
english: Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

tay: talan mo 'i' yaki' mo ka' balaiq niya' cobalay ko' naniqon co' conga. yani ko' sikasalaw mo ga'.
english: Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.

tay: pito tmocing saniq tehoq co pqwasan biro.
english: I arrived at school at seven today.

tay: tgaring ta tqbaq biro la, miyok cka sesiy, kmayan hancyo, "toliq! tmatok tonox!"
english: It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

tay: tqbaq cami mqwas biro ga, sbaqan cami nya ke lmpox na Tayal.
english: In class, the teacher taught us the Tayal language of numbers.

tay: glox cami sesiy lmpox ro, mqwas cami qwas na lmpox.
english: We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

tay: piyox wayal mo tbaqan ke na tayal la.
english: I have learned many Tayal languages.

tay: mosa co pqwasan biro krryax, tqbaq co ke tayal krryax, skayan ro pponong ni yaya mo.
english: I go to school every day, I learn the Tayal language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

tay: maki qotox qbsoyal mo mlikoy, Hayon lalo nya, mpox qotox kawas nya la.
english: I have a brother, his name is Hayun, he is 11 years old.

tay: msqon cami mqwas qotox pqwasan biro.
english: We study in the same school.
Both my brother and I like to sing.

tay: smoya co lmngyaq, ryax hngawan lga, msqon cami mosa lmngyaq qabax moyax myan.
english: I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

tay: piyox qnbaq mo qayos na rangi, msqon cami mqwas qwas ro lmngyaq.
english: I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.
There are five people in our family.
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

tay: msqon co yaba yaya qbsoyal mlikoy ro qbsoyal kneril maki moyax.
english: I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

tay: hlawax calay yaba mo, cyan alan knsat hiya.
english: My father is tall and he is a policeman.

tay: hekang calay yaya mo, cyan alan ising hiya.
english: My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

tay: baq cami kmayan ke Tayal ki yaba mo maki cqa moyax.
english: My father speaks the ethnic language with us at home.

tay: hngawan cqa ryax 'bagan ga mosa cami qalang.
english: We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

tay: msqon cami kimyap qtango ki qbsoyal mlikoy ro kneril.
english: My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

tay: siyan mo calay he moyax myan qani.
english: I like our family very much.

tay: msqon co mosa mcisan tanox ki yaya mo.
english: I went out with my mother today.

tay: mtasiq ro blaq kayal nya saniq coni, ini klto ini kilox kayal nya, sqblaq calay qsliq behoy qani.
english: The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

tay: mtama cami roq ro maniq cami menpaw, lhol calay he sbo' cami nya wagi qani.
english: We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

tay: babaw knryax lga, mtalah qa kayal la.
english: In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

tay: tbaqan mo yaya mo, cwa baq mtalah qa kayal qani.
english: I asked my mother why the sky is red.

tay: kmayan yaya maha, pbehoy hayi lay.
english: Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

tay: oka yolong nya gbiyan qani ro, mhtox qa knitoh nya la.
english: There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

tay: maki cami cka ryaniq ga, psina co knalo ro pzimo co knitoh qani.
english: On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

tay: akya ini owah qa behoy qani, smoya co calay mosa mcisan tanox loyi.
english: I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

tay: cyan maki biyh moyax myan qa pqawasn biro, khangi co mosa pqawasn biro ro, khangi co mwah moyax oyi.
english: My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

tay: ini ktyaba ciyan pqawasn myan biro qani, ini kpiyox seto ro, mqbaq cami qabax.
english: Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

tay: msli cami cqa kki'an na csalan ro, msqon cami cisan boro, mkkayan cami oyi.
english: All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

tay: baq msqon mcisan cami qa sesiy, giwan qotox moyax qa pqwasan biro qani.
english: The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

tay: cmapoh cami krryax ro, bleqon myan mcmapoh qa kki'an myan pqwasan qani.
english: We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

tay: mcmon tobon kroma cqoliq ro, mcmapoh kroma cqoliq.
english: Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

tay: cpohan myan qabax lingay na pqwasan biro, mboyox ro mkrax cami, mlabo calay pqwasan biro krryax.
english: We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

tay: chesa ga, mnwah co mkan yotas cqa qalang.
english: Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

tay: bsyaq cami calay ini pktayox la, llongon mo calay hiya.
english: We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

tay: ktalan co nya yotas mo lga, pniqan co nya sikwa ro, pbxan co nya ocya.
english: As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

tay: lbing calay sikwa mnoya ni yotas mo, blaq calay nniqon.
english: The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

tay: siyan mo calay ocya na yotas mo, balaq calay boxn.
english: I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

tay: qlyan lga, msqon co phayoy knryax ki yaki mo.
english: At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

tay: piyox calay pnhapoy knryax ni yaki mo, maki qolih, ngta, qabang ro knghi.
english: Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

tay: mnaniq cami knryax lga, mosa cami hmikot ramat cqa qmayah la.
english: After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

tay: piyox calay ngahi cehoy ro qenox mniq co ni yaki mo, aray moyax son co nya.
english: Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

tay: msgagay cami ki yotas ro yaki, kyalon mo mwah co babaw nya loyi.
english: I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

tay: naray cami nya kki'an qbsinox qa sesiy ro, pbkox cami mna laso blihon tbes kipo qani.
english: Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

tay: miyok cami cqa kki'an qbsinox qani lga, kyalon cami nya sesiy maha:"llaso ga kki'an ni qbhniq, mehong hiya ga kki'an ni maqo, ktayox kya cimo nanaq la."
english: After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

tay: mngongo co maqo hiya, mica ini co soya ktayox kki'an na maqo.
english: I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

tay: piyox wal mo ktalan qa qbhniq qani, mlaka cqa babaw na qhoniq, wal mo ktalan cyan m'abi cqa bling qhoniq qa lqom oyi.
english: I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

tay: maki zow ro rme ro ngarox cqa kki'an qbsinox qani, iyat mo kintalan na qabax qbsinox qani, wal mo ktalan lga, mqas co calay.
english: There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

tay: piyox wayal mo psingan qa siyasin qani, pktalon mo yaba ro yaya mo.
english: I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

tay: babaw nya lga, rayon mo ktayox yaba ro yaya mo.
english: Next time I will come with my parents.

tay: hngawan ryax qani ga, msqon co qbsoyal mo kneril mosa mkan mama myan cqa Tayto.
english: This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

tay: mglox cami kisya ro, kahol cami Bnka mosa Tayto.
english: We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

tay: tehoq cami Tayto lga, qmet toroy qa mama ro, halan cami nya lmwah cqa eki.
english: When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

tay: ini thiyaq ciyan eki ro moyax ni mama mo, ini cami kinga tehok moyax nya.
english: The station is not far from my uncle’s house, and it’s just a short drive away.

tay: bih moyax ni mama mo ga, maki hlabang na kki'an knyatan ro, msqon cami qmet zitensya mosa kya.
english: There is a big ranch near my uncle’s house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

tay: maki cami kya ga, rayon cami nya sm'an mit ro rme qa mama.
english: In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

tay: gbyan lga, msqon cami mosa maniq cqa maci.
english: In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

tay: piyox qa toroy na maci qani, mica qa qmet cami otobay mosa kya.
english: There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

tay: owah myan moyax lga, wal qriqon cqoliq qa ototbay nya la, si cami glox baso mwah moyax la.
english: When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

tay: tehok cami cqa Bnka lga, ini myan kbaki maha, kona wal lon otobay ni mama mo la!
english: Now that we are back in Taipei, I don’t know if my uncle’s motorcycle has been found.

tay: laqi co na ga, mnaki cami qalang Skikon, qaring co mqwas biro lga, mosa cami maki Girang la, ski mwani mqyanox cami cqa heci.
english: When we were young, our family lived in Skikun. After I started school, we moved to Yilan and have been living in the city ever since.

tay: mqwas co raygako lga, mosa co tqbaq gaga qnxan na Tayal la, mica kbqon mo qabax mnanaq gaga na qnxan Genzoming.
english: After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

tay: mica qa, ryax hngawan bagan ga, kingan ro qbsoyal mo mlikoy mosa cami mkan bnheci cqa qalang, smoya co calay tqbaq gaga na glox mo nanaq.
english: So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

tay: ktalan mo bnheci qani ga spaton mpox kawas nya la, ana ga pisan hayi sening ktalan na.
english: The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

tay: tkbaqan mo, baq kmayan ke nano qa hiya, bbaq ro hyoci calay knayan nya ke Tayal, baq kmayan ke kahat ro Troko ro ke Gipon oyi.
english: I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Atayal, as well as Hokkien, Truku and Japanese.

tay: tqbaqan mo loyi ga. mica kbaqon mo maha, baq tgaring llaqi na ga, tqbaq ke Gipon, kneril nya kahol Troko ro, mqbaq piyox kahat cqa ptyawan nya.
english: I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Truku, and he knows many Hokkien at work, so he can speak so many languages.

tay: mkkayan cami ki bnheci qani ga, piyox wal nya pinqiyan kinbaqan na qmalop qani.
english: During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

tay: ana myan ini kbaqi ciyan mong pinqiyan nya ga, wal myan halan ppsyasing ke pinqiyan nya, ana myan bleqon mong qa ke nya loyi.
english: Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

tay: llaqi co na ga, ini mo kbaqi ciyan gaga na glox mo nanaq, mica mcayox co hayi son ma cqoliq co Tayal.
english: When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

tay: tqbaqan mo gaga qani lga, mqas co calay son ma Tayal, mnanaq ro straho mo ro ssyon mo calay inlongan.
english: The more I know, the more I feel that being a Tayal is unique and something to be proud of.

tay: gbyan kisa ga, mwah moyax qa swahi mo mlikoy la.
english: My younger brother is going home this evening.

tay: mosa cami mes ngta cqa ptbesan qqaya, alan myan phapoy k'abi qa swahi mo mlikoy.
english: My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

tay: hmenas cami tbesan ramat lga, piyox blaq ro mica na hnbiyat qa ramat maki tbesan ramat qani.
english: We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

tay: mnes cami ramat horenso, qosaw ro raykon.
english: We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

tay: kmayan binah cyan tbes bway qa cqoliq maha, "lbing calay onray ro qenam mo, bes cikay ga!"
english: The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

tay: mnes cami onray ro qenam ki yaki mo.
hmnas cami tbesan syam lga, kmayan qa tbes syam qa cqoliq maha, "pbes so nano? msyam calay ngta myan coni, qotox pila nya ga tyogan qbhol."
english: We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

tay: mnglon yaki maha hmet ciyan la, hali khway cikay pila nya son nya qa tbesan syam qaca.
english: Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

tay: kmayan cqoliq tbes syam qaca cimang pila nya la, ini kbqi pbiyaq pila nya la.
english: But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

tay: kmayan binah qa cqoliq maha, "owah mes qolih mo, cimam pila beson ro tyaba qa qolih mo qani."
english: The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

tay: pocing nya lga mnes cami ngta ro qolih, mosa cami moyax ro hpoyan myan qa ramat qani la.
english: In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

tay: bsyaq cami mna ro, mnkong qa kayal nya la.
english: After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

tay: mnwah renwa qa swahi mo mlikoy maha, ini cami qbaq mhngaw coni la, aky ski cqa babaw hngawan ryax ga, baq co mwah moyax la.
english: The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

tay: kmayan yaki talagay nhapoy qani la, tapih qabax lpyong owah sqon mniq kosa.
english: Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

tay: mwah qabax qa lpyong ro, msqon cami mniq k'abi nhapoy ni yaki.
english: We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

tay: maki qotox seto mo Pasan lalo nya, mngi maray qqaya krryax qa hiya.
english: I have a classmate named Pasan, he often forgets to bring things.

tay: mqwas cami biro ga, mosa ksiyox seto cqa enpit ccom ro brban qa hiya.
english: During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

tay: minqotox, mnxan ro mtyogan ga, ksyoxan myan qqaya hiya ha.
english: Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

tay: ana ga qotih calay kako nya la, ksiyoxan myan qqaya lga ini cami biqi loyi.
english: But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

tay: pocing nya lga, ini myan siyay ksiyox qqaya hiya la.
english: In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

tay: minqotox ryax, mosa cami mcisan habax myan.
english: One day, we all went on an outing together.

tay: cka ryaniq na ga, akya mosa stanox qa Pasan qani. ana ga wal mngi maray ciligami qa Pasan la.
english: On the way, Pasan wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

tay: akya mosa ksiyox ciligami seto qa hiya, kmayan qabax naha, ini cami aray oyi.
english: He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

tay: mnkox ro mngilis qa Pasan qani la, myohong kmayan maha, cwa mamo ini ksyoxi ciligami kingan!
english: Pasan burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

tay: kyalon ni seto maha, cwa so ini aray nanaq, ana ga wal so myan ksyoxan qqaya ga, ini so calay biqi cami loyi!
english: The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

tay: kncyoxan nya mwah cami mqwas biro lga, mhyoboq tehoq pqwasan biro qa Pasan ro, sbiq cami nya qabax wal myan ksyoxan hiya qa qqaya la.
english: The next day at school, Pasan arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

tay: nway son nya qabax seto ro, kyalon cami nya maha p'aray co nanaq qqaya babaw nya la, mhway cimo ro smwan cimo pksiyox qqaya kingan.
english: Pasan apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

tay: yaba mo ga cqoliq na qmalop maki cqa qalang.
english: My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

tay: llaqi co na ga, mhngan mosa ttanox qa yaba ro mama mo, maray lalaw ro patos naha.
english: When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

tay: tmma' lga, maray qbsinox naha mwah la.
english: At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

tay: kroma ga biyok ro yapit, kroma oyi ga maki biyot oyi.
english: Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

tay: qsyoxan naha qa qbsinox maki cqa qalang ro, sbiq naha cqoliq oyi.
english: They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

tay: tkibox co yaba mo krryax, smoya co mglox mosa qmalop qa yaba.
english: Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

tay: kmayan yaba maha, long cikay tyaba kawas so lga, rayaw miso la.
english: Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

tay: baq smi mrosa kroma cqoliq oyi, sqbalay naha skakay, sqolo ro rangay.
english: The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

tay: bbaq calay smi skakay ro sqolo qa yaba mo, kmayan yaba maha, qani hiya ga pkiyap biyot hiya, akya bleqon ktayox toqi na qbsinox qani, ssyan ta cqa qnapan wahan na qbsinox qani.
english: My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

tay: eta ta helax hayi mglox yaba mosa qmalop maha co, nyan co si tqbaq smi rosa krryax, maha cqani lga ini kinga baq ciliq rosa mo la.
english: In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

tay: ktalan co ni yaba mo lga, baq kmayan maha, babaw nya ga akya so bbaq calay qmalop na cqoliq.
english: Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

tay: nyan co mrkyas ro tyaba kawas la, panan mo bhenox bneloq ro tlqi, mglox co yaba mo mosa qmalop.
english: Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

tay: mwah cami moyax lga, sqasox myan cqoliq qabax cniliq myan qani.
english: When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

tay: kmayan yaba, lanay ta showay knalo na otox bnheci ta, sbiq ta nya piyox na qbsinox qani.
english: Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

tay: coqi co mosa pinqwasan biro saniq coni.
english: I was late for school this morning.

tay: mnwah co pinqwasan ga, mingi co maray kabang bbiro.
english: When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

tay: ana nano qnqaya ini co aray.
english: I didn't bring anything with me.

tay: t'arang mqwas ga, kingan ki glox mo ga sqon cami mktayax biro.
english: During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

tay: pcpngan pinqwasan ga, k'syoxon co nya ppbiro ro ccom qa glox mo.
english: During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

tay: kyalon co nya sesiy maha, "m_yoboq hayi mtoliq saniq babaw nya, ta mcoqi la!"
english: The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

tay: Silan cnlalo nya qa blaq na lpyong mo, hiya ga laqi na Tayal oyi.
english: My good friend’s name is Silan, and he is also an Tayal child.

tay: nyan cami glox mqwas biro qa qalang Skikon.
english: We study together in the Skikun tribe.

tay: sqon myan mong ke bnheci na tyaba kawas krryax, baq cami kmayal ke Tayal qabax.
english: We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Tayal proficiently.

tay: hlawax co calay ro mqthoy co calay oyi, Silan hiya ga mrroq calay ro mhekang calay oyi.
english: I am tall and overweight, while Silan is short and thin.

tay: Silan hiya ga msona blaq mqyanox calay, siyan nya hiya qabax ta.
english: Silan is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

tay: onrokay na pqwasan ryax coni, pqwasan ga rmorox knpiyox na pcpngan.
english: Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

tay: maki pcpngan na hmoloy qthoy gasil, klkah boro, mktlyong, ppiyoy, ro mo' slqi.
english: There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
I participated in the running competition.

tay: trang mktlyong co ga, mtakoy co la, piyox sramo ciyan ramo na tari mo la.
english: When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

tay: ana ga mtoliq co, si co skora glasox mktlyong.
english: But I stood up and continued running forward.

tay: eta co qes pcingan laga, qabax cqoliq ga mqas longan naha qabax.
english: Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

tay: ana co ini agal cnlalo te qotox qnabo, ana ga mqas co calay, baha hmcwa wan mo msqon pcpngan qani la.
english: Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

tay: chesa kingan ro yaba mo ga mnwah cami mkan mama mo.
english: Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

tay: cyan mqelis kakay mama mo la.
kyalon cami nya, nya mbling qa rnamox moyax la.
english: He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

tay: kblayon nya rnamox moyax ga, knahol rnamox wan mtoroy la.
english: He fell off the roof while repairing it.

tay: maray he kacing ro bingro yaba biqan nya mama.
english: My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

tay: kingan ro mama ga mcisal cami kya iyik 'bayn, piyox ke bnheci qsyoxon co nya kmayal.
english: My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

tay: iyik shriq co ga, traho co nyan mama maha wan so mhlawax la. wan so qenah betonox ciyal.
english: Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

tay: kyalon mo maha nna mblaq kakay mama laga, babaw nya owah mcisal moyax myan oyi.
english: I said, When your foot gets better

tay: maki saying seng ro posan saying kawas, wan mcqrox lhoyan qa Sexo, mkkayal maha, lalo na Tayal ga ana nanak sbiro ta babaw kya Nibonsyo.
english: In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

tay: nwahan mo tqbaq mrkyas na qalang qa Pasang Yawi, knbsyaq kihoy skora Sexo qa magal yaw sqa lalo na Tayal ga hoyay nanak sbiro babaw kya Nibonsyo la.
english: I interviewed Pasang Yawi, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

tay: kingan ro hiya ga lman cami mkkayal, ryax hngawan qani ga mosa co moyax nya mkan hiya.
english: We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

tay: cka na nwahan mo tqbaq ga, cbaqan co nya poying yaw qa lalo nya, rayon co nya pnbaq qabax cinmoyax nya ro qalang nya oyi.
english: During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

tay: pqotan mo hiya, hmcwa sqoxan so longan qa m'iyox lalo qani, ini kblaq snyan so miro lalo cyonga?
english: I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

tay: kyalon co nya hiya maha, baha hmcwa, sbiro patas na ke Cyokok qani ga ini hoyay pinktayox qa hngya'an na lalo nya, binah cqoliq ga sgyon nya maha "pa syeng seng", mica nya tmwang piyox calay na pinssyaqan oyi.
english: He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Ba Xian Sheng

tay: kmayal Pasang Yawi maha, "tmamas pintasan biro lalo na Genzyomin ga mosa calay pktayox sqa lalo ta, lalo mo hiya ga kingiwan cnlalo na mirok ta, glox ta, sinrxan ta, sinnnay ta qenah mosa piyox glox ta Tayal ga baq m'olo lalo naha nanak."
english: Pasang Yawi said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

tay: kingan ro yaki mnwah cami smi qnqaya ptbesan kya, piyox rramat pinnoyax yaki ga naray nya kya, biqan nya qabax ta nniqon na Genzyomin qa knalay nya.
english: Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

tay: qabax naha ga siyan nya ptbesan na yaki, koriq ro kbaqit ga piyox cqoliq mes, piyox calay cqoliq tmalam rramat tnahok nya.
english: Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

tay: tnahok nya mala ro somol ga blaq niqon calay, maki loyi tnahok nya biyok tnwang maqaw, nyan hmoloy longan cqoliq lmosay qa kinsokan nya, nyan si cqrox kya ptbesan myan ro nna mes.
english: The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

tay: trang stahok nniqon yaki ga, sgyon mo cqoliq lmosay, phngiyang co hmwaw, rramat qani ga pnoya myan nanak, rakis calay, helax owah mes wah!
english: While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

tay: helax soqon ptbes qa qnqaya myan, kman yaki maha, baha hmcwa ga, "olong maki iso rmax."
english: Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

tay: yaw qani, wan mo tnbaqan yaw na k'man, kkhoniq Tayal ro tnbaqan na nniqon, pnbaq co owiy calay mosa ptbes qnqaya ptbesan qani.
english: Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

tay: kntalan mo siyan nya longan calay qabax nniqon Tayal qani qa yaki, pqason mo ro mqoyat co calay oyi.
english: Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
